Madagascar.sfcram2 — Method
sfcram2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcram2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcram2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcram2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcram2(1)

NAME
       sfcram2 - 2-D angle-domain Kirchhoff migration based on escape tables.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcram2  <  esct.rsf data=data.rsf vz=vz.rsf > oimag.rsf imap=oimap.rsf
       smap=osmap.rsf dipagath=dimag.rsf  dipimap=dimap.rsf  dipsmap=dsmap.rsf
       full=fimag.rsf  mute=n  sqsmb=n  oazmin=180.0 oazmax=180.0 dazmin=180.0
       dazmax=180.0 ts=3 th=5 vconst=1.5 smax=10*fabsf (ds) hmax=20*fabsf (dh)

PARAMETERS
       string data =      Processed prestack data (auxiliary input file name)
       float  dazmax =180.0      Maximum allowed dip angle  (abs.value)  at  z
              max
       float  dazmin  =180.0       Maximum  allowed dip angle (abs.value) at z
              min
       string dipagath =      Dip angle gathers (angle, z, x) (auxiliary  out‐
              put file name)
       string dipimap =      Dip gathers illumination (angle, z, x) (auxiliary
              output file name)
       string dipsmap =      Dip gathers semblance (angle,  z,  x)  (auxiliary
              output file name)
       string full =      Full image (scattering angle, dip angle, z, x) (aux‐
              iliary output file name)
       float  hmax =20*fabsf (dh)      Maximum allowed width of  the  receiver
              ray branch
       string imap  =      Scattering gathers illumination (angle, z, x) (aux‐
              iliary output file name)
       bool   mute =n [y/n]     y - mute signal in  constant  z  plane  before
              stacking
       float  oazmax =180.0      Maximum allowed scattering angle at z max
       float  oazmin =180.0      Maximum allowed scattering angle at z min
       string smap  =       Scattering gathers semblance (angle, z, x) (auxil‐
              iary output file name)
       float  smax =10*fabsf (ds)      Maximum allowed width of the  shot  ray
              branch
       bool   sqsmb =n [y/n]     y - output energy traces instead of semblance
       int    th  =5       Tapering length at the edges of the receiver direc‐
              tion
       int    ts =3      Tapering length at the edges of the source direction
       float  vconst =1.5      Constant velocity, if vz= is not used
       string vz =      Velocity model for amplitude weights (auxiliary  input
              file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mcram2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfcram2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfcram3 — Method
sfcram3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcram3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcram3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcram3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcram3(1)

NAME
       sfcram3 - 3-D angle-domain Kirchhoff migration based on escape tables.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcram3  < esct.rsf data=data.rsf ddaemon=ddaemon.rsf survey=survey.rsf
       vz=vz.rsf  >  imag.rsf  hits=hits.rsf  agath=oimag.rsf   imap=oimap.rsf
       smap=osmap.rsf  dipagath=dimag.rsf  dipimap=dimap.rsf dipsmap=dsmap.rsf
       amp=y  extrap=n  mute=n  outaz=y  inorm=n   oazmin=180.0   oazmax=180.0
       dazmin=180.0 dazmax=180.0 dbx=10.0*dx dby=10.0*dy dxm=5.0*dx dym=5.0*dy
       armin=0.01*dy*dx armax=100.0*dy*dx np=1 vconst=1.5 nc=0

PARAMETERS
       string agath =      Scattering angle gathers (angle, azimuth, z, x,  y)
              (auxiliary output file name)
       bool   amp =y [y/n]     n - do not apply amplitude correction weights
       float  armax  =100.0*dy*dx       Maximum  allowed  area for an exit ray
              branch
       float  armin =0.01*dy*dx      Minimum allowed  area  for  an  exit  ray
              branch
       string data =      Processed prestack data (auxiliary input file name)
       float  dazmax =180.0      Maximum allowed dip angle at z max
       float  dazmin =180.0      Maximum allowed dip angle at z min
       float  dbx =10.0*dx      Size of search bins in x
       float  dby =10.0*dy      Size of search bins in y
       string ddaemon  =       Daemon  for distributed data storage (auxiliary
              input file name)
       string dipagath =      Dip angle gathers  (angle,  azimuth,  z,  x,  y)
              (auxiliary output file name)
       string dipimap  =       Dip gathers illumination (angle, azimuth, z, x,
              y) (auxiliary output file name)
       string dipsmap =      Dip gathers energy  (angle,  azimuth,  z,  x,  y)
              (auxiliary output file name)
       float  dxm =5.0*dx      Taper length in x
       float  dym =5.0*dy      Taper length in y
       bool   extrap =n [y/n]     y - extrapolate migrated samples in gathers
       string hits  =      Image illumination (z, x, y) (auxiliary output file
              name)
       string imap =      SCattering gathers illumination (angle, azimuth,  z,
              x, y) (auxiliary output file name)
       bool   inorm =n [y/n]     y - normalize gathers for illumination
       bool   mute  =n  [y/n]     y  -  mute signal in constant z plane before
              stacking
       int    nc  =0       Number  of  threads  to   use   for   ray   tracing
              (OMP_NUM_THREADS by default)
       int    np  =1       number  of  image points to buffer before accessing
              data
       float  oazmax =180.0      Maximum allowed scattering angle at z max
       float  oazmin =180.0      Maximum allowed scattering angle at z min
       bool   outaz =y [y/n]     n - stack azimuth direction before output
       string smap =      Scattering gathers energy (angle, azimuth, z, x,  y)
              (auxiliary output file name)
       string survey  =       Survey info for input data (auxiliary input file
              name)
       float  vconst =1.5      Constant velocity, if vz= is not used
       string vz =      Velocity model for amplitude weights (auxiliary  input
              file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mcram3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfcram3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfcramdd — Method
sfcramdd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcramdd on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcramdd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcramdd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcramdd(1)

NAME
       sfcramdd  -  Daemon  for distributed storage of prestack data for angle
       migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcramdd < in.rsf  >  out.rsf  data=data.rsf  port=18003  ith=0  inet=1
       nthreads=2*ncpu timeout=10

PARAMETERS
       string data =      Grid of supercells of local escape solutions (auxil‐
              iary input file name)
       int    inet =1      Network interface index
       int    ith =0      Make every ith process a daemon
       int    nthreads =2*ncpu      Number of threads (connections) per daemon
       int    port =18003      TCP port for listening
       int    timeout =10      Inactivity time before shutdown (mins)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mcramdd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfcramdd(1)
source
Madagascar.sfcrazgathc3 — Method
sfcrazgathc3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcrazgathc3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcrazgathc3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcrazgathc3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcrazgathc3(1)

NAME
       sfcrazgathc3  - Collapse/stack (partially) azimuthal axis of 3-D angle-
       domain migration angle gathers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcrazgathc3 < gath.rsf > rgath.rsf verb=y norm=n nth=10 wd=5

PARAMETERS
       bool   norm =n [y/n]     y - normalize after stacking
       int    nth =10      leave every nth azimuth
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    wd =5      half-width of stacking base (total base is 2*wd + 1)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mcrazgathc3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfcrazgathc3(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfcreate(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcreate(1)

NAME
       sfcreate - Creates just the ascii header from parameters

SYNOPSIS
       sfcreate > out.rsf n#=

COMMENTS
       Wrapper for sf_fileflush (creating RSF header from params)

PARAMETERS
       int    n# =      size of #-th axis
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mcreate.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfcreate(1)

Madagascar.sfcrestack — Method
sfcrestack(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcrestack on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcrestack. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcrestack(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcrestack(1)

NAME
       sfcrestack - Common Reflection Element (CRE) stacking

SYNOPSIS
       sfcrestack  <  in.rsf  timeCurves=timeCurves.rsf > out.rsf verb=0 aper‐
       ture=1

COMMENTS
       Programmer: Rodolfo A. C. Neves (Dirack) 06/10/2019

       Email:  rodolfo_profissional@hotmail.com

       License: GPL-3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt>.

PARAMETERS
       int    aperture =1      Stacking aperture, number of offsets to stack
       file   timeCurves =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =0 [y/n]     1: active mode; 0: quiet mode
SOURCE
       user/dirack/Mcrestack.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfcrestack(1)

Madagascar.sfcretrajec — Method
sfcretrajec(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcretrajec on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcretrajec. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcretrajec(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcretrajec(1)

NAME
       sfcretrajec  -  Calculate  CRE  trajectory  on CMP x Offset plane given
       zero-offset CRS parameters (RN, RNIP, BETA)

SYNOPSIS
       sfcretrajec < in.rsf param=par.rsf > out.rsf nm0= om0= dm0=  nt0=  ot0=
       dt0= verb=0

COMMENTS
       Programmer: Rodolfo A. C. Neves (Dirack) 31/08/2019

       Email:  rodolfo_profissional@hotmail.com

       License: GPL-3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt>.

PARAMETERS
       float  dm0 =      Central CMPs sampling in parameters file (Km)
       float  dt0 =      t0s sampling in parameters file (s)
       int    nm0 =      Number of central CMPs in parameters file
       int    nt0 =      Number of t0s in parameters file
       float  om0 =      First central CMP coordinate in parameters file (Km)
       float  ot0 =      First t0 coordinate in parameters file (s)
       file   param =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =0 [y/n]     1: active mode; 0: quiet mode
SOURCE
       user/dirack/Mcretrajec.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfcretrajec(1)
source
Madagascar.sfcrssemb — Method
sfcrssemb(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcrssemb on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcrssemb. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcrssemb(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcrssemb(1)

NAME
       sfcrssemb - CRS-based semblance

SYNOPSIS
       sfcrssemb < inDags_.rsf dataSq=inDagsSq_.rsf > sembFile_.rsf xapp=1 di‐
       papp=11 coher=11 scatnum=1 s1= s2=

COMMENTS
       Several CIGs are used simultaneously. Dip-angle sections  corresponding
       to  the same dip-angle compose a subvolume. The subvolume allows calcu‐
       lating semblance in the  scattering-angle  direction  along  reflection
       boundaries.

       Input:  inDags_.rsf   - dip-angle gathers - stack in the scattering-an‐
       gle direction InDagsSq_.rsf - stack of amplitude squares in  the  scat‐
       tering-angle direction

       Working  with just dip-angle gathers use default value of "scatnum" pa‐
       rameter

       Output: sembFile_.rsf - crs-based semblance file; has the  same  dimen‐
       sions as the input files

PARAMETERS
       int    coher  =11      height of a vertical window for semblance calcu‐
              lation
       file   dataSq =      auxiliary input file name
       int    dipapp =11      number of traces in  the  x-dip  direction  pro‐
              cessed simultaneously
       float  s1 = ®
       float  s2 = ®
       int    scatnum  =1      shows how many traces were stacked in the scat‐
              tering angle direction;
                     if the stack was normalized use the default value
       int    xapp =1      number of CIGs in  the  inline-direction  processed
              simultaneously
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mcrssemb.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfcrssemb(1)
source
Madagascar.sfcrssemb3d — Method
sfcrssemb3d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcrssemb3d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcrssemb3d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcrssemb3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcrssemb3d(1)

NAME
       sfcrssemb3d - CRS-based semblance for 3D

SYNOPSIS
       sfcrssemb3d  <  inDags_.rsf dataSq=inDagsSq_.rsf > sembFile_.rsf xapp=1
       yapp=1 dipappx=11 dipappy=11 coher=11 scatnum=1

COMMENTS
       Several CIGs are used simultaneously. Dip-angle sections  corresponding
       to  the same dip-angle compose a subvolume. The subvolume allows calcu‐
       lating semblance in the  scattering-angle  direction  along  reflection
       boundaries.

       Input:  inDags_.rsf   - 3D dip-angle gathers - stack in the scattering-
       angle direction inDagsSq_.rsf - stack of amplitude squares in the scat‐
       tering-angle direction

       Working  with just dip-angle gathers use default value of "scatnum" pa‐
       rameter

       Output: sembFile_.rsf - crs-based semblance file; has the  same  dimen‐
       sions as the input files

PARAMETERS
       int    coher  =11      height of a vertical window for semblance calcu‐
              lation
       file   dataSq =      auxiliary input file name
       int    dipappx =11      number of traces in the  x-dip  direction  pro‐
              cessed simultaneously
       int    dipappy  =11       number  of traces in the y-dip direction pro‐
              cessed simultaneously
       int    scatnum =1      shows how many traces were stacked in the  scat‐
              tering angle direction;
                     if the stack was normalized use the default value
       int    xapp  =1       number  of CIGs in the inline-direction processed
              simultaneously
       int    yapp =1      number of CIGs in the crossline-direction processed
              simultaneously
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mcrssemb3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfcrssemb3d(1)
source

Madagascar.sfcsmooth — Method
sfcsmooth(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcsmooth on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcsmooth. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcsmooth(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcsmooth(1)

NAME
       sfcsmooth - Multi-dimensional triangle smoothing for complex data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcsmooth   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf   repeat=1  adj=n  rect#=(1,1,...)
       diff#=(n,n,...)

COMMENTS
       January 2012 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/01/01/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfsmooth/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     run in the adjoint mode
       bool   diff# =(n,n,...)  [y/n]     differentiation on #-th axis
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mcsmooth.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfcsmooth(1)

Madagascar.sfcsp2d — Method
sfcsp2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcsp2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcsp2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcsp2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcsp2d(1)

NAME
       sfcsp2d - 2-D common scattering-point gathers mapping and its adjoint

SYNOPSIS
       sfcsp2d  < in.rsf > out.rsf ompchunk=1 ompnth=0 adj=y weight=n linear=n
       v=2000. half=n verb=n nhe=nh  dhe=dh  he0=h0  nxs=nxm  dxs=dxm  xs0=xm0
       nh=nhe       dh=dhe       h0=he0      nxm=nxs      dxm=dxs      xm0=xs0
       apt=SF_MAX(fabsf(he0),fabsf(he0+(nhe-1)*dhe))

COMMENTS
       The axes in the data space are {time,offset,cmp} The axes in the  image
       space are {time,equiv_offset,csp}

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     yes: CSP mapping, no: CMP building
       float  apt =SF_MAX(fabsf(he0),fabsf(he0+(nhe-1)*dhe))      aperture
       float  dh =dhe ®
       float  dhe =dh ®
       float  dxm =dxs ®
       float  dxs =dxm ®
       float  h0 =he0 ®
       bool   half =n [y/n]     half offset flag
       float  he0 =h0 ®
       bool   linear  =n  [y/n]     yes:  linear  interpolation,  no: nearest-
              neighbor interpolation
       int    nh =nhe ®
       int    nhe =nh ®
       int    nxm =nxs ®
       int    nxs =nxm ®
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       int    ompnth =0      OpenMP available threads
       float  v =2000.       velocity
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   weight =n [y/n]     weighting flag
       float  xm0 =xs0 ®
       float  xs0 =xm0 ®
SOURCE
       user/seisinv/Mcsp2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mcsp2d.c 744 2013-07-11 18:46:07Z Yujin Liu

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfcsp2d(1)
source

NAME
       sfcsqrtf - Complex square root. Good example of I/O loop for applying a
       function.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcsqrtf < in.rsf > out.rsf

COMMENTS
       Realized after I wrote this program that the sqrt  function  in  sfmath
       does  the same job, but keeping it around as a simple example of buffer
       I/O.

Madagascar.sfcsv2rsf — Method
sfcsv2rsf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcsv2rsf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcsv2rsf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcsv2rsf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcsv2rsf(1)

NAME
       sfcsv2rsf  - Convert a delimited-text ASCII file to RSF binary floating
       point or int.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcsv2rsf delimiter=, dtype=float verb=n debug=n trunc=n header=n o1=0.
       o2=0. d1=1. d2=1. unit1=unknown unit2=unknown label1=unknown label2=un‐
       known

COMMENTS
       Zeros will be added if number of elements is not the same in each  row.
       n1 and n2 are computed automatically. For consistency with sfdisfil and
       sfmatmult, output is C-style order (row-first), i.e. rows in input file
       become  dimension-1  columns  in  output. Output encoding is native. If
       n2=1 in output, the second dimension will not be written to the header.

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =1.  ®
       float  d2 =1.  ®
       bool   debug =n [y/n]     Extra verbosity for debugging
       string delimiter =,      Separator between values in input file
       string dtype =float      Input type
       bool   header =n [y/n]     If the first line is a header
       string label1 =unknown ®
       string label2 =unknown ®
       float  o1 =0.  ®
       float  o2 =0.  ®
       bool   trunc =n [y/n]     Truncate or add zeros if  nr  elems  in  rows
              differs
       string unit1 =unknown ®
       string unit2 =unknown ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Whether to echo n1, n2, infill/truncation
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mcsv2rsf.py
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfcsv2rsf
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfcsv2rsf(1)
source

       using exact phase velocity (2 step time marching).

SYNOPSIS
       sfctilr2  <  velz.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf  >  right.rsf  type=1
       seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt=

PARAMETERS

       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       type   =1      wave mode (1=p wave, 2=Sv wave)

Madagascar.sfcurv2 — Method
sfcurv2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcurv2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcurv2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcurv2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcurv2(1)

NAME
       sfcurv2 - Joint estimation of curvature and slope

SYNOPSIS
       sfcurv2 < in.rsf > out.rsf slope=slope.rsf niter=5 m=1 n=1 interp=

PARAMETERS
       string interp =      interpolation method: maxflat lagrange bspline
       int    m =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    n =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    niter =5      iterations
       file   slope =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mcurv2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfcurv2(1)

sfcurvature(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcurvature on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcurvature. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcurvature(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcurvature(1)

NAME
       sfcurvature - Curvature

SYNOPSIS
       sfcurvature < hor.rsf > cur.rsf rotation=n scale=1.0 vscale=1.0 what=

PARAMETERS
       bool   rotation =n [y/n]     if y: rotation, if n: convergence
       float  scale =1.0      scaling (from time to depth)
       float  vscale =1.0      scaling (from time to depth)
       string what =      what to compute
SOURCE
       user/parvaneh/Mcurvature.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfcut — Method
sfcut(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfcut on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfcut. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfcut(1) Madagascar Manuals sfcut(1)

NAME
       sfcut - Zero a portion of the dataset.

SYNOPSIS
       sfcut  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf verb=n j#=(1,...) d#=(d1,d2,...) f#=(0,...)
       min#=(o1,o2,,...) n#=(0,...) max#=(o1+(n1-1)*d1,o2+(n1-1)*d2,,...)

COMMENTS
       Reverse of window.

PARAMETERS
       float  d# =(d1,d2,...)       sampling in #-th dimension
       largeint
              f# =(0,...)       window start in #-th dimension
       int    j# =(1,...)       jump in #-th dimension
       float  max# =(o1+(n1-1)*d1,o2+(n1-1)*d2,,...)       maximum in #-th di‐
              mension
       float  min# =(o1,o2,,...)       minimum in #-th dimension
       int    n# =(0,...)       window size in #-th dimension
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
USED IN
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
SOURCE
       system/main/cut.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfcut
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfcut(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdagap — Method
sfdagap(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdagap on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdagap. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdagap(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdagap(1)

NAME
       sfdagap  -  Reflection event apex protector/removal for dip-angle gath‐
       ers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdagap  <  dagFile.rsf   dips=dipFile.rsf   >   taperFile.rsf   ddep=y
       pwidth=10.f greyarea=10.f dz=20.f

COMMENTS
       May be used for migration aperture optimization or for reflected energy
       supression. For the last multiply the output on -1.

       Input: dagFile.rsf - input dip-angle gathers; dipFile.rsf - dips esiti‐
       mated in the image domain. The dips are in degree (!)

       Output: taperFile.rsf - mask for input dip-angle gathers

PARAMETERS
       bool   ddep =y [y/n]     if y, taper depends on depth; if n, no
       string dips  =       dips  esitimated  in  the image domain (in degree)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       float  dz =20.f      half of a migrated wave length
       float  greyarea =10.f      width of event tail taper (in degree)
       float  pwidth =10.f      protected width (in degree)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdagap.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfdagap(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdagap3 — Method
sfdagap3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

sfdagap3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdagap3(1)

NAME
       sfdagap3  - Reflection event apex protector/removal for dip-angle gath‐
       ers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdagap3  <  dagFile.rsf  dips=dipFile.rsf   >   taperFile.rsf   ddep=y
       pwidth1=10.f pwidth2=10.f greyarea1=10.f greyarea2=10.f dz=20.f

COMMENTS
       May be used for migration aperture optimization or for reflected energy
       supression. For the last multiply the output on -1.

       Input: dagFile.rsf - input dip-angle gathers; dipFile.rsf - dips esiti‐
       mated in the image domain. The dips are in degree (!)

       Output: taperFile.rsf - mask for input dip-angle gathers

PARAMETERS
       bool   ddep =y [y/n]     if y, taper depends on depth; if n, no
       string dips  =       dips  esitimated  in  the image domain (in degree)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       float  dz =20.f      half of a migrated wave length
       float  greyarea1 =10.f ®
       float  greyarea2 =10.f      width of event tail taper (in degree)
       float  pwidth1 =10.f ®
       float  pwidth2 =10.f      protected width (in degree)
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdagap3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdagap3(1)

Madagascar.sfdagap3a — Method
sfdagap3a(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdagap3a on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdagap3a. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdagap3a(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdagap3a(1)

NAME
       sfdagap3a - Reflection event apex protector/removal for dip-angle gath‐
       ers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdagap3a  <  dagFile.rsf  dips=dipFile.rsf  >  taperFile.rsf  rms=rms‐
       File.rsf   ddep=y  pwidth1=10.f  pwidth2=10.f  drms=y  fudge=10.f  gre‐
       yarea1=10.f greyarea2=10.f dz=20.f

COMMENTS
       May be used for migration aperture optimization or for reflected energy
       supression. For the last multiply the output on -1.

       Input: dagFile.rsf - input dip-angle gathers; dipFile.rsf - dips esiti‐
       mated in the image domain. The dips are in degree  (!)   rmsFile.rsf  -
       input rms;

       Output: taperFile.rsf - mask for input dip-angle gathers

PARAMETERS
       bool   ddep =y [y/n]     if y, taper depends on depth; if n, no
       string dips  =       dips  esitimated  in  the image domain (in degree)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   drms =y [y/n]     if y, taper depends on rms; if n, no
       float  dz =20.f      half of a migrated wave length
       float  fudge =10.f      Fudge Factor
       float  greyarea1 =10.f ®
       float  greyarea2 =10.f      width of event tail taper (in degree)
       float  pwidth1 =10.f ®
       float  pwidth2 =10.f      protected width (in degree)
       string rms =      RMS input for  tapering  variation  (auxiliary  input
              file name)
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdagap3a.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdagap3a(1)
source

Madagascar.sfdbfmig — Method
sfdbfmig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdbfmig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdbfmig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdbfmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdbfmig(1)

NAME
       sfdbfmig -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdbfmig < piFile.rsf escx=xEscFile.rsf esct=tEscFile.rsf > resFile.rsf
       ppn=pNum ppo=pStart ppd=pStep izn=zNum ixn=xNum  izo=zStart  ixo=xStart
       izd=zStep ixd=xStep sn=1 so=0.f sd=1.f isAA=y dx=xStep dt=0.008f xlim=2
       * xStep xapert=xNum * xStep pj=1

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.008f      time-range for point detection
       float  dx =xStep      x-range for point detection
       string esct =      escape-time file (auxiliary input file name)
       string escx =      escape-positions file (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   isAA =y [y/n]     if y, apply anti-aliasing
       float  ixd =xStep      step in positions (in meters)
       int    ixn =xNum      number of imaged positions
       float  ixo =xStart      first imaged position (in meters)
       float  izd =zStep      step in depth (in meters)
       int    izn =zNum      number of imaged depth samples
       float  izo =zStart      first imaged depth (in meters)
       int    pj =1      jump in points
       float  ppd =pStep      step in processed partial images
       int    ppn =pNum      number of processed partial images
       float  ppo =pStart      first processed partial image
       float  sd =1.f      step in scattering-angles
       int    sn =1      number of scattering-angles
       float  so =0.f      first scattering-angle
       float  xapert =xNum * xStep      migration aperture size
       float  xlim =2 * xStep      maximum distance between depth-line points
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdbfmig.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdbfmig(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdblendseis — Method
sfdblendseis(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdblendseis on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdblendseis. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdblendseis(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdblendseis(1)

NAME
       sfdblendseis  - Blending, or Deblending using seislet domain threshold‐
       ing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdblendseis  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  shottime=shottime.rsf  dip=dip.rsf
       init=init.rsf  niter=30 thr=10 lambda=0.5 eps=0.01 order=1 verb=0 mode=
       type= thrtype=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       string init =      auxiliary input file name
       float  lambda =0.5      update step size
       string mode =      [b-blending,d-deblending] function mode, the default
              is d
       int    niter =30      number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order for seislet transform
       file   shottime =      auxiliary input file name
       float  thr =10      threshold value (coefficients preserved in percent‐
              age)
       string thrtype =      [soft,hard] thresholding  type,  the  default  is
              soft
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       int    verb =0      output verbosity information
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdblendseis.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfdblendseis(1)
source

NAME
       sfdbmerge -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdbmerge

COMMENTS
       A  program that can be used to merge separate SCons databases together.
       Typically used when an SConstruct is split into multiple  pieces  (e.g.
       on a cluster).

       args: outdb - path of the output database

       strings - names of the databases to merge together

sfdd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdd(1)

NAME
       sfdd - Convert between different formats.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdd  <  in.rsf > out.rsf trunc=n line=8 strip=0 ibm=n form= type= for‐
       mat=

PARAMETERS
       string form =      ascii, native, xdr
       string format =      Element format (for conversion to ASCII)
       bool   ibm =n [y/n]     Special case - assume integers actually  repre‐
              sent IBM floats
       int    line  =8       Number  of  numbers  per  line (for conversion to
              ASCII)
       int    strip =0      If strip characters from format at the end of  the
              line
       bool   trunc  =n [y/n]     Truncate or round to nearest when converting
              from float to int/short
       string type =      int, float, complex, short, long
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/dwnc/vofz
       bei/fld/cube
       bei/fld/shotmovie

       bei/ft1/plane4
       bei/krch/wgkirch
       bei/sg/denmark
       bei/sg/meander
       bei/sg/toldi
       bei/vela/stretch
       bei/vela/vscan
       bei/wvs/head
       bei/wvs/vscan
       chen/test/wavmod
       chen/test/xtime
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/real
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
       27 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagas‐
       car/html/sfdd.html

Madagascar.sfdealias — Method
sfdealias(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdealias on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdealias. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdealias(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdealias(1)

NAME
       sfdealias - 3-D trace interpolation to a denser grid using PWD.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdealias < in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf both=n eps=0.01 order=1

COMMENTS
       It may be necessary to bandpass the data before and after dealiasing to
       ensure that  the  temporal  spectrum  is  banded.  Rule  of  thumb:  if
       max(jx,jy)=N, the temporal bandwidth should be 1/N of Nyquist.

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if use left and right slopes
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    order =1      accuracy order
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdealias.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdealias2.c 1713 2006-03-03 08:21:29Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdealias(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdealias2 — Method
sfdealias2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdealias2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdealias2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

sfdealias2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdealias2(1)

NAME
       sfdealias2  -  2-D  (inline) trace interpolation to a denser grid using
       PWD.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdealias2 < in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf both=n eps=0.01 order=1

COMMENTS
       It may be necessary to bandpass the data before and after dealiasing to
       ensure  that  the  temporal  spectrum  is  banded.  Rule  of  thumb: if
       max(jx,jy)=N, the temporal bandwidth should be 1/N of Nyquist.

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if use left and right slopes
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    order =1      accuracy order
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdealias2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdealias2.c 1713 2006-03-03 08:21:29Z fomels

sfdeblur(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdeblur(1)

NAME
       sfdeblur - Non-stationary debluring by inversion

SYNOPSIS
       sfdeblur  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf rect=rect.rsf niter=100 nliter=1 verb=n
       eps=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nliter =1      number of nonlinear iterations
       file   rect =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mdeblur.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdeblur(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdeburst — Method
sfdeburst(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdeburst on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdeburst. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdeburst(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdeburst(1)

NAME
       sfdeburst - Remove bursty noise by IRLS.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdeburst < in.rsf > out.rsf niter=10 eps=1. norm=

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =1.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       string norm =      norm to use in IRLS (cauchy,l1)
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mdeburst.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdecon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdecon(1)

NAME
       sfdecon - Deconvolution (N-dimensional).

SYNOPSIS
       sfdecon < in.rsf > out.rsf filt=filt.rsf predictive=n rect1=0 lag=

COMMENTS
       Uses the helix and patching technology.

PARAMETERS
       file   filt =      auxiliary input file name
       string lag = ®
       bool   predictive =n [y/n]     if y, do predictive deconvolution
       int    rect1 =0      smoothing in the first axis
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mdecon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

       file   inY =      auxiliary input file name

Madagascar.sfdepth2time — Method
sfdepth2time(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdepth2time on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

RSF Documentation

sfdepth2time(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdepth2time(1)

NAME
       sfdepth2time - Conversion from depth to time in a V(z) medium.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdepth2time  <  in.rsf  velocity=velocity.rsf  >  out.rsf  nt= dt= t0=
       slow=n eps=0.01

COMMENTS
       Transforms function of z to function of

       tau = Integral[2/v[x,n],{n,0,z}]

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      Time sampling (default is d1)
       float  eps =0.01      smoothness parameter
       int    nt =      Number of points in time (default is n1)
       bool   slow =n [y/n]     y: slowness, n: velocity
       float  t0 =      Time origin (default is 0)
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdepth2time.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfdepth2time(1)
source

       of-the-month-sfderiv/

SYNOPSIS
       sfderiv3 < in.rsf > out.rsf axis=1 operator=2

COMMENTS
       int axis=[1] axis to differentiate

       int operator=[2] 1 backward, 2 centered, 3 forward

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =1 ®
       int    operator =2 ®

RSF Documentation

sfdespike1-ed(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdespike1-ed(1)

NAME
       sfdespike1-ed - Despike filter:

SYNOPSIS
       sfdespike1-ed < in.rsf > out.rsf window=20 sigma=3.0

COMMENTS
       move outliers values to the tolerance parameter. The mean is calculated
       with moving windows

       Example:

       if (a>3sigma) a=3sigma

       outlier * *              ^ *    *            | *      *            |  *
       *          * ****          * * * * *  *****

PARAMETERS
       float  sigma =3.0 ®
       int    window =20 ®
SOURCE
       user/ediazp/Mdespike1-ed.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfdespike1-ed(1)
source

sfdifferr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdifferr(1)

NAME
       sfdifferr - Error by substituting numerical solution into equation

SYNOPSIS
       sfdifferr    <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf   slow=slow.rsf   slowz=slowz.rsf
       slowx=slowx.rsf err_cutoff=0.2 iq=2

PARAMETERS
       float  err_cutoff =0.2 ®
       int    iq =2      switch for escape variable 0=x, 1=a, 2=t, 3=z
       file   slow =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowz =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Mdifferr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdiffoc(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiffoc(1)

NAME
       sfdiffoc - Diffraction focusing test.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiffoc     <     inp.rsf    >    out.rsf    v0=SF_EPS    v=    pad=nt
       pad2=2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2) extend=4

PARAMETERS
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       int    pad =nt      padding for stretch
       int    pad2 =2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2)      padding for FFT
       float  v =      final velocity
       float  v0 =SF_EPS      initial velocity
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdiffoc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdiffoc(1)

       data.rsf freq=0.2/dt

       int    nf =0      number of final points
       strings
              paths =       [nf]

sfdimag(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdimag(1)

NAME
       sfdimag - Diffraction imaging in the plane-wave domain.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdimag  <  cmp.rsf  >  scan.rsf  semblance=n nb=2 v0= dv= nv= extend=4
       mute=12 str=0. x0=

PARAMETERS
       float  dv = ®
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       int    nb =2      semblance averaging
       int    nv = ®
       bool   semblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute semblance; if n, stack
       float  str =0.       maximum stretch allowed
       float  v0 = ®
       float  x0 = ®
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdimag.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfdimag(1)

Madagascar.sfdip — Method
sfdip(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdip on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdip. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdip(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdip(1)

NAME
       sfdip - 3-D dip estimation by plane wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdip  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf mask=mask.rsf idip=idip0.rsf xdip=xdip0.rsf
       both=n n4=2 niter=5 liter=20 rect1=1 rect2=1 rect3=1  p0=0.  q0=0.  or‐
       der=1   nj1=1   nj2=1   drift=n   verb=n   pmin=-FLT_MAX  pmax=+FLT_MAX
       qmin=-FLT_MAX qmax=+FLT_MAX eps=0.0f

COMMENTS
       The output is dimensionless (stepout in time measured in time samples).

       June 2012 program of  the  month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2012/06/02/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfdip/

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if y, compute both left and right predictions
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string idip =      initial in-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      in-line antialiasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line antialiasing
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  p0 =0.       initial in-line dip
       float  pmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum inline dip
       float  pmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum inline dip
       float  q0 =0.       initial cross-line dip
       float  qmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum cross-line dip
       float  qmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum cross-line dip
       int    rect1 =1      dip smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =1      dip smoothness on 2nd axis
       int    rect3 =1      dip smoothness on 3rd axis
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string xdip =      initial cross-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdip.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfdip(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdip2 — Method
sfdip2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdip2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdip2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdip2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdip2(1)

NAME
       sfdip2 - 2-D dip estimation by plane wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdip2 < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=mask.rsf idip=idip0.rsf niter=5 liter=20
       rect1=1  rect2=1  p0=0.  order=1  nj1=1  drift=n  verb=n  pmin=-FLT_MAX
       pmax=+FLT_MAX eps=0.0f

PARAMETERS
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string idip =      initial in-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  p0 =0.       initial dip
       float  pmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum dip
       float  pmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum dip
       int    rect1 =1      dip smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =1      dip smoothness on 2nd axis
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdip2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdip2(1)

Madagascar.sfdip_fb — Method
sfdip_fb(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdip_fb on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdip_fb. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdipfb(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipfb(1)

NAME
       sfdip_fb  -  3-D  dip estimation by plane wave destruction with forward
       and backward space derivative calculation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdip_fb < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=mask.rsf idip=idip0.rsf xdip=xdip0.rsf
       both=n  n4=2  niter=5  liter=20 rect1=1 rect2=1 rect3=1 p0=0. q0=0. or‐
       der=1  nj1=1   nj2=1   drift=n   verb=n   pmin=-FLT_MAX   pmax=+FLT_MAX
       qmin=-FLT_MAX qmax=+FLT_MAX eps=0.0f

COMMENTS
       The output is dimensionless (stepout in time measured in time samples).

       June  2012  program  of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/06/02/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfdip/

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if y, compute both left and right predictions
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string idip =      initial in-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      in-line antialiasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line antialiasing
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  p0 =0.       initial in-line dip
       float  pmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum inline dip
       float  pmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum inline dip
       float  q0 =0.       initial cross-line dip
       float  qmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum cross-line dip
       float  qmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum cross-line dip
       int    rect1 =1      dip smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =1      dip smoothness on 2nd axis
       int    rect3 =1      dip smoothness on 3rd axuis
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string xdip =      initial cross-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdip_fb.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdip_fb(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdiparti — Method
sfdiparti(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdiparti on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdiparti. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdiparti(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiparti(1)

NAME
       sfdiparti - diparti

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiparti  < piFile.rsf vel=velFile.rsf > resFile.rsf semb=sembFile.rsf
       apert=1000 sembWindow=11 gamma=1.f ppn=dipNum_  ppo=dipStart_  ppd=dip‐
       Step_ itn=tNum_ ixn=xNum_ ito=tStart_ ixo=xStart_ itd=tStep_ ixd=xStep_

PARAMETERS
       float  apert =1000      diffraction summation aperture
       float  gamma =1.f      velocity-model-accuracy parameter
       float  itd =tStep_      step in time (in ms)
       int    itn =tNum_      number of imaged depth samples
       float  ito =tStart_      first imaged time (in ms)
       float  ixd =xStep_      step in positions (in m)
       int    ixn =xNum_      number of imaged positions
       float  ixo =xStart_      first imaged position (in m)
       float  ppd =dipStep_      step in processed partial images
       int    ppn =dipNum_      number of processed partial images
       float  ppo =dipStart_      first processed partial image
       string semb  =       output file containing semblance (auxiliary output
              file name)
       int    sembWindow =11      vertical window  for  semblance  calculation
              (in samples)
       string vel =      velocity model file (velocity in km/s) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdiparti.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdiparti(1)
source

sfdiparti3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiparti3(1)

NAME
       sfdiparti3 - diparti

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiparti3 < piFile.rsf vel=velFile.rsf > resFile.rsf semb=sembFile.rsf
       apert=1000   sembWindow=11   gamma=1.f   xppn=dipNum_    xppo=dipStart_
       xppd=dipStep_  yppn=sdipNum_  yppo=sdipStart_  yppd=sdipStep_ itn=tNum_
       ixn=xNum_  iyn=yNum_  ito=tStart_  ixo=xStart_  iyo=yStart_  itd=tStep_
       ixd=xStep_ iyd=yStep_

PARAMETERS
       float  apert =1000      diffraction summation aperture
       float  gamma =1.f      velocity-model-accuracy parameter
       float  itd =tStep_      step in time (in ms)
       int    itn =tNum_      number of imaged depth samples
       float  ito =tStart_      first imaged time (in ms)
       float  ixd =xStep_      step in positions (in m)
       int    ixn =xNum_      number of imaged positions
       float  ixo =xStart_      first imaged position (in m)
       float  iyd =yStep_      step in positions (in m)
       int    iyn =yNum_      number of imaged positions
       float  iyo =yStart_      first imaged position (in m)
       string semb  =       output file containing semblance (auxiliary output
              file name)
       int    sembWindow =11      vertical window  for  semblance  calculation
              (in samples)
       string vel =      velocity model file (velocity in km/s) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       float  xppd =dipStep_      step in processed partial images
       int    xppn =dipNum_      number of processed partial images
       float  xppo =dipStart_      first processed partial image
       float  yppd =sdipStep_      step in processed partial images
       int    yppn =sdipNum_      number of processed partial images
       float  yppo =sdipStart_      first processed partial image
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdiparti3.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdipcoh(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipcoh(1)

NAME
       sfdipcoh - 3D Coherence cube

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipcoh  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf dip1=dip1.rsf dip2=dip2.rsf nw=5 twod=y
       verb=y lag1=3 lag2=3

PARAMETERS
       string dip1 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dip2 =      auxiliary input file name
       int    lag1 =3      maximal time lag on 2nd axis
       int    lag2 =3      maximal time lag on 3rd axis
       int    nw =5      half window size for coherence
       bool   twod =y [y/n]     y: only twod coherence
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity

Madagascar.sfdipfilter — Method
sfdipfilter(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdipfilter on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdipfilter. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdipfilter(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipfilter(1)

NAME
       sfdipfilter - Filter data based on dip in 2-D or 3-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipfilter  < in.rsf > out.rsf dim=2 angle=n v=-1. ang1=-50. ang2=-45.
       ang3=45. ang4=50. v1=0. v2=0.1 v3=99999. v4=999999. pass=y

COMMENTS
       February        2014        program        of        the         month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2014/02/06/program-of-the-month-sfdipfilter/

PARAMETERS
       float  ang1 =-50.  ®
       float  ang2 =-45.  ®
       float  ang3 =45.  ®
       float  ang4 =50.       Angle gate (in degrees)
       bool   angle =n [y/n]     Filter based on angle (or velocity)
       int    dim =2 [2,3]     Dimensionality: filter 2-D planes or 3-D cubes
       bool   pass =y [y/n]     Pass or reject band
       float  v  =-1.       constant velocity (if angle-y)         The default
              is d(frequency)/d(wavenumber)
       float  v1 =0.  ®
       float  v2 =0.1 ®
       float  v3 =99999.  ®
       float  v4 =999999.       Velocity gate
USED IN
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mdipfilter.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfdipfilter(1)
source

sfdiphase(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiphase(1)

NAME
       sfdiphase - Derivative of local frequency.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiphase  <  df.rsf  sig=in.rsf  >  out.rsf verb=n niter=100 order=100
       ref=1. hertz=n rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       bool   hertz =n [y/n]     if y, convert output to Hertz
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    order =100      Hilbert transformer order
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mdiphase.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdipl(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipl(1)

NAME
       sfdipl - large dip calculation via PWD

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipl  < in.rsf > out.rsf m=1 n=1 rect1=0 rect2=0 niter=5 liter=20 ra‐
       dius=1.0 eta=0.5 dip0=0.0 verb=n slope=n interp=

PARAMETERS
       float  dip0 =0.0      starting dip
       float  eta =0.5      steps for iteration
       string interp =      interpolation method: maxflat lagrange bspline
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       int    m =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    n =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       float  radius =1.0      interpolating radius for opwd
       int    rect1 =0      dip smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =0      dip smoothness on 2nd axis
       bool   slope =n [y/n]     slope (y) or dip (n) estimation
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdipl.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdipl(1)

Madagascar.sfdiplet — Method
sfdiplet(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdiplet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

RSF Documentation

sfdiplet(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiplet(1)

NAME
       sfdiplet - 2-D Seislet frame

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiplet  <  in.rsf > out.rsf dips=dip.rsf mask=mask.rsf inv=n eps=0.01
       verb=y twhole=y decomp=n ncycle=0 niter=1 perc=50.0 order=1 type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   decomp =n [y/n]     do decomposition
       file   dips =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       string mask =      (optional) data  mask  file  (auxiliary  input  file
              name)
       int    ncycle =0      number of iterations
       int    niter =1      number of Bregman iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  perc =50.0      percentage for sharpening
       bool   twhole  =y  [y/n]     threshold  flag, if y, whole model, other‐
              wise, each component
       string type =      wavelet type (haar,linear,biorthogonal), default  is
              linear
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdiplet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdiplet(1)
source

sfdipln(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipln(1)

NAME
       sfdipln - large dip calculation via non-stationary regularization

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipln  < in.rsf > out.rsf m=1 n=1 niter=5 liter=20 radius=1.0 eta=0.5
       dip0=0.0 verb=n slope=n eps=0.0f rect#= shift#= interp=

PARAMETERS
       float  dip0 =0.0      starting dip
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       float  eta =0.5      steps for iteration
       string interp =      interpolation method: maxflat lagrange bspline
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       int    m =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    n =1      b[-m, ... ,n]
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       float  radius =1.0      interpolating radius for opwd
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       bool   slope =n [y/n]     slope (y) or dip (n) estimation
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdipln.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfdipn — Method
sfdipn(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdipn on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdipn. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdipn(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipn(1)

NAME
       sfdipn  - 3-D robust dip estimation by plane wave destruction with non-
       stationary smoothing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipn < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=mask.rsf  idip=idip0.rsf  xdip=xdip0.rsf
       both=n  n4=2  niter=5  liter=20 p0=0. q0=0. order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 drift=n
       verb=n pmin=-FLT_MAX pmax=+FLT_MAX qmin=-FLT_MAX qmax=+FLT_MAX eps=0.0f
       rect#= shift#=

COMMENTS
       The output is dimensionless (stepout in time measured in time samples).
       also see sfdip

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if y, compute both left and right predictions
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string idip =      initial in-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      in-line antialiasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line antialiasing
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  p0 =0.       initial in-line dip
       float  pmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum inline dip
       float  pmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum inline dip
       float  q0 =0.       initial cross-line dip
       float  qmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum cross-line dip
       float  qmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum cross-line dip
       string rect#  =       size  of  the smoothing stencil in #-th dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift# =      shifting of the smoothing stencil in  #-th  dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string xdip =      initial cross-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdipn.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdipn(1)
source

sfdipn_fb(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdipn_fb on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdipn_fb. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdipnfb(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdipnfb(1)

NAME
       sfdipn_fb  -  3-D  robust dip estimation by plane wave destruction with
       non-stationary smoothing and forward-backward space derivative calcula‐
       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdipn_fb    <    in.rsf   >   out.rsf   mask=mask.rsf   idip=idip0.rsf
       xdip=xdip0.rsf both=n n4=2 niter=5 liter=20 p0=0. q0=0.  order=1  nj1=1
       nj2=1   drift=n   verb=n   pmin=-FLT_MAX   pmax=+FLT_MAX  qmin=-FLT_MAX
       qmax=+FLT_MAX eps=0.0f rect#= shift#=

COMMENTS
       The output is dimensionless (stepout in time measured in time samples).
       also see sfdip

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if y, compute both left and right predictions
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string idip =      initial in-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      in-line antialiasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line antialiasing
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  p0 =0.       initial in-line dip
       float  pmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum inline dip
       float  pmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum inline dip
       float  q0 =0.       initial cross-line dip
       float  qmax =+FLT_MAX      maximum cross-line dip
       float  qmin =-FLT_MAX      minimum cross-line dip
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string xdip =      initial cross-line dip (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mdipn_fb.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdipn_fb(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfdips(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdips(1)

NAME
       sfdips  -  Estimate a number of constant dips using plane-wave destruc‐
       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdips < in.rsf > out.rsf dips= nd= order=1 nj=1 verb=n niter=10

PARAMETERS
       floats dips =      initial dips [nd]
       int    nd =      number of dips
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       int    nj =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdips.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdips(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdiptaper — Method
sfdiptaper(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdiptaper on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdiptaper. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdiptaper(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdiptaper(1)

NAME
       sfdiptaper  - Aperture optimization for migrated gathers in the dip-an‐
       gle domain.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdiptaper < dipFile.rsf > taperFile.rsf dz=20.f greyarea=10.f

COMMENTS
       Estimates a constructive imaging part of a reflection event in the dip-
       angle  domain.   Basing on the estimation defines a stacking weight for
       every migrated sample.

       Input: dipFile.rsf - dips esitimated  in  constant-dip  subimages.  The
       dips  are  in  degree  (!).  A positive dip corresponds to an ascending
       boundary, a negative dip - to a descending  boundary.   A  constant-dip
       subimage  consists  of migrated traces correspondig to the same dip-an‐
       gle.

       Output: taperFile.rsf - optimal weights for the migrated samples

PARAMETERS
       float  dz =20.f      half of a migrated wave length
       float  greyarea =10.f      width of event tail taper (in degree)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdiptaper.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfdiptaper(1)
source

       np     = ®
       ntau   = ®
       p0     = ®
       tau0   = ®

Madagascar.sfdisfil — Method
sfdisfil(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdisfil on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdisfil. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdisfil(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdisfil(1)

NAME
       sfdisfil - Print out data values.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdisfil < in.rsf number=y col=0 format= header= trailer=

COMMENTS
       Alternatively, use sfdd and convert to ASCII form.

PARAMETERS
       int    col =0      Number of columns.
                     The default depends on the data type:
                     10 for int and char,
                     5 for float,
                     3 for complex
       string format =      Format for numbers (printf-style).
                     The default depends on the data type:
                     "%4d " for int and char,
                     "%13.4g" for float,
                     "%10.4g,%10.4gi" for complex
       string header =      Optional header string to output before data
       bool   number =y [y/n]     If number the elements
       string trailer =      Optional trailer string to output after data
SOURCE
       system/main/disfil.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfdisfil
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdisfil(1)
source

Madagascar.sfdistance — Method
sfdistance(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdistance. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdistance(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdistance(1)

NAME
       sfdistance  -  Computing  distance  function  by  fast marching eikonal
       solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfdistance < points.rsf > dist.rsf velocity=vel.rsf n1=  n2=  n3=1  d1=
       d2= d3=d2 o1=0. o2=0. o3=0. order=2 vel=y

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 = ®
       float  d2 = ®
       float  d3 =d2      sampling
       int    n1 = ®
       int    n2 = ®
       int    n3 =1      dimensions
       float  o1 =0.  ®
       float  o2 =0.  ®
       float  o3 =0.       origin
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   vel  =y  [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity; n, slowness
              squared
       string velocity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mdistance.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikonal.c 825 2004-10-07 08:11:17Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfdistance(1)
source

sfdistpaint(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdistpaint(1)

NAME
       sfdistpaint - Geologic distance painting by plane-wave construction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdistpaint  <  dip.rsf  >  out.rsf  seed=seed.rsf  flt=flt.rsf  verb=n
       eps=0.01 i0=0 order=1 faultscale=100.

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       float  faultscale =100.       Fault attribute  scaling  factor  (0.0  ~
              factor)
       string flt =      auxiliary input file name
       int    i0 =0      reference trace
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       string seed =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdistpaint.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfditime2d — Method
sfditime2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfditime2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfditime2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfditime2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfditime2d(1)

NAME
       sfditime2d  -  2D Hybrid Radon transform for diffraction imaging in the
       time dip-angle domain

SYNOPSIS
       sfditime2d <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  dweight=fileDweight.rsf  reflMod=fil‐
       eRefl.rsf  verb=n adj=n isAA=n liter=100 niter=0 eps=0. verb=n invMod=2
       dip0n= dip0d= dip0o= xin= xid= xio= dipn= dipo= dipd=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  dip0d =      dip0 sampling (if adj=y)
       int    dip0n =      number of dip0 values (if adj=y)
       float  dip0o =      dip0 origin (if adj=y)
       float  dipd =      offset sampling
       int    dipn =      number of offsets
       float  dipo =      offset origin
       string dweight =      input file containing data weights (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    invMod =2      number of nonlinear iterations (for inversion)
       bool   isAA =n [y/n]     if y, apply anti-aliasing
       int    liter =100      number of linear iterations (for inversion)
       int    niter =0      number of nonlinear iterations (for inversion)
       file   reflMod =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  xid =      xi sampling (if adj=y)
       int    xin =      number of xi values (if adj=y)
       float  xio =      xi origin (if adj=y)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mditime2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfditime2d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfditime3d — Method
sfditime3d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfditime3d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfditime3d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfditime3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfditime3d(1)

NAME
       sfditime3d  -  3D Hybrid Radon transform for diffraction imaging in the
       time dip-angle domain

SYNOPSIS
       sfditime3d <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  dweight=fileDweight.rsf  reflMod=fil‐
       eRefl.rsf  verb=n adj=n isAA=n liter=100 niter=0 eps=0. verb=n invMod=2
       dip0n= dip0d= dip0o= sdip0n= sdip0d= sdip0o= xin= xid= xio= sxin= sxid=
       sxio= dipn= dipo= dipd= sdipn= sdipo= sdipd=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  dip0d =      dip0 sampling (if adj=y)
       int    dip0n =      number of dip0 values (if adj=y)
       float  dip0o =      dip0 origin (if adj=y)
       float  dipd =      dip sampling in x-direction
       int    dipn =      number of dips in x-direction
       float  dipo =      dip origin in x-direction
       string dweight =      input file containing data weights (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    invMod =2      number of nonlinear iterations (for inversion)
       bool   isAA =n [y/n]     if y, apply anti-aliasing
       int    liter =100      number of linear iterations (for inversion)
       int    niter =0      number of nonlinear iterations (for inversion)
       file   reflMod =      auxiliary output file name
       float  sdip0d =      sdip0 sampling (if adj=y)
       int    sdip0n =      number of sdip0 values (if adj=y)
       float  sdip0o =      sdip0 origin (if adj=y)
       float  sdipd =      dip sampling in y-direction
       int    sdipn =      number of dips in y-direction
       float  sdipo =      dip origin in y-direction
       float  sxid =      xi sampling (if adj=y)
       int    sxin =      number of xi values (if adj=y)
       float  sxio =      xi origin (if adj=y)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  xid =      xi sampling (if adj=y)
       int    xin =      number of xi values (if adj=y)
       float  xio =      xi origin (if adj=y)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mditime3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfditime3d(1)
source

sfdivn(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdivn(1)

NAME
       sfdivn - Smooth division.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdivn  <  fnum.rsf  den=fden.rsf  > frat.rsf niter=100 verb=y eps=0.0f
       rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       December        2015        program        of        the         month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2015/12/22/program-of-the-month-sfdivn/

PARAMETERS
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mdivn.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdivn(1)

sfdix(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdix(1)

NAME
       sfdix  - Convert RMS to interval velocity using LS and shaping regular‐
       ization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdix  <  vrms.rsf  >   vint.rsf   weight=weight.rsf   vrmsout=vout.rsf
       niter=100 rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       string rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       string vrmsout =      optionally, output predicted vrms (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       string weight =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       bei/vela/vscan
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mdix.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfdix(1)
source
