sfdixshape(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdixshape on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdixshape. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdixshape(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdixshape(1)

NAME
       sfdixshape - Convert RMS to interval velocity using LS and shaping reg‐
       ularization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdixshape  <  vrms.rsf  >   vint.rsf   weight=weight.rsf   dip=dip.rsf
       prior=prior.rsf   vrmsout=vout.rsf   rect1=3   rect2=3  lam=1.  order=1
       niter=100 rect1= rect2= ...

COMMENTS
       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  lam =1.       operator scaling for inversion
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       string prior =      prior velocity model (auxiliary input file name)
       int    rect1 =3 ®
       int    rect2 =3      smoothing radius
       string vrmsout =      optionally, output predicted vrms (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       file   weight =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mdixshape.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdix.c 1131 2005-04-20 18:19:10Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfdixshape(1)
source

sfdlct(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdlct(1)

NAME
       sfdlct - discrete linear chirp transfrom (DLCT)

SYNOPSIS
       sfdlct < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n verb=n C=0.005 L=

PARAMETERS
       float  C =0.005      C=2*Lambda/L, unit slice
       int    L = ®
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform (Here adjoint is the
              same as inverse!)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mdlct.c

Madagascar.sfdmigda — Method
sfdmigda(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdmigda on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdmigda. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdmigda(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdmigda(1)

NAME
       sfdmigda - 2D depth scattering-angle Kirchhoff migration

SYNOPSIS
       sfdmigda < dataFile.rsf vel=velFile.rsf > imageFile.rsf dag=dagFile.rsf
       cig=acigFile.rsf mcig=mcigFile.rsf esct=tEscFile.rsf  escx=xEscFile.rsf
       axis2label=0  isAA=y  izn=dp.zNum ixn=dp.xNum iyn=rp.is3D ? vp.yNum : 1
       izo=dp.zStart  ixo=dp.xStart  iyo=dp.yStart  izd=dp.zStep  ixd=dp.xStep
       iyd=dp.yStep  dipn=161 dipo=-80.f dipd=1.f iscatn=1 iscato=0.f iscatd=2
       * gp.dipStep ttd=0.002f ttn=(int) floor(0.001 * 0.5 * maxTime /  ttStep
       +  1) ttrayd=gp.dipStep / 2.f ttrayo=minttRay ttrayn=(int) floor((maxt‐
       tRay - minttRay) / ttRayStep + 1)

PARAMETERS
       int    axis2label =0      0 - shot; 1 - cmp; 2 - receiver
       string cig =      output file containing CIGs in  the  scattering-angle
              domain (auxiliary output file name)
       string dag  =       output file containing CIGs in the dip-angle domain
              (auxiliary output file name)
       float  dipd =1.f      step in dip-angle
       int    dipn =161      number of dip-angles
       float  dipo =-80.f      first dip-angle
       string esct =      output file containing escqpe times (auxiliary  out‐
              put file name)
       string escx  =       output file containing escape positions (auxiliary
              output file name)
       bool   isAA =y [y/n]     if y, apply anti-aliasing
       float  iscatd =2 * gp.dipStep      scattering-angle increment  (in  de‐
              gree)
       int    iscatn =1      number of scattering-angles
       float  iscato =0.f      first scattering-angle (in degree)
       float  ixd =dp.xStep      step in inlines (in meters)
       int    ixn =dp.xNum      number of imaged inlines
       float  ixo =dp.xStart      first imaged inline (in meters)
       float  iyd =dp.yStep      step in crosslines (in meters)
       int    iyn =rp.is3D ? vp.yNum : 1      number of imaged crosslines
       float  iyo =dp.yStart      first imaged crossline (in meters)
       float  izd =dp.zStep      step in depth (in meters)
       int    izn =dp.zNum      number of imaged depth samples
       float  izo =dp.zStart      first imaged depth (in meters)
       string mcig  =      output file containing multi-CIGs (in the dip-angle
              and the scattering-angle  domain  both  (auxiliary  output  file
              name)
       float  ttd =0.002f      travel-times increment
       int    ttn   =(int)   floor(0.001  *  0.5  *  maxTime  /  ttStep  +  1)
                   travel-times number
       float  ttrayd =gp.dipStep / 2.f      travel-times rays increment
       int    ttrayn =(int) floor((maxttRay  -  minttRay)  /  ttRayStep  +  1)
                   travel-times rays number
       float  ttrayo =minttRay      travel-times rays start
       string vel  =      velocity model file (velocity in m/s) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdmigda.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfdmigda(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfdmo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdmo(1)

NAME
       sfdmo - Kirchhoff DMO with antialiasing by reparameterization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdmo  < in.rsf > out.rsf mint=2 n=32 adj=y inv=n type=1 h= half=y vel‐
       half=0.75

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  h = ®
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the third axis is half-offset instead of
              full offset
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       int    mint =2      starting time sample
       int    n =32      number of offset samples
       int    type =1      type of amplitude (0,1,2,3)
       float  velhalf =0.75      half-velocity
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/dpmv/matt
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdmo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfdmo(1)

       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nfw =      filter-window length (positive and odd integer)
       int    nw =      data-window length (positive and odd integer)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

RSF Documentation

sfdonf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdonf(1)

NAME
       sfdonf - 2D dip-oriented nonlocal (bilateral) smoothing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdonf  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf nfw= nw= boundary=y verb=n bx=
       gauss=n repeat=1 ax=

PARAMETERS
       float  ax =      Gaussian weight for the range distance
       bool   boundary =y [y/n]     if y, boundary is data, whereas zero
       float  bx =      exponential weight for the domain distance  (different
              if gaussian)
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   gauss  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  Gaussian  weight,  whereas Triangle
              weight
       int    nfw =      filter-window length (positive and odd integer)
       int    nw =      data-window length (positive and odd integer)
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mdonf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdonf(1)
source

Madagascar.sfdots — Method
sfdots(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdots on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdots. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdots(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdots(1)

NAME
       sfdots - Plot signal with lollipops.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdots  <  in.rsf  labels= dots=(n1 <= 130)? 1: 0 seemean=(bool) (n2 <=
       30) strings=(bool) (n1 <= 400) connect=1 corners= silk=n gaineach=y la‐
       belsz=8  yreverse=n constsep=n seedead=n transp=n xxscale=1. yyscale=1.
       clip=-1.  overlap=0.9   screenratio=VP_SCREEN_RATIO   screenht=VP_STAN‐
       DARD_HEIGHT  screenwd=screenhigh / screenratio radius=dd1/3 font=-1 la‐
       bel1= unit1= title= > plot.vpl

COMMENTS
       The axis is displayed only if label1= is present in the input  file  or
       the command line.

PARAMETERS
       float  clip =-1.       data clip
       int    connect =1      connection type: 1 - diagonal, 2 - bar, 4 - only
              for non-zero data
       bool   constsep =n [y/n]     if y, use constant trace separation
       int    corners =      number of polygon corners (default is 6)
       int    dots =(n1 <= 130)? 1: 0      type of dots: 1 - baloon,  0  -  no
              dots, 2 - only for non-zero data
       int    font =-1      font to use in text
       bool   gaineach =y [y/n]     if y, gain each trace independently
       string label1 =      label for the axis
       strings
              labels =      trace labels [n2]
       int    labelsz =8      label size
       float  overlap =0.9      trace overlap
       float  radius =dd1/3      dot radius
       float  screenht =VP_STANDARD_HEIGHT      screen height
       float  screenratio =VP_SCREEN_RATIO      screen aspect ratio
       float  screenwd =screenhigh / screenratio      screen width
       bool   seedead =n [y/n]     if y, show zero traces
       bool   seemean =(bool) (n2 <= 30) [y/n]     if y, draw axis lines
       bool   silk =n [y/n]     if y, silky plot
       bool   strings =(bool) (n1 <= 400) [y/n]     if y, draw strings
       string title =      plot title
       bool   transp =n [y/n]     if y, transpose the axis
       string unit1 =      unit for the axis
       float  xxscale =1.       x scaling
       bool   yreverse =n [y/n]     if y, reverse y axis
       float  yyscale =1.       y scaling
USED IN
       bei/conj/causint
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/krch/sep73
       bei/trimo/all
       bei/trimo/mig
       bei/trimo/mod
       bei/trimo/veltran
       bei/vela/stack
       bei/vela/strat
       bei/vela/vscan
SOURCE
       plot/main/dots.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdots(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS

       verb=n

PARAMETERS

       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nw =      data-window length (positive and odd integer)
       int    rect =nw      Correlation window
       bool   var =n [y/n]     if y,  variance  weights,  whereas  correlation
              weights
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

Madagascar.sfdrays — Method
sfdrays(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdrays on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdrays. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdrays(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdrays(1)

NAME
       sfdrays - 2D dynamic ray tracing by a Runge-Kutta integrator.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdrays  <  vel.rsf > gbeam.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf anglefile=angles.rsf
       rays=rays.rsf dmat=dmat.rsf proj=proj.rsf mask=mask.rsf  vel=y  order=4
       nt=  dt=  verb=y  shift=0.5  zshot=0.  yshot=o[1]+0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] nr=
       a0=0. amax=360.

COMMENTS
       Angle is 90 deg along y-axis and 180 deg along z-axis, clockwise.

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =0.       minimum angle (if no anglefile)
       float  amax =360.       maximum angle (if no anglefile)
       string anglefile =      file with initial angles [nr,nshot]  (auxiliary
              input file name)
       string dmat =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dt =      Sampling in time
       string mask =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nr =      number of angles (if no anglefile)
       int    nt =      Number of time steps
       int    order =4      Interpolation order
       string proj =      auxiliary output file name
       string rays =      auxiliary output file name
       float  shift =0.5      Complex source shift
       string shotfile  =       file  with  shot locations [zshot,yshot,nshot]
              (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     If y, input is velocity; if n, slowness
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       float  yshot =o[1]+0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] ®
       float  zshot =0.  ®
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Mdrays.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfdrays(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdsmooth — Method
sfdsmooth(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdsmooth on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdsmooth. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdsmooth(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsmooth(1)

NAME
       sfdsmooth - Multi-dimensional triangle smoothing - derivative.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsmooth < in.rsf > out.rsf ider=0 repeat=1 nderiv=6 rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       int    ider =0      direction of the derivative (0 means no derivative)
       int    nderiv =6      derivative filter accuracy
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       int    repeat =1      repeat smoothing several times
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mdsmooth.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdsmooth(1)
source
Madagascar.sfdsr — Method
sfdsr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdsr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdsr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdsr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsr(1)

NAME
       sfdsr  -  Prestack  2-D  VTI  v(z) modeling/migration by DSR with angle
       gathers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsr < in.rsf >  out.rsf  velocity=vel.rsf  velz=velz.rsf  eta=eta.rsf
       inv=n  eps=0.01  depth=n  na=1 da=90. nt= dt= t0=0. nh= dh= nz=nt dz=dt
       vel= vz=v0 n=0.0 nw=nt2/2+1 rule= arule=

PARAMETERS
       string arule =      angle gather rule
       float  da =90.       angle sampling (in degrees)
       bool   depth =n [y/n]     if true, depth migration
       float  dh =      Offset sampling (for modeling)
       float  dt =      Sampling of time axis (for modeling)
       float  dz =dt      Sampling of depth axis (for migration, if no  veloc‐
              ity file)
       float  eps =0.01      Stabilization parameter
       string eta =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     If y, modeling; If n, migration
       float  n =0.0      Constant eta (if no velocity file)
       int    na =1      number of angles
       int    nh =      Number of offsets (for modeling)
       int    nt =      Length of time axis (for modeling)
       int    nw =nt2/2+1      Maximum number of frequencies
       int    nz  =nt      Length of depth axis (for migration, if no velocity
              file)
       string rule =      phase-shift interpolation  rule  (simple,  midpoint,
              linear, anisotropic, dti)
       float  t0 =0.  ®
       float  vel =      Constant velocity (if no velocity file)
       string velocity  =       file with velocity (file with velocity (auxil‐
              iary input file name))
       string velz =      auxiliary input file name
       float  vz =v0      Constant vertical velocity (if no velocity file)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdsr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfdsr(1)
source

sfdsr2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsr2(1)

NAME
       sfdsr2 - 2-D prestack modeling/migration with split-step DSR.

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsr2  <  in.rsf > out.rsf slowness=vel.rsf inv=n verb=n eps=0.01 nt=1
       nr=1 dt=0.004 npad=0 nw= dw= w0=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.004      time error
       float  dw =      Frequency sampling (for modeling)
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     If y, modeling; if n, migration
       int    npad =0      padding on offset wavenumber
       int    nr =1      maximum number of references
       int    nt =1      taper size
       int    nw =      Length of frequency axis (for modeling)
       file   slowness =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  w0 =0.       Frequency origin (for modeling)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mdsr2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdsreiko(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsreiko(1)

NAME
       sfdsreiko - Double square-root eikonal solver (2D)

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsreiko  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  mask=mask.rsf flag=flag.rsf alpha=al‐
       pha.rsf velocity=y thres=5.e-5 tol=1.e-3 nloop=10 causal=y

PARAMETERS
       string alpha =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   causal =y [y/n]     if y, neglect non-causal branches of DSR
       string flag =      auxiliary output file name
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nloop =10      number of bisection root-search
       float  thres =5.e-5      threshold (percentage)
       float  tol =1.e-3      tolerance for bisection root-search
       bool   velocity =y [y/n]     if y, the input is velocity;  n,  slowness
              squared
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Mdsreiko.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdsreiko(1)
source

Madagascar.sfdsrtomo — Method
sfdsrtomo(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdsrtomo on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdsrtomo. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdsrtomo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsrtomo(1)

NAME
       sfdsrtomo - Prestack first-arrival traveltime tomography (DSR)

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsrtomo  < in.rsf > out.rsf grad=grad.rsf time=time.rsf flag=flag.rsf
       mask=mask.rsf prec=prec.rsf reco=reco.rsf adj=n  velocity=y  velocity=y
       shape=n scale=n scale0=0.5 verb=n niter=5 cgiter=10 liter=5 thres=5.e-5
       tol=1.e-3 nloop=10 eps=0. causal=y rect#=(1,1,...) what=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag (for what=linear)
       bool   causal =y [y/n]     if y, neglect non-causal branches of DSR
       int    cgiter =10      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       string flag =      auxiliary input file name
       string grad =      auxiliary input file name
       int    liter =5      number of line-search iterations
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =5      number of inversion iterations
       int    nloop =10      number of bisection root-search
       string prec =      auxiliary input file name
       string reco =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   scale =n [y/n]     if y, scale gradient before line-search
       float  scale0 =0.5      gradient scale max ratio (if scale=y)
       bool   shape =n [y/n]     shaping regularization (default no)
       float  thres =5.e-5      threshold (percentage)
       string time =      auxiliary input file name
       float  tol =1.e-3      tolerance for bisection root-search
       bool   velocity =y [y/n]     if y, the input is velocity; n,  slowness-
              squared
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string what =      what to compute (default tomography)
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Mdsrtomo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdsrtomo(1)
source

sfdsrtomo0(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdsrtomo0(1)

NAME
       sfdsrtomo0 - Prestack first-arrival traveltime tomography (DSR)

SYNOPSIS
       sfdsrtomo0 < in.rsf > out.rsf reco=reco.rsf mask=mask.rsf prec=prec.rsf
       grad=grad.rsf  velocity=y  limit=n  shape=n  verb=n  niter=5  cgiter=10
       thres=5.e-5 tol=1.e-3 nloop=10 eps=0. causal=y rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       bool   causal =y [y/n]     if y, neglect non-causal branches of DSR
       int    cgiter =10      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       string grad =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   limit  =n [y/n]     if y, limit computation within receiver cov‐
              erage
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =5      number of inversion iterations
       int    nloop =10      number of bisection root-search
       string prec =      auxiliary input file name
       string reco =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   shape =n [y/n]     shaping regularization (default no)
       float  thres =5.e-5      threshold (percentage)
       float  tol =1.e-3      tolerance for bisection root-search
       bool   velocity =y [y/n]     if y, the input is velocity; n,  slowness-
              squared
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Mdsrtomo0.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfdsrtomo0(1)

Madagascar.sfdtw — Method
sfdtw(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdtw on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdtw. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdtw(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw(1)

NAME
       sfdtw -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw  <  _in.rsf  ref=_ref.rsf  > _out.rsf error=_error.rsf accum=_ac‐
       cum.rsf shifts=_shifts.rsf maxshift= exp=2 strain=1.0

COMMENTS
       program calculates the shifts to warp a matching  trace  (input)  to  a
       reference trace (ref=) of equal length and applies those shifts

PARAMETERS
       string accum  =       accumulation errors from forward and backtracking
              (auxiliary output file name)
       string error =      misfit error (auxiliary output file name)
       float  exp =2      error exponent (g-f)^exp
       int    maxshift = ®
       string ref =      auxiliary input file name
       string shifts =      output integer shifts as floats (auxiliary  output
              file name)
       float  strain =1.0      maximum strain
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdtw.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfdtw(1)
source

NAME
       sfdtw-accumulate -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw-accumulate < _in.rsf > _out.rsf strain=1 dir=0

COMMENTS
       accumulates  or smooths alignment errors in the forward direction, sub‐
       ject to strain str=float is the maximum du/di

PARAMETERS
       int    dir =0      accumulation direction: 1 is forward,  -1  is  back‐
              ward, 0 is both
       float  strain =1      maximum strain
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdtw-accumulate.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdtw-apply(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw-apply(1)

NAME
       sfdtw-apply -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw-apply < _in.rsf shifts=_shifts.rsf > _out.rsf

COMMENTS
       program  applies  integer shifts (stored as floats!) to warp a matching
       trace.  Can match 1d shifts to a 1,2, or 3d volume , or 2d shifts to  a
       2, or 3 d volume, or 3d shifts to a 3d volume

PARAMETERS
       string shifts =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdtw-apply.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdtw-errors(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw-errors(1)

NAME
       sfdtw-errors -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw-errors < _in.rsf ref=_ref.rsf > _out.rsf maxshift= exp=2

COMMENTS
       program  calculates the alignment errors between a reference and match‐
       ing trace given a maximum  shift  (maxshift=)  and  an  error  exponent
       (exp=)

PARAMETERS
       float  exp =2      error exponent (g-f)^exp
       int    maxshift =      maximum shift
       string ref =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE

       4.2-git

NAME

       dtw,   optionally   writes   out   shifts,   currently   set   up   for
       (time,gather,space) for 2d imaging

       maxshift=

       int    maxshift = ®

              file name)
       float  strain =1.0      maximum strain

sfdtw-interp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw-interp(1)

NAME
       sfdtw-interp -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw-interp   <   _in.rsf  loc=_loc.rsf  >  _out.rsf  maxshift=  exp=2
       strain=1.0 n=

COMMENTS
       program takes traces sampled at arbitrary locations along a 1d line and
       outputs  regularly sampled line.  program assumes the locations are or‐
       dered.

PARAMETERS
       float  exp =2      error exponent (g-f)^exp
       string loc =      auxiliary input file name
       int    maxshift =      maximum shift to be tested
       int    n =      number of traces in output
       float  strain =1.0      maximum strain for dtw
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdtw-interp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfdtw-track(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw-track(1)

NAME
       sfdtw-track -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw-track < _in.rsf error=_miss.rsf > _out.rsf strain=1

COMMENTS
       problem  finds  the optimal trajectory across accumulation errors using
       backtracking.  takes the same strain strain= as the accumulation step.

PARAMETERS
       string error =      auxiliary input file name
       float  strain =1      maximum strain

       user/luke/Mdtw-track.c

       4.2-git

sfdtw2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdtw2(1)

NAME
       sfdtw2 -

SYNOPSIS
       sfdtw2    <    _in.rsf   ref=_ref.rsf   >   _out.rsf   accum=_accum.rsf
       shifts=_shifts.rsf maxshift= exp=2 strain1=1.0 strain2=1.0 nalter=2

COMMENTS
       program warps a 2D input image to a 2D reference image

PARAMETERS
       string accum =      optional output for accumulation errors  (auxiliary
              output file name)
       float  exp =2      error exponent (g-f)^exp
       int    maxshift =      maximum shift to be tested
       int    nalter =2      number of horizontal and vertical smoothings
       string ref =      auxiliary input file name
       string shifts  =      optional output for shifts (auxiliary output file
              name)
       float  strain1 =1.0      maximum strain in first axis
       float  strain2 =1.0      maximum strain in  second  axis,  if  >  1  no
              strain limit
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mdtw2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdtw2(1)

Madagascar.sfduffing — Method
sfduffing(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfduffing on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfduffing. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfduffing(1) Madagascar Manuals sfduffing(1)

NAME
       sfduffing  -  Duffing  differential equation solved by 4th order Runge-
       Kutta method.

SYNOPSIS
       sfduffing < in.rsf > out.rsf sfile=sfile.rsf gamma=0.75  omega=1  kxi=1
       x0=0 y0=0 pow1=1 pow2=3 verb=n ricker=n

COMMENTS
       Duffing equation: x'' + 0.5 x' - x + x^3 = gamma cos(omega t) + kxi in‐
       put(t)

PARAMETERS
       float  gamma =0.75      strength of external force
       float  kxi =1      adjustment for input signal
       float  omega =1      angular frequence of external force
       int    pow1 =1      power of first non-linear restitution term
       int    pow2 =3      power of second non-linear restitution term
       bool   ricker =n [y/n]     if y need extenal input for external force
       string sfile =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =0      initial value of x0
       float  y0 =0      initial value of y0
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mduffing.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfduffing(1)
source
Madagascar.sfduffing1 — Method
sfduffing1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfduffing1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfduffing1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfduffing1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfduffing1(1)

NAME
       sfduffing1  - 1D signal analysis by using Duffing differential equation
       solved by 4th order Runge-Kutta method.

SYNOPSIS
       sfduffing1 < in.rsf  >  out.rsf  restor=restor.rsf  gamma=0.75  omega=1
       kxi=1 x0=0 y0=0 pow1=1 pow2=3 phi=0. verb=n cosine=y

COMMENTS
       Duffing   equation:  x''/(omega^2)+0.5  x'/omega-x+x^3=gamma  cos(omega
       t+phi)+kxi R(t)

PARAMETERS
       bool   cosine =y [y/n]     if n need extenal input for periodic restor‐
              ing force
       float  gamma =0.75      strength of external force
       float  kxi =1      adjustment for input signal
       float  omega =1      angular frequence of external force
       float  phi =0.       phase of cosine signal unit=pi
       int    pow1 =1      power of first non-linear restitution term
       int    pow2 =3      power of second non-linear restitution term
       string restor =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =0      initial value of x0
       float  y0 =0      initial value of y0
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mduffing1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfduffing1(1)
source
Madagascar.sfduffing2 — Method
sfduffing2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfduffing2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfduffing2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfduffing2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfduffing2(1)

NAME
       sfduffing2  -  2D/3D  Velocity  analysis  by using Duffing differential
       equation solved by 4th order Runge-Kutta method.

SYNOPSIS
       sfduffing2 < cmp.rsf >  outf.rsf  restor=restor.rsf  winsz=200  v0=1000
       dv=20 vn=100 t0=o1 deltat0=dt t0n=n1 gamma=0.75 omega=1 kxi=1 x0=0 y0=0
       pow1=1 pow2=3 phi=0. cosine=y delta=0.01 verb=n gx=2.0

COMMENTS
       Duffing  equation:  x''/(omega^2)+0.5  x'/omega-x+x^3=gamma   cos(omega
       t+phi)+kxi R(t)

PARAMETERS
       bool   cosine =y [y/n]     if n need extenal input for periodic restor‐
              ing force
       float  delta =0.01      The density of judgement grid
       float  deltat0 =dt      step lenth for t0 scan
       float  dv =20      step lenth for velocity scan
       float  gamma =0.75      strength of external force
       float  gx =2.0      Size of grid
       float  kxi =1      adjustment for input signal
       float  omega =1      angular frequence of external force
       float  phi =0.       phase of cosine signal unit=pi
       int    pow1 =1      power of first non-linear restitution term
       int    pow2 =3      power of second non-linear restitution term
       string restor =      auxiliary input file name
       float  t0 =o1      t0 scan start point
       int    t0n =n1      numbers of t0scan
       float  v0 =1000      init Vel for velocity scan
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    vn =100      numbers of velscan
       int    winsz =200      for each trace,the width of window. Unit:samples
       float  x0 =0      initial value of x0
       float  y0 =0      initial value of y0
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mduffing2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfduffing2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfduwt — Method
sfduwt(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfduwt on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfduwt. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfduwt(1) Madagascar Manuals sfduwt(1)

NAME
       sfduwt  -  1-D  digital  undecimated  (stationary) wavelet transform by
       lifting scheme

SYNOPSIS
       sfduwt < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n adj=n unit=n scale=max type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       int    scale =max      decomposition scale
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   unit =n [y/n]     if y, use unitary scaling
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mduwt.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfduwt(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdvscan2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdvscan2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdvscan2d(1)

NAME
       sfdvscan2d - Diffraction velocity analysis

SYNOPSIS
       sfdvscan2d < dataFile_.rsf vel=velFile_.rsf > sembFile_.rsf gn=1 go=1.0
       gd=1 coher=11 cigNum=1 dlim=fabs (dipStart_) isSemb=y

COMMENTS
       Input: dataFile_.rsf - migrated dip-angle gathers

       Output: sembFile_.rsf - semblance spectrum

PARAMETERS
       int    cigNum =1      height of a vertical window for semblance  calcu‐
              lation
       int    coher  =11      height of a vertical window for semblance calcu‐
              lation
       float  dlim =fabs (dipStart_)       defines  dip-angle-window  for  the
              analysis
       float  gd =1      increment of Vm/V parameter
       int    gn =1      number of scanned Vm/V values
       float  go =1.0      start of Vm/V parameter
       bool   isSemb =y [y/n]     y - output is semblance; n - stack power
       string vel =      velocity model file (velocity in km/s) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mdvscan2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfdvscan2d(1)
source

Madagascar.sfdwt2 — Method
sfdwt2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfdwt2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfdwt2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfdwt2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdwt2(1)

NAME
       sfdwt2 - 1-D digital wavelet transform (another version)

SYNOPSIS
       sfdwt2 < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n adj=n unit=n type=

COMMENTS
       Forward  transform  (adj=y  inv=y)    m=T[d]  Adjoint  transform (adj=y
       inv=n)   m=T^(-1)'[d] Inverse transform (adj=n inv=y/n) d=T^(-1)[m]

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   unit =n [y/n]     if y, use unitary scaling
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mdwt2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfdwt2(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfdzest2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfdzest2d(1)

NAME
       sfdzest2d - Estimation of depth-delay of common-image gathers

SYNOPSIS
       sfdzest2d  Fp=Fp.rsf  <  Fnp.rsf > Fs.rsf adj=n inv=n shape=n niter=100
       eps1=0. rect1=3 rect2=3 seed=0 eps2=1e3

PARAMETERS
       file   Fp =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if adj=y, adjoint operator
       float  eps1 =0.       shaping regularization parameter
       float  eps2 =1e3      regularization parameter in model constraint
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if inv=y, perform inversion
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =3      shaping smoothing parameter in 1st axis
       int    rect2 =3      shaping smoothing parameter in 2nd axis
       int    seed =0      index of reference trace
       bool   shape =n [y/n]     if shape=y, use projection method
SOURCE
       user/zhiguang/Mdzest2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfdzest2d(1)
source

NAME
       sfederiv2d -

SYNOPSIS
       sfederiv2d ccc=Fccc.rsf < Fspk.rsf zdel=Fzdel.rsf xdel=Fxdel.rsf verb=n
       stat=y sig=1.5 order=8 domain= tapertype=

PARAMETERS

       string domain = ®
       int    order =8      order
       float  sig =1.5      sigma
       bool   stat =y [y/n]     stationary operator
       string tapertype = ®

       file   zdel =      auxiliary output file name

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfefd3dmt. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfefd3dmt(1) Madagascar Manuals sfefd3dmt(1)

NAME
       sfefd3dmt  - 3D 8-th order elastic wave propagation with sponge ABC and
       moment tensor source

SYNOPSIS
       sfefd3dmt < Fvp.rsf vs=Fvs.rsf  rho=Frho.rsf  >  Frvz.rsf  rvx=Frvx.rsf
       rvy=Frvy.rsf  wavx=Fwavx.rsf  wavy=Fwavy.rsf  wavz=Fwavz.rsf  M= verb=n
       ifwfd=n nb=30 nt= dt= fm=20.0 ft=0 jsnap=1  ct=0.01  sx=nxpad/2  sy=ny‐
       pad/2 sz=nzpad/2 free=n

COMMENTS
       By Yangkang Chen, 2020 Revised in July, 2021 Currently still in a draft
       version

       DEMO:                             https://github.com/chenyk1990/tutori‐
       als/blob/main/demo/efd3dmt/SConstruct

PARAMETERS
       floats M =       [9]
       float  ct =0.01      for absorbing boundary
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20.0      dominant freq of Ricker wavelet
       bool   free =n [y/n]     if free surface
       int    ft =0      first recorded time
       bool   ifwfd =n [y/n]     if output wavefield
       int    jsnap =1      interval for snapshots
       int    nb =30      thickness of ABC layer
       int    nt =      number of time steps
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rvx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   rvy =      auxiliary output file name
       int    sx =nxpad/2 ®
       int    sy =nypad/2 ®
       int    sz =nzpad/2 ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wavx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavz =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mefd3dmt.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfefd3dmt(1)
source

sfeicold2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeicold2d(1)

NAME
       sfeicold2d - Extended IC 3D

SYNOPSIS
       sfeicold2d  <  Fs.rsf  ur=Fr.rsf cc=Fc.rsf > Fi.rsf verb=n isreversed=n
       nhz=0   nhx=0   nht=0    gaus=n    gsx=nhx*sf_d(ax)    gsz=nhz*sf_d(az)
       gst=nht*sf_d(at)

PARAMETERS
       file   cc =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   gaus =n [y/n]     Gaussian taper flag
       float  gst =nht*sf_d(at) ®
       float  gsx =nhx*sf_d(ax) ®
       float  gsz =nhz*sf_d(az) ®
       bool   isreversed =n [y/n]     reversed rec wfld?
       int    nht =0 ®
       int    nhx =0 ®
       int    nhz =0 ®
       file   ur =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/psava/Meicold2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfeicold2d(1)

sfeicop2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeicop2d(1)

NAME
       sfeicop2d - Extended IC 2D

SYNOPSIS
       sfeicop2d  opr=Fopr.rsf cip=Fcip.rsf < Fimg.rsf > Fwfl.rsf verb=n adj=n
       wflcausal=n     oprcausal=n     nhz=0      nhx=0      nht=0      gaus=n
       gsx=0.25*sf_n(ahx)*sf_d(ahx)               gsz=0.25*sf_n(ahz)*sf_d(ahz)
       gst=0.25*sf_n(aht)*sf_d(aht)

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       file   cip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   gaus =n [y/n]     Gaussian taper
       float  gst =0.25*sf_n(aht)*sf_d(aht) ®
       float  gsx =0.25*sf_n(ahx)*sf_d(ahx) ®
       float  gsz =0.25*sf_n(ahz)*sf_d(ahz) ®
       int    nht =0      t lags
       int    nhx =0      x lags
       int    nhz =0      z lags
       file   opr =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   oprcausal =n [y/n]     causal opr?
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   wflcausal =n [y/n]     causal wfl?
SOURCE
       user/psava/Meicop2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfeicop2d(1)
source

sfeicop3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeicop3d(1)

NAME
       sfeicop3d - Extended IC 2D

SYNOPSIS
       sfeicop3d  opr=Fopr.rsf cip=Fcip.rsf < Fimg.rsf > Fwfl.rsf verb=n adj=n
       wflcausal=n   oprcausal=n    nhz=0    nhx=0    nhy=0    nht=0    gaus=n
       gsx=0.25*sf_n(ahx)*sf_d(ahx)               gsy=0.25*sf_n(ahy)*sf_d(ahy)
       gsz=0.25*sf_n(ahz)*sf_d(ahz) gst=0.25*sf_n(aht)*sf_d(aht)

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       file   cip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   gaus =n [y/n]     Gaussian taper
       float  gst =0.25*sf_n(aht)*sf_d(aht) ®
       float  gsx =0.25*sf_n(ahx)*sf_d(ahx) ®
       float  gsy =0.25*sf_n(ahy)*sf_d(ahy) ®
       float  gsz =0.25*sf_n(ahz)*sf_d(ahz) ®
       int    nht =0      t lags
       int    nhx =0      x lags
       int    nhy =0      y lags
       int    nhz =0      z lags
       file   opr =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   oprcausal =n [y/n]     causal opr?
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   wflcausal =n [y/n]     causal wfl?
SOURCE
       user/psava/Meicop3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfeicop3d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikEta — Method
sfeikEta(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikEta on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikEta. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikEta(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikEta(1)

NAME
       sfeikEta - Eta differential eikonal solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikEta < btime.rsf > time.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf btime=y order=2 sor‐
       der=2  eta=0.0  br1=d1  br2=d2  br3=d3   plane1=n   plane2=n   plane3=n
       b1=plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5)
       b3=plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2  +  0.5*(n2-1)*d2
       xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3  =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3 =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in  physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       bool   btime =y [y/n]     if y, the input is background time; n, Veloc‐
              ity
       float  eta =0.0      The value of the constant eta
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       int    sorder =2 [1,2,3]   Accuracy order of the source perturbation
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/tariq/MeikEta.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikds.c 4136 2009-02-07 17:20:32Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfeikEta(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikds — Method
sfeikds(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikds on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikds. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikds(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikds(1)

NAME
       sfeikds - Source differntial eikonal solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikds  < btime.rsf > time.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf btime=y order=2 sor‐
       der=2  dl=0.0  br1=d1  br2=d2   br3=d3   plane1=n   plane2=n   plane3=n
       b1=plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5)
       b3=plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2  +  0.5*(n2-1)*d2
       xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3  =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3 =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in  physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       bool   btime =y [y/n]     if y, the input is background time; n, Veloc‐
              ity
       float  dl =0.0      The value of the shift in the y direction
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       int    sorder =2 [1,2,3]   Accuracy order of the source perturbation
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/tariq/Meikds.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikds.c 4136 2009-02-07 17:20:32Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfeikds(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikfswp — Method
sfeikfswp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikfswp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikfswp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikfswp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikfswp(1)

NAME
       sfeikfswp - Fast sweeping eikonal solver (2-D/3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikfswp  <  vel.rsf  >  time.rsf  vel=y  niter=2  zshot=0. yshot=o2 +
       0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 shotfile= horizon=

PARAMETERS
       string horizon =      File with a reflection interface
       int    niter =2      number of sweeping iterations
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3)
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     if y, the input is velocity; n - slowness
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/bash/Meikfswp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfeikfswp(1)

Madagascar.sfeikods — Method
sfeikods(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikods on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikods. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikods(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikods(1)

NAME
       sfeikods - Fast marching with source perturbation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikods   <   vel.rsf   >  time.rsf  shotfile=shots.rsf  tdl1=tdl1.rsf
       tds1=tds1.rsf tdl2=tdl2.rsf tds2=tds2.rsf vel=y order=2 sweep=n  br1=d1
       br2=d2   br3=d3  plane1=n  plane2=n  plane3=n  b1=plane[2]?  n1:  (int)
       (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]? n3: (int)
       (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3
       l=1

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3 =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity  box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3  =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       int    l =1      source perturbation direction
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   sweep  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  use  fast  sweeping instead of fast
              marching
       string tdl1 =      auxiliary output file name
       string tdl2 =      auxiliary output file name
       string tds1 =      auxiliary output file name
       string tds2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity;  n,  slowness
              squared
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Meikods.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikonal.c 7107 2011-04-10 02:04:14Z ivlad

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfeikods(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikonal — Method
sfeikonal(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikonal on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikonal. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikonal(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikonal(1)

NAME
       sfeikonal - Fast marching eikonal solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikonal < vel.rsf > time.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf vel=y order=2 sweep=n
       br1=d1 br2=d2 br3=d3 plane1=n plane2=n plane3=n b1=plane[2]? n1:  (int)
       (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]? n3: (int)
       (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3

COMMENTS
       June 2014 program of  the  month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2014/06/11/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfeikonal/

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3  =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3 =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in  physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile  =       File  with shot locations (n2=number of shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   sweep =n [y/n]     if y,  use  fast  sweeping  instead  of  fast
              marching
       bool   vel  =y  [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity; n, slowness
              squared
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
USED IN
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Meikonal.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfeikonal(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikonal_rtp — Method
sfeikonal_rtp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikonal_rtp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikonal_rtp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikonalrtp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikonalrtp(1)

NAME
       sfeikonal_rtp - Fast marching eikonal solver (3-D) in spherical coordi‐
       nates.

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikonal_rtp < vel.rsf > time.rsf  shotfile=shots.rsf  time2=time2.rsf
       vel=y  order=2  sweep=n br1=d1 br2=d2 br3=d3 plane1=n plane2=n plane3=n
       b1=plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5)
       b3=plane[0]?  n3:  (int) (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2
       xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3

COMMENTS
       Also         see         sfeikonal         (cartesian          version)
       http://ahay.org/blog/2014/06/11/program-of-the-month-sfeikonal/

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3  =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3 =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in  physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile  =       File  with shot locations (n2=number of shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   sweep =n [y/n]     if y,  use  fast  sweeping  instead  of  fast
              marching
       file   time2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   vel  =y  [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity; n, slowness
              squared
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Meikonal_rtp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfeikonal_rtp(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikonal_surf — Method
sfeikonal_surf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikonal_surf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikonal_surf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikonalsurf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikonalsurf(1)

NAME
       sfeikonal_surf  -  Fast  marching  eikonal  solver (3-D) and record the
       traveltimes on the surface.

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikonal_surf < vel.rsf > time.rsf  shotfile=shots.rsf  vel=y  order=2
       sweep=n  br1=d1  br2=d2  br3=d3 plane1=n plane2=n plane3=n b1=plane[2]?
       n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]?
       n3:  (int)  (br3/d3+0.5)  zshot=0.  yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 +
       0.5*(n3-1)*d3

COMMENTS
       It supports massive 3D ray tracing for ML purposes.

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3 =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity  box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3  =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   sweep  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  use  fast  sweeping instead of fast
              marching
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity;  n,  slowness
              squared
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Meikonal_surf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfeikonal_surf(1)
source
Madagascar.sfeikonal_surf_dv1d — Method
sfeikonal_surf_dv1d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikonal_surf_dv1d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikonal_surf_dv1d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikonalsurfdv1d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikonalsurfdv1d(1)

NAME
       sfeikonal_surf_dv1d - Fast marching eikonal solver (3-D) and record the
       traveltimes on the surface.

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikonal_surf_dv1d  <   vel.rsf   >   time.rsf   dv=deltav.rsf   shot‐
       file=shots.rsf  vel=y  order=2  sweep=n  br1=d1  br2=d2 br3=d3 plane1=n
       plane2=n plane3=n b1=plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]?  n2:
       (int)   (br2/d2+0.5)   b3=plane[0]?  n3:  (int)  (br3/d3+0.5)  zshot=0.
       yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3

COMMENTS
       It supports massive 3D ray tracing with different 1D velocity perturba‐
       tion  for  estimating  both event location and velocity structure using
       ML.

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3 =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity  box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3  =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       file   dv =      auxiliary input file name
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   sweep  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  use  fast  sweeping instead of fast
              marching
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity;  n,  slowness
              squared
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Meikonal_surf_dv1d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023            sfeikonal_surf_dv1d(1)
source

sfeikonalvti(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikonalvti(1)

NAME
       sfeikonalvti - Fast marching eikonal solver in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikonalvti  <  vzf.rsf  >  time.rsf  shotfile=shots.rsf vel=y order=2
       br1=d1 br2=d2 br3=d3 plane1=n plane2=n plane3=n b1=plane[2]? n1:  (int)
       (br1/d1+0.5) b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]? n3: (int)
       (br3/d3+0.5) zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3
       vx= eta=

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3  =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3 =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in  physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       string eta = ®
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile  =       File  with shot locations (n2=number of shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     if  y,  the  input  is  velocity;  n,  slowness
              squared
       string vx = ®
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Meikonalvti.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikonal.c 1507 2005-10-22 04:01:28Z savap

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfeikonalvti(1)

Madagascar.sfeikvti — Method
sfeikvti(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfeikvti on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfeikvti. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfeikvti(1) Madagascar Manuals sfeikvti(1)

NAME
       sfeikvti - VTI eikonal solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfeikvti  <  bv.rsf > time.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf order=2 br1=d1 br2=d2
       br3=d3 plane1=n plane2=n plane3=n b1=plane[2]? n1:  (int)  (br1/d1+0.5)
       b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)
       zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 vv= eta=

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3 =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity  box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3  =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       string eta = ®
       int    order =2 [1,2]     Accuracy order
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       string vv = ®
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/tariq/Meikvti.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Meikvti.c 4136 2009-02-07 17:20:32Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfeikvti(1)
source
Madagascar.sfemd — Method
sfemd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfemd on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfemd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfemd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfemd(1)

NAME
       sfemd - Empirical Mode Decomposition

SYNOPSIS
       sfemd  <  inp.rsf  > outp.rsf threshold=DEFAULT_THRESHOLD tolerance=DE‐
       FAULT_TOLERANCE miter=MAX_ITERATIONS mimf=0

PARAMETERS
       int    mimf =0      Maximum number of IMFs, the default is as  many  as
              possible.
       int    miter  =MAX_ITERATIONS       Maximum number of iterations during
              sifting, the default is 1000.
       float  threshold  =DEFAULT_THRESHOLD       Sifting  stoping  parameter:
              threshold, the default is 0.05.
       float  tolerance  =DEFAULT_TOLERANCE       Sifting  stoping  parameter:
              tolerance, the default is 0.05.
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Memd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfemd(1)
source
Madagascar.sfemfdm2d — Method
sfemfdm2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfemfdm2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfemfdm2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfemfdm2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfemfdm2d(1)

NAME
       sfemfdm2d - 2D EM FD modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfemfdm2d  < Fwav.rsf sou=Fsou.rsf rec=Frec.rsf wfl=Fwfl.rsf > Fdat.rsf
       mag=Fmag.rsf ele=Fele.rsf  cdt=Fcdt.rsf  verb=n  snap=n  free=n  expl=n
       dabc=n   jdata=1   jsnap=nt   nqz=sf_n(az)   nqx=sf_n(ax)  oqz=sf_o(az)
       oqx=sf_o(ax)

PARAMETERS
       file   cdt =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   dabc =n [y/n]     absorbing BC
       file   ele =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   expl =n [y/n]     "exploding reflector"
       bool   free =n [y/n]     free surface flag
       int    jdata =1 ®
       int    jsnap =nt ®
       file   mag =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nqx =sf_n(ax) ®
       int    nqz =sf_n(az) ®
       float  oqx =sf_o(ax) ®
       float  oqz =sf_o(az) ®
       file   rec =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   snap =n [y/n]     wavefield snapshots flag
       file   sou =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   wfl =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/psava/Memfdm2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfemfdm2d(1)
source

       oqx=sf_o(ax)

Madagascar.sfemfdm3d — Method
sfemfdm3d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfemfdm3d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfemfdm3d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfemfdm3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfemfdm3d(1)

NAME
       sfemfdm3d - 3D Electromagnetic time-domain FD modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfemfdm3d  < Fwav.rsf sou=Fsou.rsf rec=Frec.rsf wfl=Fwfl.rsf > Fdat.rsf
       mag=Fmag.rsf ele=Fele.rsf  cdt=Fcdt.rsf  verb=n  snap=n  free=n  expl=n
       dabc=n   jdata=1   jsnap=nt   nqz=sf_n(az)   nqx=sf_n(ax)  nqy=sf_n(ay)
       oqz=sf_o(az)  oqx=sf_o(ax)   oqy=sf_o(ay)   dqz=sf_d(az)   dqx=sf_d(ax)
       dqy=sf_d(ay) nb=2

COMMENTS
       4th order in space, 2nd order in time. Absorbing boundary conditions.

PARAMETERS
       file   cdt =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   dabc =n [y/n]     Absorbing BC
       float  dqx =sf_d(ax)      Saved wfld window dx
       float  dqy =sf_d(ay)      Saved wfld window dy
       float  dqz =sf_d(az)      Saved wfld window dz
       file   ele =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   expl =n [y/n]     Multiple sources, one wvlt
       bool   free =n [y/n]     Free surface flag
       int    jdata =1      # of t steps at which to save receiver data
       int    jsnap =nt      # of t steps at which to save wavefield
       file   mag =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nb =2      boundary padding in grid points
       int    nqx =sf_n(ax)      Saved wfld window nx
       int    nqy =sf_n(ay)      Saved wfld window ny
       int    nqz =sf_n(az)      Saved wfld window nz
       float  oqx =sf_o(ax)      Saved wfld window ox
       float  oqy =sf_o(ay)      Saved wfld window oy
       float  oqz =sf_o(az)      Saved wfld window oz
       file   rec =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   snap =n [y/n]     Wavefield snapshots flag
       file   sou =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       file   wfl =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/ditthara/Memfdm3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfemfdm3d(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS
       sfenergy < input.rsf > log_eo.rsf wind=

COMMENTS
       Estimate energy of input

       E(t) = its_{k=(t-rac{R}{2})}^{(t+rac{R}{2})}A(k)^2

PARAMETERS
       int    wind =      Rolling window size

Madagascar.sfepsf — Method
sfepsf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfepsf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfepsf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfepsf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfepsf(1)

NAME
       sfepsf - 1-D and 2-D edge-preserving smoothing (EPS) filter.

SYNOPSIS
       sfepsf  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  nfw1=  nfw2=1 boundary=n verb=n weight=n
       sigma=3. type=

COMMENTS
       1D filter (nfw2=1); 2D filter (otherwise)

PARAMETERS
       bool   boundary =n [y/n]     if y, boundary is data, whereas zero
       int    nfw1 =      filter-window length in n1 direction  (positive  and
              odd integer)
       int    nfw2 =1      filter-window length in n2 direction (default=1, 1D
              case)
       float  sigma =3.       Gaussian weight radius (only for stack)
       string type =      [stack,median] filter choice, the default  is  stack
              (mean)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   weight =n [y/n]     Gaussian weight flag (only for stack)
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mepsf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfepsf(1)
source

sferf(1) Madagascar Manuals sferf(1)

NAME
       sferf - Bandpass filtering using erf function.

SYNOPSIS
       sferf < in.rsf > out.rsf flo=-1. fhi=-1. rect=1 spline=n der=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   der =n [y/n]     compute derivative
       float  fhi =-1.       high frequency in band
       float  flo =-1.       low frequency in band
       float  rect =1      filter sharpness
       bool   spline =n [y/n]     if use B-spline erf
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Merf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfescbsc3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfescbsc3(1)

NAME
       sfescbsc3 - Prepare supercells for stitching escape tables in 3-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfescbsc3  < adom.rsf > out.rsf vspl=vspline.rsf verb=n nz= oz= dz= nx=
       ox= dx= ny= oy= dy= na= nb= df=0.1 nc=0 parab=y md=dz

PARAMETERS
       float  df =0.1      < Maximum distance to travel per step (fraction  of
              the cell size) >
       float  dx =      Sampling of x axis
       float  dy =      Sampling of y axis
       float  dz =      Sampling of z axis
       float  md =dz      Half-width of a supercell
       int    na =      Number of samples in azimuth dimension
       int    nb =      Number of samples in inclination dimension
       int    nc   =0        Number   of   threads  to  use  for  ray  tracing
              (OMP_NUM_THREADS by default)
       int    nx =      Number of samples in x axis
       int    ny =      Number of samples in y axis
       int    nz =      Number of samples in z axis
       float  ox =      Beginning of x axis
       float  oy =      Beginning of y axis
       float  oz =      Beginning of z axis
       bool   parab =y [y/n]     y - use parabolic approximation of  trajecto‐
              ries, n - straight line
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string vspl  =       Spline  coefficients for velocity model (auxiliary
              input file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mescbsc3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfescbsc3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfescdiff — Method
sfescdiff(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfescdiff on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfescdiff. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfescdiff(1) Madagascar Manuals sfescdiff(1)

NAME
       sfescdiff  - Compute distance and traveltime difference between two es‐
       cape tables.

SYNOPSIS
       sfescdiff   <   esct0.rsf   >   out.rsf   esct=esct1.rsf   maxd=SF_HUGE
       maxt=SF_HUGE mask=SF_HUGE

PARAMETERS
       string esct  =       Second  set of escape tables (auxiliary input file
              name)
       float  mask =SF_HUGE      Mask for values above maxd= and maxt= thresh‐
              olds
       float  maxd =SF_HUGE      Maximum allowed distance
       float  maxt =SF_HUGE      Maximum allowed time
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mescdiff.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfescfgrid2 — Method
sfescfgrid2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfescfgrid2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfescfgrid2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfescfgrid2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfescfgrid2(1)

NAME
       sfescfgrid2  -  Solution  of escape equations by Gauss-Seidel solver on
       full grid for 2-D (an)isotropic media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfescfgrid2 < spdom.rsf > out.rsf vspl=vspline.rsf na=360 mdist=SF_HUGE
       thresh=1e-6  morder=ESC2_MORDER  niter=nx  atraced=n  mtraced=n  cmix=n
       tracebc=y verb=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   atraced =n [y/n]     true - output map of all traced points
       bool   cmix =n [y/n]     true - check for color mixing
       float  mdist =SF_HUGE      Maximum distance between points in F-D sten‐
              cil
       int    morder =ESC2_MORDER      Maximum order in F-D stencil
       bool   mtraced  =n [y/n]     true - output map of points traced because
              of mdist criterion
       int    na =360      Number of phase angles
       int    niter =nx      Maximum number of Gauss-Seidel iterations
       float  thresh =1e-6      Convergence threshold
       bool   tracebc =y [y/n]     n - do not trace B.C. points
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string vspl =      Spline coefficients for  velocity  model  (auxiliary
              input file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mescfgrid2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfescfgrid2(1)
source

Madagascar.sfescrt2 — Method
sfescrt2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfescrt2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfescrt2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfescrt2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfescrt2(1)

NAME
       sfescrt2 - Escape tables by ray tracing with escape equations in 2-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfescrt2  <  spdom.rsf  > out.rsf traj=traj.rsf vspl=vspline.rsf na=360
       df=0.25 md=SF_HUGE aper=SF_HUGE nc=0 parab=y verb=n nt=1001 dt=0.001

PARAMETERS
       float  aper =SF_HUGE      Maximum aperture in x and y  directions  from
              current point (default - up to model boundaries)
       float  df =0.25      < Maximum distance to travel per step (fraction of
              the cell size) >
       float  dt =0.001      Time sampling
       float  md =SF_HUGE      Maximum distance for a ray to travel (default -
              up to model boundaries)
       int    na =360      Number of phase angles
       int    nc   =0        Number   of   threads  to  use  for  ray  tracing
              (OMP_NUM_THREADS by default)
       int    nt =1001      Number of time samples for each trajectory
       bool   parab =y [y/n]     y - use parabolic approximation of  trajecto‐
              ries, n - straight line
       string traj =      Trajectory output (auxiliary output file name)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string vspl  =       Spline  coefficients for velocity model (auxiliary
              input file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mescrt2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfescrt2(1)
source

sfescrt3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfescrt3(1)

NAME
       sfescrt3 - Escape tables by ray tracing with escape equations in 3-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfescrt3  <  spdom.rsf  > out.rsf traj=traj.rsf vspl=vspline.rsf na=360
       nb=180 df=0.1  md=SF_HUGE  aper=SF_HUGE  nc=0  parab=y  verb=n  nt=1001
       dt=0.001

PARAMETERS
       float  aper  =SF_HUGE       Maximum aperture in x and y directions from
              current point (default - up to model boundaries)
       float  df =0.1      < Maximum distance to travel per step (fraction  of
              the cell size) >
       float  dt =0.001      Time sampling
       float  md =SF_HUGE      Maximum distance for a ray to travel (default -
              up to model boundaries)
       int    na =360      Number of azimuth phase angles
       int    nb =180      Number of inclination phase angles
       int    nc  =0       Number  of  threads  to   use   for   ray   tracing
              (OMP_NUM_THREADS by default)
       int    nt =1001      Number of time samples for each trajectory
       bool   parab  =y [y/n]     y - use parabolic approximation of trajecto‐
              ries, n - straight line
       string traj =      Trajectory output (auxiliary output file name)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string vspl =      Spline coefficients for  velocity  model  (auxiliary
              input file name)
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mescrt3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git
