Madagascar.sffedchain — Method
sffedchain(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffedchain on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffedchain. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffedchain(1) Madagascar Manuals sffedchain(1)

NAME
       sffedchain - Fast explicit diffusion as a chain

SYNOPSIS
       sffedchain  <  inp.rsf  smooth=smo.rsf  w=wht.rsf > out.rsf nc=1 verb=y
       niter=0 liter=50 rect=1

PARAMETERS
       int    liter =50      number of linear iterations
       int    nc =1      number of components
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       int    rect =1      smoothing in time
       file   smooth =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   w =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfedchain.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffedchain(1)
source

       verb=y niter=0 liter=50

RSF Documentation

sffermatrecursion(1) Madagascar Manuals sffermatrecursion(1)

NAME
       sffermatrecursion  - 2D traveltime derivatives computation with the re‐
       cursion from Fermat's principle (Sripanich and Fomel, 2017)

SYNOPSIS
       sffermatrecursion < refl.rsf slow=slow.rsf vnmosq=vnmo.rsf t0sum=t0.rsf
       dip=dipf.rsf curv=curvf.rsf > vnmohet.rsf dipcurv=n order=3

PARAMETERS
       file   curv =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   dipcurv =n [y/n]     if get dip/curvature from separate files
       int    order =3      Interpolation order
       file   slow =      auxiliary input file name
       file   t0sum =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vnmosq =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/zone/Mfermatrecursion.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfffd0 — Method
sfffd0(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfffd0. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfffd0(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffd0(1)

NAME
       sfffd0 - 2-D FFD zero-offset migration: MPI + OMP

SYNOPSIS
       sfffd0  vel=vel.rsf  <  source.rsf  >  output.rsf opt=y jr=1 r0=0 jm=20
       err=0.00001 alpha=-0.7 nbt=44  nbb=44  nbl=44  nbr=44  ct=0.01  cb=0.01
       cl=0.01 cr=0.01 ax=2.0 az=2.0 factor=2.0/3.0

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =-0.7 ®
       float  ax =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  az =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  cb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  err =0.00001 ®
       float  factor =2.0/3.0      suppress HF parameter
       int    jm =20 ®
       int    jr =1 ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbl =44 ®
       int    nbr =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]
       int    r0 =0 ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mffd0.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfffd0(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfffd2denomp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffd2denomp(1)

NAME
       sfffd2_den_omp - 2-D Fourier finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfffd2_den_omp   >   out.rsf   vel=vel.rsf   den=den.rsf  <  source.rsf
       snaps=snaps.rsf dt= nt= isx= isz=  irz=isz  jm=20  ax=2.0  az=2.0  fac‐
       tor=2.0/3.0  snap=y  nbt=0  nbb=0  nbl=0  nbr=0  sht=0  ct=0.01 cb=0.01
       cl=0.01 cr=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  ax =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  az =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  cb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.01      decaying parameter
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       float  factor =2.0/3.0      suppress HF parameter
       int    irz =isz ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    jm =20 ®
       int    nbb =0 ®
       int    nbl =0 ®
       int    nbr =0 ®
       int    nbt =0 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    sht =0 ®
       bool   snap =y [y/n]     Output snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mffd2_den_omp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfffd2_den_omp(1)

       source

       nbt=44 nbb=44 nbl=44 nbr=44 ct=0.01 cb=0.01 cl=0.01 cr=0.01

       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter

       int    nbr =44 ®

NAME

       point source, depress high frequency

SYNOPSIS
       sfffd2dehf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf < source.rsf opt=y dt= nt=  isx=  isz=
       nbt=44  nbb=44  nbl=44  nbr=44  ct=0.01  cb=0.01 cl=0.01 cr=0.01 ax=5.0
       az=5.0 factor=5.0/6.0

       float  az =5.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  cb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       float  factor =5.0/6.0      suppress HF parameter

       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbl =44 ®
       int    nbr =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       int    nt = ®

NAME
       sfffdantti4b_smsr - 2-D Fourier finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfffdantti4b_smsr > out.rsf velx=velx.rsf velz=velz.rsf yita=yita.rsf <
       source.rsf seta=seta.rsf opt=y dt= nt= isx= isz=0 err=0.0001 alpha=-0.7
       nbt=126 nbb=126 nbl=128 nbr=128 ct=0.002 cb=0.002 cl=0.002 cr=0.002

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =-0.7 ®
       float  cb =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       float  err =0.0001 ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz =0 ®
       int    nbb =126 ®
       int    nbl =128 ®
       int    nbr =128 ®
       int    nbt =126 ®
       int    nt = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       file   seta =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   yita =      auxiliary input file name

       user/songxl/Mffdantti4b_smsr.c

Madagascar.sfffdcos2b — Method
sfffdcos2b(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfffdcos2b on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfffdcos2b. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfffdcos2b(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffdcos2b(1)

NAME
       sfffdcos2b - 2-D Fourier finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfffdcos2b  >  out.rsf  vel=vel.rsf  <  source.rsf  opt=y dt= nt= nb=30
       c=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  c =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       int    nb =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name

RSF Documentation

sfffdrtm(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffdrtm(1)

NAME
       sfffdrtm - 2-D FFD RTM: MPI + OMP

SYNOPSIS
       sfffdrtm  geo=geo.rsf  vel=vel.rsf source=source.rsf opt=y dt= nt= isz=
       irz=isz jr=1 jm=20 nr=  err=0.00001  alpha=-0.7  nbt=44  nbb=44  nbl=44
       nbr=44  ct=0.01  cb=0.01  cl=0.01  cr=0.01 ax=2.0 az=2.0 factor=2.0/3.0
       sht=0 tskip=0

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =-0.7 ®
       float  ax =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  az =2.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  cb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       float  err =0.00001 ®
       float  factor =2.0/3.0      suppress HF parameter
       file   geo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    irz =isz      if (!sf_getint("r0",&r0)) r0=0;
       int    isz = ®
       int    jm =20 ®
       int    jr =1 ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbl =44 ®
       int    nbr =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       int    nr =      streamer total length
       int    nt = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    sht =0      Time shift parameter
       file   source =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tskip =0      Time shift parameter
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mffdrtm.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfffdrtm(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfffdrtms(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffdrtms(1)

NAME
       sfffdrtms - 2-D FFD isotropic RTM: MPI + OMP

SYNOPSIS
       sfffdrtms  geo=geo.rsf vel=vel.rsf source=source.rsf opt=y dt= nt= isz=
       irz=isz jr=1 jm=20 nr= nbt=44  nbb=44  nbl=44  nbr=44  ct=0.01  cb=0.01
       cl=0.01 cr=0.01 sht=0 tskip=0 left=2400 right=800

PARAMETERS
       float  cb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt =      time step size
       file   geo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    irz =isz      receiver depth
       int    isz =      source depth
       int    jm =20      snap sampling
       int    jr =1      receiver sampling
       int    left =2400      left
       int    nbb =44      boundary nodes
       int    nbl =44      boundary nodes
       int    nbr =44      boundary nodes
       int    nbt =44      boundary nodes
       int    nr =      streamer total length
       int    nt =      total time length
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     optimal padding
       int    right =800      right
       int    sht =0      Time shift parameter
       file   source =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tskip =0      Time shift parameter
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mffdrtms.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfffdrtms(1)
source

sfffdtti2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfffdtti2(1)

NAME
       sfffdtti2 - 2-D Fourier finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfffdtti2   >   out.rsf  velx=velx.rsf  velz=velz.rsf  yita=yita.rsf  <
       source.rsf seta=seta.rsf opt=y dt= nt= isx= isz=0 err=0.0001 alpha=-0.7
       nbt=126  nbb=126  nbl=128  nbr=128  ct=0.002 cb=0.002 cl=0.002 cr=0.002
       pad1=1 cmplx=y cmplx=y cmplx=n

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =-0.7 ®
       float  cb =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  cl =0.002      decaying parameter
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  cr =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  ct =0.002      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       float  err =0.0001 ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz =0 ®
       int    nbb =126 ®
       int    nbl =128 ®
       int    nbr =128 ®
       int    nbt =126 ®
       int    nt = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   seta =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   yita =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mffdtti2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfffdtti2(1)

sffft1(1) Madagascar Manuals sffft1(1)

NAME
       sffft1 - Fast Fourier Transform along the first axis.

SYNOPSIS
       sffft1  <  Fin.rsf  >  Fou.rsf ot=Fot.rsf verb=n inv=n sym=n opt=y mem‐
       size=1000.0

PARAMETERS
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     y, inverse transform
       float  memsize =1000.0 ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       string ot =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   sym =n [y/n]     y, symmetric scaling for Hermitian FFT
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

       bei/fdm/kjartjac
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/ft1/plane4

       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r

       system/generic/Mfft1.c

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sffft3 — Method
sffft3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffft3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffft3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffft3(1) Madagascar Manuals sffft3(1)

NAME
       sffft3 - FFT transform on extra axis.

SYNOPSIS
       sffft3 < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n sym=n sign=inv? 1: 0 opt=y axis=2 pad=2

COMMENTS
       Input and output are complex data. The input is padded by factor pad.

       July  2012  program  of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/07/02/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sffft3/

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =2      Axis to transform
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, perform inverse transform
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    pad =2      padding factor
       int    sign =inv? 1: 0      transform sign (0 or 1)
       bool   sym =n [y/n]     if y, apply symmetric scaling to make  the  FFT
              operator Hermitian
USED IN
       bei/ft1/brad
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/ft1/plane4
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mfft3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sffft3(1)
source

       sffft3d < Fi.rsf > Fo.rsf ompchunk=1 verb=n inv=n cnt=n axis=0

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =0      FFT axis or axes
       bool   cnt =n [y/n]     centering
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     forward/inverse
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

RSF Documentation

sffftexp0(1) Madagascar Manuals sffftexp0(1)

NAME
       sffftexp0  - 2-D FFT-based zero-offset exploding reflector modeling/mi‐
       gration

SYNOPSIS
       sffftexp0  <  data.rsf  >   image.rsf   snaps=snaps.rsf   left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf  mig=n  cmplx=n  pad1=1  trm=n  nz= dz= nt= dt= t0=0.0f
       snap=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      time sampling (if migration)
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      time samples (if migration)
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       float  t0 =0.0f      time origin (if modeling)
       bool   trm =n [y/n]     time-reversal imaging
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfftexp0.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffftexp0(1)
source

NAME

       eling/migration with adjoint

SYNOPSIS

       right=right.rsf adj=n cmplx=n pad1=1 nz= dz= nt= dt= t0=0.0f snap=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      time sampling (if migration)
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      time samples (if migration)
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       float  t0 =0.0f      time origin (if modeling)

NAME
       sffftexp0test  -  2-D  FFT-based zero-offset exploding reflector model‐
       ing/migration (outputs time volume; can be used to generate movies)

SYNOPSIS
       sffftexp0test movie=movie.rsf  <  data.rsf  >  image.rsf  left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf mig=n cmplx=n pad1=1 nz= dz= nt= dt= jt=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      time sampling (if migration)
       int    jt =1      time interval
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       file   movie =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      time samples (if migration)
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name

sffftexp1(1) Madagascar Manuals sffftexp1(1)

NAME
       sffftexp1  - 2-D FFT-based prestack exploding reflector modeling/migra‐
       tion

SYNOPSIS
       sffftexp1 < data.rsf > image.rsf  left=left.rsf  right=right.rsf  mig=n
       snap=0 nz= dz= nt= dt= nh= dh= cmplx=n sub=y

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  dh =      offset sampling (if modeling)
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      time sampling (if migration)
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       int    nh =      offset samples (if modeling)
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      time samples (if migration)
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       bool   sub =y [y/n]     if -1 is included in the matrix
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfftexp1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sffftfwi_sparse_2d — Method
sffftfwi_sparse_2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffftfwi_sparse_2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffftfwi_sparse_2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffftfwisparse2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sffftfwisparse2d(1)

NAME
       sffftfwi_sparse_2d  -  2D frequency domain full waveform inversion with
       sparsity regularization.

SYNOPSIS
       sffftfwi_sparse_2d   <   in.rsf   >    out.rsf    receiver=receiver.rsf
       source=source.rsf   record=record.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  vout=vout.rsf  mis‐
       fit=misfit.rsf sparsity=y niter=10 npml=20 par=1 pclip=8. uts=0  order=
       type=

PARAMETERS
       string dip =      auxiliary input file name
       string misfit =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =10      number of iteration
       int    npml =20      PML width
       string order =      discretization scheme (default optimal 9-point)
       int    par =1      seislet transform accuracy order
       float  pclip =8.       soft thresholding parameter
       string receiver =      auxiliary input file name
       string record =      auxiliary input file name
       string source =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   sparsity  =y  [y/n]     if  true, sparsity constriant; if false,
              normal FWI
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       int    uts =0 ®
       string vout =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/zhiguang/Mfftfwi_sparse_2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023             sffftfwi_sparse_2d(1)
source

       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inverse flag

       int    n3 = ®

RSF Documentation

sffftwave1(1) Madagascar Manuals sffftwave1(1)

NAME
       sffftwave1 - 1-D FFT wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sffftwave1  <  inp.rsf  > out.rsf prop=prop.rsf right=right.rsf nt= dt=
       sub=y step=y nsps=n

PARAMETERS
       float  dt = ®
       bool   nsps =n [y/n]     if using NSPS
       int    nt = ®
       file   prop =      auxiliary input file name
       string right =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   step =y [y/n]     if two-step propagation
       bool   sub =y [y/n]     if -1 is included in the matrix
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfftwave1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffftwave1(1)

NAME
       sffftwave2 - Simple 2-D wave propagation

SYNOPSIS
       sffftwave2  <  Fw.rsf > Fo.rsf ref=Fr.rsf snaps=snaps.rsf left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf verb=n snap=0 cmplx=n pad1=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity

       user/fomels/Mfftwave2.c

NAME
       sffftwave2omp  -  Simple 2-D wave propagation with multi-threaded Kiss-
       FFT

SYNOPSIS
       sffftwave2omp   <   Fw.rsf   >   Fo.rsf   ref=Fr.rsf    snaps=snaps.rsf
       left=left.rsf right=right.rsf verb=n abc=n nbt= nbb=nbt nbl=nbt nbr=nbt
       ct= cb=ct cl=ct cr=ct snap=0 pad1=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity

       user/jsun/Mfftwave2omp.c

       4.2-git

NAME
       sffftwave2p - Simple 2-D wave propagation with multi-threaded fftw3

SYNOPSIS
       sffftwave2p  < Fw.rsf > Fo.rsf ref=Fr.rsf snaps=snaps.rsf left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf verb=n abc=n nbt= nbb=nbt  nbl=nbt  nbr=nbt  ct=  cb=ct
       cl=ct cr=ct snap=0 cmplx=n pad1=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity

       user/jsun/Mfftwave2p.c

RSF Documentation

sffftwave2taper(1) Madagascar Manuals sffftwave2taper(1)

NAME
       sffftwave2taper - Simple 2-D wave propagation with multi-threaded fftw3

SYNOPSIS
       sffftwave2taper   <   Fw.rsf   >   Fo.rsf   ref=Fr.rsf  snaps=snaps.rsf
       left=left.rsf right=right.rsf verb=n cmplx=n pad1=1 taper=0 thresh=0.92
       snap=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       int    taper =0      tapering in the frequency domain
       float  thresh =0.92      tapering threshold
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mfftwave2taper.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                sffftwave2taper(1)

Madagascar.sffiglist — Method
sffiglist(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffiglist on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffiglist. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffiglist(1) Madagascar Manuals sffiglist(1)

NAME
       sffiglist - Compare Vplot files in Fig and Lock directories

SYNOPSIS
       sffiglist figdir= lockdir= list= show= rsftest=n copy=n

COMMENTS
       Parameter figdir is path to Fig directory, default is ./Fig.  Parameter
       lockdir  is  path  to  Lock  directory:   If   figdir   is   in   $RSF‐
       SRC/book/[book]/[chapter]/[section],  then  default  lockdir  is  $RSF‐
       FIGS/[book]/[chapter]/[section].    If   figdir   is   not   in   $RSF‐
       SRC/book/[book]/[chapter]/[section],  then  default lockdir is $RSFALT‐
       FIGS/[book]/[chapter]/[section].

       Parameter list controls files to list, default is all.  Parameter  show
       controls files to flip with sfpen, default is none.

       list|show  =  none     No  files, print only summary.  list|show = diff
       Files that are different, determined by sfvplotdiff.  list|show =  miss
       Files missing from figdir or lockdir, and different files.  list|show =
       all     All files.

       File list codes:

       space   indicates files that are the same.   -      indicates  file  in
       lockdir  that  is  missing  from figdir.  +     indicates extra file in
       figdir that is missing from lockdir.  number  is return code from  sfv‐
       plotdiff indicating different files.

PARAMETERS
       bool   copy =n [y/n]     copy different figs from figdir to lockdir?
       string figdir =      fig directory, default = ./Fig
       string list =      how much to list [none,diff,miss,all], default = all
       string lockdir  =       lock  directory,  default = lock counterpart of
              figdir
       bool   rsftest =n [y/n]     write .rsftest file?
       string show =      how much to  show  [none,diff,miss,all],  default  =
              none
SOURCE
       user/jennings/Mfiglist.py
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sffiglist
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffiglist(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS
       sffiledims < in.rsf large=n parform=y

COMMENTS
       Wrapper for sf_filedims.

PARAMETERS
       bool   large =n [y/n]     if y, file with large dimensions.
       bool   parform  =y  [y/n]     If  y,  print  out parameter=value. If n,
              print out value.
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mfiledims.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sffileheader(1) Madagascar Manuals sffileheader(1)

NAME
       sffileheader - dumps header information to the standard output.

SYNOPSIS
       sffileheader < in.rsf large=n parform=y all=n

COMMENTS
       Extended sffiledims.

PARAMETERS
       bool   all  =n [y/n]     If y, print all values, icluding singleton di‐
              mensions.
                     If n, drop trailing singleteon dimensions.
       bool   large =n [y/n]     if y, file with large dimensions.
       bool   parform =y [y/n]     If y,  print  out  parameter=value.  If  n,
              print out value.
SOURCE
       user/slim/Mfileheader.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffindmax1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffindmax1(1) Madagascar Manuals sffindmax1(1)

NAME
       sffindmax1  - Find max value and its sampled position along fast dimen‐
       sion

SYNOPSIS
       sffindmax1 < in.rsf > out.rsf max_val=max_val.rsf shift=0 verb=n

PARAMETERS
       string max_val =      auxiliary output file name
       int    shift =0      shift
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Mfindmax1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffindmax1(1)

RSF Documentation

sffint(1) Madagascar Manuals sffint(1)

NAME
       sffint - Forward interpolation (1-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sffint  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf warp=warp.rsf adj=n der=n n1= d1=1. o1=0.
       eps=0.01

COMMENTS
       adj=0: data(t) and warp(s) and outputs interp(s)=data(warp(s)).

       adj=1: interp(s) -> data(t)

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  d1 =1.  ®
       bool   der =n [y/n]     derivative flag
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       int    n1 = ®
       float  o1 =0.  ®
       file   warp =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/tharit/Mfint.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sffint(1)
source

Madagascar.sffitcrs — Method
sffitcrs(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffitcrs on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffitcrs. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffitcrs(1) Madagascar Manuals sffitcrs(1)

NAME
       sffitcrs -

SYNOPSIS
       sffitcrs < in.rsf > out_tcrs_params.rsf tcrs=

COMMENTS
       Input:  T[m][h][t]  and its sf-file  m[], Nm h[], Nh Output: a(3) three
       CRS parameters: a(0) m + a(1)m^2 + a(2) h^2

       H_11 = 2 Nx Sum(m^2) H_12 = 2 Nx Sum(m^4) H_13 = 2 Sum(x^2) Sum(m)

       H_22 = 2 Nx Sum(m^4) H_23 = 2 Sum(x^2) Sum(m^2)

       H_33 = 2 Nm Sum(x^2)

       da = - grad H^{-1}

PARAMETERS
       string tcrs = ®
SOURCE
       user/roman/Mfitcrs.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sffitcrs(1)
source
Madagascar.sffitcrspicks — Method
sffitcrspicks(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffitcrspicks on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffitcrspicks. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffitcrspicks(1) Madagascar Manuals sffitcrspicks(1)

NAME
       sffitcrspicks -

SYNOPSIS
       sffitcrspicks < in.rsf > out_tcrs.rsf crsparams= mask=

COMMENTS
       Compute fitting of Non-hyperbolic CRS to first-arrivals T[m][h].

       Input:  T[m][h]  arrivals  and  in its sf-file  m[], Nm h[], Nh Output:
       tcrs=filname - t[m][h] crs surface prints  three  CRS  parameters  a[3]
       where: t[m][h] = a(0) m + a(1)m^2 + a(2) h^2

PARAMETERS
       string crsparams = ®
       string mask = ®
SOURCE
       user/roman/Mfitcrspicks.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sffitcrspicks(1)
source
Madagascar.sffitnonhcrspicks — Method
sffitnonhcrspicks(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffitnonhcrspicks on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffitnonhcrspicks. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffitnonhcrspicks(1) Madagascar Manuals sffitnonhcrspicks(1)

NAME
       sffitnonhcrspicks -

SYNOPSIS
       sffitnonhcrspicks < in.rsf > out_tcrs.rsf A1= A2= B=

COMMENTS
       Compute fitting of Non-hyperbolic CRS to first-arrivals T[m][h].

       Input: T[m][h] arrivals and in its sf-file  m[], Nm h[], Nh

       parameters:

       A1 A2 B

       FF = F(t0,t02,A1,A2,m-h)*F(t0,t02,A1,A2,m+h);

       t2 = 0.5 * (F(t0, t02, A1, A2, m) + (2*B+A1*A1-A2)*h*h + sqrt(FF) );

       Output:  tcrs=filname - t[m][h] crs surface prints three CRS parameters
       a[3] where: t[m][h] = a(0) m + a(1)m^2 + a(2) h^2

PARAMETERS
       float  A1 = ®
       float  A2 = ®
       float  B =      memory allocations
SOURCE
       user/roman/Mfitnonhcrspicks.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023              sffitnonhcrspicks(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sffkgdmo(1) Madagascar Manuals sffkgdmo(1)

NAME
       sffkgdmo - FK-domain Gardner's DMO for regularly sampled 2-D data

SYNOPSIS
       sffkgdmo < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=y shot=n eps=0.01 nb=85 db=1 xi=1

COMMENTS
       The input/ouput is (offset,logstretch frequency, midpoint/shot wavenum‐
       ber).

PARAMETERS
       float  db =1      angle increment
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       bool   inv =y [y/n]     inversion flag
       int    nb =85      number of angles
       bool   shot =n [y/n]     if shot gathers instead of midpoint gathers
       float  xi =1      continuation paremeter
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfkgdmo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sffkgdmo(1)

Madagascar.sffkoclet — Method
sffkoclet(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffkoclet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffkoclet. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffkoclet(1) Madagascar Manuals sffkoclet(1)

NAME
       sffkoclet - 1-D seislet transform using omega-wavenumber offset contin‐
       uation

SYNOPSIS
       sffkoclet < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n adj=n dwt=n verb=y eps=0.01 type=

COMMENTS
       Forward transform  (adj=n  inv=y/n)  m=T[d]  Inverse  transform  (adj=y
       inv=y)   d=T^(-1)[d] Adjoint transform (adj=y inv=n)   d=T'[d]

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       bool   dwt =n [y/n]     if y, do wavelet transform
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mfkoclet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffkoclet(1)
source
Madagascar.sffkoclet3 — Method
sffkoclet3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffkoclet3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffkoclet3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffkoclet3(1) Madagascar Manuals sffkoclet3(1)

NAME
       sffkoclet3  -  2-D seislet transform using frequency-wavenumber offset-
       azimuth continuation

SYNOPSIS
       sffkoclet3 < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n adj=n dwt=n amp=n  verb=y  eps=0.01
       maxe=10. dir= type=

COMMENTS
       Forward  transform  (adj=n  inv=y/n)  m=T[d]  Inverse  transform (adj=y
       inv=y)   d=T^(-1)[d] Adjoint transform (adj=y inv=n)   d=T'[d]

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       bool   amp =n [y/n]     if y, true amplitudes continuation
       string dir =      [azimuth,offset,both] direction, the default is  both
              directions
       bool   dwt =n [y/n]     if y, do wavelet transform
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       float  maxe =10.       stability constraint
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mfkoclet3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffkoclet3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfflatlinpiwrapper — Method
sfflatlinpiwrapper(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfflatlinpiwrapper on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfflatlinpiwrapper. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfflatlinpiwrapper(1) Madagascar Manuals sfflatlinpiwrapper(1)

NAME
       sfflatlinpiwrapper  -  pi operator building wrapping test function flat
       gaussian weighting smoothing after pi

SYNOPSIS
       sfflatlinpiwrapper < inp.rsf > out.rsf  velocity=vel.rsf  hd=y  domod=y
       sw=0 adj=n sm=y v_1= v_2= v_3= v_4= passthr=0.001 eps=0.001 epst2=0.001
       pad=nt repeat=1 v0= rect#=(1,1,...) diff#=(n,n,...)

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if perform derivative filtering
       bool   diff# =(n,n,...)  [y/n]     differentiation on #-th axis
       bool   domod =y [y/n]     if y, apply half-derivative filter
       float  eps =0.001 ®
       float  epst2 =0.001 ®
       bool   hd =y [y/n]
       int    pad =nt      output time samples
       float  passthr =0.001 ®
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
       bool   sm =y [y/n]     if y, do adjoint integration
       int    sw =0      if > 0, select a branch of the antialiasing operation
       float  v0 =      constant velocity (if no velocity=)
       float  v_1 = ®
       float  v_2 = ®
       float  v_3 = ®
       float  v_4 = ®
       string velocity =      velocity file (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mflatlinpiwrapper.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023             sfflatlinpiwrapper(1)
source
Madagascar.sfflatlinpiwrapper2d — Method
sfflatlinpiwrapper2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfflatlinpiwrapper2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfflatlinpiwrapper2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfflatlinpiwrapper2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfflatlinpiwrapper2d(1)

NAME
       sfflatlinpiwrapper2d - pi operator building wrapping test function flat
       gaussian weighting smoothing after pi

SYNOPSIS
       sfflatlinpiwrapper2d < inp.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf  offset=offset.rsf
       adj=n  normalize=y  nh=  antialias=1.0  apt=nx angle=90.0 half=y verb=y
       rho=1.-1./nt dh= h0= sm=y v_1= v_2= v_3= v_4=  passthr=0.001  eps=0.001
       epst2=0.001 pad=nt repeat=1 domod=y rect#=(1,1,...) diff#=(n,n,...)

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     kirchhoff parameters
       float  angle =90.0      angle aperture
       float  antialias =1.0      antialiasing
       int    apt =nx      integral aperture
       float  dh =      offset sampling (for modeling)
       bool   diff# =(n,n,...)  [y/n]     differentiation on #-th axis
       bool   domod =y [y/n]
       float  eps =0.001 ®
       float  epst2 =0.001 ®
       float  h0 =      first offset (for modeling)
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the third axis is half-offset instead of
              full offset
       int    nh =      number of offsets (for modeling)
       bool   normalize =y [y/n]     normalize for the fold
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad =nt      output time samples
       float  passthr =0.001 ®
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
       float  rho =1.-1./nt      Leaky integration constant
       bool   sm =y [y/n]     if y, do adjoint integration
       float  v_1 = ®
       float  v_2 = ®
       float  v_3 = ®
       float  v_4 = ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mflatlinpiwrapper2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023           sfflatlinpiwrapper2d(1)
source

Madagascar.sffold — Method
sffold(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffold on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffold. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffold(1) Madagascar Manuals sffold(1)

NAME
       sffold - Make a seismic foldplot/stacking chart.

SYNOPSIS
       sffold < in.rsf > out.rsf verbose=1 o1= o2= o3= n1= n2= n3= d1= d2= d3=
       label1= label2= label3=

COMMENTS
       This is a general 3D histogram program implemented to  create  foldplot
       or  stacking charts on a 3d project from trace headers.  Axis1, 2 and 3
       define the bins for the output  fold  map.   These  are  usually  (off‐
       set,xline,iline),  but  you might want to compute some other histogram.
       This can be done by selecting other segy headers using label1, 2 and 3.

       See also fold= option in sfbin for creating 2D histograms.

       EXAMPLES:

       To make a stacking chart  movie  showing  fold(xline,offset)  for  each
       iline from a 3D segyfile:

       sfsegyread    tfile=tteapot.rsf    hfile=teapot.asc    bfile=teapot.bin
       tape=npr3_field.sgy > teapot.rsf

       #  read  the  tfile,  which  contains  the   segy   trace   headers   <
       teapot_hdr.rsf sffold verbose=1        o1=0 n1=96  d1=200 label1=offset
       o2=1  n2=188  d2=1    label2=xline   o3=1  n3=345  d3=1    label3=iline
       >foldplot.rsf <foldplot.rsf sfgrey title=foldplot pclip=100 | sfpen

       # transpose this data to plot foldmaps for each offset window:

       <   foldplot.rsf   sftransp   plane=13            |  sftransp  plane=12
       | sfgrey title=foldplot_off gainpanel=all | sfpen

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =      Delta label1 - usually delta offset
       float  d2 =      Delta label2 - usually delta xline
       float  d3 =      Delta label3 - usually delta iline
       string label1 =      header for axis1 - usually offset
       string label2 =      header for axis2 - usually xline or cdp
       string label3 =      header for axis3 - usually iline
       int    n1 =      Number label1 - usually number offset
       int    n2 =      Number label2 - usually number xline
       int    n3 =      Number label3 - usually number iline
       float  o1 =      Minimum label1 - usually min offset
       float  o2 =      Minimum label2 - usually min xline
       float  o3 =      Minimum label3 - usually min iline
       int    verbose =1      0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
USED IN
       data/alaska/foldplot
       data/bpstatics94/firstlook
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfold.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sffold(1)
source

SYNOPSIS

COMMENTS

       Colorado School of Mines Created on: Mar 9, 2022

PARAMETERS

       string topoWl = ®

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffourbreg2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffourbreg2(1) Madagascar Manuals sffourbreg2(1)

NAME
       sffourbreg2  -  Missing data interpolation in 2-D using Fourier Bregman
       shaping iteration.

SYNOPSIS
       sffourbreg2 < in.rsf > out.rsf  mask=mask.rsf  res=res.rsf  ref=ref.rsf
       niter=20 verb=n error=n perc=99. fact=0.5

PARAMETERS
       bool   error =n [y/n]     error verbosity flag
       float  fact =0.5      factor for soft-thresholding
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       float  perc =99.       percentage for soft-thresholding
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       string res =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mfourbreg2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sffourbreg2(1)
source
Madagascar.sffourmis2 — Method
sffourmis2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffourmis2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffourmis2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffourmis2(1) Madagascar Manuals sffourmis2(1)

NAME
       sffourmis2  - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using Fourier transform
       and compressive sensing.

SYNOPSIS
       sffourmis2 < in.rsf >  out.rsf  mask=mask.rsf  res=res.rsf  ref=ref.rsf
       niter=20 verb=n error=n cut=n f0=0. k0=0. parf=0. parw=0. orderf=1. or‐
       derw=1. perc=99. ordert=1. ordert=1. oper=

PARAMETERS
       bool   cut =n [y/n]     cutting verbosity flag, the  default  is  soft-
              thresholding
       bool   error =n [y/n]     error verbosity flag
       float  f0 =0.       initial cutting frequency
       float  k0 =0.       initial cutting wavenumber
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       string oper  =      [shaping,pocs,bregman] method, the default is shap‐
              ing
       float  orderf =1.       Curve order for frequency  window,  default  is
              linear
       float  ordert =1.       Curve order for thresholding parameter, default
              is linear
       float  orderw =1.       Curve order for frequency  window,  default  is
              linear
       float  parf =0.       Ajustable parameter for frequency window, default
              is fixed window
       float  parw =0.       Ajustable parameter for  wavenumber  window,  de‐
              fault is fixed window
       float  perc =99.       percentage for soft-thresholding
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       string res =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mfourmis2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffourmis2(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sffourvc(1) Madagascar Manuals sffourvc(1)

NAME
       sffourvc - Prestack velocity continuation.

SYNOPSIS
       sffourvc      <      in.rsf      >      out.rsf     eps=0.01     pad=n1
       pad2=2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2) verb=n nv= dv= extend=4 v0=

PARAMETERS
       float  dv =      velocity step size
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       int    nv =      velocity steps
       int    pad =n1      padding for stretch
       int    pad2 =2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2)      padding for FFT
       float  v0 =      starting velocity
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfourvc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sffourvc(1)
source

PARAMETERS

       float  eps =0.01 ®
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       int    nv = ®
       int    pad =n1 ®
       int    pad2 =2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2) ®

sffourvc2(1) Madagascar Manuals sffourvc2(1)

NAME
       sffourvc2 - Velocity continuation with semblance computation.

SYNOPSIS
       sffourvc2     <    in.rsf    >    out.rsf    nb=2    eps=0.01    pad=n1
       pad2=2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2) nv= dv= semblance=y extend=4

PARAMETERS
       float  dv = ®
       float  eps =0.01 ®
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       int    nb =2 ®
       int    nv = ®
       int    pad =n1 ®
       int    pad2 =2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((n2+1)/2) ®
       bool   semblance =y [y/n]     if y, compute semblance; if n, stack
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfourvc2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

NAME
       sffowler - 2-D velocity-domain imaging (Fowler DMO + Stolt migration).

SYNOPSIS
       sffowler < inp.rsf > out.rsf eps=0.01

COMMENTS
       Input: 2-D cosft of constant-velocity stacks (v,w,k).

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfowler.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sffpocs2d — Method
sffpocs2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffpocs2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffpocs2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffpocs2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sffpocs2d(1)

NAME
       sffpocs2d - 2-D Two-step POCS interpolation using a general Lp-norm op‐
       timization

SYNOPSIS
       sffpocs2d  <  Fin.rsf  mask=Fmask.rsf  >  Fout.rsf   verb=n   niter=100
       tol=1.0e-6 pclip=99. p=0.35 mode=

PARAMETERS
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       string mode =      thresholding mode: 'hard', 'soft','pthresh','exp';
                     'hard', hard thresholding;  'soft', soft thresholding;
                     'pthresh',   generalized   quasi-p;   'exp',  exponential
              shrinkage
       int    niter =100      total number iterations
       float  p =0.35      norm=p, where 0<p<=1
       float  pclip =99.       starting data clip percentile (default is 99)
       float  tol =1.0e-6      iteration tolerance
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mfpocs2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffpocs2d(1)
source

sffpocs3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sffpocs3d(1)

NAME
       sffpocs3d - 3-D Two-step POCS interpolation using a general Lp-norm op‐
       timization

SYNOPSIS
       sffpocs3d  <  Fin.rsf  mask=Fmask.rsf  >  Fout.rsf   verb=n   niter=100
       tol=1.0e-6 pclip=99. p=0.35 mode=

PARAMETERS
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       string mode =      thresholding mode: 'hard', 'soft','pthresh','exp';
                     'hard', hard thresholding;  'soft', soft thresholding;
                     'pthresh',   generalized   quasi-p;   'exp',  exponential
              shrinkage
       int    niter =100      total number iterations
       float  p =0.35      norm=p, where 0<p<=1
       float  pclip =99.       starting data clip percentile (default is 99)
       float  tol =1.0e-6      iteration tolerance
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity

       user/pyang/Mfpocs3d.c

RSF Documentation

sffpow(1) Madagascar Manuals sffpow(1)

NAME
       sffpow - Time/frequency power estimation

SYNOPSIS
       sffpow   <   inp.rsf   >   out.rsf   beta=beta.rsf   niter=10   fmin=o1
       fmax=o1+(n1-1)*d1 bmin=-1.0 bmax=1.0 nb=10 tol=SF_EPS verb=y time=n

PARAMETERS
       file   beta =      auxiliary output file name
       float  bmax =1.0      maximum value of beta
       float  bmin =-1.0      minimum value of beta
       float  fmax =o1+(n1-1)*d1      maximum frequency
       float  fmin =o1      minimum frequency
       int    nb =10 ®
       int    niter =10      number of Newton iterations
       bool   time =n [y/n]     time axis
       float  tol =SF_EPS      accuracy tolerance for beta
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfpow.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sffpow(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sffraclr2(1) Madagascar Manuals sffraclr2(1)

NAME
       sffraclr2  -  Complex  lowrank decomposition for 2-D viscoacoustic iso‐
       tropic wave propagation.

SYNOPSIS
       sffraclr2   <   vel.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   left=left.rsf    >    right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4  npk=20 dt= w0= rev=false mode=0 compen=false
       taper=0.2 cutoff=250. vmax=6000. sign=0 avg=false  gamma=  abc=0  nbt=0
       nbb=0 nbl=0 nbr=0 ct=0.0 cb=0.0 cl=0.0 cr=0.0

PARAMETERS
       abc    =0 ®
       avg    =false      whether use average value of gamma
       cb     =0.0 ®
       cl     =0.0 ®
       compen =false      compensate attenuation, only works if mode=0,1 (vis‐
              coacoustic)
       cr     =0.0 ®
       ct     =0.0 ®
       cutoff =250.       cutoff frequency
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       gamma  = ®
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0      mode of propagation: 0 is viscoacoustic (default); 1  is
              loss-dominated; 2 is dispersion dominated; 3 is acoustic
       nbb    =0 ®
       nbl    =0 ®
       nbr    =0 ®
       nbt    =0 ®
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       rev    =false      reverse propagation
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       sign   =0      sign of solution: 0 is positive, 1 is negative
       taper  =0.2      taper ratio for tukey window
       vmax   =6000.       maximum velocity
       w0     =      reference frequency
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mfraclr2.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffraclr2(1)
source
Madagascar.sffraclr2test — Method
sffraclr2test(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sffraclr2test(1) Madagascar Manuals sffraclr2test(1)

NAME
       sffraclr2test - Complex lowrank decomposition for 2-D constant-Q visco-
       acoustic wave equation. (Testing for exact disperison relation)

SYNOPSIS
       sffraclr2test  <  vel.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   left=left.rsf   >   right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt= c0= w0= rev=false mode=0 sign=0 ap‐
       prox=true

PARAMETERS
       approx =true      use Tieyuan's approximation
       c0     =      reference velocity
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0      mode of propagation: 0 is viscoacoustic (default); 1  is
              loss-dominated; 2 is dispersion dominated; 3 is acoustic
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       rev    =false      reverse propagation
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       sign   =0      sign of solution: 0 is positive, 1 is negative
       w0     =      reference frequency
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mfraclr2test.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sffraclr2test(1)
source

sffreqest(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sffreqest(1) Madagascar Manuals sffreqest(1)

NAME
       sffreqest - Local frequency estimation

SYNOPSIS
       sffreqest < in.rsf > out.rsf niter=100 hertz=n rect1=1 rect2=1 ...

COMMENTS
       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       bool   hertz =n [y/n]     if y, convert output to Hertz
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mfreqest.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Menvelope.c 696 2004-07-06 23:17:31Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffreqest(1)
source
Madagascar.sffreqint — Method
sffreqint(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffreqint on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffreqint. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffreqint(1) Madagascar Manuals sffreqint(1)

NAME
       sffreqint - 1-D data regularization using freqlet transform

SYNOPSIS
       sffreqint  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf freq=w.rsf coord=coord.rsf n1= d1= o1=
       niter=10 ncycle=1 eps=1.0 inv=n perc=50.0 fact=0.5 type=

PARAMETERS
       file   coord =      auxiliary input file name
       float  d1 =      output sampling
       float  eps =1.0      regularization parameter
       float  fact =0.5      factor for sharpening
       file   freq =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       int    n1 =      output samples
       int    ncycle =1      number of IRLS iterations
       int    niter =10      number of iterations for inversion
       float  o1 =      output origin
       float  perc =50.0      percentage for sharpening
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfreqint.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffreqint(1)
source

Runs RSF program sffreqlet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

RSF Documentation

sffreqlet(1) Madagascar Manuals sffreqlet(1)

NAME
       sffreqlet - 1-D seislet frame

SYNOPSIS
       sffreqlet  < in.rsf > out.rsf freq=w.rsf inv=n verb=y decomp=n ncycle=0
       niter=1 perc=50.0 type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   decomp =n [y/n]     do decomposition
       file   freq =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       int    ncycle =0      number of iterations
       int    niter =1      number of Bregman iterations
       float  perc =50.0      percentage for sharpening
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mfreqlet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sffrt — Method
sffrt(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffrt on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffrt. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffrt(1) Madagascar Manuals sffrt(1)

NAME
       sffrt - Frequency domain Radon transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sffrt  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  ref=ref.rsf  curv=0  inv=n  mtd=0 mu=0.05
       eta=0.05 niter=5 np=0 op=0 dp=0 x0=maxoff

PARAMETERS
       int    curv =0      0: linear; 1:parabolic
       float  dp =0      stepout interval
       float  eta =0.05      eta: for fhrt, fcrt
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, perform inverse operation
       int    mtd =0      0: fart; 1:firt; 2:fhrt; 3:fcrt
       float  mu =0.05      mu: for firt, fhrt, fcrt
       int    niter =5      sparse iterations: for fhrt, fcrt
       int    np =0      stepout number
       float  op =0      first stepout (moveout at ref )
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       float  x0 =maxoff      reference offset
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mfrt.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sffrt(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sffwi2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sffwi2d(1)

NAME
       sffwi2d - Time domain full waveform inversion

SYNOPSIS
       sffwi2d  < vinit.rsf shots=shots.rsf > vupdates.rsf grads=grads.rsf il‐
       lums=illums.rsf objs=objs.rsf verb=y precon=n niter=100 rbell=2

COMMENTS
       Note: This serial FWI is merely designed to help the  understanding  of
       beginners. Enquist absorbing boundary condition (A2) is applied!

PARAMETERS
       file   grads =      auxiliary output file name
       file   illums =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       file   objs =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   precon =n [y/n]     precondition or not
       int    rbell =2      radius of bell smooth
       file   shots =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     vebosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mfwi2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sffwi2d(1)

sffxdecon(1) Madagascar Manuals sffxdecon(1)

NAME
       sffxdecon - Random noise attenuation using f-x deconvolution

SYNOPSIS
       sffxdecon  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf verb=n taper=.1 fmin=1. fmax=1./(2*dt)
       twlen=(float)(n1-1)*dt n2w=10 lenf=4

PARAMETERS
       float  fmax =1./(2*dt)      maximum frequency to process in Hz
       float  fmin =1.       minimum frequency to process in Hz
       int    lenf =4      number of traces for filter
       int    n2w =10      number of traces in window
       float  taper =.1      length of taper
       float  twlen =(float)(n1-1)*dt      time window length
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     flag to get advisory messages
USED IN
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mfxdecon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sffxrna(1) Madagascar Manuals sffxrna(1)

NAME
       sffxrna - Local prediction filter for complex numbers (n-dimensional).

SYNOPSIS
       sffxrna    <    dat.rsf    >    flt.rsf    mask=mask.rsf   pred=pre.rsf
       zshift=zshift.rsf zdata=zdata.rsf ns=1 niter=100 verb=y ty=

PARAMETERS
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    ns =1      shifts of both sides npef=2*ns+1
       string pred =      auxiliary output file name
       string ty =      Prediction type: all=backward+forward
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string zdata =      auxiliary output file name
       string zshift =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/gchliu/Mfxrna.c

Madagascar.sffxynpre — Method
sffxynpre(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffxynpre on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffxynpre. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffxynpre(1) Madagascar Manuals sffxynpre(1)

NAME
       sffxynpre - FXY non-stationary predictive filtering (with the option of
       local processing windows).

SYNOPSIS
       sffxynpre <  Fin.rsf  >  Fou.rsf  verb=n  sym=n  opt=y  fs=n  Nfrac=6.0
       Ntimes=5.0  pow=0.5  niter=100 n1win=n1 n2win=nx n3win=ny r1=0.5 r2=0.5
       r3=0.5 mode=0 nsx=2 nsy=2 rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       with  frequency-axis  smoothness  constraint  with  frequency-dependent
       smoothing

       Reference:  Wang et al. (2021), Non-stationary predictive filtering for
       seismic random noise  suppression  -  A  tutorial,  Geophysics,  86(3),
       W21-W30.

PARAMETERS
       float  Nfrac   =6.0        frequency-dependent  smoothing  starts  from
              1/Nfrac * (Nyquist frequency)
       float  Ntimes =5.0      Maximum smoothing radius  is  Ntimes*(reference
              smoothing radius)
       bool   fs =n [y/n]     y, determine frequency-dependent smoothing
       int    mode =0      predictive filtering mode; default: non-stationary
       int    n1win =n1      first window length
       int    n2win =nx      second window length
       int    n3win =ny      second window length
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nsx =2      number of shifts in non-causal prediction filtering
       int    nsy =2      number of shifts in non-causal prediction filtering
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       float  pow =0.5      fraction parameter
       float  r1 =0.5      first overlapping ratio
       float  r2 =0.5      second overlapping ratio
       float  r3 =0.5      third overlapping ratio
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   sym =n [y/n]     y, symmetric scaling for Hermitian FFT
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mfxynpre.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sffxynpre(1)
source
Madagascar.sffxynpre2 — Method
sffxynpre2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sffxynpre2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffxynpre2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffxynpre2(1) Madagascar Manuals sffxynpre2(1)

NAME
       sffxynpre2  -  FXY non-stationary predictive filtering (with the option
       of local processing windows).

SYNOPSIS
       sffxynpre2 < Fin.rsf  >  Fou.rsf  verb=n  sym=n  opt=y  fs=n  Nfrac=6.0
       Ntimes=5.0  pow=0.5  niter=100 n1win=n1 n2win=nx n3win=ny r1=0.5 r2=0.5
       r3=0.5 mode=0 nsx=2 nsy=2 rect#= shift#=

COMMENTS
       with  frequency-axis  smoothness  constraint  with  frequency-dependent
       smoothing  with  arbitrarily  designed smoothing strategies (to enforce
       the a priori constraint) Enhanced version of sffxynpre Reference: Huang
       et al. (2021).

PARAMETERS
       float  Nfrac =6.0 ®
       float  Ntimes =5.0 ®
       bool   fs =n [y/n]     y, determine frequency-dependent smoothing
       int    mode =0      predictive filtering mode; default: non-stationary
       int    n1win =n1      first window length
       int    n2win =nx      second window length
       int    n3win =ny      second window length
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nsx =2      number of shifts in non-causal prediction filtering
       int    nsy =2      number of shifts in non-causal prediction filtering
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       float  pow =0.5 ®
       float  r1 =0.5      first overlapping ratio
       float  r2 =0.5      second overlapping ratio
       float  r3 =0.5      third overlapping ratio
       string rect#  =       size  of  the smoothing stencil in #-th dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift# =      shifting of the smoothing stencil in  #-th  dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       bool   sym =n [y/n]     y, symmetric scaling for Hermitian FFT
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mfxynpre2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sffxynpre2(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sffxyspf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sffxyspf(1) Madagascar Manuals sffxyspf(1)

NAME
       sffxyspf  -  3D  f-x-y streaming prediction filter (SPF) for interpola‐
       tion/denoising.

SYNOPSIS
       sffxyspf <  inp.rsf  >  out.rsf  mask=msk.rsf  verb=n  type=1  lambda1=
       lambda2= lambda3= na1= na2=

PARAMETERS
       float  lambda1 =      lambda1
       float  lambda2 =      lambda2
       float  lambda3 =      lambda3
       file   mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    na1 =      fiter size along x axis
       int    na2 =      fiter size along y axis
       int    type =1      default = 1,
                   1 : denoise with noncausul filter desin
                   2 : interpolation with causul filter design
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     default=false, verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mfxyspf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sffxyspf(1)
source

Madagascar.sfgazdag — Method
sfgazdag(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgazdag on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgazdag. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgazdag(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgazdag(1)

NAME
       sfgazdag  - Post-stack 2-D/3-D v(z) time modeling/migration with Gazdag
       phase-shift.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgazdag < in.rsf > out.rsf velocity=vel.rsf velz=velz.rsf  eta=eta.rsf
       inv=n  eps=0.01  verb=n  depth=n  nt=  dt=  nz=  dz=  vel=  vz=v0 n=0.0
       pad=2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((nt+1)/2) rule=

PARAMETERS
       bool   depth =n [y/n]     if true, depth migration
       float  dt =      Sampling of time axis (for modeling)
       float  dz =      Sampling of depth axis (for migration, if no  velocity
              file)
       float  eps =0.01      stabilization parameter
       string eta =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, modeling; if n, migration
       float  n =0.0      Constant eta (if no velocity file)
       int    nt =      Length of time axis (for modeling)
       int    nz  =       Length  of depth axis (for migration, if no velocity
              file)
       int    pad =2*kiss_fft_next_fast_size((nt+1)/2) ®
       string rule =      phase-shift interpolation  rule  (simple,  midpoint,
              linear)
       float  vel =      Constant velocity (if no velocity file)
       string velocity =      auxiliary input file name
       string velz =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  vz =v0      Constant vertical velocity (if no velocity file)
USED IN
       bei/dwnc/phasemod
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/dwnc/vofz
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mgazdag.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfgazdag(1)
source

Madagascar.sfgenshots — Method
sfgenshots(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgenshots on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgenshots. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgenshots(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgenshots(1)

NAME
       sfgenshots  -  Generate  shots for FWI using Enquist absorbing boundary
       condition

SYNOPSIS
       sfgenshots  <  vinit.rsf  >  shots.rsf  time=time.rsf   check=check.rsf
       amp=1000  fm=10  dt=  nt=  ns= ng= jsx= jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg=
       gxbeg= gzbeg= csdgather=n chk=n kt=100

COMMENTS
       Note: You can try other complex boundary condition but we do not recom‐
       mend  to  do so. The main reason is that FWI is to recover the low-fre‐
       quency information of the earth model. Low-freq means  that  exact  ab‐
       sorbing  is  not  necessarilly needed. The result will be improved with
       the optimization procedure.  Furthermore,  complex  boundary  condition
       (such as sponge ABC or PML) implies more computational cost, which will
       degrade the efficiency of FWI.

PARAMETERS
       float  amp =1000      maximum amplitude of ricker
       file   check =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   chk =n [y/n]     check whether GPU-CPU  implementation  coincide
              with each other or not
       bool   csdgather =n [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time interval
       float  fm =10      dominant freq of ricker
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    kt =100      check it at it=100
       int    ng =      total receivers in each shot
       int    ns =      total shots
       int    nt =      total modeling time steps
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       file   time =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mgenshots.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfgenshots(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgenshotscyk — Method
sfgenshotscyk(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

sfgenshotscyk(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgenshotscyk(1)

NAME
       sfgenshotscyk - Generate shots for FWI test

SYNOPSIS
       sfgenshotscyk  < vel.rsf > shots.rsf wfd=wfd.rsf verb=y nt= ng= ns= dt=
       amp=1000 fm=10 jsx= jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg= gxbeg=  gzbeg=  cs‐
       dgather=n

PARAMETERS
       float  amp =1000      maximum amplitude of ricker
       bool   csdgather =n [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =10      dominant freq of ricker
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    ng =      total receivers in each shot
       int    ns =      number of shots
       int    nt =      total modeling time steps
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     vebosity
       file   wfd =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mgenshotscyk.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfgenshotscyk(1)

Madagascar.sfgetcregather — Method
sfgetcregather(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgetcregather on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgetcregather. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgetcregather(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgetcregather(1)

NAME
       sfgetcregather - Build CRE gather given CMP X Offset CRE trajectory co‐
       ordinates and interpolated data cube

SYNOPSIS
       sfgetcregather < in.rsf cremh=cremh.rsf > out.rsf m=out_m.rsf nm0= nt0=
       aperture=1 verb=0

COMMENTS
       This  program  searches  for the closest trace to the CRE trajectory to
       build the CRE Gather for each (m, h) pair  given  in  the  interpolated
       data cube.

       Programmer: Rodolfo A. C. Neves (Dirack) 04/09/2019

       Email:  rodolfo_profissional@hotmail.com

       License: GPL-3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt>.

PARAMETERS
       int    aperture =1      Number of traces to put in a CRE Gather
       file   cremh =      auxiliary input file name
       file   m =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nm0 =      Number of central CMPs in cremh file
       int    nt0 =      Number of t0s in cremh file
       bool   verb =0 [y/n]     1: active mode; 0: quiet mode
SOURCE
       user/dirack/Mgetcregather.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfgetcregather(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgetcretimecurve — Method
sfgetcretimecurve(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgetcretimecurve on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgetcretimecurve. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgetcretimecurve(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgetcretimecurve(1)

NAME
       sfgetcretimecurve  -  Calculate  CRE  traveltime curve t(m,h) given CRS
       zero-offset parameters (RN, RNIP, BETA)

SYNOPSIS
       sfgetcretimecurve < in.rsf param=par.rsf > out.rsf nm0= om0= dm0=  nt0=
       ot0= dt0= v0=1.5 verb=0 cds=0

COMMENTS
       Programmer: Rodolfo A. C. Neves (Dirack) 14/09/2019

       Email:  rodolfo_profissional@hotmail.com

       License: GPL-3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt>.

PARAMETERS
       bool   cds  =0  [y/n]     1: Non-hyperbolic CRS using CDS condition; 0:
              cre approximation
       float  dm0 =      central CMP sampling (Km) in parameters file
       float  dt0 =      t0s sampling (s) in parameters file
       int    nm0 =      Numbers of central CMPs in parameters file
       int    nt0 =      Numbers of t0s in parameters file
       float  om0 =      First central CMP (Km) in parameters file
       float  ot0 =      First t0 (s) in parameters file
       file   param =      auxiliary input file name
       float  v0 =1.5      Near surface velocity (Km/s)
       bool   verb =0 [y/n]     1: active mode; 0: quiet mode
SOURCE
       user/dirack/Mgetcretimecurve.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023              sfgetcretimecurve(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgettype — Method
sfgettype(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfgettype(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgettype(1)

NAME
       sfgettype - Displays numerical type of a dataset

SYNOPSIS
       sfgettype < in.rsf

COMMENTS
       Output  can  be  be:  SF_CHAR,  SF_COMPLEX, SF_FLOAT, SF_INT, SF_SHORT,
       SF_UCHAR Shell/tester for sf_gettype

SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mgettype.c

VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfgettype(1)
source

sfgpufbrec3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgpufbrec3d(1)

NAME
       sfgpufbrec3d  - Backward reconstruction of forward modeling with random
       boundary

SYNOPSIS
       sfgpufbrec3d < Fv.rsf > Fw.rsf verb=n nb=20  nt=  kt=  dt=  fm=20  ns=1
       szbeg= sxbeg= sybeg= jsz= jsx= jsy=

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20      dominant frequency of Ricker wavelet
       int    jsx =      source jump interval in x-axis
       int    jsy =      source jump interval in y-axis
       int    jsz =      source jump interval in z-axis
       int    kt =      record wavefield at time kt
       int    nb =20      thickness of random boundary
       int    ns =1      number of sources
       int    nt =      total number of time steps
       int    sxbeg =      source beginning of x-axis
       int    sybeg =      source beginning of y-axis
       int    szbeg =      source beginning of z-axis
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mgpufbrec3d.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git
