Madagascar.sfgpufwi — Method
sfgpufwi(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgpufwi on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgpufwi. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgpufwi(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgpufwi(1)

NAME
       sfgpufwi  -  CUDA  based FWI using Enquist absorbing boundary condition
       (A2)

SYNOPSIS
       sfgpufwi < vinit.rsf  shots=shots.rsf  >  vupdates.rsf  grads=grads.rsf
       objs=objs.rsf illums=illums.rsf verb=y precon=n niter=100 rbell=2

COMMENTS
       Note: You can try other complex boundary condition but we do not recom‐
       mend to do so. The main reason is that FWI is to recover  the  low-fre‐
       quency  information  of  the earth model. Low-freq means that exact ab‐
       sorbing is not necessarilly needed. The result will  be  improved  with
       the  optimization  precedure.   Furthermore, complex boundary condition
       (such as sponge ABC or PML) implies more computational cost, which will
       degrade the efficiency of FWI.

PARAMETERS
       file   grads =      auxiliary output file name
       file   illums =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       file   objs =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   precon =n [y/n]     precondition or not
       int    rbell =2      radius of bell smooth
       file   shots =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     vebosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mgpufwi.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfgpufwi(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgpuktmig — Method

RSF Documentation

sfgpuktmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgpuktmig(1)

NAME
       sfgpuktmig - Prestack time migration (2-D/3-D) with CUDA.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgpuktmig   <   data.rsf   >   image.rsf  vrms=vrms.rsf  sxsy=sxsy.rsf
       gxgy=gxgy.rsf cxcy=cxcy.rsf verb=n time=n aa=y diff=y dbtr=-1 apx=onx/2
       apy=ony/2 maxtri=13 trfact=4.0*(0.5*(odx + ody)/dt)

PARAMETERS
       bool   aa =y [y/n]     Antialiaing flag
       int    apx =onx/2      Apperture half-width in x direction
       int    apy =ony/2      Apperture half-width in y direction
       string cxcy =      File with midpoint coordinates (auxiliary input file
              name)
       int    dbtr =-1      Desired number of traces per block of threads
       bool   diff =y [y/n]     Differentiation flag
       string gxgy =      File with receiver coordinates (auxiliary input file
              name)
       int    maxtri =13      Maximum half-length of the antialias filter
       string sxsy  =       File  with  shot coordinates (auxiliary input file
              name)
       bool   time =n [y/n]     Total time measurement time
       float  trfact =4.0*(0.5*(odx + ody)/dt)      Trace factor for antialias
              filter length calculation
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       string vrms =      File with RMS velocities (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/cuda/Mgpuktmig.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfgpuktmig(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfgpurayt(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgpurayt(1)

NAME
       sfgpurayt - Parallel shortest path ray tracing

SYNOPSIS
       sfgpurayt  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf ray=rayout.rsf ctime=ctimeout.rsf sx=0
       sz=0 bs=16 ord=3 dx=1.0f ray= ctime=

PARAMETERS
       bs     =16      Cuda block is a square with bs*bs threads. Must  divide
              dimensions of in.rsf, bs >= 1 (int)
       ctime  =      Output rsf file for computation time. Empty for no compu‐
              tation time output.
       dx     =1.0f      Horizontal and vertical separation between nodes,  dx
              > 0.0 (float)
       ord    =3      Forward star has (ord*ord-1) nodes, ord >= 1 (int)
       ray    =       Output file for a sfgraph compatible ray file. Empty for
              no ray output.
       sx     =0      Horizontal node source coordinate (int)
       sz     =0      Vertical node source coordinate (int)
SOURCE
       user/jmonsegny/Mgpurayt.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfgpurayt(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgpurtm — Method
sfgpurtm(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgpurtm on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgpurtm. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgpurtm(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgpurtm(1)

NAME
       sfgpurtm - 2D prestack GPU-based RTM using effective boundary saving.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgpurtm  <  vmodl.rsf  > imag1.rsf imag2=imag2.rsf fm= dt= nt= ns= ng=
       jsx= jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg= gxbeg= gzbeg= order=6 phost=0  cs‐
       dgather=y vmute=1500 tdmute=2.0/(fm*dt)

COMMENTS
       Some  basic descriptions of this code are in order.  1) Coordinate con‐
       figuration of seismic data:

       o--------------> x (2nd dim: *.y) | | | | | z (1st dim: *.x)  1st  dim:
       i1=threadIdx.x+blockDim.x*blockIdx.x;  2nd  dim:  i2=threadIdx.y+block‐
       Dim.y*blockIdx.y; (i1, i2)=i1+i2*nnz;

       2) stability condition:   min(dx, dz)>sqrt(2)*dt*max(v) (NJ=2)  numeri‐
       cal   dispersion   condition:    max(dx,  dz)<min(v)/(10*fmax)   (NJ=2)
       max(dx, dz)<min(v)/(5*fmax)   (NJ=4)

       3) This code doesn't save the history of forward time  steps.  We  just
       save  the  least  boundaries  (referred to as effective boundary in our
       work) of every time step and the two final steps of the wavefield.  Us‐
       ing  this information, we can easily reconstruct the exact wavefield in
       the reverse time steps. It is noteworthy that to implement large  scale
       seismic  imaging,  pinned  memory is employed to save the boundaries of
       each step so that all the saved data can be computed on the device  di‐
       rectly.

       4)  In our implementation, we employ staggered grid based convolutional
       PML (CPML) boundary condition. Using 20 points for CPML  is  enough  to
       obtain  perfect  absorbing  effect  (while commonly used sponge ABC may
       need 30 or more). However, we use 32 points on each  side  due  to  the
       grid  alignment  reasons.  (To make your code fast, you should consider
       that the GPU codes implementation unit is half-warp (16  threads).  The
       thickness of the boundary should be times of 16.

       5)  The  final  images  can be two kinds: result of correlation imaging
       condition and the normalized one. The  normalized  correlation  imaging
       result  is  preferred due to compensated illumination. Some filters are
       popular and effective to remove the  low  frequency  artifacts  of  the
       imaging: the Laplacian filtering, derivative filtering and the bandpass
       filtering. In this code, we use laplacian filtering.

PARAMETERS
       bool   csdgather =y [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time interval
       float  fm =      dominant freq of ricker
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       file   imag2 =      auxiliary output file name
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    ng =      total receivers in each shot
       int    ns =      total shots
       int    nt =      total modeling time steps
       int    order =6      order of finite difference, order=2,4,6,8,10
       float  phost  =0       phost% points on host with zero-copy pinned mem‐
              ory, the rest on device
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    tdmute =2.0/(fm*dt)      number of deleyed time samples to mute
       float  vmute =1500      muting velocity to remove  the  low-freq  arti‐
              facts, unit=m/s
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mgpurtm.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfgpurtm(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfgraph(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgraph(1)

NAME
       sfgraph - Graph plot.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgraph   <   in.rsf   depth=depth.rsf  symbolsz=  scalebar=n  wantfra‐
       menum=(bool)  (n3  >  1)  nreserve=8   minval=   maxval=   barreverse=n
       pclip=100. transp=n color= bar= symbol= > plot.vpl

COMMENTS
       Run "sfdoc stdplot" for more parameters.

       August  2011 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2011/08/09/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfgraph/

PARAMETERS
       string bar =      file for scalebar data
       bool   barreverse =n [y/n]     if y, go from small to large on the  bar
              scale
       string color =      color scheme (default is j)
       string depth =      auxiliary input file name
       float  maxval  =       maximum  value for scalebar (default is the data
              maximum)
       float  minval =      minimum value for scalebar (default  is  the  data
              minimum)
       int    nreserve =8      reserved colors
       float  pclip =100.       clip percentile
       bool   scalebar =n [y/n]     if y, draw scalebar
       string symbol =      if set, plot with symbols instead of lines
       floats symbolsz =      symbol size (default is 2) [n2]
       bool   transp =n [y/n]     if y, transpose the axes
       bool   wantframenum =(bool) (n3 > 1) [y/n]     if y, display third axis
              position in the corner
USED IN
       bei/fdm/movies
       bei/vela/vscan
       carrot/test/modeling
       chen/test/wavmod
       cup/rna2d/real
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate2
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate5
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/sigsbee
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       6 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sf‐
       graph.html
SOURCE
       plot/main/graph.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfgraph(1)

Madagascar.sfgraph3 — Method
sfgraph3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

sfgraph3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgraph3(1)

NAME
       sfgraph3 - Generate 3-D cube plot for surfaces.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgraph3  <  in.rsf orient=1 yreverse=n min= max= point1=0.5 point2=0.5
       frame1=0.5*(min+max)    frame2=n1-1    frame3=0    movie=0     dframe=1
       n1pix=n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)  n2pix=n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2) flat=y >
       plot.vpl

PARAMETERS
       float  dframe =1      frame increment in a movie
       bool   flat =y [y/n]     if n, display perspective view
       float  frame1 =0.5*(min+max) ®
       int    frame2 =n1-1 ®
       int    frame3 =0      frame numbers for cube faces
       float  max =      maximum function value
       float  min =      minimum function value
       int    movie =0      0: no movie, 1: movie over axis 1, 2: axis  2,  3:
              axis 3
       int    n1pix =n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)      number of vertical pixels
       int    n2pix =n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2)      number of horizontal pixels
       int    orient =1      function orientation
       float  point1 =0.5      fraction of the vertical axis for front face
       float  point2 =0.5      fraction of the horizontal axis for front face
       bool   yreverse =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       plot/main/graph3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfgraph3(1)
source

Madagascar.sfgrey — Method
sfgrey(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgrey on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgrey. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgrey(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgrey(1)

NAME
       sfgrey - Generate raster plot.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgrey  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  > bar.rsf transp=y yreverse=y xreverse=n
       gpow= phalf= clip= pclip= gainstep=0.5+n1/256. allpos=n mean=n  bias=0.
       polarity=n symcp=n verb=n scalebar=n minval= maxval= barreverse=n want‐
       framenum=(bool) (n3 > 1) nreserve=8 gpow=1  gainpanel=  bar=  color=  >
       (plot.vpl | char.rsf)

COMMENTS
       Can input char values.  If called "byte", outputs char values.

       If called "bar", outputs scalebar data.

       Run "sfdoc stdplot" for more parameters.

       March  2015  program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2015/03/04/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfgrey/

PARAMETERS
       bool   allpos =n [y/n]     if y, assume positive data
       string bar =      file for scalebar data
       bool   barreverse =n [y/n]     if y, go from small to large on the  bar
              scale
       float  bias =0.       value mapped to the center of the color table
       float  clip =      data clip
       string color =      color scheme (default is i)
       string gainpanel  =       gain reference: 'a' for all, 'e' for each, or
              number
       int    gainstep =0.5+n1/256.       subsampling for gpow and clip  esti‐
              mation
       float  gpow =1      raise data to gpow power for display
       float  maxval  =       maximum  value for scalebar (default is the data
              maximum)
       bool   mean =n [y/n]     if y, bias on the mean value
       float  minval =      minimum value for scalebar (default  is  the  data
              minimum)
       int    nreserve =8      reserved colors
       float  pclip =      data clip percentile (default is 99)
       float  phalf =      percentage for estimating gpow
       bool   polarity  =n  [y/n]     if y, reverse polarity (white is high by
              default)
       bool   scalebar =n [y/n]     if y, draw scalebar
       bool   symcp =n [y/n]     if y, assume symmetric color palette  of  255
              colors
       bool   transp =y [y/n]     if y, transpose the display axes
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   wantframenum =(bool) (n3 > 1) [y/n]     if y, display third axis
              position in the corner
       bool   xreverse =n [y/n]     if y, reverse the horizontal axis
       bool   yreverse =y [y/n]     if y, reverse the vertical axis
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/dpmv/matt
       bei/dpmv/yalei
       bei/dwnc/phasemod
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/dwnc/vofz
       bei/fdm/kjartjac
       bei/fld/cube
       bei/fld/shotmovie

       bei/ft1/brad
       bei/ft1/brad

       77 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sf‐
       grey.html

       plot/main/grey.c

Madagascar.sfgrey3 — Method
sfgrey3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgrey3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgrey3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgrey3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgrey3(1)

NAME
       sfgrey3 - Generate 3-D cube plot.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgrey3  <  in.rsf  point1=0.5 point2=0.5 frame1=0 frame2=n2-1 frame3=0
       movie=0             dframe=1             n1pix=n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)
       n2pix=n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2) flat=y scalebar=n minval= maxval= barre‐
       verse=n nreserve=8 bar= color= > plot.vpl

COMMENTS
       Requires an "unsigned char" input (the output of sfbyte).

       April 2012 program of the  month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2012/04/01/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfgrey3/

PARAMETERS
       string bar =      file for scalebar data
       bool   barreverse  =n [y/n]     if y, go from small to large on the bar
              scale
       string color =      color scheme (default is i)
       int    dframe =1      frame increment in a movie
       bool   flat =y [y/n]     if n, display perspective view
       int    frame1 =0      top frame number
       int    frame2 =n2-1      side frame number
       int    frame3 =0      front frame number
       float  maxval =      maximum value for scalebar (default  is  the  data
              maximum)
       float  minval  =       minimum  value for scalebar (default is the data
              minimum)
       int    movie =0      0: no movie, 1: movie over axis 1, 2: axis  2,  3:
              axis 3
       int    n1pix =n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)      number of vertical pixels
       int    n2pix =n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2)      number of horizontal pixels
       int    nreserve =8      reserved colors
       float  point1 =0.5      fraction of the vertical axis for front face
       float  point2 =0.5      fraction of the horizontal axis for front face
       bool   scalebar =n [y/n]     if y, draw scalebar
USED IN
       bei/fld/cube
       cup/rna3d/real
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cup/rna3d/sin
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/vti3
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
       data/boem-g3d1206-002a/displayin
SOURCE
       plot/main/grey3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfgrey3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfgrey4 — Method
sfgrey4(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgrey4 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgrey4. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgrey4(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgrey4(1)

NAME
       sfgrey4 - Generate movie of 3-D cube plots.

SYNOPSIS
       sfgrey4  <  in.rsf  point1=0.5 point2=0.5 frame1=0 frame2=n2-1 frame3=0
       n1pix=n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)  n2pix=n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2)   flat=y
       scalebar=n  minval=  maxval=  barreverse=n  nreserve=8  bar=  color=  >
       plot.vpl

COMMENTS
       Requires an "unsigned char" input (the output of sfbyte).

PARAMETERS
       string bar =      file for scalebar data
       bool   barreverse =n [y/n]     if y, go from small to large on the  bar
              scale
       string color =      color scheme (default is i)
       bool   flat =y [y/n]     if n, display perspective view
       int    frame1 =0      top frame number
       int    frame2 =n2-1      side frame number
       int    frame3 =0      front frame number
       float  maxval  =       maximum  value for scalebar (default is the data
              maximum)
       float  minval =      minimum value for scalebar (default  is  the  data
              minimum)
       int    n1pix =n1/point1+n3/(1.-point1)      number of vertical pixels
       int    n2pix =n2/point2+n3/(1.-point2)      number of horizontal pixels
       int    nreserve =8      reserved colors
       float  point1 =0.5      fraction of the vertical axis for front face
       float  point2 =0.5      fraction of the horizontal axis for front face
       bool   scalebar =n [y/n]     if y, draw scalebar
SOURCE
       plot/main/grey4.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfgrey4(1)

Madagascar.sfgroll — Method
sfgroll(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgroll on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgroll. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgroll(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgroll(1)

NAME
       sfgroll - Add linear-chirp ground-roll noise to the data

SYNOPSIS
       sfgroll < in.rsf > out.rsf begf=10. endf=5. theta=0.2 alpha=0.1 beg1=0.
       beg2=0. rep=n

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =0.1      width parameter of ground roll
       float  beg1 =0.       radial beginning point at first axis
       float  beg2 =0.       radial beginning point at second axis
       float  begf =10.       beginning frequency of ground roll
       float  endf =5.       ending frequency of ground roll
       bool   rep =n [y/n]     if y, replace data with noise
       float  theta =0.2      direction of central ground roll
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mgroll.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfgroll(1)

Madagascar.sfgsray — Method
sfgsray(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfgsray on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfgsray. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfgsray(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgsray(1)

NAME
       sfgsray  -  Gauss  Seidel iterative solver for phase space escape posi‐
       tions, angle and traveltime

SYNOPSIS
       sfgsray   <   in.rsf   >    out.rsf    slow=slow.rsf    slowz=slowz.rsf
       slowx=slowx.rsf  dslow=dslow.rsf  dtout=dtout.rsf  iq= niter=50 liter=0
       tol=0.000002*nx*nz order=1 verb=n sph=n

PARAMETERS
       string dslow =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dtout =      auxiliary output file name
       int    iq =      switch for escape variable 0=x, 1=a,  2=t,  3=z,  4=l,
              5=i
       int    liter =0      number of first iterations with low-order scheme
       int    niter =50      number of Gauss-Seidel iterations
       int    order =1      order of upwind
       file   slow =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowz =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   sph  =n  [y/n]     true  -  half-sphere,  false  -  flat B.C. on
              left/right
       float  tol =0.000002*nx*nz      accuracy tolerance
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Mgsray.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfgsray(1)
source

       sfgsray2rays2d - Oriented zero-offset migration.

       slowz=slowz.rsf slowx=slowx.rsf  ref3=fref3.rsf  >  imagt.rsf  stride=1
       tolz= tolx= tola= ref1= ref2=

       file   dept =      auxiliary input file name

       string ref2 = ®
       string ref3 =      auxiliary input file name

RSF Documentation

sfgsrayvti(1) Madagascar Manuals sfgsrayvti(1)

NAME
       sfgsrayvti - Gauss Seidel iterative solver for phase space escape posi‐
       tions, angle and traveltime

SYNOPSIS
       sfgsrayvti   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf    vel=slow.rsf    velz=slowz.rsf
       velx=slowx.rsf     iq=    niter=50    tol=0.000002*nx*nz    vti_eps=0.0
       vti_gamma=0.0 vti_delta=0.0 vti=

PARAMETERS
       int    iq =      switch for escape variable 0=x, 1=a, 2=t, 3=z, 4=l
       int    niter =50      number of Gauss-Seidel iterations
       float  tol =0.000002*nx*nz      accuracy tolerance
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velz =      auxiliary input file name
       string vti =      what to compute (p=qP, v=qSV, h=SH)
       float  vti_delta =0.0      VTI constants Thomsen
       float  vti_eps =0.0 ®
       float  vti_gamma =0.0 ®
SOURCE
       user/roman/Mgsrayvti.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfgsrayvti(1)

SYNOPSIS

       mid=(float)(in_n2-1)*in_d2/2+in_o2

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       float  mid  =(float)(in_n2-1)*in_d2/2+in_o2       center  for  midpoint
              streching
       int    pad =in_n2      output time samples

sfhalfint(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhalfint(1)

NAME
       sfhalfint - Half-order integration or differentiation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhalfint < in.rsf > out.rsf adj=n inv=n rho=1.-1./n1

COMMENTS
       December         2012        program        of        the        month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2012/12/23/program-of-the-month-sfhalfint/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     If y, apply adjoint
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     If y, do differentiation instead of integration
       float  rho =1.-1./n1      Leaky integration constant
USED IN
       bei/ft1/hankel
       bei/trimo/mig
       bei/trimo/mod

       system/seismic/Mhalfint.c

sfhalfthr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhalfthr(1)

NAME
       sfhalfthr  -  Half thresholding using exact-value or percentile thresh‐
       olding.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhalfthr < in.rsf > out.rsf other=other.rsf ifverb=0 ifperc=1 thr=

PARAMETERS
       int    ifperc  =1       0,  exact-value  thresholding;  1,   percentile
              thresholding.
       int    ifverb  =0      0, not print threshold value; 1, print threshold
              value.
       string other =      auxiliary output file name
       float  thr =      thresholding level
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mhalfthr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfhandvel2rsf — Method
sfhandvel2rsf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhandvel2rsf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhandvel2rsf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhandvel2rsf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhandvel2rsf(1)

NAME
       sfhandvel2rsf - Converts 2D/3D velocity files from handvel.txt to hand‐
       vel.rsf

SYNOPSIS
       sfhandvel2rsf n1= o1= d1=

COMMENTS
       - sfhandvel2rsf < handvels.txt o1=0 d1=.001 n1=3000 > handvel.rsf

       - The program converts time samples from ms to s

       - The rsf output file will have traces equal to the number of CMP loca‐
       tions  in  handvel.txt.  You  need  to interploate between traces for a
       denser grid e.g. using sfremap1

       - This program uses sfspline for interpolation.

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =      sampling in the first axis
       int    n1 =      size of the first axis
       float  o1 =      origin of the first axis
SOURCE
       user/salah/Mhandvel2rsf.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfhandvel2rsf(1)
source

sfhdefd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhdefd(1)

NAME
       sfhdefd - Heat diffusion equation FD modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfhdefd  < Fwav.rsf con=Fcon.rsf sou=Fsou.rsf rec=Frec.rsf wfl=Fwfl.rsf
       >  Fdat.rsf  verb=n  snap=n  free=n   jdata=1   jsnap=nt   nqz=sf_n(az)
       nqx=sf_n(ax) oqz=sf_o(az) oqx=sf_o(ax)

PARAMETERS
       file   con =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   free =n [y/n]     free surface flag
       int    jdata =1      # of t steps at which to save receiver data
       int    jsnap =nt      # of t steps at which to save wavefield
       int    nqx =sf_n(ax) ®
       int    nqz =sf_n(az) ®
       float  oqx =sf_o(ax) ®
       float  oqz =sf_o(az) ®
       file   rec =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   snap =n [y/n]     wavefield snapshots flag
       file   sou =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   wfl =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/psava/Mhdefd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfhdefd(1)
source

Madagascar.sfheadercut — Method
sfheadercut(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfheadercut. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfheadercut(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheadercut(1)

NAME
       sfheadercut - Zero a portion of a dataset based on a header mask.

SYNOPSIS
       sfheadercut mask=head.rsf < in.rsf > out.rsf

COMMENTS
       The  input data is a collection of traces n1xn2, mask is an integer ar‐
       ray of size n2.

PARAMETERS
       file   mask =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       system/main/headercut.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfheadercut
VERSION
       4.2-git headerwindow.c 1303 2005-08-17 02:08:33Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfheadercut(1)
source
Madagascar.sfheadermath — Method
sfheadermath(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfheadermath on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfheadermath. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfheadermath(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheadermath(1)

NAME
       sfheadermath - Mathematical operations, possibly on header keys.

SYNOPSIS
       sfheadermath  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf segy=y nkey=-1 memsize=sf_memsize()
       key= output=

COMMENTS
       Known functions for float data: cos,  sin,  tan,  acos,   asin,   atan,
       cosh,  sinh,  tanh,  acosh,  asinh,  atanh, exp,  log,  sqrt, abs, erf,
       erfc, sign

       Known functions for int data: sign, abs

       See also sfmath.

       An addition operation can be performed by sfadd.

PARAMETERS
       string key =      key to replace
       int    memsize =sf_memsize()      Max amount of RAM (in Mb) to be used
       int    nkey =-1      number of key to replace
       string output =      Describes the output in a mathematical notation.
       bool   segy =y [y/n]     if SEGY headers
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mheadermath.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfheadermath
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfheadermath(1)
source

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfheadersort(1)

Madagascar.sfheaderwindow — Method
sfheaderwindow(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfheaderwindow on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfheaderwindow. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfheaderwindow(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheaderwindow(1)

NAME
       sfheaderwindow - Window a dataset based on a header mask.

SYNOPSIS
       sfheaderwindow mask=head.rsf < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n

COMMENTS
       The  input data is a collection of traces n1xn2, mask is an integer ar‐
       ray os size n2, windowed is n1xm2, where m2 is the  number  of  nonzero
       elements in mask.

PARAMETERS
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       file   mask =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/main/headerwindow.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfheaderwindow
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfheaderwindow(1)
source

sfheal(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheal(1)

NAME
       sfheal - Heal empty traces ddd

SYNOPSIS
       sfheal < inFile.rsf > outFile.rsf

COMMENTS
       Interpolation between two neighbours; An empty trace should be horizon‐
       tal => transpose input before and after

       user/aklokov/Mheal.c

Madagascar.sfheatexplitest — Method
sfheatexplitest(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfheatexplitest on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfheatexplitest. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfheatexplitest(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheatexplitest(1)

NAME
       sfheatexplitest  - Solving 1-D heat equation using explicit finite dif‐
       ference

SYNOPSIS
       sfheatexplitest > out.rsf nt= dt= nx= dx=

COMMENTS
       artial(u)/artial(t)=a^2artial^2(u)/artial(x^2),
       0<x<l & t>0, u(0,t)=u(l,t)=0, t>0, u(x,0)=f(x), 0<=x<=l.

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      temporal sampling
       float  dx =      spatial sampling
       int    nt =      number of temporal points
       int    nx =      number of spatial points
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mheatexplitest.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                sfheatexplitest(1)
source

sfheatgmres1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfheatgmres1(1)

NAME
       sfheatgmres1 - Solution of 1-D heat equation with GMRES.

SYNOPSIS
       sfheatgmres1 < tinitial.rsf > solution.rsf alpha= dt= nt= Ta=0 Tb=0

PARAMETERS
       float  Ta =0      Boundary condition on the left
       float  Tb =0      Boundary condition on the right
       float  alpha =      Conductivity
       float  dt =      Time step
       int    nt =      Number of time steps
SOURCE
       user/petsc/Mheatgmres1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfheatgmres1(1)

RSF Documentation

sfhelicon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhelicon(1)

NAME
       sfhelicon  -  Multidimensional  convolution  and deconvolution by helix
       transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhelicon < in.rsf filt=filt.rsf > out.rsf n= adj=n div=n lag=

COMMENTS
       May 2014 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2014/05/13/program-
       of-the-month-sfhelicon/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint operation
       bool   div =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse operation (deconvolution)
       file   filt =      auxiliary input file name
       string lag =      file with filter lags
       ints   n =       [dim]
USED IN
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mhelicon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfhelicon(1)

sfhelm2Dbornsyn(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhelm2Dbornsyn(1)

NAME
       sfhelm2D_bornsyn - 2D Born synthetic based on Helmholtz forward solver.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhelm2D_bornsyn < in.rsf > out.rsf source=source.rsf refl=reflfile.rsf
       uts=0 hermite=n npml=20 order=

PARAMETERS
       bool   hermite =n [y/n]     Hermite operator
       int    npml =20      PML width
       string order =      discretization scheme (default optimal 9-point)
       string refl =      auxiliary input file name
       string source =      auxiliary input file name
       int    uts =0 ®
SOURCE
       user/hzhu/Mhelm2D_bornsyn.c

       4.2-git

NAME

SYNOPSIS

       nw=1 dw=1.0 ow=1.0 nsource=1 dsource=0 srcz= srcx0= srcdx= mag=1.0

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =0.1 ®
       float  d2 =0.1 ®
       int    dsource =0 ®
       float  dw =1.0 ®
       string fmag =      auxiliary input file name
       float  mag =1.0 ®
       int    n1 =1 ®
       int    n2 =1 ®
       int    ns =1 ®
       int    nsource =1 ®
       int    nw =1 ®
       float  ow =1.0 ®
       int    srcdx = ®
       int    srcx0 = ®
       int    srcz = ®

sfhelm2Dlsm(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhelm2Dlsm(1)

NAME
       sfhelm2D_lsm  -  2D  Frequency Domain Least Squares Reverse Time Migra‐
       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhelm2D_lsm < in.rsf > out.rsf misfit=misfit.rsf receiver=receiver.rsf
       source=source.rsf record=record.rsf uts=0 npml=20 niter=0 order=

PARAMETERS
       file   misfit =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =0      Number of iterations
       int    npml =20      PML width
       string order =      discretization scheme (default optimal 9-point)
       string receiver =      auxiliary input file name
       string record =      auxiliary input file name
       string source =      auxiliary input file name
       int    uts =0 ®

       user/hzhu/Mhelm2D_lsm.c

sfhelmlu(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhelmlu(1)

NAME
       sfhelmlu - 2D Helmholtz solver by LU factorization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhelmlu  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  source=source.rsf verb=n save=n load=n
       uts=0 hermite=n npml=10 order=

PARAMETERS
       bool   hermite =n [y/n]     Hermite operator
       bool   load =n [y/n]     load LU
       int    npml =10      PML width
       string order =      discretization scheme (default optimal 9-point)
       bool   save =n [y/n]     save LU
       string source =      auxiliary input file name
       int    uts =0      number of OMP threads
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/sparse/Mhelmlu.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfhelmlu(1)

Madagascar.sfhelmmig — Method
sfhelmmig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhelmmig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhelmmig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhelmmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhelmmig(1)

NAME
       sfhelmmig - 2D frequency-domain migration with space-lag imaging condi‐
       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhelmmig < in.rsf > out.rsf source=source.rsf data=data.rsf  us=us.rsf
       ur=ur.rsf timg=timg.rsf verb=n save=n load=n uts=0 nh=0 npml=10 order=

PARAMETERS
       string data =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   load =n [y/n]     load LU
       int    nh =0      horizontal space-lag
       int    npml =10      PML width
       string order =      discretization scheme (default optimal 9-point)
       bool   save =n [y/n]     save LU
       string source =      auxiliary input file name
       string timg =      auxiliary output file name
       string ur =      auxiliary output file name
       string us =      auxiliary output file name
       int    uts =0      number of OMP threads
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/sparse/Mhelmmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfhelmmig(1)
source

Madagascar.sfhic2ang — Method
sfhic2ang(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhic2ang on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhic2ang. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhic2ang(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhic2ang(1)

NAME
       sfhic2ang - angle decomposition of CIPs

SYNOPSIS
       sfhic2ang  < Fcip.rsf > Fang.rsf vel=Fvel.rsf nor=Fnor.rsf tlt=Ftlt.rsf
       ani=Fani.rsf verb=n anis=n adj=y nth=90 oth=0 dth=1.  nph=360  oph=-180
       dph=1.  nhx=1  ohx=0  dhx=1.  nhy=1  ohy=0  dhy=1.  nht=1 oht=0. dht=1.
       nps=251 ops=-25 dps=0.2

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     adj flag
       file   ani =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   anis =n [y/n]     anisotropy flag
       float  dht =1.  ®
       float  dhx =1.  ®
       float  dhy =1.  ®
       float  dph =1.  ®
       float  dps =0.2 ®
       float  dth =1.  ®
       int    nht =1 ®
       int    nhx =1 ®
       int    nhy =1 ®
       file   nor =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nph =360 ®
       int    nps =251 ®
       int    nth =90 ®
       float  oht =0.  ®
       float  ohx =0 ®
       float  ohy =0 ®
       float  oph =-180 ®
       float  ops =-25 ®
       float  oth =0 ®
       file   tlt =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
USED IN
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
SOURCE
       user/psava/Mhic2ang.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfhilbert — Method
sfhilbert(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhilbert on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhilbert. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhilbert(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhilbert(1)

NAME
       sfhilbert - Compute hilbert transform using different methods.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhilbert < in.rsf > out.rsf order=100 ref=1. phase=90. type=

COMMENTS
       type=t  -> time domain convolution type=f -> frequency domain multipli‐
       cation and use FFT type=m -> closed-form design of maximally  flat  FIR
       hilbert transformer

PARAMETERS
       int    order =100      Hilbert transformer order if type=m
       float  phase =90.       phase shift (in degrees)
       float  ref  =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1) if
              type=m
       string type =      Choosing hilbert transform method, type=t means time
              domain,
                     type=f means freqency domain, type=m means using more ro‐
              bust algorithm
                     the default is type=m
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mhilbert.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfhilbert(1)
source
Madagascar.sfhist2 — Method
sfhist2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhist2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhist2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhist2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhist2(1)

NAME
       sfhist2  -  Compute  a  2-D histogram of integer- or float-valued input
       data

SYNOPSIS
       sfhist2 < in.rsf inp2=inp2.rsf > out.rsf n1= o1= d1= n2= o2= d2=

COMMENTS
       The output grid is not centered on  the  bins;  it  marks  their  "left
       edge".   I.e.,  the  first sample holds the number of values between o1
       and o1+d1

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =      histogram sampling for dimension 1
       float  d2 =      histogram sampling for dimension 2
       file   inp2 =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n1 =      number of histogram samples in dimension 1
       int    n2 =      number of histogram samples in dimension 2
       float  o1 =      histogram origin for dimension 1
       float  o2 =      histogram origin for dimension 2
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mhist2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfhist2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfhistogram — Method
sfhistogram(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfhistogram(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhistogram(1)

NAME
       sfhistogram  -  Compute  a  histogram of integer- or float-valued input
       data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhistogram < in.rsf > out.rsf n1= o1= d1=

COMMENTS
       The output grid is not centered on  the  bins;  it  marks  their  "left
       edge".   I.e.,  the  first sample holds the number of values between o1
       and o1+d1.

       February        2015        program        of        the         month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2015/03/01/program-of-the-month-sfhistogram/

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =      histogram sampling
       int    n1 =      number of histogram samples
       float  o1 =      histogram origin
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mhistogram.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfhpef(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhpef(1)

NAME
       sfhpef  - Multi-dimensional PEF (prediction error filter) estimation on
       a helix.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhpef < in.rsf > filt.rsf maskin=mask.rsf  a=  center=  gap=  n=  na=0
       tol=1.e-6 niter=2*(aa->nh) lag= maskout=

PARAMETERS
       ints   a =       [dim]
       ints   center =       [dim]
       ints   gap =       [dim]
       string lag =      output file for filter lags
       string maskin  =       optional  input  mask file (auxiliary input file
              name)
       string maskout =      optional output mask file
       ints   n =       [dim]
       int    na =0      filter size
       int    niter =2*(aa->nh)      number of iterations
       float  tol =1.e-6      tolerance for filter compression
USED IN
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mhpef.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfhpef(1)
source
Madagascar.sfhradon — Method
sfhradon(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhradon on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhradon. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhradon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhradon(1)

NAME
       sfhradon - Time domain high-resolution hyperbolic Radon transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhradon  <  in.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf offset=offset.rsf inv=y adj=n
       solver=n v0= dv= nv= N1=10 N2=3 verb=0 h0= dh= nh=

COMMENTS
       m(tau,p) = _{ih=1}^{nh} d(tau=t{tau^2+h[ih]^2/p^2),h} inv=true  do  in‐
       verse adj=true do adjoint inv=false && adj=false do forward

PARAMETERS
       int    N1 =10      CG Iterations (Internal loop)
       int    N2  =3      Update of weights for the sparse solution, N1 = 1 LS
              , N2 > 3 for High Res (Sparse) solution
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if implement the adjoint transform  instead  of
              the inverse transform
       float  dh = ®
       float  dv = ®
       float  h0 = ®
       bool   inv =y [y/n]     if implement the inverse transform
       int    nh = ®
       int    nv = ®
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   solver =n [y/n]     if use Madagascar bigsolver, default is not
       float  v0 = ®
       string vel =      auxiliary input file name
       int    verb =0      If output the debugging process
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mhradon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfhradon(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfhv2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhv2d(1)

NAME
       sfhv2d - Velocity with heterogeneity convert to dip.

SYNOPSIS
       sfhv2d  <  in.rsf > out.rsf heterog=heterog.rsf n=32 d=12.5 o=0. mute=n
       half=n tp=0.150 t0=0. v0=10000 x0=0. abs=y inner=n hyper=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   abs =y [y/n]     if y, use absolute value |x-x0| (available when
              mute=y)
       float  d =12.5      offset interval
       bool   half =n [y/n]     if y, half-offset instead of full offset
       file   heterog =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   hyper  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  do  hyperbolic mute (available when
              mute=y)
       bool   inner =n [y/n]     if y, do inner muter (available when mute=y)
       bool   mute =n [y/n]     if y, use mutter
       int    n =32      offset number
       float  o =0.       offset origin
       float  t0 =0.       starting time (available when mute=y)
       float  tp =0.150      end time (available when mute=y)
       float  v0 =10000      velocity (available when mute=y)
       float  x0 =0.       starting space (available when mute=y)
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mhv2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfhv2d(1)
source

NAME
       sfhwt2d - 2-D Huygens wavefront tracing traveltimes

SYNOPSIS
       sfhwt2d  <  Fv.rsf > Fw.rsf verb=n rays=n xsou=sf_o(ax) + nx*sf_d(ax)/2
       zsou=sf_o(az) + nz*sf_d(az)/2 nt=100 ot=0 dt=0.001 ng=360 og=-180 dg=1

PARAMETERS
       float  dg =1 ®
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       int    ng =360 ®
       int    nt =100 ®
       float  og =-180 ®
       float  ot =0 ®
       bool   rays =n [y/n]     velocity file
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
       float  xsou =sf_o(ax) + nx*sf_d(ax)/2 ®
       float  zsou =sf_o(az) + nz*sf_d(az)/2 ®

NAME
       sfhwt3d -

SYNOPSIS
       sfhwt3d < Fv.rsf > Fw.rsf verb=n forceray=n scaleray=1. xsou=sf_o(ax) +
       sf_n(ax)*sf_d(ax)/2 ysou=sf_o(ay) + sf_n(ay)*sf_d(ay)/2 zsou=sf_o(az) +
       sf_n(az)*sf_d(az)/2  nt=100  ot=0  dt=0.001  ng=360 og=-180 dg=1 nh=360
       oh=-180 dh=1

COMMENTS

       float  dh =1 ®
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       bool   forceray =n [y/n]
       int    ng =360 ®
       int    nh =360 ®
       int    nt =100 ®
       float  og =-180 ®
       float  oh =-180 ®
       float  ot =0 ®
       int    scaleray =1.       velocity file
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
       float  xsou =sf_o(ax) + sf_n(ax)*sf_d(ax)/2 ®
       float  ysou =sf_o(ay) + sf_n(ay)*sf_d(ay)/2 ®
       float  zsou =sf_o(az) + sf_n(az)*sf_d(az)/2 ®

Madagascar.sfhyperdif — Method
sfhyperdif(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfhyperdif on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfhyperdif. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfhyperdif(1) Madagascar Manuals sfhyperdif(1)

NAME
       sfhyperdif  -  Solving 1-D transportation equation using finite differ‐
       ence algorithm

SYNOPSIS
       sfhyperdif > out.rsf dinit=dinit.rsf  dtrue=dtrue.rsf  wanttrue=n  wan‐
       tinit=n nt= dt= ox= nx= dx= type=

COMMENTS
       artial(u)/artial(t)+a(x,t)artial(u)/artial(x),
       0<t<=T, x->unlimited, u(x,0)=f(x).

PARAMETERS
       file   dinit =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dt =      temporal sampling
       file   dtrue =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dx =      spatial sampling
       int    nt =      number of temporal points
       int    nx =      number of spatial points
       float  ox =      spatial starting point
       string type =      [upwind, friedrichs,  wendroff]  get  the  type  for
              solving  hyperbola partial differential equation, the default is
              upwind
       bool   wantinit =n [y/n]     if want initial value. y: want,  n:  don't
              want.
       bool   wanttrue  =n  [y/n]     if want true solution. y: want, n: don't
              want.
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mhyperdif.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfhyperdif(1)
source

Madagascar.sfigrad — Method
sfigrad(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfigrad on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfigrad. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

       NMO.

       float  d2 =200.       offset sampling (if inv=n)

sfimpl1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfimpl1(1)

NAME
       sfimpl1 - 1-D anisotropic diffusion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfimpl1 < in.rsf > out.rsf rect1= tau=0.1 pclip=50. up=n

PARAMETERS
       float  pclip =50.       percentage clip for the gradient
       float  rect1 =      smoothing radius
       float  tau =0.1      smoothing time
       bool   up =n [y/n]     smoothing style

Madagascar.sfimpl2 — Method
sfimpl2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfimpl2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfimpl2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfimpl2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfimpl2(1)

NAME
       sfimpl2 - 2-D anisotropic diffusion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfimpl2  < in.rsf > out.rsf rect1= rect2= tau=0.1 pclip=50. up=n verb=n
       nsnap=1 lin=n adj=n dist= snap=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       string dist =      inverse distance file (input)
       bool   lin =n [y/n]     if linear operator
       int    nsnap =1      number of snapshots
       float  pclip =50.       percentage clip for the gradient
       float  rect1 =      vertical smoothing
       float  rect2 =      horizontal smoothing
       string snap =      snapshot file (output)
       float  tau =0.1      smoothing time
       bool   up =n [y/n]     smoothing style
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mimpl2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfimpl2(1)
source

       verb=n nsnap=1 dist= snap=

       int    nsnap =1      number of snapshots
       float  pclip =50.       percentage clip for the gradient
       float  rect1 = ®
       float  rect2 = ®
       float  rect3 =      smoothing radius
       string snap =      snapshot file (output)
       float  tau =0.1      smoothing time

Madagascar.sfin — Method
sfin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfin(1)

NAME
       sfin - Display basic information about RSF files.

SYNOPSIS
       sfin info=y check=2. trail=y [<file0.rsf] file1.rsf file2.rsf ...

COMMENTS
       n1,n2,...  are data dimensions o1,o2,... are axis origins d1,d2,... are
       axis   sampling   intervals   label1,label2,...   are    axis    labels
       unit1,unit2,... are axis units

PARAMETERS
       float  check  =2.        Portion  of the data (in Mb) to check for zero
              values.
       bool   info =y [y/n]     If n, only display the name of the data file.
       bool   trail =y [y/n]     If n, skip trailing dimensions of one
SOURCE
       system/main/in.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfin
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                           sfin(1)
source

sfinitwave2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinitwave2(1)

NAME
       sfinitwave2 - Complex 2-D wave propagation using initial condition

SYNOPSIS
       sfinitwave2    <    Fi.rsf    >   Fo.rsf   snaps=Fs.rsf   left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf verb=y nt= dt= snap=0 correct=n pad1=1 mode=

PARAMETERS
       bool   correct =n [y/n]     correction
       float  dt = ®
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       string mode =      default mode is pspi
       int    nt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Minitwave2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfinmo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinmo(1)

NAME
       sfinmo - Inverse normal moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinmo  <  cmp.rsf  velocity=velocity.rsf  > nmod.rsf offset=offset.rsf
       mask=msk.rsf half=y slowness=n h0=0. eps=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       float  h0 =0.       reference offset
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       bei/vela/strat
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Minmo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfinmo(1)
source

sfinmo3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinmo3(1)

NAME
       sfinmo3 - 3-D Inverse normal moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinmo3 < cmp.rsf > nmod.rsf velocity=vel.rsf half=y eps=0.01 extend=8

COMMENTS
       velocity file contains slowness squared with n2=3 (wx,wy,wxy)

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       int    extend =8      trace extension
       bool   half  =y [y/n]     if y, the second and third axes are half-off‐
              set instead of full offset
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       cup/rna3d/shot
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Minmo3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfinmo3(1)

sfinmo3ort(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinmo3ort(1)

NAME
       sfinmo3_ort  - 3-D Inverse normal moveout using orthogonal parametriza‐
       tion

SYNOPSIS
       sfinmo3_ort < cmp.rsf > nmod.rsf velocity=vel.rsf half=y  eps=0.01  ex‐
       tend=8

COMMENTS
       velocity file contains slowness squared with n2=3 (Wavg,Wcos,Wsin)

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       int    extend =8      trace extension
       bool   half  =y [y/n]     if y, the second and third axes are half-off‐
              set instead of full offset

Madagascar.sfinmo3gma — Method
sfinmo3gma(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfinmo3gma on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfinmo3gma. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfinmo3gma(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinmo3gma(1)

NAME
       sfinmo3gma - 3-D Inverse generalized normal moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinmo3gma  <  cmp.rsf  > nmod.rsf velocity=vel.rsf half=n eps=0.01 ex‐
       tend=8

COMMENTS
       Velocity    file    contains    slowness     squared     with     n2=16
       (wx,wxy,wy,A1,A2,A3,A4,A5,B1,B2,B3,C1,C2,C3,C4,C5)  following Sripanich
       and Fomel (2015).

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       int    extend =8      trace extension
       bool   half =n [y/n]     if x,y , the second and third axes  are  half-
              offset instead of full offset
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Minmo3gma.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfinmo3gma(1)
source
Madagascar.sfinstattr — Method
sfinstattr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfinstattr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfinstattr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfinstattr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinstattr(1)

NAME
       sfinstattr - Estimate of instantaneous attributes.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinstattr  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf order=10 ref=1. hertz=y hires=n der2=n
       verb=n type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   der2 =n [y/n]     if y, compute 2nd-order derivative to use with
              hires=y
       bool   hertz =y [y/n]     if y, convert output to Hertz
       bool   hires  =n  [y/n]     if y, compute high resolution instantaneous
              attributes
       int    order =10      Hilbert transformer order
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       string type =      [amplitude,phase,frequency] attribute type, the  de‐
              fault is amplitude
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Minstattr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfinstattr(1)
source

sfint3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfint3d(1)

NAME
       sfint3d -

SYNOPSIS
       sfint3d  <  Fw.rsf  >  Ft.rsf  verb=n  pick=2 fill=1 nz=100 oz=0. dz=1.
       nx=100 ox=0. dx=1. ny=1 oy=0. dy=1.

COMMENTS
       * 3-D traveltime interpolation (from rays to Cartesian cube) * pcs 2005

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =1.  ®
       float  dy =1.  ®
       float  dz =1.  ®
       int    fill =1      wavefronts file (a,g,h,t)
       int    nx =100 ®
       int    ny =1 ®
       int    nz =100 ®
       float  ox =0.  ®
       float  oy =0.  ®
       float  oz =0.  ®
       int    pick =2 ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/psava/Mint3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfint3d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfintbin — Method
sfintbin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfintbin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfintbin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfintbin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfintbin(1)

NAME
       sfintbin - Data binning by trace sorting.

SYNOPSIS
       sfintbin  <  in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n xkey= ykey= xmin= xmax= ymin= ymax=
       head= xk= yk= map= mask=

COMMENTS
       If inv=n, the input is 2-D (n1 x ntr). The output is 3-D  (n1  x  n2  x
       n3), n2 and n3 correspond to two selected keys from the header file.

       If inv=y, the input is 3-D, and the output is 2-D.

       if xkey < 0, the first axis indexes traces in a gather like cdpt.

       June  2015  program  of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2015/06/10/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfintbin/

PARAMETERS
       string head =      header file
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       string map =      output map file
       string mask =      output mask file
       string xk =      x key name
       int    xkey =      x key number (if no xk), default is fldr
       int    xmax =      x maximum
       int    xmin =      x minimum
       string yk =      y key name
       int    ykey =      y key number (if no yk), default is tracf
       int    ymax =      y maximum
       int    ymin =      y minimum
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mintbin.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfintbin(1)
source
Madagascar.sfintbin3 — Method
sfintbin3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfintbin3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfintbin3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfintbin3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfintbin3(1)

NAME
       sfintbin3 - 4-D data binning.

SYNOPSIS
       sfintbin3  < in.rsf > out.rsf xkey= ykey= zkey= xmin= xmax= ymin= ymax=
       zmin= zmax= head= xk= yk= zk= mask=

COMMENTS
       if xkey < 0, the first axis indexes traces in a gather like cdpt.

PARAMETERS
       string head =      header file
       string mask =      output mask file
       string xk =      x key name
       int    xkey =      x key number (if no xk), default is fldr
       int    xmax =      x maximum
       int    xmin =      x minimum
       string yk =      y key name
       int    ykey =      y key number (if no yk), default is iline
       int    ymax =      y maximum
       int    ymin =      y minimum
       string zk =      z key name
       int    zkey =      z key number (if no zk), default is xline
       int    zmax =      z maximum
       int    zmin =      z minimum
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mintbin3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfintbin3(1)
source

sfintbin4(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfintbin4 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfintbin4. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfintbin4(1) Madagascar Manuals sfintbin4(1)

NAME
       sfintbin4 - 5-D data binning.

SYNOPSIS
       sfintbin4  < in.rsf > out.rsf xkey= ykey= skey= rkey= xmin= xmax= ymin=
       ymax= smin= smax= rmin= rmax= dx=1 dy=1 ds=1 dr=1 head= xk= yk= sk= rk=
       fold=

PARAMETERS
       int    dr =1 ®
       int    ds =1 ®
       int    dx =1 ®
       int    dy =1 ®
       string fold =      output fold file
       string head =      header file
       string rk =      r key name
       int    rkey =      r key number (if no rk), default is gwdep
       int    rmax =      r maximum
       int    rmin =      r minimum
       string sk =      s key name
       int    skey =      s key number (if no sk), default is swdep
       int    smax =      s maximum
       int    smin =      s minimum
       string xk =      x key name
       int    xkey =      x key number (if no xk), default is fldr
       int    xmax =      x maximum
       int    xmin =      x minimum
       string yk =      y key name
       int    ykey =      y key number (if no yk), default is tracf
       int    ymax =      y maximum
       int    ymin =      y minimum
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mintbin4.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfintbin4(1)

RSF Documentation

sfinternalmult(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinternalmult(1)

NAME
       sfinternalmult  -  Generate internal multiples by using virtual seismic
       data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinternalmult < in.rsf > out.rsf  dif=dif.rsf  verb=n  stack=n  both=n
       jumpo=1 jumps=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     receiver flag, if y, receiver with both sides
       string dif =      auxiliary input file name
       int    jumpo =1      jump in offset dimension, only for stack=n
       int    jumps =1      jump in shot dimension, only for stack=n
       bool   stack =n [y/n]     stack flag, if y, no common multiple gather
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Minternalmult.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfinternalmult(1)

sfinterp2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinterp2(1)

NAME
       sfinterp2 - Multiple-arrival interpolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinterp2  <  in.rsf  size=size.rsf > out.rsf grid=grid.rsf sx=0. sz=0.
       nw=4 plane=0

PARAMETERS
       file   grid =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nw =4      Interpolation accuracy
       int    plane =0      0: point-source, 4: plane-wave
       file   size =      auxiliary input file name
       float  sx =0.  ®
       float  sz =0.       Shot coordinates
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Minterp2.c
VERSION

       sfintshow > filt.rsf nw= x= kai=4.0 interp=

COMMENTS
       See also: inttest1.

PARAMETERS
       string interp  =       interpolation (lagrange,cubic,kaiser,lanczos,co‐
              sine,welch,spline,mom)
       float  kai =4.0      Kaiser window parameter
       int    nw =      interpolator size
       float  x =      interpolation shift

sfinttest1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinttest1(1)

NAME
       sfinttest1 - Interpolation from a regular grid in 1-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinttest1 < in.rsf > out.rsf coord=crd.rsf nw= same=y kai=4.0 interp=

COMMENTS
       January 2014 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2014/01/09/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfinttest1/

PARAMETERS
       file   coord =      auxiliary input file name
       string interp =       interpolation  (lagrange,cubic,kaiser,lanczos,co‐
              sine,welch,spline,mom)
       float  kai =4.0      Kaiser window parameter
       int    nw =      interpolator size
       bool   same =y [y/n]     same or different coordinates for each trace
USED IN
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r

       system/generic/Minttest1.c

RSF Documentation

sfinvalid(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinvalid(1)

NAME
       sfinvalid  -  Finds  RSF  files  with missing or incomplete binaries or
       headers.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinvalid verb=n dir=. rec=n chk4nan=n

COMMENTS
       Delete them all with shell constructs like: rm -f `sfinvalid dir=.`

PARAMETERS
       bool   chk4nan =n [y/n]     Check for NaN values. Expensive!!
       string dir =.       Directory with files
       bool   rec =n [y/n]     Whether to go down recursively
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Display what is wrong with the dataset
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Minvalid.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfinvalid(1)
source
Madagascar.sfinvbin — Method
sfinvbin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfinvbin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfinvbin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfinvbin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinvbin(1)

NAME
       sfinvbin  -  Data interpolation in 2-D slices using helix precondition‐
       ing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinvbin < in.rsf > out.rsf filt=flt.rsf  pch=pch.rsf  n=  xkey=  ykey=
       xmax=  xmin=  ymax=  ymin=  x0=xmin y0=ymin nx=(int) (xmax - xmin + 1.)
       ny=(int) (ymax - ymin + 1.) dx=  dy=  interp=2  der=n  stat=y  niter=20
       eps=0.01 head= lag= nh=

PARAMETERS
       bool   der =n [y/n]     if y, apply derivative filter on the residual
       float  dx =      bin size in x
       float  dy =      bin size in y
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       file   filt =      auxiliary input file name
       string head = ®
       int    interp =2      interpolation length
       string lag = ®
       ints   n =       [2]
       string nh = ®
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       int    nx =(int) (xmax - xmin + 1.)       Number of bins in x
       int    ny =(int) (ymax - ymin + 1.)       Number of bins in y
       file   pch =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   stat =y [y/n]     stationary or nonstationary filter
       float  x0 =xmin ®
       int    xkey =      x key number
       float  xmax = ®
       float  xmin = ®
       float  y0 =ymin      grid origin
       int    ykey =      y key number
       float  ymax = ®
       float  ymin =      Grid dimensions
SOURCE
       user/gee/Minvbin.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mbin.c 991 2005-02-10 11:42:19Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfinvbin(1)
source
Madagascar.sfinvbin1 — Method
sfinvbin1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfinvbin1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfinvbin1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfinvbin1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinvbin1(1)

NAME
       sfinvbin1 - 1-D inverse interpolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinvbin1  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  nx=  xmin= xmax= x0=xmin dx= filter=1
       prec=y verb=n niter=nx eps=0.2 pef=n head=

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =      grid sampling
       float  eps =0.2      regularization parameter
       int    filter =1      filter type
       string head = ®
       int    niter =nx      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       int    nx =      number of bins
       bool   pef =n [y/n]     if y, use PEF for regularization
       bool   prec =y [y/n]     if y, use preconditioning
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =xmin      grid origin
       float  xmax = ®
       float  xmin =      grid size
SOURCE
       user/gee/Minvbin1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfinvbin1(1)
source

       bool   verb =n [y/n]

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfinvrec1 — Method
sfinvrec1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfinvrec1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfinvrec1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfinvrec1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfinvrec1(1)

NAME
       sfinvrec1 - 1-D inverse interpolation with recursive filtering.

SYNOPSIS
       sfinvrec1  < in.rsf > out.rsf filt=filt.rsf lag=lag.rsf nx= xmin= xmax=
       x0=xmin dx= spline=n nw=2 verb=n niter=nx eps=0.2 movie=n head=

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =      grid sampling
       float  eps =0.2      regularization parameter
       file   filt =      auxiliary input file name
       string head = ®
       string lag =      optional input file with filter lags (auxiliary input
              file name)
       bool   movie =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    niter =nx      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       int    nw =2      interpolator size
       int    nx =      number of bins
       bool   spline =n [y/n]     if use spline interpolation
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =xmin      grid origin
       float  xmax = ®
       float  xmin =      grid size
SOURCE
       user/gee/Minvrec1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Minvbin1.c 2521 2007-02-02 00:25:42Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfinvrec1(1)
source

Madagascar.sfiphase — Method
sfiphase(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfiphase on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfiphase. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfiphase(1) Madagascar Manuals sfiphase(1)

NAME
       sfiphase - Smooth estimate of instantaneous frequency.

SYNOPSIS
       sfiphase < in.rsf > out.rsf verb=n complex=n niter=100 order=100 ref=1.
       hertz=n band=n rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       bool   band =n [y/n]     if y, compute instantaneous bandwidth
       bool   complex =n [y/n]     if y, use complex-valued computations
       bool   hertz =n [y/n]     if y, convert output to Hertz
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    order =100      Hilbert transformer order
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Miphase.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfiphase(1)
source

sfirays(1) Madagascar Manuals sfirays(1)

NAME
       sfirays - Fast marching for image rays

SYNOPSIS
       sfirays  < in.rsf > out.rsf t0=ot0.rsf x0=ox0.rsf f0=of0.rsf velocity=y
       order=1 thres=10.

PARAMETERS
       string f0 =      auxiliary output file name
       int    order =1      fastmarching accuracy order
       string t0 =      auxiliary output file name
       float  thres =10.       thresholding for caustics
       bool   velocity =y [y/n]     y, inputs  are  velocity  /  n,  slowness-
              squared
       string x0 =      output upwind neighbor (auxiliary output file name)

sfisaac0(1) Madagascar Manuals sfisaac0(1)

NAME
       sfisaac0 - Zero-offset bending ray tracing in one-layered media

SYNOPSIS
       sfisaac0  <  refl.rsf > ttime.rsf xrefl=xrefl.rsf ns=nr ds=dr s0=r0 or‐
       der=3 velocity=2.0 tol=0.0001/velocity

PARAMETERS
       float  ds =dr      source sampling
       int    ns =nr      Number of sources
       int    order =3      interpolation order
       float  s0 =r0      source origin
       float  tol =0.0001/velocity      assign a default value for tolerance
       float  velocity =2.0      assign velocity km/s
       file   xrefl =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/zone/Misaac0.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfisaac0(1)
