Madagascar.sfonelayer — Method
sfonelayer(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfonelayer on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfonelayer. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfonelayer(1) Madagascar Manuals sfonelayer(1)

NAME
       sfonelayer - One layer NN training.

SYNOPSIS
       sfonelayer  < x_train_obj.rsf ytrain=y_train_obj.rsf xval=x_val_obj.rsf
       yval=y_val_obj.rsf > loss_train_obj.rsf lossval=loss_val_obj.rsf

COMMENTS
       Reproducing  the   training   process   of   the   following   example:
       https://github.com/seg/tutorials-2018/tree/master/1808_Neural_networks
       This is a minimal one-layer network: x -> a -> z == y The training uses
       L2 loss function.

PARAMETERS
       file   lossval =      auxiliary output file name
       file   xval =      auxiliary input file name
       file   ytrain =      auxiliary input file name
       file   yval =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Monelayer.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfonelayer(1)
source
Madagascar.sfopame2d — Method
sfopame2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfopame2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfopame2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfopame2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfopame2d(1)

NAME
       sfopame2d  - 2-D opam for elastic wave modeling and vector field decom‐
       postion

SYNOPSIS
       sfopame2d  vp=fvelp.rsf  vs=fvels.rsf  <   fsource.rsf   >   fwavup.rsf
       wavwp=fwavwp.rsf   wavus=fwavus.rsf   wavws=fwavws.rsf   wavu=fwavu.rsf
       wavw=fwavw.rsf   Guxxl=Guxxl.rsf   Guxxr=Guxxr.rsf    Gwxzpl=Gwxzpl.rsf
       Gwxzpr=Gwxzpr.rsf  Guxzpl=Guxzpl.rsf  Guxzpr=Guxzpr.rsf Gwzzl=Gwzzl.rsf
       Gwzzr=Gwzzr.rsf   Guzzl=Guzzl.rsf   Guzzr=Guzzr.rsf   Gwxzsl=Gwxzsl.rsf
       Gwxzsr=Gwxzsr.rsf   Gwxxl=Gwxxl.rsf  Gwxxr=Gwxxr.rsf  Guxzsl=Guxzsl.rsf
       Guxzsr=Guxzsr.rsf opt=0 dt= nt= isx= isz= nbt=44 nbb=44  nxl=44  nxr=44
       czt=0.01 czb=0.01 cxl=0.01 cxr=0.01 cmplx=n pad1=1 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       file   Guxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guxzpl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guxzpr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guxzsl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guxzsr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Guzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxzpl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxzpr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxzsl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwxzsr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gwzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  cxl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cxr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czt =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nxl =44 ®
       int    nxr =44      assume ABC pars are the same
       int    opt =0      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   vp =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wavu =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavus =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavw =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavwp =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavws =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mopame2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfopame2d(1)
source

NAME
       sfopame2dckxx - 2-D opam for elastic wave modeling and vector field de‐
       compostion */

SYNOPSIS
       sfopame2dckxx  <  vel.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   left=left.rsf   >   right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt=

PARAMETERS
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mopame2dckxx.cc

Madagascar.sfopoti2d — Method
sfopoti2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfopoti2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfopoti2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfopoti2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfopoti2d(1)

NAME
       sfopoti2d  -  Modeling  of  pure acoustic wave in 2-D transversely iso‐
       tropic meida using optimized pseudo-Laplacian operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfopoti2d  >  out.rsf  vel=vel.rsf  sigma=fsigma.rsf   delta=fdelta.rsf
       seta=fseta.rsf  <  source.rsf Gxxl=Gxxl.rsf Gxxr=Gxxr.rsf Gzzl=Gzzl.rsf
       Gzzr=Gzzr.rsf  Gxxxxl=Gxxxxl.rsf  Gxxxxr=Gxxxxr.rsf   Gzzzzl=Gzzzzl.rsf
       Gzzzzr=Gzzzzr.rsf Gxzzzl=Gxzzzl.rsf Gxzzzr=Gxzzzr.rsf Gxxxzl=Gxxxzl.rsf
       Gxxxzr=Gxxxzr.rsf Gxxzzl=Gxxzzl.rsf  Gxxzzr=Gxxzzr.rsf  opt=1  dt=  nt=
       isx=  isz=  nbt=30  nbb=30  nxl=30  nxr=30  czt=0.01  czb=0.01 cxl=0.01
       cxr=0.01 ax=5.0 az=5.0 factor=5.0/6.0 cmplx=n pad1=1 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       file   Gxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       float  ax =5.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  az =5.0      suppress HF parameter
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  cxl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cxr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czt =0.01      decaying parameter
       file   delta =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       float  factor =5.0/6.0      suppress HF parameter
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =30 ®
       int    nbt =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nxl =30 ®
       int    nxr =30      assume ABC pars are the same
       int    opt =1      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   seta =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sigma =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mopoti2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfopoti2d(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfopoti3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfopoti3d(1)

NAME
       sfopoti3d  -  Modeling  of  pure acoustic wave in 3-D transversely iso‐
       tropic meida using optimized pseudo-Laplacian operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfopoti3d  >  out.rsf  vel=vel.rsf  sigma=fsigma.rsf   delta=fdelta.rsf
       seta=fseta.rsf  phi=fphi.rsf  <  source.rsf Gxxl=Gxxl.rsf Gxxr=Gxxr.rsf
       Gyyl=Gyyl.rsf Gyyr=Gyyr.rsf Gzzl=Gzzl.rsf  Gzzr=Gzzr.rsf  Gxyl=Gxyl.rsf
       Gxyr=Gxyr.rsf  Gxzl=Gxzl.rsf  Gxzr=Gxzr.rsf Gyzl=Gyzl.rsf Gyzr=Gyzr.rsf
       Gxxxxl=Gxxxxl.rsf Gxxxxr=Gxxxxr.rsf Gyyyyl=Gyyyyl.rsf Gyyyyr=Gyyyyr.rsf
       Gzzzzl=Gzzzzl.rsf Gzzzzr=Gzzzzr.rsf Gxxxyl=Gxxxyl.rsf Gxxxyr=Gxxxyr.rsf
       Gxxxzl=Gxxxzl.rsf Gxxxzr=Gxxxzr.rsf Gxyyyl=Gxyyyl.rsf Gxyyyr=Gxyyyr.rsf
       Gyyyzl=Gyyyzl.rsf Gyyyzr=Gyyyzr.rsf Gxzzzl=Gxzzzl.rsf Gxzzzr=Gxzzzr.rsf
       Gyzzzl=Gyzzzl.rsf Gyzzzr=Gyzzzr.rsf Gxxyyl=Gxxyyl.rsf Gxxyyr=Gxxyyr.rsf
       Gxxzzl=Gxxzzl.rsf Gxxzzr=Gxxzzr.rsf Gyyzzl=Gyyzzl.rsf Gyyzzr=Gyyzzr.rsf
       Gxxyzl=Gxxyzl.rsf Gxxyzr=Gxxyzr.rsf Gxyyzl=Gxyyzl.rsf Gxyyzr=Gxyyzr.rsf
       Gxyzzl=Gxyzzl.rsf Gxyzzr=Gxyzzr.rsf opt=1 dt= nt= isx= isy= isz= nbt=30
       nbb=30 nxl=30 nxr=30 nyl=30 nyr=30 czt=0.01 czb=0.01 cxl=0.01  cxr=0.01
       cmplx=n pad1=1 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       file   Gxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxxl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxxr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxxzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxyyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxyyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxyzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxyzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxxzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyyyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyyyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyyzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyyzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxyzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gxzzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyyyl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyyyr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyyzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyyzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyyzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyzzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gyzzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzzzl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gzzzzr =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       float  cxl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cxr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czt =0.01      decaying parameter
       file   delta =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isy = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =30 ®
       int    nbt =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nxl =30 ®
       int    nxr =30 ®
       int    nyl =30 ®
       int    nyr =30      assume ABC pars are the same
       int    opt =1      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   phi =      auxiliary input file name
       file   seta =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sigma =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mopoti3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfopoti3d(1)

sfopsmigrk(1) Madagascar Manuals sfopsmigrk(1)

NAME
       sfopsmigrk - Shot-recorder Oriented prestack migration data is (shots x
       recs x time).

SYNOPSIS
       sfopsmigrk  <   dist.rsf   time=time.rsf   dept=dept.rsf   >   imag.rsf
       data=data.rsf tolz=2.0 is_offset=n

PARAMETERS
       file   data =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dept =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   is_offset =n [y/n]
       file   time =      auxiliary input file name
       float  tolz =2.0 ®

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sforientation — Method
sforientation(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforientation on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforientation. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforientation(1) Madagascar Manuals sforientation(1)

NAME
       sforientation - orientation estimation by structural gradient tensor

SYNOPSIS
       sforientation  < in.rsf > out.rsf weight=wgt.rsf azimuth=az.rsf rect1=0
       rect2=0 rect3=0 order=2 interp= filt=

PARAMETERS
       string azimuth =      auxiliary output file name
       string filt =      filter type : ls, tls, tensor
       string interp =      interpolation method: maxflat lagrange bspline
       int    order =2      approximating order of finite difference
       int    rect1 =0      smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =0      smoothness on 2nd axis
       int    rect3 =0      smoothness on 3rd axis
       string weight =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chen/Morientation.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sforientation(1)
source

sformatrix(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sformatrix(1) Madagascar Manuals sformatrix(1)

NAME
       sformatrix  -  Lowrank decomposition for 3-D orthorhombic wave propaga‐
       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sformatrix   <   velz.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   >   middle.rsf    app=app.rsf
       real=real.rsf seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 xx1= xx2= xx3= dt=

PARAMETERS
       file   app =      auxiliary output file name
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       file   real =      auxiliary output file name
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       xx1    =      x location
       xx2    =      x location
       xx3    =      x location
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mormatrix.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sformatrix(1)

Madagascar.sforp — Method
sforp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforp(1) Madagascar Manuals sforp(1)

NAME
       sforp - 2-D 10th-order Finite-difference dispersion

SYNOPSIS
       sforp  >  out.rsf  < vel.rsf vx=2.1 vy=2.05 vz=2.0 e1=0.3 e2=0.1 e3=1.0
       phi=45.0

PARAMETERS
       float  e1 =0.3 ®
       float  e2 =0.1 ®
       float  e3 =1.0 ®
       float  phi =45.0 ®
       float  vx =2.1 ®
       float  vy =2.05 ®
       float  vz =2.0 ®
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Morp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sforp(1)

Madagascar.sfort3de — Method
sfort3de(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfort3de on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfort3de. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfort3de(1) Madagascar Manuals sfort3de(1)

NAME
       sfort3de  -  3-D three-components wavefield modeling using elastic wave
       equation in tilted ORT media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfort3de  <   Fvp0.rsf   vs0=Fvs0.rsf   epsi1=Fep1.rsf   epsi2=Fep2.rsf
       del1=Fde1.rsf  del2=Fde2.rsf  del3=Fde3.rsf gam1=Fga1.rsf gam2=Fga2.rsf
       the=Falpha.rsf the=Fthe.rsf phi=Fphi.rsf >  Fo1.rsf  FDElasticy=Fo2.rsf
       FDElasticz=Fo3.rsf ns=301 dt=0.001

COMMENTS
       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng and Tengfei Wang

       This  code  is  first written by Tengfei Wang at Tongji University, and
       then optimzied by Jiubing Cheng for Madagascar version at BEG,  Univer‐
       sity of Texas at Austin.

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   FDElasticy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   FDElasticz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   del1 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   del2 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   del3 =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi1 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   epsi2 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   gam1 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   gam2 =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ns =301 ®
       file   phi =      auxiliary input file name
       file   the =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mort3de.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

NAME
       sfort3devectorlrkspace_double - None

SYNOPSIS

       ticy.rsf Elasticz=Elasticz.rsf ElasticPx=ElasticPx.rsf  ElasticPy=Elas‐
       ticPy.rsf    ElasticPz=ElasticPz.rsf    ElasticSx=ElasticSx.rsf   Elas‐
       ticSy=ElasticSy.rsf  ElasticSz=ElasticSz.rsf  seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-6
       npk=20 ns= dt=

       file   ElasticPy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ElasticPz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ElasticSx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ElasticSy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ElasticSz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   Elasticy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   Elasticz =      auxiliary output file name
       dt     = ®
       eps    =1.e-6      tolerance
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       ns     = ®
       seed   =time(NULL ®

sfort3dhomodevK(1) Madagascar Manuals sfort3dhomodevK(1)

NAME
       sfort3dhomodevK  -  3D three-components projection deviation correction
       operators calculation in

SYNOPSIS
       sfort3dhomodevK  >  Fo1.rsf  apvy=Fo2.rsf  apvz=Fo3.rsf   taper=Fo4.rsf
       vp0=3000.0  vs0=1500.0  de1=0.05  de2=-0.05  de3=0.15  ep1=0.2 ep2=0.05
       ga1=0.1 ga2=0.1 alpha=0. the=0. phi=0. hnx=250 hny=250  hnz=250  dx=10.
       dy=10. dz=10. itaper=1

COMMENTS
       *  homogeneous orthorhombic media Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University,
       Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng and Tengfei Wang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under  the  terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the
       Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at  your
       option) any later version.

       This  program  is  distributed  in the hope that it will be useful, but
       WITHOUT ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of  MER‐
       CHANTABILITY  or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =0.  ®
       file   apvy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvz =      auxiliary output file name
       float  de1 =0.05 ®
       float  de2 =-0.05 ®
       float  de3 =0.15 ®
       float  dx =10.  ®
       float  dy =10.  ®
       float  dz =10.  ®
       float  ep1 =0.2 ®
       float  ep2 =0.05 ®
       float  ga1 =0.1 ®
       float  ga2 =0.1 ®
       int    hnx =250 ®
       int    hny =250 ®
       int    hnz =250 ®
       int    itaper =1 ®
       float  phi =0.  ®
       file   taper =      auxiliary output file name
       float  the =0.  ®
       float  vp0 =3000.0 ®
       float  vs0 =1500.0 ®

       user/chengjb/Mort3dhomodevK.c

sfort3dhomodevcK(1) Madagascar Manuals sfort3dhomodevcK(1)

NAME
       sfort3dhomodevcK  -  Correct  projection  deviation in K-domian for 3-D
       pseudo-pure P-wave field in homogeneous ORT media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfort3dhomodevcK   <   Fix.rsf   apvy=Fiy.rsf   apvz=Fiz.rsf   PseudoP‐
       urePx=Fi1.rsf PseudoPurePy=Fi2.rsf PseudoPurePz=Fi3.rsf > Fo1.rsf Pseu‐
       doPureSepP=Fo2.rsf

COMMENTS
       Refernces: Cheng et al. (15th IWSA, 2012);  Cheng  and  Kang  (SEG  Ab‐
       stract,  2012); Kang and Cheng (SEG Abstract, 2012) Wang et al.(SEG Ab‐
       stract, 2012)

       then  optimzied by Jiubing Cheng for Madagascar version at BEG, Univer‐
       sity of Texas at Austin.

       under  the  terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the
       Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at  your
       option) any later version.

       This  program  is  distributed  in the hope that it will be useful, but
       WITHOUT ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of  MER‐
       CHANTABILITY  or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   PseudoPurePx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   PseudoPurePy =      auxiliary input file name
       file   PseudoPurePz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   PseudoPureSepP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvy =      auxiliary input file name
       file   apvz =      auxiliary input file name

Runs RSF program sfort3dpseudophomo on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfort3dpseudophomo. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfort3dpseudophomo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfort3dpseudophomo(1)

NAME
       sfort3dpseudophomo  -  3-D  three-components  wavefield  modeling using
       pseudo-pure mode P-wave equation in tilted ORT media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfort3dpseudophomo > Fo1.rsf PseudoPurePy=Fo2.rsf  PseudoPurePz=Fo3.rsf
       ns=301  ny=101  nx=101  nz=101 dt=0.001 dx=0.0 dy=0.0 dz=0.0 vp0=3000.0
       vs0=1500.0  epsi1=0.2  epsi2=0.067  del1=0.1  del2=-0.0422   del3=0.125
       gam1=0.1 gam2=0.047 bd=20

COMMENTS
       Refernces:  Cheng  et  al.  (15th  IWSA, 2012); Cheng and Kang (SEG Ab‐
       stract, 2012); Kang and Cheng (SEG Abstract, 2012) Wang et al.(SEG  Ab‐
       stract, 2012)

       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng, Tengfei Wang and Wei Kang

       This  code  is  first written by Tengfei Wang at Tongji University, and
       then optimzied by Jiubing Cheng for Madagascar version at BEG,  Univer‐
       sity of Texas at Austin.

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   PseudoPurePy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPurePz =      auxiliary output file name
       int    bd =20 ®
       float  del1 =0.1 ®
       float  del2 =-0.0422 ®
       float  del3 =0.125 ®
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       float  dx =0.0 ®
       float  dy =0.0 ®
       float  dz =0.0 ®
       float  epsi1 =0.2 ®
       float  epsi2 =0.067 ®
       float  gam1 =0.1 ®
       float  gam2 =0.047 ®
       int    ns =301 ®
       int    nx =101 ®
       int    ny =101 ®
       int    nz =101 ®
       float  vp0 =3000.0 ®
       float  vs0 =1500.0 ®
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mort3dpseudophomo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfortho — Method
sfortho(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfortho on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfortho. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfortho(1) Madagascar Manuals sfortho(1)

NAME
       sfortho - Orthogonolize signal and noise.

SYNOPSIS
       sfortho  <  fnoi.rsf  sig=fsig.rsf > fnoi2.rsf sig2=fsig2.rsf niter=100
       verb=y eps=0.0f rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sig2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mortho.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfortho(1)
source
Madagascar.sforthoa — Method
sforthoa(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforthoa on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforthoa. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforthoa(1) Madagascar Manuals sforthoa(1)

NAME
       sforthoa - Accelerated local orthogonalization

SYNOPSIS
       sforthoa  <  fnoi.rsf  sig=fsig.rsf w=fw.rsf > fnoi2.rsf sig2=fsig2.rsf
       ifns=y  verb=y  ifsm=y  ifnm=y  nrad=1  alpha=0.0  beta=0.0   gamma=0.0
       n1win=n1 n2win=n2 n3win=n3 r1=0.5 r2=0.5 r3=0.5 rect#= shift#=

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =0.0      Regularization in t direction
       float  beta =0.0      Regularization in x direction
       float  gamma =0.0      Regularization in y direction
       bool   ifnm =y [y/n]     if normalize the weight
       bool   ifns =y [y/n]     if apply the non-stationary smoothing radius
       bool   ifsm =y [y/n]     if smooth the weight
       int    n1win =n1      first window length
       int    n2win =n2      second window length
       int    n3win =n3      second window length
       int    nrad =1      NO of smoothing
       float  r1 =0.5      first overlapping ratio
       float  r2 =0.5      second overlapping ratio
       float  r3 =0.5      third overlapping ratio
       string rect#  =       size  of  the smoothing stencil in #-th dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift# =      shifting of the smoothing stencil in  #-th  dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sig2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
       file   w =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Morthoa.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sforthoa(1)
source

       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance

Madagascar.sfortholr3 — Method
sfortholr3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfortholr3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfortholr3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfortholr3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfortholr3(1)

NAME
       sfortholr3  -  Lowrank decomposition for 3-D orthorhombic wave propaga‐
       tion (Real).

SYNOPSIS
       sfortholr3  <  c11.rsf  seta1=seta1.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf   >
       right.rsf  seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4  npk=20  dt= mode=0 tilt=false ap‐
       prox=2

PARAMETERS
       approx =2       Type  of  approximation  (0=exact   1=zone   2=acoustic
              3=tsvankin)
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0       '0'  means  quasi-P  (default),  '1' means quasi-S, '2'
              means quasi-S2
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       file   seta1 =      auxiliary input file name
       tilt   =false ®
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mortholr3.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfortholr3(1)

Madagascar.sfortholrzone — Method
sfortholrzone(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfortholrzone on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfortholrzone. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfortholrzone(1) Madagascar Manuals sfortholrzone(1)

NAME
       sfortholrzone  - Lowrank decomposition for 3-D orthorhombic wave propa‐
       gation with zone's approximation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfortholrzone < c11.rsf  seta1=seta1.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf  >
       right.rsf  seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4  npk=20  dt= mode=0 tilt=false ap‐
       prox=false reduce=false

PARAMETERS
       approx =false      if true, use zone's approximation instead  of  exact
              phase velocity
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0       '0'  means  quasi-P  (default),  '1' means quasi-S, '2'
              means quasi-S2
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       reduce =false      if true, use the expirical linear  relationship  be‐
              tween qv and qh
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       file   seta1 =      auxiliary input file name
       tilt   =false ®
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mortholrzone.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfortholrzone(1)
source
Madagascar.sforthon — Method
sforthon(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforthon on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforthon. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforthon(1) Madagascar Manuals sforthon(1)

NAME
       sforthon - Non-stationary orthogonalization

SYNOPSIS
       sforthon  <  fnoi.rsf sig=fsig.rsf > fnoi2.rsf sig2=fsig2.rsf niter=100
       verb=y eps=0.0f rect#= shift#=

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sig2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Morthon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sforthon(1)
source
Madagascar.sforthonc — Method
sforthonc(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforthonc on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforthonc. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforthonc(1) Madagascar Manuals sforthonc(1)

NAME
       sforthonc - Non-stationary orthogonalization for complex value

SYNOPSIS
       sforthonc  < fnoi.rsf sig=fsig.rsf > fnoi2.rsf sig2=fsig2.rsf niter=100
       verb=y eps=0.0f rect#= shift#=

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sig2 =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Morthonc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sforthonc(1)
source
Madagascar.sforthowave — Method
sforthowave(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sforthowave on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sforthowave. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sforthowave(1) Madagascar Manuals sforthowave(1)

NAME
       sforthowave - Simple 3-D wave propagation

SYNOPSIS
       sforthowave  < Fw.rsf > Fo.rsf ref=Fr.rsf snaps=snaps.rsf left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf mid=mid.rsf verb=y cmplx=n pad1=1 snap=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       file   mid =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Morthowave.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sforthowave(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfortllr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfortllr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfortllr(1)

NAME
       sfortllr  - Lowrank decomposition for 3-D orthorhombic wave propagation
       with linearization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfortllr   <   velz.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   >   middle.rsf    left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt=

PARAMETERS
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       file   right =      auxiliary output file name
       seed   =time(NULL ®
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mortllr.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfortllr(1)

PARAMETERS
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mosam3dckxyyz.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfosam3dckxyyz(1)
source
Madagascar.sfosam3dckxyzz — Method
sfosam3dckxyzz(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfosam3dckxyzz on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfosam3dckxyzz. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfovc(1) Madagascar Manuals sfovc(1)

NAME
       sfovc - Oriented velocity continuation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfovc < in.rsf > out.rsf eps=0.1 nv=1 lagrange=n v0=0. vmax=

COMMENTS
       Axis order: t, p, x

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.1      stretch regularization
       bool   lagrange =n [y/n]     Use Lagrangian method
       int    nv =1      number of velocity steps
       float  v0 =0.       starting velocity
       float  vmax =      end velocity
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Movc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfovc(1)
source

sfovcco(1) Madagascar Manuals sfovcco(1)

NAME
       sfovcco - Prestack (common-offset) 2-D oriented velocity continuation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfovcco < in.rsf > out.rsf verb=y nv= dv= v0=

COMMENTS
       Axes: (Omega,h,k,p) -> (Omega,v,k,p)

PARAMETERS
       float  dv =      velocity step size
       int    nv =      velocity steps
       float  v0 =      starting velocity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Movcco.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

       grange=n

Madagascar.sfpad — Method
sfpad(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpad on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpad. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpad(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpad(1)

NAME
       sfpad - Pad a dataset with zeros.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpad < in.rsf > out.rsf beg#=0 end#=0 n#=

COMMENTS
       n#out is equivalent to n#, both of them overwrite end#.

       Other  parameters from the command line are passed to the output (simi‐
       lar to sfput).

PARAMETERS
       int    beg# =0      the number of zeros to add before the beginning  of
              #-th axis
       int    end#  =0       the  number of zeros to add after the end of #-th
              axis
       int    n# =      the output length of #-th axis - padding at the end
USED IN
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/ft1/brad
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/real
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate2
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate5
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/sigsbee
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       4 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sf‐
       pad.html
SOURCE
       system/main/pad.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfpad
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfpad(1)
source

       int    bottom =0 ®
       int    left =0 ®
       int    right =0 ®
       int    top =0 ®

       big.rsf extend=y mode=y conf=1 order=2

sfpame2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpame2d(1)

NAME
       sfpame2d  - 2-D elasitc wave modeling and vector field decompostion us‐
       ing pseudo-analytical method

SYNOPSIS
       sfpame2d  vp=fvelp.rsf  vs=fvels.rsf   <   fsource.rsf   >   fwavup.rsf
       wavwp=fwavwp.rsf   wavus=fwavus.rsf   wavws=fwavws.rsf   wavu=fwavu.rsf
       wavw=fwavw.rsf opt=0 dt= nt= isx=  isz=  nbt=44  nbb=44  nxl=44  nxr=44
       czt=0.01 czb=0.01 cxl=0.01 cxr=0.01 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       float  cxl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cxr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czt =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nxl =44 ®
       int    nxr =44      assume ABC pars are the same
       int    opt =0      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   vp =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wavu =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavus =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavw =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavwp =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wavws =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mpame2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfpassive2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpassive2d(1)

NAME
       sfpassive2d - 2-D passive seismic RTM and its adjoint

SYNOPSIS
       sfpassive2d  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf velocity=vel.rsf wave=wave.rsf verb=n
       adj=n pas=n abc=n snap=0 depth=0 nt= dt= cb=0.0f

PARAMETERS
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing boundary condition
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag, 0: modeling, 1: migration
       float  cb =0.0f ®
       int    depth =0      surface
       float  dt = ®
       int    nt = ®
       bool   pas =n [y/n]     passive flag, 0: exploding  reflector  rtm,  1:
              passive seismic imaging
       int    snap =0      wavefield snapshot flag
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name

       user/jsun/Mpassive2d.c

Madagascar.sfpatch — Method
sfpatch(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpatch on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpatch. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpatch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpatch(1)

NAME
       sfpatch - Patching (N-dimensional).

SYNOPSIS
       sfpatch < in.rsf > out.rsf n0= w= p= inv=n verb=n weight=n dim=dim0

COMMENTS
       w  is  window  size  (defaults to n1,n2,...)  p is number of patches in
       different dimensions (defaults to 1,1,...)

       If inv=n, the number of output dimensions is twice the number of  input
       dimensions.  If inv=y, the number of output dimensions is half the num‐
       ber of input dimensions.

       September        2013        program        of        the        month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2013/09/14/program-of-the-month-sfpatch/

PARAMETERS
       int    dim =dim0 ®
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inverse or forward operation
       ints   n0 =      data dimensions (for inv=y) [dim]
       ints   p =      number of windows [dim]
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       ints   w =      window size [dim]
       bool   weight =n [y/n]     if y, apply weighting to each patch
USED IN
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/real
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mpatch.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpatch(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpathmin — Method
sfpathmin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpathmin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpathmin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpathmin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpathmin(1)

NAME
       sfpathmin  -  Program  for  iteratively  determining  the  optimal path
       through a cost function input array.  Input file's second dimension  is
       a  parameter  that  can vary along the path, and the first dimension is
       "time", or a coordinate that the output path, R(t), will be a  function
       of.  Dimensions  greater than 2 in the input array represent additional
       panels to calculate the path through. To use this program for picking a
       path  maximizing  an  objective function, first transform the objective
       function lpha by exp(-1*lpha) and feed the resulting output  to  this
       program. Path integral minimization is in the manner of "Path Optimiza‐
       tion with Application to Tunneling", Dorothea  M.  Einarsdottir,  Andri
       Arnaldsson, Finnbogi Oskarsson, and Hannes Jonsson, 2010

SYNOPSIS
       sfpathmin  < _in.rsf > _out.rsf k=1 kink=1 lr=.3 g=.1 knots=11 niter=10
       damp=.5 shove=1000 aniso1=D[1]/D[0] dorder=6 srad=2 nsmooth=1 eps=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  aniso1 =D[1]/D[0]      anisotropy of 2nd axis relative to first
       float  damp =.5      if the path goes out of  bounds,  we  reflect  and
              dampen the rate of change by this much
       int    dorder =6      derivative order (stencil size) for gradient (dS)
              calculation
       float  eps =0.       if the  change  and  gradient  are  simultaneously
              lower than this, terminate early
       float  g  =.1      scale the momentum for updating the path at each it‐
              eration by how much before applying?
       float  k =1      stiffness relative to attraction
       float  kink =1      resistance to kinks
       int    knots =11      number of knots
       float  lr =.3      learning rate
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       int    nsmooth =1      number of input panel gradient (dS) smoothings
       float  shove =1000      size of initial random lateral shove
       int    srad =2      smoothing radius for input panel gradient (dS)
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mpathmin.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpathmin(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpathmin-mov — Method
sfpathmin-mov(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpathmin-mov on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpathmin-mov. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpathmin-mov(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpathmin-mov(1)

NAME
       sfpathmin-mov  -  Program  for iteratively determining the optimal path
       through a cost function input array.  Input file's second dimension  is
       a  parameter  that  can vary along the path, and the first dimension is
       "time", or a coordinate that the output path, R(t), will be a  function
       of.  Dimensions  greater than 2 in the input array represent additional
       panels to calculate the path through. To use this program for picking a
       path  maximizing  an  objective function, first transform the objective
       function lpha by exp(-1*lpha) and feed the resulting output  to  this
       program. Path integral minimization is in the manner of "Path Optimiza‐
       tion with Application to Tunneling", Dorothea  M.  Einarsdottir,  Andri
       Arnaldsson, Finnbogi Oskarsson, and Hannes Jonsson, 2010

SYNOPSIS
       sfpathmin-mov  <  _in.rsf  >  _out.rsf  k=1  kink=1 lr=.3 g=.1 knots=11
       niter=10 damp=.5 shove=1000 movie= aniso1=D[1]/D[0] dorder=6 srad=2 ns‐
       mooth=1 eps=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  aniso1 =D[1]/D[0]      anisotropy of 2nd axis relative to first
       float  damp  =.5       if  the  path goes out of bounds, we reflect and
              dampen the rate of change by this much
       int    dorder =6      derivative order (stencil size) for gradient (dS)
              calculation
       float  eps  =0.        if  the  change  and gradient are simultaneously
              lower than this, terminate early
       float  g =.1      scale the momentum for updating the path at each  it‐
              eration by how much before applying?
       float  k =1      stiffness relative to attraction
       float  kink =1      resistance to kinks
       int    knots =11      number of knots
       float  lr =.3      learning rate
       int    movie = ®
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       int    nsmooth =1      number of input panel gradient (dS) smoothings
       float  shove =1000      size of initial random lateral shove
       int    srad =2      smoothing radius for input panel gradient (dS)
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mpathmin-mov.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpathmin-mov(1)
source

       niter=0 liter=50 rect=1

       int    nc =1      number of components
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       file   pef =      auxiliary output file name

sfpclipc2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpclipc2(1)

NAME
       sfpclipc2 - One-or Two-sided Percentile Data clipping (C language).

SYNOPSIS
       sfpclipc2 < in.rsf > out.rsf upclip=99 lpclip=0

COMMENTS
       For    example:    A=1,2,3,...,100    sfpclipc2    upclip=98   lpclip=3
       A'=3,3,3,...,98,98,98

       float  lpclip =0      percentile lower cliping value
       float  upclip =99      percentile upper cliping value

RSF Documentation

sfpcrdata2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpcrdata2(1)

NAME
       sfpcrdata2 - Prepare data for 2-D angle-domain migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpcrdata2 < data.rsf > out.rsf verb=n absoff=n filter=y KMAH=y diff=y

PARAMETERS
       bool   KMAH =y [y/n]     y - account for phase shifts due to KMAH index
       bool   absoff  =n  [y/n]     y - absolute offset (default - relative to
              shot axis)
       bool   diff =y [y/n]     y - apply half-order differentiation
       bool   filter =y [y/n]     y - antialiasing filter for data
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mpcrdata2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpcrdata2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpcrdata3 — Method
sfpcrdata3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpcrdata3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

sfpcrdata3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpcrdata3(1)

NAME
       sfpcrdata3 - Prepare data for 3-D angle-domain migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpcrdata3 < data.rsf > out.rsf verb=n erefl=n filter=y KMAH=y diff=y

PARAMETERS
       bool   KMAH =y [y/n]     y - account for phase shifts due to KMAH index
       bool   diff =y [y/n]     y - apply differentiation
       bool   erefl  =n  [y/n]     y  - assume data modeled with exploding re‐
              flector
       bool   filter =y [y/n]     y - antialiasing filter for data
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mpcrdata3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpcrdata3(1)

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpcrsurv3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpcrsurv3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpcrsurv3(1)

NAME
       sfpcrsurv3 - Prepare survey info for 3-D angle-domain migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpcrsurv3  <  data.rsf > survey.rsf sxsy=sxsy.rsf gxgy=gxgy.rsf verb=n
       tri=n esmax=0.2 ehmax=0.1

PARAMETERS
       float  ehmax =0.1      Maximum edge length in the  receiver  triangula‐
              tion
       float  esmax =0.2      Maximum edge length in the shot triangulation
       string gxgy =      File with receiver coordinates (auxiliary input file
              name)
       string sxsy =      File with shot  coordinates  (auxiliary  input  file
              name)
       bool   tri =n [y/n]     triangulation flag
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cram/Mpcrsurv3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpcrsurv3(1)

sfpde2dadp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpde2dadp(1)

NAME
       sfpde2dadp  -  Numerical  solution  of linear pde 2-d (X-Z-a) for phase
       space escape positions, angle and traveltime

SYNOPSIS
       sfpde2dadp   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf   slow=slow.rsf   slowz=slowz.rsf
       slowx=slowx.rsf  iq=  method=  method_2d= niter=100 ixsmooth= izsmooth=
       xsmooth= zsmooth= is_xinf= is_zinf= tol=0.000002*nx*nz cvgce=

PARAMETERS
       string cvgce =      output file for convergence
       int    iq =      switch for escape variable 0=x, 1=a, 2=t, 3=z
       int    is_xinf = ®
       int    is_zinf = ®
       int    ixsmooth = ®
       int    izsmooth = ®
       int    method = ®
       int    method_2d = ®
       int    niter =100      number of Gauss-Seidel iterations
       file   slow =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slowz =      auxiliary input file name
       float  tol =0.000002*nx*nz      accuracy tolerance
       float  xsmooth = ®
       float  zsmooth = ®
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Mpde2dadp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfpdr2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpdr2d(1)

NAME
       sfpdr2d - 2D Parametric Development of Reflections

SYNOPSIS
       sfpdr2d  <  dataFile.rsf  > outFile.rsf aux=auxFile.rsf vel=velFile.rsf
       po=shotStart_ pn=recNum_ pd=recStep_ wh=11

PARAMETERS
       string aux =      output file  containing  semblance  measure  of  CIGs
              stacking (auxiliary output file name)
       float  pd =recStep_      increment of positions in stack section
       int    pn =recNum_      number of positions in stack section
       float  po =shotStart_      start position in stack section
       string vel  =      velocity model file (velocity in m/s) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       int    wh =11      height of a vertical window for  semblance  calcula‐
              tion
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mpdr2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfpef(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpef(1)

NAME
       sfpef - Wiener predictive error filtering

SYNOPSIS
       sfpef   <  inp.rsf  >  out.rsf  wiener=wien.rsf  mix=  minlag=  maxlag=
       pnoise=0.001 nmix=1 mincorr= maxcorr=

PARAMETERS
       float  maxcorr =      end of autocorrelation window in sec
       float  maxlag =      last lag of prediction filter (sec)
       float  mincorr =      start of autocorrelation window in sec
       float  minlag =      first lag of prediction filter (sec)
       floats mix =      weights for moving average  of  the  autocorrelations
              [nmix]
       int    nmix =1      number of weights (floats) for moving averages
       float  pnoise =0.001      relative additive noise level
       string wiener  =       file  to  output Wiener filter (auxiliary output
              file name)
USED IN
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       su/main/pef.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfpef(1)

       in V(x,z)

SYNOPSIS
       sfpermlr3   <   vel.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   left=left.rsf    >    right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL tol=1.e-4 npk=20 dt= eps=0.0 nh= equation=3 sub=true

       eps    =0.0      regularization

              =3      equation type

       file   left =      auxiliary output file name

       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       sub    =true      if subtract one
       tol    =1.e-4      tolerance

       float  oqz =sf_o (az) ®

Madagascar.sfpgreywfl — Method
sfpgreywfl(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpgreywfl. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpgreywfl(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpgreywfl(1)

NAME
       sfpgreywfl - Plot wavefields over a background image

SYNOPSIS
       sfpgreywfl bg=None savefile= title= pclip=100 absclip=n scalebar=y bar‐
       label=  timetext=y   bgcmap=viridis   wflcmap=gray   jsnap=1   aspect=1
       tmin=None   tmax=None   figx=10  figy=8  xints=None  yints=None  fps=15
       speedup=10 dpi=90 fontsize=16 verb=n

COMMENTS
       Common usage examples      * Plot to screen  using  default  parameters
                 sfpgreywfl  <  wavefield.rsf  bg=velocity.rsf       * Save to
       file  using  custom  parameters            sfpgreywfl  <  wavefield.rsf
       bg=velocity.rsf  jsnap=10  bgcmap=gray  wflcmap=seismic  fps=10  verb=y
       savefile=output.mp4

PARAMETERS
       bool   absclip =n [y/n]     Clipping is done  for  all  gathers  rather
              than per frame (y/n)
       int    aspect =1      Aspect ratio
       string barlabel =      Colorbar label
       string bg =None      Background for animation. Zero if not supplied
       string bgcmap   =viridis       Background  colormap.  See  https://mat‐
              plotlib.org/users/colormaps.html
       float  dpi =90      DPI
       float  figx =10      Figure x size in inches
       float  figy =8      Figure y size in inches
       float  fontsize =16      Font size
       float  fps =15      Frames per second (when saving file)
       int    jsnap =1      Number of timesteps at which to plot wavefield
       float  pclip =100      Clip amplitude percentage from (0-100)
       string savefile =      Save animation to file. If not present,  display
              animation.
       bool   scalebar =y [y/n]     Colorbar
       float  speedup  =10      Delay between frames (in milliseconds) will be
              speedup*dt
       bool   timetext =y [y/n]     Time text
       string title =      Plot title
       float  tmax =None      Maximum time
       float  tmin =None      Minimum time
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       string wflcmap =gray      Wavefield colormap (should be sequential)
       int    xints =None      Max number of x intervals
       int    yints =None      Max number of y intervals
SOURCE
       user/cdacosta/Mpgreywfl.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpgreywfl(1)
source

       der=100 ref=1.

sfphasescan(1) Madagascar Manuals sfphasescan(1)

NAME
       sfphasescan - Multicomponent data registration analysis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfphasescan < in.rsf > warped.rsf other=other.rsf verb=y ng=1 g0= dg=g0
       rect1=1 rect2=1 rect3=1 rect4=1 niter=10 accuracy=

PARAMETERS
       int    accuracy = [1-4]     interpolation accuracy
       float  dg =g0      gamma sampling
       float  g0 =      gamma origin
       int    ng =1      number of gamma values
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect1 =1      vertical smoothing
       int    rect2 =1      gamma smoothing
       int    rect3 =1      in-line smoothing
       int    rect4 =1      cross-line smoothing
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mphasescan.c

       4.2-git Mphasescan.c 744 2004-08-17 18:46:07Z songxl

Madagascar.sfpiazpwdmig3 — Method
sfpiazpwdmig3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpiazpwdmig3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpiazpwdmig3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpiazpwdmig3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpiazpwdmig3(1)

NAME
       sfpiazpwdmig3  -  Least-Squares  3D  Path-Summation Integral, Azimuthal
       Plane-Wave Destruction and Kirchhoff Modeling/Migration Chain of Opera‐
       tors

SYNOPSIS
       sfpiazpwdmig3    <    inp.rsf   >   out.rsf   dip=dip.rsf   az=azin.rsf
       vel=velFile.rsf adj=n  v_1=  v_2=  v_3=  v_4=  passthr=0.001  eps=0.001
       epst2=0.001  pad=nt  vel=  rho=1.-1./nt apt=nx angle=90.0 order=1 nj1=1
       nj2=1 sm=y domod=y dopi=y doomp=n antialias=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     Adjoint flag
       float  angle =90.0      angle aperture
       string antialias =      antialiasing type [triangle,flat,steep,none]
       int    apt =nx      integral aperture
       file   az =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   domod =y [y/n]     if perform Kirchhoff modeling/migration
       bool   doomp =n [y/n]     OpenMP
       bool   dopi =y [y/n]     if perform PI filtering
       float  eps =0.001      Damper for pi
       float  epst2 =0.001      Damper for t2warp
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing iline
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing xline
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       int    pad =nt      output time samples
       float  passthr =0.001      Threshold for tail elimination
       float  rho =1.-1./nt      Leaky integration constant
       bool   sm =y [y/n]     if perform AzPWD filtering
       float  v_1 =      Path-integral range
       float  v_2 = ®
       float  v_3 = ®
       float  v_4 = ®
       float  vel =      migration velocity for Kirchhoff
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mpiazpwdmig3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpiazpwdmig3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpick — Method
sfpick(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpick on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpick. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpick(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpick(1)

NAME
       sfpick - Automatic picking from semblance-like panels.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpick  <  scn.rsf  >  pik.rsf  vel0=o2 niter=100 an=1. gate=3 smooth=y
       norm=n back=n rect#=(1,1,...) rect1=1 rect2=1 ...

COMMENTS
       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

       Theory in Appendix B of: S. Fomel, 2009,  Velocity  analysis  using  AB
       semblance:  Geophysical Prospecting, v. 57, 311-321.  Reproducible ver‐
       sion  in   RSFSRC/book/tccs/avo   http://ahay.org/RSF/book/tccs/avo/pa‐
       per_html/

       August  2012 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/08/01/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfpick/

PARAMETERS
       float  an =1.       axes anisotropy
       bool   back =n [y/n]     if run backward
       int    gate =3      picking gate
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       bool   norm =n [y/n]     if apply normalization (0.~1.)
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   smooth =y [y/n]     if apply smoothing
       float  vel0 =o2      surface velocity
USED IN
       bei/vela/vscan
       bei/wvs/vscan
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mpick.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfpick
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpick(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpick2 — Method
sfpick2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpick2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpick2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpick2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpick2(1)

NAME
       sfpick2 - Automatic picking from semblance-like panels (3-D input).

SYNOPSIS
       sfpick2  <  scn.rsf > pik.rsf slice=0 vel0=o2 rect1=1 rect2=1 niter=100
       an=1. gate=3

PARAMETERS
       float  an =1.       axes anisotropy
       int    gate =3      picking gate
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =1      smoothing radius on the first axis
       int    rect2 =1      smoothing radius on the second axis
       int    slice =0      if only one kind of slicing (1: inline, 2: time)
       float  vel0 =o2      surface velocity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mpick2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpick2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpick2d — Method
sfpick2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpick2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpick2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpick2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpick2d(1)

NAME
       sfpick2d - 2D picking

SYNOPSIS
       sfpick2d < dataFile_.rsf > outFile_.rsf eps=0 xApp=1

COMMENTS
       Input: dataFile_.rsf - parameter spectrum (semblance) panel

       Output: outFile_.rsf - picked optimal values

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0      smoothness measure
       int    xApp =1      x-aperture
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mpick2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpick2d(1)
source

sfpick3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpick3(1)

NAME
       sfpick3 - Automatic picking  from 3-D semblance-like panels.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpick3  <  scn.rsf  > pik.rsf vel1=o2 vel2=o3 rect1=1 niter=100 an1=1.
       an2=1. gate1=3 gate2=3 smooth=y

PARAMETERS
       float  an1 =1.  ®
       float  an2 =1.       axes anisotropy
       int    gate1 =3 ®
       int    gate2 =3      picking gate
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =1      smoothing radius
       bool   smooth =y [y/n]     if apply smoothing
       float  vel1 =o2 ®
       float  vel2 =o3      surface velocity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mpick3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpick3(1)

sfpick31(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpick31(1)

NAME
       sfpick31  -  Automatic picking from 3D semblance-like panels plus addi‐
       tional axis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpick31 < scn.rsf > pik.rsf vel1=o2 vel2=o3 rect1=1  niter=100  an1=1.
       an2=1. gate1=3 gate2=3 smooth=y verb=y

PARAMETERS
       float  an1 =1.  ®
       float  an2 =1.       axes anisotropy
       int    gate1 =3 ®
       int    gate2 =3      picking gate
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =1      smoothing radius
       bool   smooth =y [y/n]     if apply smoothing
       float  vel1 =o2 ®
       float  vel2 =o3      surface velocity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mpick31.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfpickmaxima — Method
sfpickmaxima(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpickmaxima on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpickmaxima. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpickmaxima(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpickmaxima(1)

NAME
       sfpickmaxima  -  Picking  local  maxima  on  the first axis with evenly
       spaced windows.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpickmaxima    <    in.rsf    >    out.rsf     semblance=semblance.rsf
       npicks=npicks.rsf min=o1 max=o1+(n1-1)*d1 np=n1 nw=1 space=100. parab=n
       removal=y

PARAMETERS
       float  max =o1+(n1-1)*d1      maximum value of time
       float  min =o1      minimum value of time
       int    np =n1      maximum number of picks
       file   npicks =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nw =1      number of windows
       bool   parab =n [y/n]     if y, parabolic interpolation
       bool   removal =y [y/n]     if y, remove adjacent events based on  sem‐
              blance
       file   semblance =      auxiliary input file name
       float  space =100.       minimum distance bewteen picked events
SOURCE
       user/zhiguang/Mpickmaxima.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfpickmaxima(1)
source

sfpickprint(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpickprint(1)

NAME
       sfpickprint - Write predictive painting result into a txt file

SYNOPSIS
       sfpickprint   <  in.rsf  pick=pick.rsf  npick=npick.rsf  semblance=sem‐
       blance.rsf verb=y cut=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  cut =0.       muting value in boundary
       file   npick =      auxiliary input file name
       file   pick =      auxiliary input file name
       file   semblance =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     if y, print icdp/ncdp during operation
SOURCE
       user/zhiguang/Mpickprint.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfpicks2rsf — Method
sfpicks2rsf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpicks2rsf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpicks2rsf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpicks2rsf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpicks2rsf(1)

NAME
       sfpicks2rsf - Creates a mask from horizons:

SYNOPSIS
       sfpicks2rsf < in.rsf > out.rsf ntic=5 tmask=y extend=n above=n picks=

COMMENTS
       horizon format:

       x1 h1 x2 h2 x3 h3 x4 h4 xn hn

       xn> ... >x4 >x3 >x2>x1

       picks  (file)   ascii  file  with two columns (x and h(x)) the x values
       must be increasing order, you can easily achieve that by doing:

       sort -k 1  unsorted_picks.txt > sorted_picks.txt

       stdin             2D file from which  the  axes  will  be  read  extend
       [false]     Extends picks to the boundaries of the axis n Do not extend
       y Extend to boundary

       tmask [true]     write a mask (1 if z>h(x)) false     put a tic on  the
       horizon

       above [false] put 1 above the horizon true   put 1 below the horizon

       ntic  [1]      works  with  tmask=false;  put 1 around ntic grid points
       above and below the horizon.

       stdout       It writes a file with the same dimensions as stdin with  a
       mask function, 1 below the horizon 0 above

PARAMETERS
       bool   above =n [y/n]
       bool   extend =n [y/n]
       int    ntic =5 ®
       string picks =      parameters from input file
       bool   tmask =y [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/ediazp/Mpicks2rsf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpicks2rsf(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpipwdmig2 — Method
sfpipwdmig2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpipwdmig2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpipwdmig2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpipwdmig2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpipwdmig2(1)

NAME
       sfpipwdmig2 - Chain of Path Integral, Plane-Wave Destruction and Kirch‐
       hoff migration (based on sfmig2)

SYNOPSIS
       sfpipwdmig2 < inp.rsf > out.rsf vel=fvel.rsf dip=dip.rsf adj=n sm=y do‐
       mod=y  pi=y  verb=n  doomp=y  apt=nx  angle=90.0  hd=y ps=y dd=y half=y
       rho=1.-1./nt v_1= v_2= v_3= v_4=  passthr=0.001  eps=0.001  epst2=0.001
       pad=nt order=1 nj1=1 antialias=

COMMENTS
       works only for zero offset

       make sure nh = 1 dh = 1.0 h0 = 0.0 offset file is not used

       there  are flags to disable PWD (Plane-Wave Destruction), P (Path-Inte‐
       gral Filter) and L (Kirchhoff modelling/migration)

       no regularization

       can be expressed for forward as: data = P PWD L (  reflections  +  dif‐
       fractions ) or as a matrix

       | P PWD L   P PWD L | |              | = | data |

       can be expressed for adjoint as:

       adjoint reflections = L^T PWD^T P^T data

       adjoint diffractions = L^T PWD^T P^T data or as a matrix

       |   reflections    |     |  L^T  PWD^T  P^T  |  |               |  =  |
       | | data | | diffractions |   | L^T PWD^T P^T |

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  angle =90.0      angle aperture
       string antialias =      antialiasing type [triangle,flat,steep,none]
       int    apt =nx      integral aperture
       bool   dd =y [y/n]     differentiation in the data domain
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   domod =y [y/n]     if perform modeling via  Kirchhoff  (if  dis‐
              abled -> chain = P PWD)
       bool   doomp =y [y/n]     OMP flag - currently hard-coded to y
       float  eps =0.001      damper for pi
       float  epst2 =0.001      damper for t2warp
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the third axis is half-offset instead of
              full offset
       bool   hd =y [y/n]     half derivative
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       int    pad =nt      output time samples
       float  passthr =0.001      threshold for tail elimination
       bool   pi =y [y/n]     if perform Path-Integral filtering (if  disabled
              -> chain = PWD L)
       bool   ps =y [y/n]     amplitude correction
       float  rho =1.-1./nt      leaky integration constant
       bool   sm  =y  [y/n]     if perform Plane-Wave destruction (if disabled
              -> chain = P L)
       float  v_1 =      no pass velocity
       float  v_2 =      first pass velocity
       float  v_3 =      second pass velocity
       float  v_4 =      no pass velocity
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbose flag
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mpipwdmig2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpipwdmig2(1)
source

sfplane(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplane(1)

NAME
       sfplane - Generating plane waves with steering filters.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplane < inp.rsf > out.rsf p=0.7 a1=2 b1=1 hyp=n lag=

PARAMETERS
       int    a1 =2      filter length
       int    b1 =1      denominator length
       bool   hyp =n [y/n]     generate hyperbolas
       string lag = ®
       float  p =0.7      plane wave slope
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mplane.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfplanemis2 — Method
sfplanemis2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfplanemis2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanemis2(1)

NAME
       sfplanemis2  -  Missing  data interpolation in 2-D using plane-wave de‐
       struction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanemis2 < in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf mask=mask.rsf niter=100  or‐
       der=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 drift=n prec=n verb=n

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing for first dip
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing for second dip
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   prec =n [y/n]     if y, apply preconditioning
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mplanemis2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfplanemis2(1)
source

sfplanemis3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanemis3(1)

NAME
       sfplanemis3  -  Missing  data interpolation in 3-D using plane-wave de‐
       struction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanemis3 < in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf mask=mask.rsf niter=100  or‐
       der=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 drift=n verb=n seed=time(NULL) var=0.

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1 ®
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
       float  var =0.       noise variance
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mplanemis3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfplanemis3(1)

sfplanereg2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanereg2(1)

NAME
       sfplanereg2 - Data regularization in 2-D using plane-wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanereg2  <  in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf interp=2 niter=100 order=1
       drift=n verb=n eps=0.01 head=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       string head = ®
       int    interp =2      interpolation length
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mplanereg2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfplanereg2(1)
