sfplanereg3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanereg3(1)

NAME
       sfplanereg3 - Data regularization in 3-D using plane-wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanereg3  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  xkey=  ykey=  interp=2
       niter=100 eps=0.01 order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 drift=n verb=n head=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       string head = ®
       int    interp =2      interpolation length
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1 ®
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    xkey =      x key number
       int    ykey =      y key number

       user/pwd/Mplanereg3.c

sfplanesig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanesig(1)

NAME
       sfplanesig - Signal separation using plane-wave destruction filters.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanesig  < in.rsf dips=dips.rsf > out.rsf eps= niter=50 order=1 nj=1
       drift=n verb=n

PARAMETERS
       file   dips =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       floats eps =       [nc]
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations
       int    nj =1      antialiasing
       int    order =1 ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mplanesig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfplanesignoi — Method
sfplanesignoi(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfplanesignoi on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfplanesignoi. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfplanesignoi(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplanesignoi(1)

NAME
       sfplanesignoi  -  Signal and noise separation using plane-wave destruc‐
       tion filters.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplanesignoi < in.rsf ndip=ndip.rsf sdip=sdip.rsf >  out.rsf  niter=50
       eps=1. order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 drift=n verb=n

COMMENTS
       If  n3=1  in the output, outputs both signal and noise. Otherwise, only
       signal.

PARAMETERS
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =1.       regularization parameter
       file   ndip =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing for noise dip
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing for signal dip
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       file   sdip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mplanesignoi.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfplanesignoi(1)
source

Madagascar.sfplas — Method
sfplas(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfplas on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfplas. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

Madagascar.sfplsurf — Method
sfplsurf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfplsurf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfplsurf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfplsurf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfplsurf(1)

NAME
       sfplsurf - Generate a surface plot.

SYNOPSIS
       sfplsurf  < in.rsf wantaxis=y wantaxis1=y wantaxis2=y wantaxis3=y want‐
       title=y labelsz=8.0  titlesz=10.0  labelfat=1  titlefat=1  font=2  min‐
       val=SF_HUGE  maxval=-SF_HUGE  alt=35.0  az=25.0  mesh=y meshc=VP_YELLOW
       sides=n bcontour=n scontour=n nc=10 faceted=n label1=  label2=  label3=
       unit1= unit2= unit3= title= wheretitle= color=

PARAMETERS
       float  alt =35.0      altitude [0;90]
       float  az =25.0      azimuth
       bool   bcontour =n [y/n]     draw contour lines at the bottom
       string color =      color scheme (default is i)
       bool   faceted  =n  [y/n]     each cell is faceted on the surface (sur‐
              face mode only)
       int    font =2      font
       string label1 = ®
       string label2 = ®
       string label3 = ®
       int    labelfat =1      label fatness
       float  labelsz =8.0      label font size
       float  maxval =-SF_HUGE      maximum value for the vertical  axis  (de‐
              fault is data maximum)
       bool   mesh =y [y/n]     what to draw: true - mesh, false - shaded sur‐
              face
       int    meshc =VP_YELLOW      mesh color or surface contour color
       float  minval =SF_HUGE      minimum value for the  vertical  axis  (de‐
              fault is data minimum)
       int    nc =10      number of contour lines
       bool   scontour =n [y/n]     draw contour lines on the surface (surface
              mode only)
       bool   sides =n [y/n]     draw sides
       string title = ®
       int    titlefat =1      title fatness
       float  titlesz =10.0      title font size
       string unit1 = ®
       string unit2 = ®
       string unit3 = ®
       bool   wantaxis =y [y/n]     if generate axes with ticks and labels
       bool   wantaxis1 =y [y/n]
       bool   wantaxis2 =y [y/n]
       bool   wantaxis3 =y [y/n]
       bool   wanttitle =y [y/n]     if include title
       string wheretitle =      where to put title (top,bottom)
SOURCE
       plot/plplot/plsurf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfplsurf(1)
source

sfpmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpmig(1)

NAME
       sfpmig - Slope-based prestack time migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpmig  <  cmp.rsf  xdip=xdip.rsf  hdip=hdip.rsf > mig.rsf half=y mzo=n
       eps=1.0

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =1.0      stretch regularization
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       file   hdip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mzo =n [y/n]     do migration to zero offset
       file   xdip =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mpmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpmig(1)
source

NAME
       sfpmig1 - Slope-based prestack (t,xs,h) time migration .

SYNOPSIS
       sfpmig1  <  csg.rsf  sdip=sdip.rsf  hdip=hdip.rsf > mig.rsf half=y nw=4
       mzo=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       file   hdip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mzo =n [y/n]     do migration to zero offset
       int    nw =4      interpolator size (2,3,4,6,8)
       file   sdip =      auxiliary input file name

sfpmod(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpmod(1)

NAME
       sfpmod - Random plane wave modeling.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpmod  <  inp.rsf  >  out.rsf  np=1  gauss=0  type=1 ampmax=1. rc1=0.2
       rc2=0.2  h1=200.  h2=150.  v1=2000.  v2=3000.   pmax=0.000332   phi=0.1
       xloc=200. seed=time(NULL)

PARAMETERS
       float  ampmax =1.  ®
       int    gauss =0 ®
       float  h1 =200.  ®
       float  h2 =150.  ®
       int    np =1 ®
       float  phi =0.1 ®
       float  pmax =0.000332 ®
       float  rc1 =0.2 ®
       float  rc2 =0.2 ®
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
       int    type =1      1 single plane layer
                     2 two plane layers
                     3 point diffractor
       float  v1 =2000.  ®
       float  v2 =3000.  ®
       float  xloc =200.  ®
SOURCE
       user/rickettj/Mpmod.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfpnmo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpnmo(1)

NAME
       sfpnmo - Slope-based normal moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpnmo  <  cmp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > nmod.rsf vel=vel.rsf offset=offset.rsf
       crv=crv.rsf eta=eta.rsf half=y eps=0.01

PARAMETERS
       string crv =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       file   eta =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary output file name

       half=y eps=0.01 extend=8

Madagascar.sfpnmomf — Method
sfpnmomf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpnmomf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpnmomf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpnmomf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpnmomf(1)

NAME
       sfpnmomf - Normal moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpnmomf  <  cmp.rsf  velocity=velocity.rsf  >  nmod.rsf s=het.rsf off‐
       set=offset.rsf mask=msk.rsf half=y str=0.5 mute=12 CDPtype=  slowness=n
       squared=n h0=0. extend=4 a=

COMMENTS
       Compatible with sfvscan.

       Copyright (C) 2004 University of Texas at Austin

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       int    CDPtype = ®
       string a = ®
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       float  h0 =0.       reference offset
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       string s =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       bool   squared =n [y/n]     if y, the slowness or velocity is squared
       float  str =0.5      maximum stretch allowed
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mpnmomf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpnmomf(1)
source

sfpocs(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpocs(1)

NAME
       sfpocs - n-D POCS interpolation using a hard thresholding

SYNOPSIS
       sfpocs < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=Fmask.rsf verb=n niter=100 pclip=10. n#=

COMMENTS
       Note: Acquistion geometry specified by mask operator.

PARAMETERS
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n# =      size of #-th axis
       int    niter =100      total number iterations
       float  pclip =10.       starting data clip percentile (default is 99)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mpocs.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpocs(1)
source

Madagascar.sfpocsseislet — Method
sfpocsseislet(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpocsseislet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpocsseislet. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpocsseislet(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpocsseislet(1)

NAME
       sfpocsseislet - Seislet-based POCS interpolation (2d validation)

SYNOPSIS
       sfpocsseislet < Fin.rsf mask=Fmask.rsf > Fout.rsf dip=Fdip.rsf eps=0.01
       order=1 pscale=25 verb=n niter=10 pclip=99 p=0.35 type= mode=

COMMENTS
       POCS=projection onto convex sets

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       string mode =      thresholding mode: 'hard', 'soft','pthresh','exp';
                     'hard', hard thresholding;  'soft', soft thresholding;
                     'pthresh',  generalized   quasi-p;   'exp',   exponential
              shrinkage
       int    niter =10      total number iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order for seislet transform
       float  p =0.35      norm=p, where 0<p<=1
       float  pclip =99      starting data clip percentile (default is 99)
       float  pscale  =25       percentile of small scale to be preserved (de‐
              fault is 25)
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mpocsseislet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpocsseislet(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpocssemb — Method
sfpocssemb(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

sfpocssemb(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpocssemb(1)

NAME
       sfpocssemb  - POCS using semblance thresholding or amplitude threshold‐
       ing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpocssemb   <   inp.rsf   mask=m.rsf   >   outp.rsf    spec2=spec2.rsf
       spec1=spec1.rsf  snr=snr.rsf  true=trued.rsf  niter=10  ifsnr=0 pmin=-2
       pmax=2 np=nx type=

PARAMETERS
       int    ifsnr =0      If compute SNR during iteration
       file   mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =10      Get the number of iterations
       int    np =nx      number of p
       float  pmax =2      maximum p
       float  pmin =-2      minimum p
       file   snr =      auxiliary output file name
       string spec1 =      auxiliary output file name
       string spec2 =      auxiliary output file name
       string true =      auxiliary input file name
       string type =      [amplitude, semblance] thresholding  type,  the  de‐
              fault is amplitude thresholding
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mpocssemb.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpocssemb(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfpolyfit(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpolyfit(1)

NAME
       sfpolyfit - Fitting a polynomial by least-squares.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpolyfit < inp.rsf > out.rsf coef=coef.rsf coord=coord.rsf reg=reg.rsf
       eps=0.0f np=1 n1= d1= o1=

PARAMETERS
       string coef =      (optional) coefficients (auxiliary output file name)
       string coord =      coordinates (auxiliary input file name)
       float  d1 =      sampling for regularly sampled
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization parameter
       int    n1 =      number of samples for regularly sampled
       int    np =1      polynomial order
       float  o1 =      origin for regularly sampled
       string reg =      (optional) regularly sampled (auxiliary  output  file
              name)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mpolyfit.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpolyfit(1)

Madagascar.sfpostfilter2 — Method
sfpostfilter2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpostfilter2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpostfilter2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpostfilter2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpostfilter2(1)

NAME
       sfpostfilter2 - Convert B-spline coefficients to data in 2-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpostfilter2 < in.rsf > out.rsf nw= vert=y horz=y

PARAMETERS
       bool   horz =y [y/n]     include filter on the second axis
       int    nw =      filter size
       bool   vert =y [y/n]     include filter on the first axis
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mpostfilter2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpostfilter2(1)
source

sfpostrtm2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpostrtm2d(1)

NAME
       sfpostrtm2d - 2-D exploding-reflector RTM and its adjoint

SYNOPSIS
       sfpostrtm2d  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf velocity=vel.rsf wave=wave.rsf adj=y
       snap=n n0=0 jt=50 nt= dt= padx=nz/2 padz=nz/2

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     adjoint flag, 0: modeling, 1: migration
       float  dt = ®
       int    jt =50      time interval of wavefield snapshot
       int    n0 =0      surface
       int    nt = ®
       int    padx =nz/2 ®
       int    padz =nz/2 ®
       bool   snap =n [y/n]     wavefield snapshot flag
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name

sfpreconstkirch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpreconstkirch(1)

NAME
       sfpreconstkirch - Prestack Kirchhoff modeling/migration in constant ve‐
       locity.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpreconstkirch < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n zero=n aal=y nh= dh= h0= vel=

COMMENTS
       Requires the input to be in (time,cmp x,cmp y,offset)

PARAMETERS
       bool   aal =y [y/n]     if y, apply antialiasing
       float  dh =      offset sampling
       float  h0 =      offset origin
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, modeling; if n, migration
       int    nh =      number of offsets
       float  vel =      velocity
       bool   zero =n [y/n]     if y, stack in migration
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/matt
       bei/dpmv/yalei
       bei/krch/sep73
       bei/trimo/mig
       bei/trimo/mod
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mpreconstkirch.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfprekirch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfprekirch(1)

NAME
       sfprekirch - 2-D Prestack Kirchhoff time migration with antialiasing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfprekirch  <  inp.rsf  vel=vel.rsf  >  mig.rsf  nz=nt  dz=dt z0=t0 an‐
       tialias=1.0

COMMENTS
       The axes in the input are {time,midpoint,offset} The axes in the output
       are {time,midpoint}

PARAMETERS
       float  antialias =1.0      antialiasing
       float  dz =dt ®
       int    nz =nt ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       float  z0 =t0 ®

       user/chenyk/Mprekirch.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfprekirchsr — Method
sfprekirchsr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfprekirchsr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfprekirchsr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfprekirchsr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfprekirchsr(1)

NAME
       sfprekirchsr  - 2-D Prestack Kirchhoff time migration with antialiasing
       in source-receiver domain.

SYNOPSIS
       sfprekirchsr vel=vel.rsf < inp.rsf > outp.rsf nz=nt dz=dt  z0=t0  adj=n
       antialias=1.0

COMMENTS
       The axes in the input are {time,receiver,source} The axes in the output
       are      {time,receiver}       I(t0,x0)=int       (W(t0,y0,s,r)       *
       u(s,r,T(s,t0,x0)+T(r,t0,x0)) dsdr

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]
       float  antialias =1.0      antialiasing
       float  dz =dt ®
       int    nz =nt ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       float  z0 =t0 ®
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mprekirchsr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfprekirchsr(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpremig — Method
sfpremig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpremig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpremig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpremig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpremig(1)

NAME
       sfpremig - Pseudo-spectral pre-stack source-receiver source independent
       diffraction imaging

SYNOPSIS
       sfpremig < Fi.rsf  >  Fo.rsf  vel=Fv.rsf  dat_v=Fd_v.rsf  dat_2=Fi1.rsf
       snaps=snaps.rsf spx= spz= f0= t0= A= snap=0 cmplx=y pad1=1 abc=n roll=n
       born=n diff=n justrec=n nbt= nbb=nbt nbl=nbt nbr=nbt  ct=  cb=ct  cl=ct
       cr=ct  verb=n  ps=n  adj=n  vref=1500  nt=  dt=  gpl=-1  gpl_v=-1 src=0
       n_srcs=1  shtbgn=  shtend=  shtint=  which=0  gpx=-1  gpz=-1   gpx_v=-1
       gpz_v=-1 offset=0 split=1

PARAMETERS
       floats A =      wavelet amplitude [n_srcs]
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       bool   born =n [y/n]     born modeling flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       bool   cmplx =y [y/n]     use complex fft
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       file   dat_2 =      auxiliary input file name
       string dat_v =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   diff =n [y/n]     diffraction imaging flag
       float  dt = ®
       floats f0 =      wavelet peak freq [n_srcs]
       int    gpl =-1      geophone length
       int    gpl_v =-1      geophone height
       int    gpx =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpx_v =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpz =-1      geophone position z
       int    gpz_v =-1      geophone position z
       bool   justrec  =n [y/n]     just need full waveform record (no born or
              rtdm)
       int    n_srcs =1      source type
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    offset =0      nearest offset
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       bool   ps =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       bool   roll =n [y/n]     if n, receiver is independent of source  loca‐
              tion and gpl=nx
       int    shtbgn = ®
       int    shtend = ®
       int    shtint = ®
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       int    split =1      receiver split
       ints   spx =      shot position x [n_srcs]
       ints   spz =      shot position z [n_srcs]
       int    src =0      source type
       floats t0 =      wavelet time lag [n_srcs]
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       float  vref =1500      reference velocity (default using water)
       int    which =0 ®
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mpremig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpremig(1)
source
Madagascar.sfprep4plot — Method
sfprep4plot(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfprep4plot on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfprep4plot. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfprep4plot(1) Madagascar Manuals sfprep4plot(1)

NAME
       sfprep4plot  -  Resamples  a 2-D dataset to the desired picture resolu‐
       tion, with antialias

SYNOPSIS
       sfprep4plot inp= out= verb=n h=768 w=1024 h= w= unit=px ppi= prar=y

COMMENTS
       Only one of the h and w parameters needs to be specified.   If  prar=n,
       no  action  will  be  taken  on axis for which h/w was not specified If
       prar=y and only one par (h or w) is specified, the picture  will  scale
       along both axes until it is of the specified dimension.

PARAMETERS
       string h = ®
       string inp =      input file
       string out =      output file
       int    ppi =      outp. resolution (px/in). Necessary when unit!=px
       bool   prar =y [y/n]     if y, PReserve Aspect Ratio of input
       string unit =px      unit of h and w. Can be: px, mm, cm, in
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     if y, print system commands, outputs
       string w = ®
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mprep4plot.py
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfprep4plot
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfprep4plot(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpresr — Method
sfpresr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpresr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpresr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpresr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpresr(1)

NAME
       sfpresr  - 2-D simplest-form post-stack Kirchhoff time modeling and mi‐
       gration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpresr < in.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf adj=y aa=n sw=0 v0=

COMMENTS
       Suppose the input_image & output_data or input_data & output_image have
       the same dimensions, samplings.  The dottest has been past.

PARAMETERS
       bool   aa =n [y/n]     yes: apply reciprocal antialiaising operator
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     yes: migration, no: modeling
       int    sw =0      if > 0, select a branch of the antialiasing operation
       float  v0 =      constant velocity (if no velocity=)
       string vel =      velocity file (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mpresr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpresr(1)
source

sfprestolt(1) Madagascar Manuals sfprestolt(1)

NAME
       sfprestolt - Prestack Stolt modeling/migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfprestolt < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n depth=n stack=y nh= dh= vel= pad=nt
       extend=4

PARAMETERS
       bool   depth =n [y/n]     y: depth migration, n: time migration
       float  dh =      offset sampling
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     y: modeling, n: migration
       int    nh =      number of offsets
       int    pad =nt      padding on the time axis
       bool   stack =y [y/n]     if y: stack migrated image
       float  vel =      constant velocity
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mprestolt.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

       niter=100 verb=n

       file   filt =      auxiliary input file name
       int    lag =1      lag for internal convolution
       int    niter =100      number of iterations

Madagascar.sfps2d — Method
sfps2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfps2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfps2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfps2d(1)

NAME
       sfps2d  -  2-D  attenuating  wavefield  simulation using Fourier Pseudo
       Spectral method

SYNOPSIS
       sfps2d < Fv.rsf Qp=FQp.rsf > Fw.rsf nb=20 nt= dt= fm=20.0 kt=nt

COMMENTS
       for computing fractional laplacian instead of fractional  time  deriva‐
       tive

PARAMETERS
       file   Qp =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20.0      dominant freq of Ricker wavelet
       int    kt =nt ®
       int    nb =20      thickness of sponge ABC
       int    nt =      number of time steps
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mps2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfps2d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfps_getstring — Method
sfps_getstring(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfps_getstring on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfps_getstring. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsgetstring(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsgetstring(1)

NAME
       sfps_getstring - None

SYNOPSIS
       sfps_getstring

SOURCE
       trip/iwave/base/main/ps_getstring.cc

VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfps_getstring(1)
source

Madagascar.sfpsefd — Method
sfpsefd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsefd on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsefd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsefd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsefd(1)

NAME
       sfpsefd - EFD phase shift wave extrapolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsefd  <  data.rsf  >  imag.rsf vel=modl.rsf wave=wave.rsf jz=40 rz=0
       nz=nz0-rz

PARAMETERS
       int    jz =40      depth step for wave data
       int    nz =nz0-rz      depth number
       int    rz =0      receiver depth
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mpsefd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpsefd(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpseudo — Method
sfpseudo(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpseudo on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpseudo. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpseudo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpseudo(1)

NAME
       sfpseudo  - Generate rank-1 approximation for lowrank wave propagation:
       prop1, prop2, prop3, prop4

SYNOPSIS
       sfpseudo < fft.rsf > alpha.rsf flag= reg= nz= dz= z0= nx= dx= x0= seed=
       eps= npk=

PARAMETERS
       dx     = ®
       dz     = ®
       eps    =      tolerance
       flag   = ®
       npk    =      maximum sample rows/columns
       nx     = ®
       nz     = ®
       reg    = ®
       seed   =      seed for random number generator
       x0     =      Get lowrank parameters
       z0     = ®
SOURCE
       user/jingwei/Mpseudo.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpseudo(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpseudodepth — Method
sfpseudodepth(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpseudodepth on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpseudodepth. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpseudodepth(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpseudodepth(1)

NAME
       sfpseudodepth - depth to vertical-time interpolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfpseudodepth  < Fin.rsf tau=Ftau.rsf > Fout.rsf inv=n linear=y n= o=0.
       d=

COMMENTS
       z to tau : pseudodepth < FZ.rsf inv=n tau=tau.rsf n=ntau o=otau  d=dtau
       > FT.rsf tau to z : pseudodepth < FT.rsf inv=y tau=tau.rsf > FZ.rsf

PARAMETERS
       float  d =      tau d (>0)
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, tau to z; if n, tau to z
       bool   linear  =y  [y/n]     if  y,  linear  spline; if n, cubic spline
              (buggy)
       int    n =      tau n
       float  o =0.       tau o
       file   tau =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/xuxin/Mpseudodepth.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpseudodepth(1)
source

sfpseudolrexp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpseudolrexp(1)

NAME
       sfpseudolrexp - Generate rank-1 approximation for lowrank wave propaga‐
       tion: lrexp

SYNOPSIS
       sfpseudolrexp < fft.rsf > alpha.rsf flag= gpz= nt= dt= t0= nz= dz=  z0=
       nx= dx= x0= seed= eps= npk=

PARAMETERS
       dt     = ®
       dx     = ®
       dz     = ®
       eps    =      tolerance
       flag   = ®
       gpz    = ®
       npk    =      maximum sample rows/columns
       nt     = ®
       nx     = ®
       nz     = ®
       seed   =      seed for random number generator
       t0     = ®
       x0     =      Get lowrank parameters
       z0     = ®
SOURCE
       user/jingwei/Mpseudolrexp.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfpseudoprim — Method
sfpseudoprim(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpseudoprim on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpseudoprim. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpseudoprim(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpseudoprim(1)

NAME
       sfpseudoprim - Generate pseudoprimaries using multiples

SYNOPSIS
       sfpseudoprim  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  mul=mul.rsf  verb=n stack=y both=n
       jumpo=1 jumps=1

COMMENTS
       The axes in the input are {offset,shot,frequency} The axes in the  out‐
       put are {offset,shot,frequency} Requirement: offset interval = shot in‐
       terval

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     receiver flag, if y, receiver with both sides
       int    jumpo =1      jump in offset dimension, only for stack=n
       int    jumps =1      jump in shot dimension, only for stack=n
       string mul =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   stack =y [y/n]     stack flag, if  y,  no  common  pseudoprimary
              gather
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mpseudoprim.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfpseudoprim(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpsmig — Method
sfpsmig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsmig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsmig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsmig(1)

NAME
       sfpsmig - 2-D Phase-shift modeling and migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsmig < inp.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf adj=n nw= dw= eps=0.1f

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag, 0: modeling, 1: migration
       float  dw = ®
       float  eps =0.1f      stabilization parameter
       int    nw = ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mpsmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpsmig(1)

Madagascar.sfpsovc — Method
sfpsovc(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsovc on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsovc. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsovc(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsovc(1)

NAME
       sfpsovc - Pre-stack 2-D oriented velocity continuation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsovc < in.rsf > out.rsf verb=y nv= dv= v0=

COMMENTS
       Axes: (Omega,h,p,k) -> (Omega,v,p,k)

       Make sure you use half-offsets for h.

PARAMETERS
       float  dv =      velocity step size
       int    nv =      velocity steps
       float  v0 =      starting velocity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mpsovc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpsovc(1)
source

Madagascar.sfpsp — Method
sfpsp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsp(1)

NAME
       sfpsp - Pseudo-spectral wave extrapolation/migration using second-order
       two-way wave equation

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsp < Fi.rsf > Fo.rsf dat=Fd.rsf dat_v=Fd_v.rsf snaps=snaps.rsf  spx=
       spz=  f0=  t0=  A=  snap=0  cmplx=y  pad1=1  abc=n nbt= nbb=nbt nbl=nbt
       nbr=nbt ct= cb=ct cl=ct cr=ct  verb=n  ps=n  mig=n  vref=1500  nt=  dt=
       gpl=-1 gpl_v=-1 src=0 n_srcs=1 gpx=-1 gpz=-1 gpx_v=-1 gpz_v=-1

PARAMETERS
       floats A =      wavelet amplitude [n_srcs]
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       bool   cmplx =y [y/n]     use complex fft
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       string dat =      auxiliary input file name
       string dat_v =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       floats f0 =      wavelet peak freq [n_srcs]
       int    gpl =-1      geophone length
       int    gpl_v =-1      geophone height
       int    gpx =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpx_v =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpz =-1      geophone position z
       int    gpz_v =-1      geophone position z
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       int    n_srcs =1      source type
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       bool   ps =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       ints   spx =      shot position x [n_srcs]
       ints   spz =      shot position z [n_srcs]
       int    src =0      source type
       floats t0 =      wavelet time lag [n_srcs]
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       float  vref =1500      reference velocity (default using water)
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mpsp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfpsp(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpspifcos2bs — Method
sfpspifcos2bs(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpspifcos2bs on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpspifcos2bs. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpspifcos2bs(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpspifcos2bs(1)

NAME
       sfpspifcos2bs - 1-D finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfpspifcos2bs  <  inp.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf source=source.rsf opt=y
       dt= nt= nv= isx= isz= nb=30 c=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  c =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nb =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nv = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       file   source =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Mpspifcos2bs.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpspifcos2bs(1)
source

NAME
       sfpspig - 1-D finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS

       lmdv= lmdvx=

PARAMETERS
       float  dt = ®
       file   grad =      auxiliary input file name
       float  lmdv = ®
       float  lmdvx =      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       int    nt = ®
       int    nv = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name

       user/songxl/Mpspig.c

Madagascar.sfpspmig — Method
sfpspmig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpspmig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpspmig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpspmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpspmig(1)

NAME
       sfpspmig - Pseudo-spectral migration/de-migration adjoint operators us‐
       ing second-order two-way wave equation

SYNOPSIS
       sfpspmig < Fi.rsf > Fo.rsf  vel=Fv.rsf  dat_v=Fd_v.rsf  snaps=snaps.rsf
       spx=  spz=  f0=  t0= A= snap=0 cmplx=y pad1=1 abc=n born=n nbt= nbb=nbt
       nbl=nbt nbr=nbt ct= cb=ct cl=ct cr=ct verb=n ps=n adj=n  vref=1500  nt=
       dt= gpl=-1 gpl_v=-1 src=0 n_srcs=1 gpx=-1 gpz=-1 gpx_v=-1 gpz_v=-1

PARAMETERS
       floats A =      wavelet amplitude [n_srcs]
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       bool   born =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       bool   cmplx =y [y/n]     use complex fft
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       string dat_v =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       floats f0 =      wavelet peak freq [n_srcs]
       int    gpl =-1      geophone length
       int    gpl_v =-1      geophone height
       int    gpx =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpx_v =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpz =-1      geophone position z
       int    gpz_v =-1      geophone position z
       int    n_srcs =1      source type
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       bool   ps =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       ints   spx =      shot position x [n_srcs]
       ints   spz =      shot position z [n_srcs]
       int    src =0      source type
       floats t0 =      wavelet time lag [n_srcs]
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       float  vref =1500      reference velocity (default using water)
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mpspmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpspmig(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpspp — Method
sfpspp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpspp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpspp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpspp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpspp(1)

NAME
       sfpspp  -  Pseudo-spectral  wave extrapolation for second-order two-way
       wave equation using wavefield injection for passive imaging

SYNOPSIS
       sfpspp < Fi.rsf >  Fo.rsf  wave=Fw.rsf  dat_v=Fd_v.rsf  snaps=snaps.rsf
       spx=  spz=  f0= t0= A= snap=0 cmplx=y pad1=1 abc=n nbt= nbb=nbt nbl=nbt
       nbr=nbt ct= cb=ct cl=ct cr=ct verb=n  ps=n  vref=1500  nt=  dt=  gpl=-1
       gpl_v=-1 src=0 n_srcs=1 gpx=-1 gpz=-1 gpx_v=-1 gpz_v=-1

PARAMETERS
       floats A =      wavelet amplitude [n_srcs]
       bool   abc =n [y/n]     absorbing flag
       float  cb =ct ®
       float  cl =ct ®
       bool   cmplx =y [y/n]     use complex fft
       float  cr =ct ®
       float  ct = ®
       string dat_v =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dt = ®
       floats f0 =      wavelet peak freq [n_srcs]
       int    gpl =-1      geophone length
       int    gpl_v =-1      geophone height
       int    gpx =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpx_v =-1      geophone position x
       int    gpz =-1      geophone position z
       int    gpz_v =-1      geophone position z
       int    n_srcs =1      source type
       int    nbb =nbt ®
       int    nbl =nbt ®
       int    nbr =nbt ®
       int    nbt = ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       bool   ps =n [y/n]     use pseudo-spectral
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       ints   spx =      shot position x [n_srcs]
       ints   spz =      shot position z [n_srcs]
       int    src =0      source type
       floats t0 =      wavelet time lag [n_srcs]
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       float  vref =1500      reference velocity (default using water)
       string wave =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mpspp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpspp(1)
source

NAME
       sfpsss - phase shift wave extrapolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsss  <  data.rsf  >  imag.rsf  vel=modl.rsf wave=wave.rsf jz=40 rz=0
       nz=nz0-rz

PARAMETERS
       int    jz =40      depth step for wave data
       int    nz =nz0-rz      depth number
       int    rz =0      receiver depth
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name

       user/chen/Mpsss.c

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfpsti2d — Method
sfpsti2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsti2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsti2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsti2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsti2d(1)

NAME
       sfpsti2d - Modeling of pure acoustic wave in 2-D transversely isotropic
       meida using psuedospectral method

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsti2d  >  out.rsf  vel=vel.rsf   sigma=fsigma.rsf   delta=fdelta.rsf
       seta=fseta.rsf  <  source.rsf  opt=1  dt=  nt=  isx= isz= nbt=44 nbb=44
       nxl=44 nxr=44 czt=0.01 czb=0.01 cxl=0.01 cxr=0.01 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       float  cxl =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  cxr =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czb =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  czt =0.01      decaying parameter
       file   delta =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nbb =44 ®
       int    nbt =44 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nxl =44 ®
       int    nxr =44      assume ABC pars are the same
       int    opt =1      if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       file   seta =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sigma =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Mpsti2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfpsti2d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpsvp — Method
sfpsvp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpsvp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpsvp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpsvp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpsvp(1)

NAME
       sfpsvp - Ps to vplot

SYNOPSIS
       sfpsvp sep=

PARAMETERS
       string sep =      cmd separater
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mpsvp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpsvp(1)
source
Madagascar.sfptaupmo — Method
sfptaupmo(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfptaupmo on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfptaupmo. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfptaupmo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfptaupmo(1)

NAME
       sfptaupmo - Slope-based tau-p moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfptaupmo  < inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf dipt=dipt.rsf > nmod.rsf vel2=vel2.rsf
       eps=0.01 v0=0. type=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dipt =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       string type =      transform type
       float  v0 =0.       initial velocity
       file   vel2 =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mptaupmo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfptaupmo(1)
source

sfptaupmo3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfptaupmo3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfptaupmo3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfptaupmo3(1)

NAME
       sfptaupmo3 - Slope-based tau-p 3D moveout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfptaupmo3   <   inp.rsf   dip1=dip1.rsf   dip2=dip2.rsf   >   nmod.rsf
       tau0=tau0.rsf eps=0.01

PARAMETERS
       string dip1 =      slope field mesaure along dimension 2(auxiliary  in‐
              put file name)
       string dip2  =      slope field mesaure along dimension 3(auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       string tau0 =      tau0(tau,p) (auxiliary output file name)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mptaupmo3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfptaupmo3(1)

sfptaupmoVTI(1) Madagascar Manuals sfptaupmoVTI(1)

NAME
       sfptaupmoVTI - Slope-based tau-p moveout in VTI.

SYNOPSIS
       sfptaupmoVTI   <   inp.rsf   dip=dip.rsf   ddip=ddip.rsf   >   nmod.rsf
       tau0=tau0.rsf cos2=cos2.rsf eps=0.01

PARAMETERS
       file   cos2 =      auxiliary output file name
       string ddip =      curvature field (auxiliary input file name)
       string dip =      slope field (auxiliary input file name)
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       string tau0 =      tau0(tau,p) (auxiliary output file name)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/MptaupmoVTI.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfput — Method
sfput(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfput on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfput. See ?Madagascar for examples.

NAME
       sfput - Input parameters into a header.

SYNOPSIS
       sfput < in.rsf > out.rsf [parameter=value list]

USED IN
       bei/ft1/ft2d

       bei/trimo/all

       bei/trimo/subsamp

       bei/trimo/veltran

       chen/test/wavmod

       put.html

Madagascar.sfpveltran — Method
sfpveltran(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpveltran on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpveltran. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpveltran(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpveltran(1)

NAME
       sfpveltran - Slope-based velocity transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpveltran < cmp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > vel.rsf dipt=dipt.rsf half=y nv= v0=
       dv= interval=n eps=0.1

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dipt =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dv =      velocity sampling
       float  eps =0.1      stretch regularization
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       bool   interval =n [y/n]     if y, compute interval velocity
       int    nv =      number of velocities
       float  v0 =      velocity origin
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mpveltran.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpveltran(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpveltran3 — Method
sfpveltran3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpveltran3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpveltran3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpveltran3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpveltran3(1)

NAME
       sfpveltran3  -  Slope-based  tau-p 3D velocity transform for elliptical
       anisotropy.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpveltran3  <  input.rsf  >  velx.rsf  vely=vely.rsf   velxy=velxy.rsf
       cmp=cmp.rsf  dipx=dipx.rsf  dipy=dipy.rsf  dipxy=dipxy.rsf map=n inter‐
       val=n  nvx=  vx0=  dvx=  nvy=nvx  vy0=vx0  dvy=dvx  nvxy=101  vxy0=-0.1
       dvxy=0.1 nw=4

COMMENTS
       * The program returns the squared velocity vx,vy,vxy spectra or maps

PARAMETERS
       string cmp =      auxiliary input file name
       string dipx =      auxiliary input file name
       string dipxy =      auxiliary input file name
       string dipy =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dvx =      vx squared velocity sampling
       float  dvxy =0.1      vxy velocity sampling
       float  dvy =dvx      vy squared velocity sampling
       bool   interval =n [y/n]     interval values by 3D stripping equations
       bool   map =n [y/n]     output maps instead of coherency panels
       int    nvx =      number of vx squared velocities
       int    nvxy =101      number of vxy velocities
       int    nvy =nvx      number of vy squared velocities
       int    nw =4      interpolator size (2,3,4,6,8)
       file   velxy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   vely =      auxiliary output file name
       float  vx0 =      vx squared velocity origin
       float  vxy0 =-0.1      vxy velocity origin
       float  vy0 =vx0      vy squared velocity origin
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mpveltran3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpveltran3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpveltranVTI — Method
sfpveltranVTI(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpveltranVTI on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpveltranVTI. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpveltranVTI(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpveltranVTI(1)

NAME
       sfpveltranVTI - Slope-based tau-p velocity transform for VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpveltranVTI   <   tau0.rsf   >   velN.rsf  velH=velH.rsf  eta=eta.rsf
       cmp=cmp.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  curv=curv.rsf  dipt=dipt.rsf  tau0t=tau0t.rsf
       curvt=curvt.rsf  map=n  nv= v0= dv= nvh=nv vh0=v0 dvh=dv ne=101 e0=-0.5
       de=0.01 nw=4 method=

PARAMETERS
       file   cmp =      auxiliary input file name
       string curv =      curvature field (required for method=e and method=d)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       string curvt  =       time  derivative of curvature field (required for
              method=d and method=s) (auxiliary input file name)
       float  de =0.01      eta sampling
       string dip =      slope field  (required  for  method=e  and  method=d)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       string dipt  =      time derivative of slope field(auxiliary input file
              name)
       float  dv =      velocity sampling
       float  dvh =dv      HOR velocity sampling
       float  e0 =-0.5      eta origin
       file   eta =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   map =n [y/n]     output maps instead of coherency panels
       string method =      method to use (stripping,dix,fowler,effective)
       int    ne =101      number of etas
       int    nv =      number of velocities
       int    nvh =nv      number of HOR velocities
       int    nw =4      interpolator size (2,3,4,6,8)
       string tau0t =      tau0 tau derivative field (required  for  method=f)
              (auxiliary input file name)
       float  v0 =      velocity origin
       file   velH =      auxiliary output file name
       float  vh0 =v0      HOR velocity origin
SOURCE
       system/seismic/MpveltranVTI.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfpveltranVTI(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwarp — Method
sfpwarp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwarp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwarp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwarp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwarp(1)

NAME
       sfpwarp - Shift estimation by amplitude-adjusted plane-wave destruction

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwarp  <  inp.rsf other=oth.rsf > shift.rsf ishift=ishift.rsf niter=5
       liter=20 rect1=1 rect2=1 order=1 drift=n verb=n eps=0.0f

PARAMETERS
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       string ishift =      initial shift (auxiliary input file name)
       int    liter =20      number of linear iterations
       int    niter =5      number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect1 =1      shift smoothness on 1st axis
       int    rect2 =1      shift smoothness on 2nd axis
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwarp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpwarp(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwave3d — Method
sfpwave3d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwave3d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwave3d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwave3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwave3d(1)

NAME
       sfpwave3d -

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwave3d > Fdat.rsf verb=n nt= ot= dt= nx= ox= dx= ny= oy= dy= nz= oz=
       dz= vel=1.0 cx=1.0 cy=1.0 cz=1.0

COMMENTS
       generate a plane in t-x-y-z space cx x + cy y + cz z - vel t =  0  (the
       plane goes through the origin)

PARAMETERS
       float  cx =1.0 ®
       float  cy =1.0 ®
       float  cz =1.0 ®
       float  dt = ®
       float  dx = ®
       float  dy = ®
       float  dz = ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    nx = ®
       int    ny = ®
       int    nz = ®
       float  ot = ®
       float  ox = ®
       float  oy = ®
       float  oz = ®
       float  vel =1.0 ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/psava/Mpwave3d.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpwave3d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwcascade — Method
sfpwcascade(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwcascade on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwcascade. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwcascade(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwcascade(1)

NAME
       sfpwcascade - Plane-wave smoothing by box cascade.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwcascade  < inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n eps=0.01 edge=n or‐
       der=1 rect=0 pclip=50. cycle=1

PARAMETERS
       int    cycle =1      number of cycles
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   edge =n [y/n]     preserve edges
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  pclip =50.       percentage clip for the gradient
       int    rect =0      smoothing radius
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwcascade.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpwcascade(1)
source

       der=1 rect=0 pclip=50. cycle=1

       eps=0.01 rect=2 order=1

PARAMETERS

       int    nfw =      calculation window in n1 direction (positive integer)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

Madagascar.sfpwd — Method
sfpwd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwd on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwd(1)

NAME
       sfpwd - 3-D plane wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwd  <  in.rsf  dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf both=n n4=2 order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1
       drift=n

COMMENTS
       February        2013        program        of        the         month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2013/02/09/program-of-the-month-sfpwd/

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     if y, compute both left and right predictions
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    nj1 =1      in-line aliasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line aliasing
       int    order =1      accuracy
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfpwd(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwd1 — Method
sfpwd1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwd1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwd1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwd1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwd1(1)

NAME
       sfpwd1 - One side of plane wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwd1  <  in.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  >  out.rsf  left=y  order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1
       drift=n

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       bool   left =y [y/n]     if using left or right side of PWD
       int    nj1 =1      in-line aliasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line aliasing
       int    order =1      accuracy
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwd1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpwd1(1)

Madagascar.sfpwdchain — Method
sfpwdchain(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwdchain on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwdchain. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwdchain(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdchain(1)

NAME
       sfpwdchain - Multiple dip estimation by chain of PWDs

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdchain < inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf dipin=dipin.rsf nc=1 order=1
       drift=n vp=n verb=(bool) (1 == nt)  niter=0  liter=50  rect1=1  rect2=1
       lambda=1.0f

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary output file name
       string dipin =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       float  lambda =1.0f      scaling
       int    liter =50      number of linear iterations
       int    nc =1      number of components
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       int    order =1      PWD order
       int    rect1 =1 ®
       int    rect2 =1      smoothing radius
       bool   verb =(bool) (1 == nt) [y/n]     verbosity flag
       bool   vp =n [y/n]     if use variable projection
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwdchain.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpwdchain(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwdchain1 — Method
sfpwdchain1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwdchain1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwdchain1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

sfpwdchain1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdchain1(1)

NAME
       sfpwdchain1 - Chain of PWDs - linear operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdchain1  <  inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf sig=sig.rsf > out.rsf adj=n drift=n
       forx=n order=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   drift =n [y/n]     if shift filter
       bool   forx =n [y/n]     for x only
       int    order =1      PWD order
       file   sig =      auxiliary input file name

       user/pwd/Mpwdchain1.c

Madagascar.sfpwddiffuse — Method
sfpwddiffuse(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwddiffuse on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwddiffuse. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwddiffuse(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwddiffuse(1)

NAME
       sfpwddiffuse  - Anisotropic diffusion by regularized inversion. Instead
       of a gradient PWDs in inline and crossline directions are used. 3D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwddiffuse < in.rsf dip=dip.rsf vx=fvx.rsf vy=fvy.rsf >  out.rsf  or‐
       der=1 nj1=1 nj2=1 sm=y niter=10 repeat=1 eps=1. adj=n test=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag - when test=y
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =1.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =10      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       int    nj1 =1      antialiasing iline
       int    nj2 =1      antialiasing xline
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       int    repeat =1      number of smoothing iterations
       bool   sm =y [y/n]     if perform PWD filtering
       bool   test  =n  [y/n]     test  - applied in either forward or adjoint
              mode (no inversion)
       file   vx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vy =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/dmerzlikin/Mpwddiffuse.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfpwddiffuse(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwdecon — Method
sfpwdecon(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwdecon on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwdecon. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwdecon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdecon(1)

NAME
       sfpwdecon  -  Deconvolution  with  known  wavelelt using pwc to control
       sparsity.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdecon   <    in.rsf    dips=dips.rsf    wav=wav.rsf    >    out.rsf
       weight=weight.rsf  sparse=y  reg=0  cut_p=y  order=1  niter=50 nliter=1
       eps=0. verb=y

COMMENTS
PARAMETERS
       bool   cut_p =y [y/n]     cut off value of precondition
       file   dips =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations
       int    nliter =1      number of reweighting iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    reg =0      cut off value of precondition
       bool   sparse  =y  [y/n]     if  sparse  =  ture  sparse  deconvolution
              cauchy-norm
                        if reg = 0: regularization A = |I|
                        if reg = 1:  regularization A = |PWD|
                     if  sparse = false  2-norn deconvolution regularization A
              = ||I||
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   wav =      auxiliary input file name
       string weight =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/gchliu/Mpwdecon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpwdecon(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwdfreq — Method
sfpwdfreq(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwdfreq on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwdfreq. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwdfreq(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdfreq(1)

NAME
       sfpwdfreq - frequency response of PWD operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdfreq  >  out.rsf  n1=50  order=1 o3=20 d3=30 n3=1 iir=n opwd=y ra‐
       dius=1.0 interp=

PARAMETERS
       float  d3 =30      dip angle increment
       bool   iir =n [y/n]     y: iir; n: fir
       string interp =      interpolation method: maxflat lagrange bspline
       int    n1 =50      samples in frequency domain between (0:f_c]
       int    n3 =1      number dip angle
       float  o3 =20      first dip angle
       bool   opwd =y [y/n]     y: circle interpolating pwd; n: line  interpo‐
              lating pwd
       int    order =1      order of PWD
       float  radius =1.0      radius for circle interpolating pwd
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mpwdfreq.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpwdfreq(1)

sfpwdix(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdix(1)

NAME
       sfpwdix - Convert RMS to interval velocity using LS and plane-wave con‐
       struction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdix < vrms.rsf > vint.rsf  weight=weight.rsf  slope=slope.rsf  vrm‐
       sout=vout.rsf niter=100 ncycle=10 rect1=1 verb=n eps=0. order=1

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    ncycle =10      number of cycles for anisotropic diffusion
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    rect1 =1      vertical smoothing radius
       file   slope =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string vrmsout =      optionally, output predicted vrms (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       file   weight =      auxiliary input file name

sfpwdnorm(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwdnorm(1)

NAME
       sfpwdnorm - 3-D plane wave destruction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwdnorm  <  in.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  >  out.rsf  n4=2 order=1 nj1=1 nj2=1
       norm=y

PARAMETERS

       int    n4 =2      what to compute in 3-D. 0: in-line, 1: cross-line, 2:
              both
       int    nj1 =1      in-line aliasing
       int    nj2 =1      cross-line aliasing
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     filter normalization
       int    order =1      accuracy

Madagascar.sfpwic — Method
sfpwic(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfpwic(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwic(1)

NAME
       sfpwic - Least square imaging condition with pwc regularization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwic < in.rsf dips=dips.rsf down=down.rsf > out.rsf weight=weight.rsf
       sparse=y reg=0 cut_p=n niter=50 nliter=1 eps=0. verb=y order=1

COMMENTS
PARAMETERS
       bool   cut_p =n [y/n]     cut off value of precondition
       file   dips =      auxiliary input file name
       file   down =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations
       int    nliter =1      number of reweighting iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    reg =0      cut off value of precondition
       bool   sparse  =y  [y/n]     if  sparse  =  ture  sparse  deconvolution
              cauchy-norm
                        if reg = 0: regularization A = |I|
                        if reg = 1:  regularization A = |PWD|
                     if  sparse = false  2-norn deconvolution regularization A
              = ||I||
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string weight =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/gchliu/Mpwic.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfpwic(1)

sfpwsfault(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwsfault(1)

NAME
       sfpwsfault - Fault detection from plane-wave spray.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwsfault < inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n eps=0.01 ns= niter=20
       perc=98. fact=0.5 order=1 type=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       float  fact =0.5      factor for sharpen
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       int    ns =      spray radius
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  perc =98.       percentage for sharpen, default is 98
       string type =       [difference,sharpen_similarity]  calculation  type,
              the default is difference
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mpwsfault.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpwsfault(1)

sfpwshapeic(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfpwshapeic(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwshapeic(1)

NAME
       sfpwshapeic  -  Least  Square  Imaging  condition using structure-based
       shaping regularization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwshapeic  <  upgw.rsf  >  refl.rsf  down=dwgw.rsf  weight=weight.rsf
       dip=dip.rsf rect1=3 rect2=3 lam=1. order=1 niter=100 rect1= rect2= ...

COMMENTS
       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       file   down =      auxiliary input file name
       float  lam =1.       operator scaling for inversion
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    rect1 =3 ®
       int    rect2 =3      smoothing radius
       file   weight =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/gchliu/Mpwshapeic.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdixshape.c 1131 2005-04-20 18:19:10Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpwshapeic(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwsmooth — Method
sfpwsmooth(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwsmooth on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwsmooth. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwsmooth(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwsmooth(1)

NAME
       sfpwsmooth - 2-D structure-enhancing filtering.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwsmooth  <  in.rsf  dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n ns=0 adj=n eps=0.01
       order=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    ns =0      smoothing radius
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwsmooth.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfpwsmooth(1)
source

sfpwsmooth2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwsmooth2(1)

NAME
       sfpwsmooth2 - 2-D structure-enhancing filtering: two slopes.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwsmooth2  <  in.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n ns=0 adj=n eps=0.01
       order=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    ns =0      smoothing radius
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwsmooth2.c

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfpwsmooth3 — Method
sfpwsmooth3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwsmooth3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwsmooth3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwsmooth3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwsmooth3(1)

NAME
       sfpwsmooth3  - 3-D structural-oriented smoothing using plane-wave spray
       and weighted stacking.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwsmooth3 < inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n eps=0.01  ns2=  ns3=
       bilat=n gauss=n ax= bx= order=1

PARAMETERS
       float  ax =      Gaussian weight for the range distance
       bool   bilat =n [y/n]     if y, bilateral smoothing
       float  bx =      exponential weight for the domain distance
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   gauss  =n  [y/n]     if  y, gaussian weight; otherwise, triangle
              weight
       int    ns2 =      spray radius (inline)
       int    ns3 =      spray radius (crossline)
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mpwsmooth3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfpwsmooth3(1)
source
Madagascar.sfpwspray — Method
sfpwspray(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpwspray on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpwspray. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpwspray(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwspray(1)

NAME
       sfpwspray - Plane-wave spray.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwspray  <  inp.rsf dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf verb=n eps=0.01 ns= order=1
       rect=2 reduce=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    ns =      spray radius
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    rect =2      radius for predictive coherence (reduce=coherence)
       string reduce   =        reduction   method   (none,stack,median,trian‐
              gle,gaussian,predict,coherence)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwspray.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpwspray(1)
source

NAME
       sfpwspray2 - Plane-wave spray in 3-D.

SYNOPSIS

       ns3=

PARAMETERS
