       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    ns2 = ®
       int    ns3 =      spray radius
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity

RSF Documentation

sfpwstack(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpwstack(1)

NAME
       sfpwstack - Recursive stacking by plane-wave construction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpwstack  <  inp.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  >  out.rsf  verb=n eps=0.01 order=1
       mode=1

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    mode =1      1: predict backward, 2: predict forward then  back‐
              ward
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mpwstack.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpwstack(1)

Madagascar.sfpygraph — Method
sfpygraph(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfpygraph on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpygraph. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpygraph(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpygraph(1)

NAME
       sfpygraph - graph by python

SYNOPSIS
       sfpygraph  < input.rsf < xfile.rsf pclip=100 plotfat=1 markint=10 plot‐
       col=0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7  dash=0  symbol=None  legend=None  x=None  usetex=n
       min1=x1[0] max1=x1[n1-1] min2=min2 max2=max2 label1= unit1=None label2=
       unit2=None wantlegend=y wherelegend=1 format=pdf

PARAMETERS
       string dash =0      dash styles
               0   solid line
               1   dash line
               2   dotted line
               3   dash dot
       string format =pdf ®
       string label1 = ®
       string label2 = ®
       string legend =None      legends
       int    markint =10      mark symbol interval
       float  max1 =x1[n1-1] ®
       float  max2 =max2 ®
       float  min1 =x1[0] ®
       float  min2 =min2 ®
       float  pclip =100      clip percent
       string plotcol =0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7      plot color
       int    plotfat =1      plot line width
       string symbol =None      mark symbols
       string unit1 =None ®
       string unit2 =None ®
       bool   usetex =n [y/n]     use tex symbol
       bool   wantlegend =y [y/n]
       int    wherelegend =1 ®
       string x =None      xpos
SOURCE
       user/chen/Mpygraph.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfpygraph(1)
source

NAME
       sfpyramid - Pyramid transform

SYNOPSIS
       sfpyramid < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n nu= du=dx u0=x0 eps=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  du =dx ®
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       int    nu = ®
       float  u0 =x0 ®

       system/seismic/Mpyramid.c

Madagascar.sfpyran — Method
sfpyran(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfpyran. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfpyran(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpyran(1)

NAME
       sfpyran - Add random noise using python.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpyran  <  pi.rsf  > po.rsf axis=2 range=1 seed=n2 type=y mean=0 var=1
       rep=n

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =2 ®
       float  mean =0      noise mean (default=0)
       float  range =1      noise range (default=1)
       bool   rep =n [y/n]     if y, replace data with noise
       int    seed =n2      random seed (default=n2)
       string type =y      noise type, y: normal, n: uniform
       float  var =1      noise variance (default=1)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mpyran.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfpyran(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfpysvd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfpysvd(1)

NAME
       sfpysvd - Perform SVD on a matrix using SCIPY.

SYNOPSIS
       sfpysvd  <  fin.rsf  >  fout.rsf  > lout.rsf > rout.rsf vectors=n left=
       right=

COMMENTS
       REQUIRES the PYTHON API, NUMPY AND SCIPY

PARAMETERS
       string left =      File to store left singular vectors
       string right =      File to store right singular vectors
       bool   vectors =n [y/n]     Output singular vectors?
SOURCE
       user/godwinj/Mpysvd.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfqdome(1) Madagascar Manuals sfqdome(1)

NAME
       sfqdome - 3-D synthetic image from Jon Claerbout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfqdome   >  mod.rsf  trace=trace.rsf  ranget=3.  n1=400  n2=100  n3=50
       large=(int)  n1*ranget  d1=0.004  d2=0.01   d3=0.02   o1=0.   o2=-3.*d2
       o3=-3.*d3 gaussvel=2.5 throw=0.01 endtaper=20 slicei=40 impedance=n

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =0.004 ®
       float  d2 =0.01 ®
       float  d3 =0.02 ®
       int    endtaper =20 ®
       float  gaussvel =2.5 ®
       bool   impedance =n [y/n]
       int    large =(int) n1*ranget ®
       int    n1 =400 ®
       int    n2 =100 ®
       int    n3 =50 ®
       float  o1 =0.  ®
       float  o2 =-3.*d2 ®
       float  o3 =-3.*d3 ®
       float  ranget =3.  ®
       int    slicei =40 ®
       float  throw =0.01 ®
       string trace  =      file to optionally output the master trace (auxil‐
              iary output file name)
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mqdome.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfqdome(1)
source
Madagascar.sfquantile — Method
sfquantile(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfquantile on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfquantile. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfquantile(1) Madagascar Manuals sfquantile(1)

NAME
       sfquantile - Computes what clip value corresponds to a given pclip.

SYNOPSIS
       sfquantile < in.rsf pclip= memsize=sf_memsize()

COMMENTS
       Loads  the entire dataset in core. Use it to find a clip= parameter for
       sfclip, given a wanted pclip=

PARAMETERS
       int    memsize =sf_memsize()      Max amount of RAM (in Mb) to be used
       float  pclip =      Percentage clip, between 0 and 100
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mquantile.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfquantile(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfradial(1) Madagascar Manuals sfradial(1)

NAME
       sfradial - Radial transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfradial < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n nw=2 tp=t0 xp=0. nv= vmin= vmax=

PARAMETERS
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       int    nv =      number of velocities (if inv=n)
       int    nw =2      accuracy level
       float  tp =t0 ®
       float  vmax =      maximum velocity (if inv=n)
       float  vmin =      minimum velocity (if inv=n)
       float  xp =0.  ®
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mradial.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfradial(1)
source

SYNOPSIS

Madagascar.sfradon — Method
sfradon(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfradon on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfradon. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfradon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfradon(1)

NAME
       sfradon - High-resolution Radon transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfradon  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  offset=offset.rsf adj=y inv=adj spk=inv
       verb=n np= dp= p0= nx= eps=1. ns=1 tol=1.e-6 perc=50.0 fact=0.5 ox= dx=
       parab=n x0=1. niter=100

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     if y, perform adjoint operation
       float  dp =      p sampling (if adj=y)
       float  dx = ®
       float  eps =1.  ®
       float  fact =0.5      percentage for sharpening
       bool   inv =adj [y/n]     if y, perform inverse operation
       int    niter =100 ®
       int    np =      number of p values (if adj=y)
       int    ns =1      number of sharpening cycles
       int    nx =      number of offsets (if adj=n)
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       float  ox = ®
       float  p0 =      p origin (if adj=y)
       bool   parab =n [y/n]     if y, parabolic Radon transform
       float  perc =50.0      percentage for sharpening
       bool   spk =inv [y/n]     if y, use spiking (hi-res) inversion
       float  tol =1.e-6      inversion tolerance
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =1.       reference offset
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mradon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfradon(1)
source

sfradon2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

NAME
       sfradon2 - 2to2 Radon transform (using 2to2 butterfly)

SYNOPSIS
       sfradon2 < input.rsf > output.rsf ntau= np= tau0= dtau= p0= dp= N=

PARAMETERS
       N      =      number of partitions
       dp     = ®
       dtau   = ®
       np     = ®
       ntau   = ®
       p0     = ®
       tau0   = ®
SOURCE
       user/jingwei/Mradon2.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfradon2(1)

       dq= N=

       dq     = ®
       dtau   = ®

       nq     = ®

       q0     = ®

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfradon34. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfradon34(1) Madagascar Manuals sfradon34(1)

NAME
       sfradon34  -  azimuthally  anisotropic 3to4 Radon transform (using 3to3
       butterfly)

SYNOPSIS
       sfradon34 < input.rsf > output.rsf ntau= np= nq= ns=  tau0=  dtau=  p0=
       dp= q0= dq= s0= ds= N=

PARAMETERS
       N      =      number of partitions
       dp     = ®
       dq     = ®
       ds     = ®
       dtau   = ®
       np     = ®
       nq     = ®
       ns     = ®
       ntau   = ®
       p0     = ®
       q0     = ®
       s0     = ®
       tau0   = ®
SOURCE
       user/jingwei/Mradon34.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfradon34(1)
source
Madagascar.sfradonoper — Method
sfradonoper(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfradonoper on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfradonoper. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfradonoper(1) Madagascar Manuals sfradonoper(1)

NAME
       sfradonoper - Linear Radon operator.

SYNOPSIS
       sfradonoper  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf adj=y verb=n np= dp= p0= nx= ox= dx=
       parab=n x0=1.

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     if y, perform adjoint operation
       float  dp =      p sampling (if adj=y)
       float  dx = ®
       int    np =      number of p values (if adj=y)
       int    nx =      number of offsets (if adj=n)
       float  ox = ®
       float  p0 =      p origin (if adj=y)
       bool   parab =n [y/n]     if y, parabolic Radon transform
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =1.       reference offset
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mradonoper.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfradonoper(1)
source

       tscale=1. func=

Madagascar.sfrays2 — Method
sfrays2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrays2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrays2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrays2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrays2(1)

NAME
       sfrays2 - Ray tracing by a Runge-Kutta integrator.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrays2  <  vel.rsf  > rays.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf anglefile=angles.rsf
       vel=y order=4 nt= dt=  sym=y  verb=y  escvar=n  zshot=0.  yshot=o[1]  +
       0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] nr= a0=0. amax=360. > rays.rsf

COMMENTS
       Rays can be plotted with sfplotrays.

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =0.       minimum angle (if no anglefile)
       float  amax =360.       maximum angle (if no anglefile)
       string anglefile  =      file with initial angles (auxiliary input file
              name)
       float  dt =      Sampling in time
       bool   escvar =n [y/n]     If y - output escape values, n  -  trajecto‐
              ries
       int    nr =      number of angles (if no anglefile)
       int    nt =      Number of time steps
       int    order =4      Interpolation order
       string shotfile  =       file with shot locations (auxiliary input file
              name)
       bool   sym =y [y/n]     if y, use symplectic integrator
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     If y, input is velocity; if n, slowness
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       float  yshot =o[1] + 0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] ®
       float  zshot =0.       shot coordinates (if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mrays2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfrays2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfrays2a — Method
sfrays2a(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrays2a on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrays2a. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrays2a(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrays2a(1)

NAME
       sfrays2a - Ray tracing in VTI media by a Runge-Kutta integrator.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrays2a  <  vz.rsf  > rays.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf anglefile=angles.rsf
       vel=y  order=4  nt=  dt=  verb=y   escvar=n   zshot=0.   yshot=o[1]   +
       0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] nr= a0=0. amax=360. vx= eta= > rays.rsf

COMMENTS
       Rays can be plotted with sfplotrays.

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =0.       minimum angle (if no anglefile)
       float  amax =360.       maximum angle (if no anglefile)
       string anglefile  =      file with initial angles (auxiliary input file
              name)
       float  dt =      Sampling in time
       bool   escvar =n [y/n]     If y - output escape values, n  -  trajecto‐
              ries
       string eta =      eta parameter
       int    nr =      number of angles (if no anglefile)
       int    nt =      Number of time steps
       int    order =4      Interpolation order
       string shotfile  =       file with shot locations (auxiliary input file
              name)
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     If y, input is velocity; if n, slowness
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       string vx =      horizontal velocity or slowness
       float  yshot =o[1] + 0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1] ®
       float  zshot =0.       shot coordinates (if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mrays2a.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfrays2a(1)
source
Madagascar.sfrays3 — Method
sfrays3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrays3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrays3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrays3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrays3(1)

NAME
       sfrays3 - Ray tracing by a Runge-Kutta integrator in 3-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrays3  <  vel.rsf  > rays.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf anglefile=angles.rsf
       vel=y  order=4  nt=  dt=  sym=y  escvar=n   zshot=o[0]   yshot=o[1]   +
       0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1]   xshot=o[2]   +   0.5*(n[2]-1)*d[2]  na=  nb=  a0=0.
       amax=360. b0=0. bmax=180. > rays.rsf

COMMENTS
       Rays can be plotted with sfplotrays.

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =0.       First azimuth angle in degrees (if anglefile is not
              specified)
       float  amax  =360.       Maximum azimuth angle in degrees (if anglefile
              is not specified)
       string anglefile =      file with initial angles (auxiliary input  file
              name)
       float  b0 =0.       First inclination angle in degrees (if anglefile is
              not specified)
       float  bmax =180.       Maximum inclination angle in degrees (if angle‐
              file is not specified)
       float  dt =      Sampling in time
       bool   escvar  =n  [y/n]     If y - output escape values, n - trajecto‐
              ries
       int    na =      Number of azimuths (if anglefile is not specified)
       int    nb =      Number of inclinations (if anglefile is not specified)
       int    nt =      Number of time steps
       int    order =4      Interpolation order
       string shotfile =      file with shot locations (auxiliary  input  file
              name)
       bool   sym =y [y/n]     if y, use symplectic integrator
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     If y, input is velocity; if n, slowness
       float  xshot =o[2] + 0.5*(n[2]-1)*d[2]      shot location crossline (if
              shotfile is not specified)
       float  yshot =o[1] + 0.5*(n[1]-1)*d[1]      shot  location  inline  (if
              shotfile is not specified)
       float  zshot  =o[0]       shot  location  in  depth (if shotfile is not
              specified)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mrays3.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfrays3(1)
source

sfrdiv(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrdiv(1)

NAME
       sfrdiv - Rough division.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrdiv  <  fnum.rsf  den=fden.rsf  > frat.rsf niter=100 niter2=1 verb=y
       eps=0.01 perc=50.0 fact=0.5

PARAMETERS
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       float  fact =0.5      factor for sharpening
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    niter2 =1      number of outer iterations
       float  perc =50.0      percentage for sharpening
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity

Madagascar.sfrefer — Method
sfrefer(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrefer on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrefer. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrefer(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrefer(1)

NAME
       sfrefer - Subtract a reference from a grid.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrefer < in.rsf > out.rsf ref=ref.rsf

PARAMETERS
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mrefer.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfrefer(1)
source

sfreg2tri(1) Madagascar Manuals sfreg2tri(1)

NAME
       sfreg2tri - Decimate a regular grid to triplets for triangulation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfreg2tri < in.rsf > out.rsf edgeout=edge.rsf nt= zero=0.

PARAMETERS
       string edgeout =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nt =      number of triplets
       float  zero =0.       level surface
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mreg2tri.c

       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfregr — Method
sfregr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfregr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfregr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfregr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfregr(1)

NAME
       sfregr - Linear regression

SYNOPSIS
       sfregr  <  inp.rsf reg=reg.rsf > out.rsf dim=1 niter=10 method=2 verb=n
       n1iter=10 perc=90.0 fact=1.5 type=

PARAMETERS
       int    dim =1      number of dimensions
       float  fact =1.5      percentage for sharpening
       int    method =2      method (L1-like or L2)
       int    n1iter =10      number of POCS iterations
       int    niter =10      number of CG iterations
       float  perc =90.0      percentage for sharpening
       file   reg =      auxiliary input file name
       string type =      thresholding type
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mregr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfregr(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfremap1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfremap1(1)

NAME
       sfremap1 - 1-D ENO interpolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfremap1  <  in.rsf > out.rsf pattern=pattern.rsf n1=n1 d1=d1 o1=o1 or‐
       der=3

COMMENTS
       November        2013        program        of        the         month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2013/11/03/program-of-the-month-sfremap1/

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =d1      Output sampling
       int    n1 =n1      Number of output samples
       float  o1 =o1      Output origin
       int    order =3      Interpolation order
       string pattern =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf2
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mremap1.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfremap1
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfremap1(1)

sfreplace(1) Madagascar Manuals sfreplace(1)

NAME
       sfreplace -

SYNOPSIS
       sfreplace < loga.rsf > log_eo.rsf loc= num=

COMMENTS
       1D dataset padding

       Built  for  time-depth  relationship  manipulation.  LSIM  scan/pick is
       smooth intoducing non-real updates at top of pick.

PARAMETERS
       int    loc =      Location of value used to replace
       int    num =      Number of values to replace at beginning of dataset
SOURCE
       user/sbader/Mreplace.py

       4.2-git

       sfresamp < in.rsf > out.rsf o1=o[0] d1=d[0] o2=o[1] d2=d[1]

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =d[0]      sample interval on 1st axis
       float  d2 =d[1]      sample interval on 2nd axis
       float  o1 =o[0]      first sample sample on 1st axis
       float  o2 =o[1]      first sample on 2nd axis

Madagascar.sfresamplextnd — Method
sfresamplextnd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfresamplextnd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfresamplextnd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfresamplextnd(1)

NAME
       sfresamplextnd - 2D data resampling with ability to extrapolate.

SYNOPSIS
       sfresamplextnd  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  o1=o[0]  d1=d[0] o2=o[1] d2=d[1]
       n1=(d[0]*(n[0]-1)+o[0]-o1)/d1 n2=(d[1]*(n[1]-1)+o[1]-o2)/d2

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =d[0]      sample interval on 1st axis
       float  d2 =d[1]      sample interval on 2nd axis
       int    n1 =(d[0]*(n[0]-1)+o[0]-o1)/d1      number of samples  on  first
              axis
       int    n2  =(d[1]*(n[1]-1)+o[1]-o2)/d2      number of samples on second
              axis
       float  o1 =o[0]      first sample sample on 1st axis
       float  o2 =o[1]      first sample on 2nd axis
SOURCE
       user/luke/Mresamplextnd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfresamplextnd(1)
source

       out2=out2.rsf dim=1

       string in2 =      optional second  input  file  (auxiliary  input  file
              name)
       file   ma =      auxiliary input file name
       file   ma2 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   out2 =      auxiliary output file name

Madagascar.sfrevent — Method
sfrevent(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrevent on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrevent. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrevent(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrevent(1)

NAME
       sfrevent - Compute reflection event

SYNOPSIS
       sfrevent  <  reflFile.rsf  deriv=derivFile.rsf  >  dataFile.rsf tn=1001
       hn=51 sn=1 to=0.f ho=0.f so=0.f td=0.004f hd=0.05f sd=0.025f eps=0.5  *
       hStep vel=2.f

PARAMETERS
       string deriv  =       first  derivative  estimated along the reflection
              boundary (auxiliary input file name)
       float  eps =0.5 * hStep      receiver position accuracy (in km)
       float  hd =0.05f      step in offset (in km)
       int    hn =51      number of offsets
       float  ho =0.f      start offset (in s)
       float  sd =0.025f      step in source position (in km)
       int    sn =1      number of sources
       float  so =0.f      start source position (in s)
       float  td =0.004f      step in time (in s)
       int    tn =1001      number of time samples
       float  to =0.f      start time (in s)
       float  vel =2.f      constant velocity value (in km/s)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mrevent.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfrevent(1)
source
Madagascar.sfreverse — Method
sfreverse(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfreverse on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfreverse. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfreverse(1) Madagascar Manuals sfreverse(1)

NAME
       sfreverse - Reverse one or more axes in the data hypercube.

SYNOPSIS
       sfreverse < in.rsf > out.rsf which=-1 verb=n memsize=sf_memsize() opt=

PARAMETERS
       int    memsize =sf_memsize()      Max amount of RAM (in Mb) to be used
       string opt =      If y, change o and d parameters on the reversed axis;
                     if i, don't change o and d
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
       int    which =-1      Which axis to reverse.
                     To reverse a given axis, start with 0,
                     add 1 to number to reverse n1 dimension,
                     add 2 to number to reverse n2 dimension,
                     add 4 to number to reverse n3 dimension, etc.
                     Thus, which=7 would reverse the first three dimensions,
                     which=5 just n1 and n3, etc.
                     which=0 will just pass the input on through unchanged.
USED IN
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/vela/stretch
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf2
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
SOURCE
       system/main/reverse.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfreverse
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfreverse(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfrfxrna(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrfxrna(1)

NAME
       sfrfxrna - Local prediction filter for complex numbers (n-dimensional).

SYNOPSIS
       sfrfxrna    <    dat.rsf    >    flt.rsf   mask=mask.rsf   pred=pre.rsf
       zshift=zshift.rsf zdata=zdata.rsf ns=1 niter=100 verb=y jump=1 ty=

PARAMETERS
       int    jump =1      jump
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    ns =1      shifts of both sides npef=2*ns+1
       string pred =      auxiliary output file name
       string ty =      Prediction type: all=backward+forward
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string zdata =      auxiliary output file name
       string zshift =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/gchliu/Mrfxrna.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfrfxrna(1)
source

       m= m= m= m= m= n= niter=100 verb=n

PARAMETERS

       floats m =       [n]
       file   ma =      auxiliary output file name
       int    n = ®
       int    niter =100 ®

Madagascar.sfricker — Method
sfricker(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfricker on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfricker. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfricker(1) Madagascar Manuals sfricker(1)

NAME
       sfricker - Ricker wavelet estimation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfricker  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf ma=ma.rsf m=f0+0.25*(na-1)*df niter=100
       verb=n

PARAMETERS
       float  m =f0+0.25*(na-1)*df      initial frequency
       file   ma =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mricker.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfricker(1)
source
Madagascar.sfricker1 — Method
sfricker1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfricker1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfricker1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfricker1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfricker1(1)

NAME
       sfricker1 - Convolution with a Ricker wavelet.

SYNOPSIS
       sfricker1 < in.rsf > out.rsf frequency= freq=0.2 deriv=n

COMMENTS
       January 2013 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2013/01/08/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfricker1/

PARAMETERS
       bool   deriv =n [y/n]     apply a half-order derivative filter
       float  freq =0.2      peak frequency for Ricker wavelet (as fraction of
              Nyquist)
       float  frequency =      peak frequency for Ricker wavelet (in Hz)
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/yalei
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cup/rna3d/sin
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/icomp
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate2
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate5
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/sigsbee
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee

Madagascar.sfricker2 — Method
sfricker2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfricker2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfricker2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfricker2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfricker2(1)

NAME
       sfricker2  - Nonstationary convolution with a Ricker wavelet. Phase and
       Frequency can be time-varying.

SYNOPSIS
       sfricker2 < in.rsf > out.rsf tfreq=tfre.rsf tphase=tpha.rsf  frequency=
       freq=0.2 esp=0. norm=n hiborder=6 hibref=1.

PARAMETERS
       float  esp =0.       if norm=y, stable parameter
       float  freq =0.2      peak frequency for Ricker wavelet (as fraction of
              Nyquist)
       float  frequency =      peak frequency for Ricker wavelet (in Hz)
       int    hiborder =6      Hilbert transformer order
       float  hibref =1.  ®
       bool   norm =n [y/n]
       file   tfreq =      auxiliary input file name
       string tphase =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       carrot/test/modeling
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mricker2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfricker2(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrickerfit. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrickerfit(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrickerfit(1)

NAME
       sfrickerfit  - Model wavelet spectrum by fitting spectral components of
       ricker wavelet.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrickerfit < in.rsf > out.rsf ma1=ma1.rsf ma2=ma2.rsf m= n=  niter=100
       verb=n

COMMENTS
       n is the number of components. ma1 is amplitude, ma2 is peak frequency.

PARAMETERS
       floats m =       [n]
       file   ma1 =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ma2 =      auxiliary output file name
       int    n = ®
       int    niter =100 ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/tsai/Mrickerfit.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfrickerfit(1)

       See also: sfmv, sfcp.

sfrmrf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrmrf(1)

NAME
       sfrmrf - Recursively removes all RSF headers in a directory (associated
       binaries too)

SYNOPSIS
       sfrmrf verb=n dir= rec=n

COMMENTS
       Missing binaries do not cause failure.

PARAMETERS
       string dir =      Directory with files
       bool   rec =n [y/n]     Whether to go down recursively
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Display headers and binaries being deleted
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mrmrf.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfroots(1) Madagascar Manuals sfroots(1)

NAME
       sfroots - Find roots of a complex polynomial.

SYNOPSIS
       sfroots < poly.rsf > root.rsf niter=10 tol=1.0e-6 verb=y sort=

PARAMETERS
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       string sort  =       attribute for sorting (phase,amplitude,real,imagi‐
              nary)
       float  tol =1.0e-6      tolerance for convergence
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE

sfrotate(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrotate(1)

NAME
       sfrotate - Rotate a portion of one or more axes in the data hypercube.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrotate < in.rsf > out.rsf verb=n memsize=sf_memsize() rot#=(0,0,...)

PARAMETERS
       int    memsize =sf_memsize()      Max amount of RAM (in Mb) to be used
       int    rot#  =(0,0,...)        length of #-th axis that is moved to the
              end
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag

       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3

sfrrt3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrrt3d(1)

NAME
       sfrrt3d -

SYNOPSIS
       sfrrt3d  <  Fv.rsf  >  Ft.rsf  verb=n  pick=2 fill=1 scaleray=1. nray=1
       jray=1  gmin=-90  gmax=+90  hmin=0  hmax=180   nt=100   ot=0   dt=0.001
       xsou=sf_o(ax) + sf_n(ax)*sf_d(ax)/2 ysou=sf_o(ay) + sf_n(ay)*sf_d(ay)/2
       zsou=sf_o(az) + sf_n(az)*sf_d(az)/2 seed=time(NULL)

COMMENTS
       * 3-D ray tracing w/ random shooting directions * pcs 2005

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       int    fill =1 ®
       float  gmax =+90 ®
       float  gmin =-90 ®
       float  hmax =180 ®
       float  hmin =0 ®
       int    jray =1 ®
       int    nray =1 ®
       int    nt =100 ®
       float  ot =0 ®
       int    pick =2 ®
       int    scaleray =1.  ®
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
       float  xsou =sf_o(ax) + sf_n(ax)*sf_d(ax)/2 ®
       float  ysou =sf_o(ay) + sf_n(ay)*sf_d(ay)/2 ®
       float  zsou =sf_o(az) + sf_n(az)*sf_d(az)/2 ®
SOURCE
       user/psava/Mrrt3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfrrt3d(1)
source

       cation2.txt

RSF Documentation

sfrtft(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrtft(1)

NAME
       sfrtft - Ricker time-frequency transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtft  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf basis=basis.rsf mask=mask.rsf inv=n verb=n
       nw= dw= w0=0. rect=10 niter=100 alpha=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  alpha =0.       frequency adaptivity
       string basis =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dw =      frequency step
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =100      number of inversion iterations
       int    nw =      number of frequencies
       int    rect =10      smoothing radius
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  w0 =0.       first frequency
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mrtft.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfrtft(1)
source

       sfrtm2d vel=modl.rsf < data.rsf > imag.rsf adj=n n0=0 nt= dt=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, migration; else, modeling
       float  dt =      time sampling interval: dt
       int    n0 =0      shot depth in the grid
       int    nt =      number of time steps
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name

Madagascar.sfrtmadcig — Method
sfrtmadcig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrtmadcig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrtmadcig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrtmadcig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrtmadcig(1)

NAME
       sfrtmadcig  -  RTM  and  angle gather (ADCIG) extraction using poynting
       vector

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtmadcig < vmodl.rsf velsmooth=vmods.rsf > rtmadcig.rsf vecx=vecx.rsf
       vecz=vecz.rsf  amp=1.e3  fm=  dt=  nt=  ns= ng= nb=20 na=30 kt=200 jsx=
       jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg= gxbeg= gzbeg= csdgather=y

COMMENTS
       SPML boundary condition combined with 4-th order finite difference, ef‐
       fective boundary saving strategy used!

PARAMETERS
       float  amp =1.e3      maximum amplitude of ricker wavelet
       bool   csdgather =y [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time interval
       float  fm =      dominant freq of ricker
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    kt =200      record poynting vector at kt
       int    na =30      number of angles
       int    nb =20      thickness of split PML
       int    ng =      total receivers in each shot
       int    ns =      total shots
       int    nt =      total modeling time steps
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       file   vecx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   vecz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   velsmooth =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mrtmadcig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfrtmadcig(1)
source

Madagascar.sfrtmodcig — Method
sfrtmodcig(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrtmodcig on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrtmodcig. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrtmodcig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrtmodcig(1)

NAME
       sfrtmodcig - RTM output ODCIG with extended images

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtmodcig  <  vmodl.rsf  vel1stlayer=vmods.rsf > Fodcig.rsf amp=1. fm=
       dt= nt= ns= ng= nb=20 nh=30 kt=200 jsx= jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg=
       gxbeg= gzbeg= csdgather=y vmute=1500 tdmute=2./(fm*dt)

PARAMETERS
       float  amp =1.       maximum amplitude of ricker wavelet
       bool   csdgather =y [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time interval
       float  fm =      dominant freq of ricker
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    kt =200      record poynting vector at kt
       int    nb =20      thickness of split PML
       int    ng =      total receivers in each shot
       int    nh =30      number of points in offset coordinate
       int    ns =      total shots
       int    nt =      total modeling time steps
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    tdmute =2./(fm*dt)      number of deleyed time samples to mute
       file   vel1stlayer =      auxiliary input file name
       float  vmute =1500      muting velocity to remove the  low-freq  noise,
              unit=m/s
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mrtmodcig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfrtmodcig(1)
source
Madagascar.sfrtmva2d — Method
sfrtmva2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfrtmva2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrtmva2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrtmva2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrtmva2d(1)

NAME
       sfrtmva2d - RTM with checkpointing in 2D acoustic media

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtmva2d  <  Fv.rsf  rho=Frho.rsf tau=Ftau.rsf tauo=Ftauo.rsf > Fw.rsf
       p1=Fp1.rsf  p2=Fp2.rsf  verb=n  nb=20  nt=  dt=  fm=20.0  ns=  ng=  kt=
       nob=(int)log2f(nt)  jsx=  jsz=0 jgx=1 jgz=0 sxbeg= szbeg= gxbeg= gzbeg=
       csdgather=y vmute=1500 tdmute=2./(fm*dt)

COMMENTS
       The real value of checkpointing technology resides in the  backpropaga‐
       tion with viscoacoustic and viscoelastic wave equation, where the wave‐
       field reconstruction method using saved boundaries fails. Here, we only
       demonstrate  how to implement it in acoustic media without dissipation.
       Note the backpropagation operator should be the adjoint of forward mod‐
       eling!  Here we just use forward modeling operator for the time being!

PARAMETERS
       bool   csdgather =y [y/n]     default, common shot-gather; if n, record
              at every point
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20.0      dominant freq of Ricker wavelet
       int    gxbeg =      x-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    gzbeg =      z-begining index of receivers, starting from 0
       int    jgx =1      receiver x-axis jump interval
       int    jgz =0      receiver z-axis jump interval
       int    jsx =      source x-axis jump interval
       int    jsz =0      source z-axis jump interval
       int    kt =      output px and pz component at kt
       int    nb =20      thickness of PML ABC
       int    ng =      number of geophones/receivers per shot
       int    nob  =(int)log2f(nt)       number  of  buffers,  default=optimal
              value
       int    ns =      number of shots
       int    nt =      number of time steps
       file   p1 =      auxiliary output file name
       file   p2 =      auxiliary output file name
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       int    sxbeg =      x-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       int    szbeg =      z-begining index of sources, starting from 0
       file   tau =      auxiliary input file name
       file   tauo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tdmute =2./(fm*dt)      number of deleyed time samples to mute
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       float  vmute  =1500       muting velocity to remove the low-freq noise,
              unit=m/s
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mrtmva2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfrtmva2d(1)
source

NAME
       sfrtoc - Convert real data to complex (by adding zero imaginary part).

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtoc < real.rsf > cmplx.rsf pair=n

COMMENTS
       See also: sfcmplx

PARAMETERS
       bool   pair  =n  [y/n]     y  - use odd elements for real part and even
              ones for imaginary part
USED IN

       bei/ft1/brad

Runs RSF program sfrtseislet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfrtseislet. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfrtseislet(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrtseislet(1)

NAME
       sfrtseislet - Seislet transform using relative time

SYNOPSIS
       sfrtseislet  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf rt=rt.rsf inv=n adj=n eps=0.01 unit=n
       order=1 verb=n type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       file   rt =      auxiliary input file name
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   unit =n [y/n]     if y, use unitary scaling
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/zgeng/Mrtseislet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfrtseislet(1)

RSF Documentation

sfrwe2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfrwe2d(1)

NAME
       sfrwe2d - None

SYNOPSIS
       sfrwe2d rwf=rwfile.rsf swf=swfile.rsf vel=velfile.rsf rays=rays.rsf im‐
       age=imfile.rsf Rimage=Rimage.rsf forward=0.  nref=256  verbose=n  kine‐
       matic=y norm=1 nsx=3 nsz=3 xmin=ax%o xmax=(ax%n-1 zmax=(az%n-1 dxx=ax%d

PARAMETERS
       file   Rimage =      auxiliary output file name
       dxx    =ax%d      call from_par("dzz",dzz,az%d)
       forward
              =0.       Forward scattering option
       file   image =      auxiliary output file name
       kinematic
              =y      Kinematic approximation
       norm   =1      Whether (1) or not (0) to normalize by gnorm
       nref   =256       starting  number  of points for calculating reference
              velocities
       nsx    =3 ®
       nsz    =3 ®
       file   rays =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rwf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       verbose
              =n      level of verbosity
       xmax   =(ax%n-1 ®
       xmin   =ax%o      call from_par("zmin",zmin,az%o)
       zmax   =(az%n-1 ®
SOURCE
       user/jeff/Mrwe2d.f90
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfrwe2d(1)
source

Madagascar.sfsaltpepper — Method

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsaltpepper. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsaltpepper(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsaltpepper(1)

NAME
       sfsaltpepper - Add salt and pepper noise to the data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsaltpepper  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  den=10.  inten=0.1  rep=n allpos=n
       noise=n seed=time(NULL)

PARAMETERS
       bool   allpos =n [y/n]     if y, assume positive noise
       float  den  =10.        noise  density  (percent,  default=10,   Min=0,
              Max=100)
       float  inten  =0.1       noise  intensity (multiple peak value of data,
              default=0.1)
       bool   noise =n [y/n]     if y, output noise only
       bool   rep =n [y/n]     if y, replace data with noise
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Msaltpepper.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfsaltpepper(1)
source

NAME
       sfsbclip1 -

SYNOPSIS

COMMENTS
       One-sided data clipping

       Built  for  log data manipulation - remove extraneous values introduced
       from LSIM shifting

PARAMETERS
       float  clip =      Clipping value
       float  value =      Output if log is less than clip

Madagascar.sfsbd — Method
sfsbd(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsbd on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsbd. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsbd(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsbd(1)

NAME
       sfsbd - 1-D finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsbd < inp.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf grad=grad.rsf what=2

PARAMETERS
       file   grad =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       int    what =2      2nd or 4th order for FD
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Msbd.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfsbd(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsbslice — Method
sfsbslice(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsbslice on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsbslice. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsbslice(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsbslice(1)

NAME
       sfsbslice -

SYNOPSIS
       sfsbslice  <  logrefa.rsf  <  deptha.rsf  <  log1a.rsf  <  log2a.rsf  <
       log3a.rsf  <  log4a.rsf  <  log5a.rsf  <  log6a.rsf   >   logref_co.rsf
       depth_c=depth_co.rsf        log1_c=log1_co.rsf       log2_c=log2_co.rsf
       log3_c=log3_co.rsf        log4_c=log4_co.rsf         log5_c=log5_co.rsf
       log6_c=log6_co.rsf depth= log1= log2= log3= log4= log5= log6=

COMMENTS
       Multiple 1D inputs clipped to length of reference input

       Built for log data manipulation - clips six input logs to the length of
       the reference well log

PARAMETERS
       string depth = ®
       file   depth_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log1 = ®
       file   log1_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log2 = ®
       file   log2_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log3 = ®
       file   log3_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log4 = ®
       file   log4_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log5 = ®
       file   log5_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log6 = ®
       file   log6_c =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/sbader/Msbslice.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfsbslice(1)
source

NAME
       sfsbslice2 -

SYNOPSIS
       sfsbslice2  <  logrefa.rsf  <  deptha.rsf  <  log1a.rsf  <  log2a.rsf <
       log3a.rsf   <   log4a.rsf    >    logref_co.rsf    depth_c=depth_co.rsf
       log1_c=log1_co.rsf         log2_c=log2_co.rsf        log3_c=log3_co.rsf
       log4_c=log4_co.rsf depth= log1= log2= log3= log4=

COMMENTS
       Multiple 1D inputs clipped to length of reference input

       Built for log data manipulation - clips six input logs to the length of
       the reference well log

PARAMETERS

       file   depth_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log1 = ®

       string log2 = ®
       file   log2_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log3 = ®
       file   log3_c =      auxiliary output file name
       string log4 = ®

Madagascar.sfsc — Method
sfsc(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsc on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsc. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsc(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsc(1)

NAME
       sfsc - Surface-consistent decomposition

SYNOPSIS
       sfsc  < inp.rsf pred=pred.rsf error=error.rsf index=index.rsf > out.rsf
       niter=0 prec=y

PARAMETERS
       string error =      prediction (auxiliary output file name)
       file   index =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       bool   prec =y [y/n]     if apply preconditioning
       string pred =      prediction (auxiliary output file name)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Msc.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                           sfsc(1)
source
Madagascar.sfscale — Method
sfscale(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfscale on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfscale. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfscale(1) Madagascar Manuals sfscale(1)

NAME
       sfscale - Scale data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfscale < in.rsf > out.rsf axis=0 rscale=0. pclip=100. dscale=1.

COMMENTS
       To scale by a constant factor, you can also use sfmath.

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =0      Scale by maximum in the dimensions up to this axis.
       float  dscale =1.       Scale by this factor (works if rscale=0)
       float  pclip =100.       data clip percentile
       float  rscale =0.       Scale by this factor.
USED IN
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/krch/sep73
       bei/trimo/all
       bei/vela/stack
       bei/vela/strat
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/tti3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/aniopsize
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/oporder
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate2
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate3
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate5
       12 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sfs‐
       cale.html
SOURCE
       system/main/scale.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfscale

       4.2-git

sfscalestretch(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Madagascar.sfsclet — Method
sfsclet(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsclet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsclet. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsclet(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsclet(1)

NAME
       sfsclet - 2-D SC-seislet: Seislet transform with differential shot con‐
       tinuation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsclet < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=y adj=y unit=n eps=0.1 verb=n type=

COMMENTS
       Forward transform  (adj=y  inv=y)    m=T[d]  Adjoint  transform  (adj=y
       inv=n)   m=T^(-1)'[d] Inverse transform (adj=n inv=y/n) d=T^(-1)[m]

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       float  eps =0.1      regularization parameter
       bool   inv =y [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   unit =n [y/n]     if y, use unitary scaling
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Msclet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfsclet(1)
source
Madagascar.sfseekwin — Method
sfseekwin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseekwin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseekwin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseekwin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseekwin(1)

NAME
       sfseekwin - Test for the seek wrapper function in the F90 API

SYNOPSIS
       sfseekwin < in.rsf > out.rsf whence=sf_seek_set nseek=10 nread=10

COMMENTS
       Works  like sfwindow in 1-D. Extracts consecutive sequence of values in
       N-d.  The following commands should output the integer sequence from 10
       to 19: sfmath n1=20 o1=0 d1=1 type=float output=x1 > junk.rsf <junk.rsf
       sfseekwin | sfdisfil col=10 number=n Cannot take input from a pipe  be‐
       cause stdin cannot be seeked through

PARAMETERS
       nread  =10 ®
       nseek  =10 ®
       whence =sf_seek_set ®
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mseekwin.f90
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfseekwin(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsegyheader — Method
sfsegyheader(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsegyheader on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsegyheader. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsegyheader(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsegyheader(1)

NAME
       sfsegyheader - Make a trace header file for segywrite.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsegyheader < in.rsf > out.rsf tfile=tfile.rsf n1= d1= o1=0

COMMENTS
       Use the output for tfile= argument in segywrite.

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =      trace sampling
       int    n1 =      number of samples in a trace
       float  o1 =0      trace origin
       string tfile =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msegyheader.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfsegyheader(1)

Madagascar.sfsegyread — Method
sfsegyread(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsegyread on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsegyread. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsegyread(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsegyread(1)

NAME
       sfsegyread - Convert a SEG-Y or SU dataset to RSF.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsegyread  mask=msk.rsf > out.rsf tfile=hdr.rsf verb=n su= suxdr=n en‐
       dian=y n2=0 format= ns=0 nsbyte=0 tape= hfile= bfile= read=

COMMENTS
       Data headers and trace headers are separated from the data.

       "suread" is equivalent to "segyread su=y"

       SEGY key names:

       tracl: trace sequence number within line 0

       tracr: trace sequence number within reel 4

       fldr:     field record number 8

       tracf:    trace number within field record 12

       ep:       energy source point number 16

       cdp:      CDP ensemble number 20

       cdpt:     trace number within CDP ensemble 24

       trid:     trace identification code: 1 = seismic data  2  =  dead  3  =
       dummy  4  =  time break 5 = uphole 6 = sweep 7 = timing 8 = water break
       9---, N = optional use (N = 32,767) 28

       nvs:      number of vertically summed traces 30

       nhs:      number of horizontally summed traces 32

       duse:     data use: 1 = production 2 = test 34

       offset:   distance from source point to receiver group (negative if op‐
       posite to direction in which the line was shot) 36

       gelev:     receiver  group elevation from sea level (above sea level is
       positive) 40

       selev:    source elevation from sea level (above sea level is positive)
       44

       sdepth:   source depth (positive) 48

       gdel:     datum elevation at receiver group 52

       sdel:     datum elevation at source 56

       swdep:    water depth at source 60

       gwdep:    water depth at receiver group 64

       scalel:    scale factor for previous 7 entries with value plus or minus
       10 to the power 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 (if positive,  multiply,  if  negative
       divide) 68

       scalco:    scale  factor for next 4 entries with value plus or minus 10
       to the power 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 (if positive, multiply, if  negative  di‐
       vide) 70

       sx:       X source coordinate 72

       sy:       Y source coordinate 76

       gx:       X group coordinate 80

       gy:       Y group coordinate 84

       counit:    coordinate  units code: for previous four entries 1 = length
       (meters or feet) 2 = seconds of arc (in this case, the X values are un‐
       signed longitude and the Y values are latitude, a positive value desig‐
       nates the number of seconds east of Greenwich or north of  the  equator
       88

       wevel:     weathering velocity 90

       swevel:    subweathering velocity 92

       sut:       uphole time at source 94

       gut:       uphole time at receiver group 96

       sstat:     source static correction 98

       gstat:     group static correction 100

       tstat:     total static applied 102

       laga:       lag time A, time in ms between end of 240- byte trace iden‐
       tification header and time break, positive if time break  occurs  after
       end  of  header,  time  break  is defined as the initiation pulse which
       maybe recorded on an auxiliary trace or as otherwise specified  by  the
       recording system 104

       lagb:      lag time B, time in ms between the time break and the initi‐
       ation time of the energy source, may be positive or negative 106

       delrt:     delay recording time, time in ms between initiation time  of
       energy  source and time when recording of data samples begins (for deep
       water work if recording does not start at zero time) 108

       muts:      mute time--start 110

       mute:      mute time--end 112

       ns:        number of samples in this trace 114

       dt:        sample interval, in micro-seconds 116

       gain:      gain type of field instruments code: 1 = fixed 2 = binary  3
       = floating point 4 ---- N = optional use 118

       igc:       instrument gain constant 120

       igi:       instrument early or initial gain 122

       corr:      correlated: 1 = no 2 = yes 124

       sfs:       sweep frequency at start 126

       sfe:       sweep frequency at end 128

       slen:      sweep length in ms 130

       styp:      sweep type code: 1 = linear 2 = cos-squared 3 = other 132

       stas:      sweep trace length at start in ms 134

       stae:      sweep trace length at end in ms 136

       tatyp:     taper type: 1=linear, 2=cos^2, 3=other 138

       afilf:     alias filter frequency if used 140

       afils:     alias filter slope 142

       nofilf:    notch filter frequency if used 144

       nofils:    notch filter slope 146

       lcf:       low cut frequency if used 148

       hcf:       high cut frequncy if used 150

       lcs:       low cut slope 152

       hcs:       high cut slope 154

       year:      year data recorded 156

       day:       day of year 158

       hour:      hour of day (24 hour clock) 160

       minute:    minute of hour 162

       sec:       second of minute 164

       timbas:    time basis code: 1 = local 2 = GMT 3 = other 166

       trwf:      trace weighting factor, defined as 1/2^N volts for the least
       sigificant bit 168

       grnors:    geophone group number of roll switch position one 170

       grnofr:    geophone group number of trace  one  within  original  field
       record 172

       grnlof:     geophone  group  number of last trace within original field
       record 174

       gaps:      gap size (total number of groups dropped) 176

       otrav:     overtravel taper code: 1 = down  (or  behind)  2  =  up  (or
       ahead) 178

       cdpx:   X coordinate of CDP 180

       cdpy:   Y coordinate of CDP 184

       iline:  in-line number 188

       xline:  cross-line number 192

       shnum:  shotpoint number 196

       shsca:  shotpoint scalar 200

       tval:   trace value meas. 202

       tconst4: transduction const 204

       tconst2: transduction const 208

       tunits:  transduction units 210

       device:  device identifier 212

       tscalar: time scalar 214

       stype:   source type 216

       sendir:  source energy dir. 218

       unknown: unknown 222

       smeas4:  source measurement 224

       smeas2:  source measurement 228

       smeasu:  source measurement unit 230

       unass1:  unassigned 232

       unass2:  unassigned 236

       additional  keys can be created in the output trace headers The parame‐
       ters key1, key2, ... key# are used to additional keys.  The  keys  must
       be  unique  and  different  from  the  SEGY key names above.  The input
       header byte location and lengths must also be defined.  This capability
       is described in an example that defines a new keys iline1 from byte 220
       and xline1 from byte 224:        key1=iline1  iline1=220  key1_len=4
       key2=xline1 xline1=224 key2_len=4 key#_len defaults to 4

PARAMETERS
       string bfile =      output binary data header file
       bool   endian =y [y/n]     Whether to automatically estimate endianness
              or not
       int    format = [1,2,3,5] Data format.
                         The default is taken from binary header for segy  in‐
              put.            Default  is  5  for  su input.          1 is IBM
              floating point         2 is 4-byte integer         3  is  2-byte
              integer         5 is IEEE floating point
                     6  is native_float (same as RSF binary default)         7
              is 1-byte integer
       string hfile =      output text data header file
       string mask =      optional  header  mask  for  reading  only  selected
              traces (auxiliary input file name)
       int    n2 =0      number of traces to read (if 0, read all traces)
       int    ns  =0       Number of samples. The default is taken from binary
              header
       int    nsbyte =0      byte number for ns in binary header
       string read =      what to read: h - header, d - data, b  -  both  (de‐
              fault)
       bool   su = [y/n]     y if input is SU, n if input is SEGY
       bool   suxdr =n [y/n]     y, SU has XDR support.
                         SU with xdr on (as downloaded), use endian=y suxdr=y
                         SU  with  xdr  off  in  the  makefiles,  use endian=n
              suxdr=n
       string tape =      input data
       string tfile =      output trace header  file  (auxiliary  output  file
              name)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/sigsbee
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf2
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
       data/alaska/foldplot
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
       data/boem-g3d1206-002a/displayin
       data/bpmodel94/firstlook
       data/bpstatics94/firstlook
       data/bptti/data
       data/bptti/modl
       data/bptti2007/firstlook
       data/bpvelanal2004/firstlook
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msegyread.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfsegyread
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfsegyread(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsegywrite — Method
sfsegywrite(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsegywrite on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsegywrite. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsegywrite(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsegywrite(1)

NAME
       sfsegywrite - Convert an RSF dataset to SEGY or SU.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsegywrite  < in.rsf tfile=hdr.rsf verb=n endian=y su= suxdr=n suxdr=n
       tape= hfile= bfile=

COMMENTS
       Merges trace headers with data.

       "suwrite" is equivalent to "segywrite su=y"

       If bfile= and/or hfile= are not provided, they will be created automat‐
       ically using information from the trace headers.

       The file for tfile= can be generated with sfsegyheader.

PARAMETERS
       string bfile =      input binary data header file
       bool   endian =y [y/n]     Whether to automatically estimate endianness
              or not
       string hfile =      input text data header file
       bool   su = [y/n]     y if input is SU, n if input is SEGY
       bool   suxdr =n [y/n]     y, SU has XDR support
       string tape =      output data
       file   tfile =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msegywrite.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfsegywrite
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsegywrite(1)
source
Madagascar.sfseisavf — Method
sfseisavf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseisavf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseisavf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseisavf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseisavf(1)

NAME
       sfseisavf  -  1-D  amplitude  versus  frequency (AVF) analysis with 1-D
       seislet frames

SYNOPSIS
       sfseisavf < in.rsf  >  out.rsf  freq=w.rsf  thr=t.rsf  verb=y  ncycle=0
       niter=1 type=

PARAMETERS
       file   freq =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ncycle =0      number of iterations
       int    niter =1      number of Bregman iterations
       file   thr =      auxiliary input file name
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mseisavf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfseisavf(1)
source
Madagascar.sfseisbreg2 — Method
sfseisbreg2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseisbreg2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseisbreg2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseisbreg2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseisbreg2(1)

NAME
       sfseisbreg2  - Missing data interpolation in 2D using seislet and Breg‐
       man shaping iteration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfseisbreg2 < in.rsf > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf mask=mask.rsf  niter=20  or‐
       der=1 verb=n eps=0.01 perc=99. order=1 type= oper=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       string oper  =      [bregman,thresholding] method, the default is breg‐
              man
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  perc =99.       percentage for soft thresholding
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mseisbreg2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfseisbreg2(1)
source

sfseiscut(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseiscut on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseiscut. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseiscut(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseiscut(1)

NAME
       sfseiscut - Seislet Transform Denoising using Mask Operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfseiscut  <  in.rsf  dip=dip.rsf > out.rsf slet=slet.rsf sletcut=slet‐
       cut.rsf cut=n2/4 eps=0.01 order1=1 eps=0.01 type=

PARAMETERS
       int    cut =n2/4      cut threshold value
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    order1 =1      accuracy order for seislet transform
       string slet =      seismic domain (auxiliary output file name)
       string sletcut =      cutted  seislet  domain  (auxiliary  output  file
              name)
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mseiscut.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfseiscut(1)

sfseishrink(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseishrink(1)

NAME
       sfseishrink - 2-D Seislet shrinkage denoising.

SYNOPSIS
       sfseishrink   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf   dip=dip.rsf  lcurve=lcurve.rsf
       hcurve=hcurve.rsf norm=norm.rsf order=1 verb=n dwt=n eps=0.01  perc=90.
       nperc=1 type=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   dwt =n [y/n]     if y, dwt in vertical axis
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       string hcurve =      auxiliary output file name
       string lcurve =      auxiliary output file name
       string norm =      auxiliary output file name
       int    nperc =1      number of percentage dimension
       int    order =1 [1,2,3]   accuracy order
       float  perc =90.       percentage for shrinkage
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mseishrink.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfseishrink(1)

RSF Documentation

sfseisigk(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseisigk(1)

NAME
       sfseisigk - Signal component separation using seislet transforms.

SYNOPSIS
       sfseisigk  <  in.rsf dips=dips.rsf > out.rsf weight=weight.rsf niter=50
       nliter=1 eps=0. eps0=0.01 verb=n order=1 type=

COMMENTS
       The program works with 2-D data. The second dimension should be a power
       of 2.

PARAMETERS
       file   dips =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.       regularization parameter
       float  eps0 =0.01      regularization for seislet
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations
       int    nliter =1      number of reweighting iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       string type =      wavelet type (haar,linear)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string weight =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mseisigk.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfseisigk(1)
source
Madagascar.sfseislet — Method
sfseislet(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseislet on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseislet. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseislet(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseislet(1)

NAME
       sfseislet - Seislet transform

SYNOPSIS
       sfseislet  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf inv=n adj=n eps=0.01 unit=n
       order=1 verb=n type=

COMMENTS
       April 2017 program of the  month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2017/04/19/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfseislet/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   unit =n [y/n]     if y, use unitary scaling
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
USED IN
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/circle
SOURCE
       user/pwd/Mseislet.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfseislet(1)
source

NAME

       type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if y, do adjoint transform
       file   freq =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
