Madagascar.sfseismis2 — Method
sfseismis2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfseismis2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfseismis2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfseismis2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseismis2(1)

NAME
       sfseismis2 - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using seislet transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfseismis2  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf mask=mask.rsf niter=20 or‐
       der=1 verb=n cut=n eps=0.01  order=1  cnum=n2  orderc=1.  perc=99.  or‐
       dert=1. ordert=1. type= oper=

PARAMETERS
       int    cnum =n2      Max cutting in cutting operator, default is n2
       bool   cut =n [y/n]     cutting flag, the default is shaping
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       string oper    =        [destruction,construction,shaping,pocs,bregman]
              method, the default is shaping
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  orderc =1.       Curve order for cutting  operator,  default  is
              linear
       float  ordert  =1.       Curve order for thresholding operator, default
              is linear
       float  perc =99.       percentage for soft-thresholding
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mseismis2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfseismis2(1)
source

NAME
       sfseispocs  -  Missing  data interpolation using POCS added 2-D seislet
       transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfseispocs < in.rsf >  out.rsf  dip=dip.rsf  mask=mask.rsf  convex=con‐
       vex.rsf  niter=20  order=1  verb=n  eps=0.01  order=1 perc=90. fact=0.5
       type=

PARAMETERS
       string convex =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization parameter
       float  fact =0.5      percentage for smooth
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       float  perc =90.       percentage for smooth
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is biorthogonal

sfseisthr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfseisthr(1)

NAME
       sfseisthr - Seislet Transform Denoising using Thresholding

SYNOPSIS
       sfseisthr  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf dip=dip.rsf slet=slet.rsf sletthr=slet‐
       thr.rsf eps=0.01 pclip=99. order1=1 eps=0.01 type= thrtype=

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       int    order1 =1      accuracy order for seislet transform
       float  pclip =99.       data clip percentile (default is 99)
       string slet =      seismic domain (auxiliary output file name)
       string sletthr =      thresholded seislet domain (auxiliary output file
              name)
       string thrtype  =       [soft,hard]  thresholding  type, the default is
              soft
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mseisthr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfselfblend(1) Madagascar Manuals sfselfblend(1)

NAME
       sfselfblend - Self blending for simple test.

SYNOPSIS
       sfselfblend  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  seed=time(NULL)  type=y var= range=
       mean=0 t0=n1*dt

PARAMETERS
       float  mean =0      noise mean
       float  range =      dithering time range (default=1)
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
       float  t0 =n1*dt      scheduled time interval between  two  consecutive
              shots in one source
       bool   type  =y  [y/n]     dithering  time  distribution, y: normal, n:
              uniform
       float  var =      dithering time variance
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mselfblend.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfselfblend(1)

sfsensitivity(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsensitivity(1)

NAME
       sfsensitivity - Traveltime sensitivity kernels.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsensitivity  >  out.rsf  nx=100 ny=1 nz=100 ox=0. oy=0. oz=0. dx=0.02
       dy=0.02 dz=0.02 v0=1.5 vgrad=.8 mode=6  sx=0.15  sy=0.  sz=0.15  rx=1.6
       ry=0. rz=1.605 t1=0.8 t2=1.2 dt=0.008

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.008 ®
       float  dx =0.02 ®
       float  dy =0.02 ®
       float  dz =0.02      grid spacing
       int    mode =6      source coordinates
       int    nx =100 ®
       int    ny =1 ®
       int    nz =100      dimensions
       float  ox =0.  ®
       float  oy =0.  ®
       float  oz =0.       grid origin
       float  rx =1.6 ®
       float  ry =0.  ®
       float  rz =1.605      receiver
       float  sx =0.15 ®
       float  sy =0.  ®
       float  sz =0.15      source
       float  t1 =0.8 ®
       float  t2 =1.2 ®
       float  v0 =1.5      surface velocity
       float  vgrad =.8      velocity gradient
SOURCE
       user/rickettj/Msensitivity.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfsensitivity(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsepcmplx2rsf — Method
sfsepcmplx2rsf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsepcmplx2rsf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsepcmplx2rsf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsepcmplx2rsf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsepcmplx2rsf(1)

NAME
       sfsepcmplx2rsf - Convert legacy SEPlib complex datasets to RSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfsepcmplx2rsf file= preserve_t=y verb=n

COMMENTS
       I.e. from

       esize=8 data_format=xdr_float

       to

       esize=8 data_format=xdr_complex

       This  combination  is  tolerated  by  SEPlib  versions  released  after
       2011-01-20, and required by all versions of Madagascar. Previous to the
       date  above,  it  was  impossible  to  have  a complex single-precision
       dataset that was valid both in SEPlib and Madagascar

       This program opens the SEPlib file in read-write mode!

       Handles in=stdin case (header and data in one file)

PARAMETERS
       string file =      Name of file to process
       bool   preserve_t =y [y/n]     Whether to preserve timestamp
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Say if file was converted or unchanged
SOURCE
       user/seplib_compat/Msepcmplx2rsf.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfsepcmplx2rsf(1)
source

Madagascar.sfsgelfd2dpml — Method
sfsgelfd2dpml(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsgelfd2dpml on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsgelfd2dpml. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsgelfd2dpml(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsgelfd2dpml(1)

NAME
       sfsgelfd2dpml  - A k-space staggered-grid lowrank finite-difference for
       elastic and viscoelastic seismic-wave modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfsgelfd2dpml  <  vpfp.rsf  vs=vsfp.rsf   rho=rhofp.rsf   Gpx=Gpxfp.rsf
       Gpz=Gpzfp.rsf  Gsx=Gsxfp.rsf  Gsz=Gszfp.rsf sxx=sxxfp.rsf sxz=sxzfp.rsf
       szx=szxfp.rsf    szz=szzfp.rsf    >    snapfpx.rsf    snapz=snapfpz.rsf
       snappx=snapfppx.rsf       snappz=snapfppz.rsf       snapsx=snapfpsx.rsf
       snapsz=snapfpsz.rsf order=12 dt= nt= fpeak=20.0 isrcx=  isrcz=  npml=30
       verb=1 freesurface=0 igz=1 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       file   Gpx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gpz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gsx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gsz =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       float  fpeak =20.0 ®
       int    freesurface =0      recerver
       int    igz =1 ®
       int    isrcx = ®
       int    isrcz = ®
       int    npml =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    order =12      source
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   snappx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snappz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapsx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapsz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   sxx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sxz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szz =      auxiliary input file name
       int    verb =1      freesurface
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Msgelfd2dpml.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfsgelfd2dpml(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsgelfd2dpml2 — Method
sfsgelfd2dpml2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsgelfd2dpml2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsgelfd2dpml2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsgelfd2dpml2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsgelfd2dpml2(1)

NAME
       sfsgelfd2dpml2 - A k-space staggered-grid lowrank finite-difference for
       elastic and viscoelastic seismic-wave modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfsgelfd2dpml2  <  vpfp.rsf  vs=vsfp.rsf  rho=rhofp.rsf   Gpx=Gpxfp.rsf
       Gpz=Gpzfp.rsf  Gsx=Gsxfp.rsf  Gsz=Gszfp.rsf sxx=sxxfp.rsf sxz=sxzfp.rsf
       szx=szxfp.rsf    szz=szzfp.rsf    >    snapfpx.rsf    snapz=snapfpz.rsf
       snappx=snapfppx.rsf       snappz=snapfppz.rsf       snapsx=snapfpsx.rsf
       snapsz=snapfpsz.rsf order=12 dt= nt= fpeak=20.0 isrcx=  isrcz=  npml=30
       verb=1 freesurface=0 igz=1 snap=1

PARAMETERS
       file   Gpx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gpz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gsx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gsz =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt = ®
       float  fpeak =20.0 ®
       int    freesurface =0      recerver
       int    igz =1 ®
       int    isrcx = ®
       int    isrcz = ®
       int    npml =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       int    order =12      source
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =1 ®
       file   snappx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snappz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapsx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapsz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   snapz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   sxx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sxz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szz =      auxiliary input file name
       int    verb =1      freesurface
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/junyan/Msgelfd2dpml2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfsgelfd2dpml2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsgfd1 — Method
sfsgfd1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsgfd1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsgfd1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsgfd1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsgfd1(1)

NAME
       sfsgfd1 - 1-D staggered Grid Finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsgfd1  <  Fsrc.rsf  vel=Fvel.rsf  den=Fden.rsf > Fwf.rsf rec=Frec.rsf
       ic=Fic.rsf    presrc=Fpsrc.rsf    velsrc=Fvsrc.rsf    preinit=Fpint.rsf
       velinit=Fvint.rsf  verb=n  srcmms=n  slx=  srcdecay=n srctrunc=1000 in‐
       ject=y gdep=0 snapinter=1 pmlsize=PMLOUT  pmld0=PMLD0  decay=DECAY_FLAG
       decaybegin=DECAY_BEGIN freesurface=n size=4

PARAMETERS
       int    decay  =DECAY_FLAG      Flag of decay boundary condtion: 1 = use
              ; 0 = not use
       int    decaybegin =DECAY_BEGIN      Begin time of using decay  boundary
              condition
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   freesurface =n [y/n]     free surface
       float  gdep =0      recorder depth
       file   ic =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inject  =y [y/n]     inject = y use inject source; inject =n use
              initial condition
       int    pmld0 =PMLD0      PML parameter
       int    pmlsize =PMLOUT      size of PML layer
       file   preinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   presrc =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rec =      auxiliary output file name
       int    size =4      FD half order
       float  slx =      source location in x
       int    snapinter =1      snap interval
       bool   srcdecay =n [y/n]     source decay y=use
       bool   srcmms =n [y/n]     source type: if y, use point source
       float  srctrunc =1000      source trunc time (s)
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velsrc =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msgfd1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfsgfd1(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsgfdewe2d — Method
sfsgfdewe2d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsgfdewe2d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsgfdewe2d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsgfdewe2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsgfdewe2d(1)

NAME
       sfsgfdewe2d - 2-D staggered-grid elastic time-domain FD modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfsgfdewe2d  datax=dataxf.rsf  dataz=datazf.rsf  vp=vpf.rsf  vs=vsf.rsf
       rho=rhof.rsf nshot=1 dshot=1  nx=nvx  nabs=50  sx_ini=  sz_ini=5  hsz=5
       tmax= dt= peak=20

COMMENTS
       10th order in space, 2th order in time.

PARAMETERS
       file   datax =      auxiliary output file name
       file   dataz =      auxiliary output file name
       int    dshot =1      shot interval, multiple of receiver intervals
       float  dt =      time interval
       int    hsz =5      vertical position of recerivers
       int    nabs =50      width of padded boundary
       int    nshot =1      number of shots
       int    nx =nvx      coverage area for each shot
       float  peak =20      peak frequency for Ricker wavelet (in Hz)
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       int    sx_ini =      horizontal position of shot point
       int    sz_ini =5      vertical position of shot point
       float  tmax =      record length
       file   vp =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/zhiguang/Msgfdewe2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsgfdewe2d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsglfd1pml — Method
sfsglfd1pml(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsglfd1pml on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsglfd1pml. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsglfd1pml(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglfd1pml(1)

NAME
       sfsglfd1pml - 1-D Lowrank Finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglfd1pml < Fsrc.rsf vel=Fvel.rsf den=Fden.rsf > Fwf.rsf rec=Frec.rsf
       G=FG.rsf  sx=Fsx.rsf   ic=Fic.rsf   presrc=Fpsrc.rsf   velsrc=Fvsrc.rsf
       preinit=Fpint.rsf  velinit=Fvint.rsf  verb=n  srcmms=n  slx= srcdecay=n
       srctrunc=1000 inject=y gdep=0.0 snapinter=1 pmlsize=PMLOUT  pmld0=PMLD0
       decay=DECAY_FLAG decaybegin=DECAY_BEGIN freesurface=n

PARAMETERS
       file   G =      auxiliary input file name
       int    decay  =DECAY_FLAG      Flag of decay boundary condtion: 1 = use
              ; 0 = not use
       int    decaybegin =DECAY_BEGIN      Begin time of using decay  boundary
              condition
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   freesurface =n [y/n]     free surface
       float  gdep =0.0      depth of geophone
       file   ic =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inject  =y  [y/n]     inject=y  use  inject source; inject=n use
              initial condition
       int    pmld0 =PMLD0      PML parameter
       int    pmlsize =PMLOUT      size of PML layer
       file   preinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   presrc =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rec =      auxiliary output file name
       float  slx =      source location in x
       int    snapinter =1      snap interval
       bool   srcdecay =n [y/n]     source decay y=use
       bool   srcmms =n [y/n]     source type: if y, use point source
       float  srctrunc =1000      source trunc time (s)
       file   sx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velsrc =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglfd1pml.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsglfd1pml(1)
source

sfsglfd2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglfd2(1)

NAME
       sfsglfd2 - 2-D Low Rank Finite-difference wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglfd2  <  fsource.rsf vel=fvel.rsf den=fden.rsf > fwf.rsf Gx=fGx.rsf
       Gz=fGz.rsf sxx=fsxx.rsf sxz=fsxz.rsf szx=fszx.rsf  szz=fszz.rsf  verb=n
       spx= spz=

PARAMETERS
       file   Gx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       int    spx =      source point in x
       int    spz =      source point in z
       file   sxx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sxz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglfd2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfsglfd2pml — Method
sfsglfd2pml(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsglfd2pml on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsglfd2pml. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsglfd2pml(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglfd2pml(1)

NAME
       sfsglfd2pml - 2-D Lowrank Finite-difference wave extrapolation on stag‐
       gered grid

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglfd2pml  <  fsource.rsf   vel=fvel.rsf   den=fden.rsf   >   fwf.rsf
       rec=frec.rsf    Gx=fGx.rsf    Gz=fGz.rsf    sxx=fsxx.rsf   sxz=fsxz.rsf
       szx=fszx.rsf szz=fszz.rsf verb=n  srcdecay=n  srcrange=10  srctrunc=100
       snapinter=1  pmlsize=PMLOUT pmld0=PMLD0 decay=DECAY_FLAG decaybegin=DE‐
       CAY_BEGIN freesurface=n slx=-1.0 spx=-1 slz=-1.0 spz=-1 gdep=-1.0 gp=0

PARAMETERS
       file   Gx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gz =      auxiliary input file name
       int    decay =DECAY_FLAG      Flag of decay boundary condtion: 1 =  use
              ; 0 = not use
       int    decaybegin  =DECAY_BEGIN      Begin time of using decay boundary
              condition
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   freesurface =n [y/n]     free surface
       float  gdep =-1.0      recorder depth on grid
       int    gp =0      recorder depth on index
       int    pmld0 =PMLD0      PML parameter
       int    pmlsize =PMLOUT      size of PML layer
       file   rec =      auxiliary output file name
       float  slx =-1.0      source location x
       float  slz =-1.0      source location z
       int    snapinter =1      snap interval
       int    spx =-1      source location x (index)
       int    spz =-1      source location z (index)
       bool   srcdecay =n [y/n]     source decay
       int    srcrange =10      source decay range
       float  srctrunc =100      trunc source after srctrunc time (s)
       file   sxx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sxz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglfd2pml.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsglfd2pml(1)
source

sfsglfdc1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglfdc1(1)

NAME
       sfsglfdc1  - 1D Lowrank FD coefficient of d/dx on staggered grid (opti‐
       mized)

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglfdc1 < velf.rsf >  outm.rsf  sx=fsx.rsf  seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4
       npk=20 dt= wavnumcut=1.0 size=6

PARAMETERS
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       size   =6      stencil length
       file   sx =      auxiliary output file name
       wavnumcut
              =1.0      wavenumber cut percentile
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglfdc1.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

       mized)

       seed=time(NULL taper=1.e-3 eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt= wavnumcut=1.0 size=6

       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       size   =6      stencil length
       file   sx =      auxiliary output file name
       taper  =1.e-3      taper for stability
       wavnumcut
              =1.0      wavenumber cut percentile

sfsglfdrtm2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglfdrtm2(1)

NAME
       sfsglfdrtm2 - None

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglfdrtm2  <  Fsrc.rsf  fvel=Ffvel.rsf  fden=Ffden.rsf bvel=Fbvel.rsf
       bden=Fbden.rsf rec=Frcd.rsf > Fimg1.rsf img2=Fimg2.rsf tmpwf=Ftmpwf.rsf
       tmpbwf=Ftmpbwf.rsf   Gx=FGx.rsf  Gz=FGz.rsf  sxx=Fsxx.rsf  sxz=Fsxz.rsf
       szx=Fszx.rsf szz=Fszz.rsf verb=n wantwf=n wantrecord=y  srcdecay=SRCDE‐
       CAY  srcrange=SRCRANGE srctrunc=SRCTRUNC pmlsize=PMLOUT pmld0=PMLD0 de‐
       cay=DECAY_FLAG  decaybegin=DECAY_BEGIN  freesurface=n  slx=-1.0  spx=-1
       gdep=-1.0 gp=0 ginter=1 snapinter=10

PARAMETERS
       file   Gx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   Gz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   bden =      auxiliary input file name
       file   bvel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   decay =DECAY_FLAG [y/n]     Flag of decay boundary condtion: 1 =
              use ; 0 = not use
       int    decaybegin =DECAY_BEGIN      Begin time of using decay  boundary
              condition
       file   fden =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   freesurface =n [y/n]     free surface
       file   fvel =      auxiliary input file name
       float  gdep =-1.0      recorder depth on grid
       int    ginter =1      geophone interval
       int    gp =0      recorder depth on index
       file   img2 =      auxiliary output file name
       int    pmld0 =PMLD0      PML parameter
       int    pmlsize =PMLOUT      size of PML layer
       file   rec =      auxiliary input file name
       float  slx =-1.0      source location x
       int    snapinter =10      snap interval
       int    spx =-1      source location x (index)
       bool   srcdecay =SRCDECAY [y/n]     source decay
       int    srcrange =SRCRANGE      source decay range
       float  srctrunc =SRCTRUNC      trunc source after srctrunc time (s)
       file   sxx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   sxz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   szz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   tmpbwf =      auxiliary output file name
       file   tmpwf =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       bool   wantrecord  =y  [y/n]     if  n,  using record data generated by
              this program
       bool   wantwf =n [y/n]     output forward and backward wavefield
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglfdrtm2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsglfdrtm2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsglr1 — Method
sfsglr1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsglr1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsglr1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsglr1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglr1(1)

NAME
       sfsglr1 - 1-D lowrank wave propagation on staggered grid

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglr1  vel=Fvel.rsf  den=Fden.rsf  <  Fsrc.rsf  > Fo.rsf rec=Frec.rsf
       left=left.rsf right=right.rsf fft=Ffft.rsf ic=Fic.rsf  presrc=Fpsrc.rsf
       velsrc=Fvsrc.rsf  preinit=Fpint.rsf  velinit=Fvint.rsf  verb=n srcmms=n
       slx=  srcdecay=y  srcrange=10  srctrunc=100  cmplx=n  pad1=1   inject=y
       gdep=0.0

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       float  gdep =0.0      depth of geophone (meter)
       file   ic =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inject =y [y/n]     =y inject source; =n initial condition
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   preinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   presrc =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rec =      auxiliary output file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       float  slx =      source location in x
       bool   srcdecay =y [y/n]     source decay
       bool   srcmms =n [y/n]     use MMS source
       int    srcrange =10      source decay range
       float  srctrunc =100      trunc source after srctrunc time (s)
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velinit =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velsrc =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglr1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfsglr1(1)
source

sfsglr2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsglr2(1)

NAME
       sfsglr2 - Simple 2-D wave propagation on staggered grid

SYNOPSIS
       sfsglr2  vel=Fvel.rsf  den=Fden.rsf  <  Fsrc.rsf  > Fo.rsf rec=Frec.rsf
       left=left.rsf  right=right.rsf  fft=Ffft.rsf  verb=n   cmplx=n   pad1=1
       gdep=0.0  slx=-1.0 spx=-1 slz=-1.0 spz=-1 gdep=-1.0 gp=0 srcdecay=n sr‐
       crange=10 srctrunc=100

PARAMETERS
       bool   cmplx =n [y/n]     use complex FFT
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       float  gdep =-1.0      recorder depth on grid
       int    gp =0      recorder depth on index
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   rec =      auxiliary output file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       float  slx =-1.0      source location x
       float  slz =-1.0      source location z
       int    spx =-1      source location x (index)
       int    spz =-1      source location z (index)
       bool   srcdecay =n [y/n]     source decay
       int    srcrange =10      source decay range
       float  srctrunc =100      trunc source after srctrunc time (s)
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fangg/Msglr2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

       rect#=(125,1,1,...)

       string gain =      output gain file (optional) (auxiliary  output  file

Madagascar.sfshapebin — Method
sfshapebin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshapebin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshapebin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshapebin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshapebin(1)

NAME
       sfshapebin - Data binning in 2-D slices by inverse interpolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshapebin   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf  pattern=pattern.rsf  pin=pin.rsf
       pout=pout.rsf xkey= ykey= nx=  ny=  xmin=  xmax=  ymin=  ymax=  x0=xmin
       y0=ymin  dx=  dy=  interp=2 niter=nm nliter=1 eps=1./nd gauss=n shape=y
       verb=y filt1=3. filt2=filt1 head=

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =      bin size in x
       float  dy =      bin size in y
       float  eps =1./nd      regularization parameter
       float  filt1 =3.  ®
       float  filt2 =filt1      smoothing length for shaping
       bool   gauss =n [y/n]     if y, use gaussian  shaping  (estimated  from
              the data)
       string head = ®
       int    interp =2      interpolation length
       int    niter =nm      number of iterations
       int    nliter =1      number of reweighting iterations
       int    nx =      Number of bins in x
       int    ny =      Number of bins in y
       string pattern =      auxiliary input file name
       string pin =      auxiliary input file name
       string pout =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   shape =y [y/n]     if y, use shaping regularization
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =xmin ®
       int    xkey =      x key number
       float  xmax = ®
       float  xmin = ®
       float  y0 =ymin      grid origin
       int    ykey =      y key number
       float  ymax = ®
       float  ymin =      Grid dimensions
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mshapebin.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfshapebin(1)
source
Madagascar.sfshapebin1 — Method
sfshapebin1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshapebin1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshapebin1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshapebin1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshapebin1(1)

NAME
       sfshapebin1 - 1-D inverse interpolation with shaping regularization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshapebin1  <  in.rsf > out.rsf verb=y nx= xmin= xmax= x0=xmin dx= in‐
       terp=2 filter=3. niter=nx eps=1./nd pef=n gauss=n pad=0 head=

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =      grid sampling
       float  eps =1./nd      regularization parameter
       float  filter =3.       smoothing length
       bool   gauss =n [y/n]     if y, use Gaussian shaping
       string head = ®
       int    interp =2 [1,2]     forward  interpolation  method,  1:  nearest
              neighbor, 2: linear
       int    niter =nx      number of conjugate-gradient iterations
       int    nx =      number of bins
       int    pad =0      padding for Gaussian shaping
       bool   pef =n [y/n]     if y, use monofrequency regularization
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =xmin      grid origin
       float  xmax = ®
       float  xmin =      grid size
SOURCE
       system/generic/Mshapebin1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfshapebin1(1)
source

       rect#=(1,1,...)

       string mask  =      optional mask file with zeroes for missing data lo‐
              cations (auxiliary input file name)

       rect1=1 rect2=1

COMMENTS

       float  eps =1.       regularization parameter
       int    niter =50      maximum number of iterations

RSF Documentation

sfshearer(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshearer(1)

NAME
       sfshearer - Preconditioning for traveltime picking.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshearer  < in.rsf > out.rsf niter=100 order=10 ref=1. short=1 long=10
       rect1=1 rect2=1 ...

COMMENTS
       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       int    long =10      long smoothing radius
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    order =10      Hilbert transformer order
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       int    short =1      short smoothing radius
USED IN
       bei/vela/vscan
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mshearer.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Menvelope.c 696 2004-07-06 23:17:31Z fomels

Madagascar.sfshoot2 — Method
sfshoot2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshoot2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshoot2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshoot2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshoot2(1)

NAME
       sfshoot2 - 2-D ray shooting.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshoot2  <  vel.rsf > out.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf vel=y order=4 lsint=n
       nt=nx*nz nr=1 r0=x0 dr=dx tol=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  dr =dx      receiver increment
       bool   lsint =n [y/n]     if use least-squares interpolation
       int    nr =1      number of recievers
       int    nt =nx*nz      Maximum number of time steps
       int    order =4      Interpolation order
       float  r0 =x0      first receiver
       string shotfile =      file with shot locations (auxiliary  input  file
              name)
       float  tol =0.01      Shooting tolerance (in degrees)
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     If y, the input is velocity; if n, slowness
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mshoot2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfshoot2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfshot2cmp — Method
sfshot2cmp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshot2cmp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshot2cmp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshot2cmp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshot2cmp(1)

NAME
       sfshot2cmp - Convert shots to CMPs for regular 2-D geometry.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshot2cmp < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=msk.rsf positive=y half=y

COMMENTS
       The axes in the input are {time,offset,shot} The axes in the output are
       {time,offset,midpoint}

PARAMETERS
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   positive =y [y/n]     initial offset orientation
USED IN
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mshot2cmp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfshot2cmp(1)
source

SYNOPSIS
       sfshot2grid  <  Fr.rsf  wav=Fs.rsf  swf=Fsou.rsf > Frec.rsf nx= dx= ox=
       ny=1 dy=1 oy=0

PARAMETERS

       float  dy =1      y sampling
       int    nx =      x samples
       int    ny =1      y samples

sfshotconstkirch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshotconstkirch(1)

NAME
       sfshotconstkirch  -  Prestack  shot-profile Kirchhoff migration in con‐
       stant velocity.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshotconstkirch < inp.rsf > out.rsf aal=y nx=ns dx=ds  x0=s0  offset=n
       vel=

COMMENTS
       Requires the input to be in (time,offset,shot)

PARAMETERS
       bool   aal =y [y/n]     if y, apply antialiasing
       float  dx =ds ®
       int    nx =ns ®
       bool   offset =n [y/n]     if y, the output is in offset
       float  vel =      velocity
       float  x0 =s0 ®

Madagascar.sfshpwstack — Method
sfshpwstack(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshpwstack on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshpwstack. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshpwstack(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshpwstack(1)

NAME
       sfshpwstack - Recursive stacking by plane-wave construction.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshpwstack  <  cmp.rsf  velocity=velocity.rsf  > stack.rsf dip=dip.rsf
       offset=offset.rsf half=y slowness=n verb=n eps=0.01 velocity=0.0f nmo=n
       order=1  mode=1  h0=0. eps1=0.01 jump=1 niter=10 restart=niter tol=1e-5
       flo= fhi= nplo=6 nphi=6

PARAMETERS
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.01      regularization
       float  eps1 =0.01      stretch regularization
       float  fhi =      High frequency in band, default is Nyquist
       float  flo =      Low frequency in band, default is 0
       float  h0 =0.       reference offset
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       int    jump =1      subsampling
       int    mode  =1      1: predict backward, 2: predict forward then back‐
              ward
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       bool   nmo =n [y/n]     if y, apply constant velocity NMO
       int    nphi =6      number of poles for high cutoff
       int    nplo =6      number of poles for low cutoff
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       int    order =1      accuracy order
       int    restart =niter      GMRES memory
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       float  tol =1e-5      GMRES tolerance
       float  velocity =0.0f      constant velocity
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/kregimbal/Mshpwstack.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfshpwstack(1)
source
Madagascar.sfshstack — Method
sfshstack(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfshstack on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfshstack. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfshstack(1) Madagascar Manuals sfshstack(1)

NAME
       sfshstack - Shaping stack.

SYNOPSIS
       sfshstack < cmp.rsf velocity=velocity.rsf > stack.rsf offset=offset.rsf
       half=y slowness=n h0=0. eps=0.01 jump=1 niter=10 restart=niter tol=1e-5
       flo= fhi= nplo=6 nphi=6

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       float  fhi =      High frequency in band, default is Nyquist
       float  flo =      Low frequency in band, default is 0
       float  h0 =0.       reference offset
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       int    jump =1      subsampling
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       int    nphi =6      number of poles for high cutoff
       int    nplo =6      number of poles for low cutoff
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       int    restart =niter      GMRES memory
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       float  tol =1e-5      GMRES tolerance
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/kregimbal/Mshstack.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfshstack(1)

NAME

SYNOPSIS

       oa=0.0 da=1.0 nl=1 dl=1. ol=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  da =1.0 ®
       float  dl =1.  ®
       int    na =1 ®
       int    nbuf =1      buffer size
       int    nl =1 ®
       float  oa =0.0 ®
       float  ol =0.  ®
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       float  sig =1.0 ®
       file   ur =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

sfsigmoid(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfsigmoid(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsigmoid(1)

NAME
       sfsigmoid - 2-D synthetic model from J.F.Claerbout.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsigmoid  >  mod.rsf  n1=400  n2=100  large=5*n1  o1=0. o2=0. d1=0.004
       d2=0.032 reflectivity=y taper=y

COMMENTS
       October 2014 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2014/10/08/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfsigmoid/

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =0.004 ®
       float  d2 =0.032      sampling
       int    large =5*n1      reflectivity series
       int    n1 =400      vertical axis
       int    n2 =100      horizontal axis
       float  o1 =0.  ®
       float  o2 =0.       origin
       bool   reflectivity =y [y/n]     if output reflectivity (otherwise out‐
              put impedance model)
       bool   taper =y [y/n]     if taper the edges
USED IN
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/krch/sep73
SOURCE
       user/gee/Msigmoid.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfsigmoid(1)
source

       niter=20 spitz=n prec=n verb=n slag= nlag=

PARAMETERS
       float  epsilon =      regularization parameter
       file   nfilt =      auxiliary input file name
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       string nlag = ®
       bool   prec =n [y/n]     if use preconditioning with Spitz
       file   sfilt =      auxiliary input file name
       string slag = ®
       bool   spitz =n [y/n]     if use Spitz method
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

Madagascar.sfsimenv — Method
sfsimenv(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimenv on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimenv. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimenv(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimenv(1)

NAME
       sfsimenv - Rotate phase and compute similarity with enevelope.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimenv  <  inp.rsf  > sim.rsf na=360 da=1.0 a0=-180. order=100 ref=1.
       verb=y inv=y niter=20 rect=3

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =-180.       first angle
       float  da =1.0      angle increment
       bool   inv =y [y/n]     inverse similarity
       int    na =360      number of angles
       int    niter =20      maximum number of iterations
       int    order =100      Hilbert transformer order
       int    rect =3      smoothing radius
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Msimenv.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfsimenv(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsimidenoise — Method
sfsimidenoise(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimidenoise on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimidenoise. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimidenoise(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimidenoise(1)

NAME
       sfsimidenoise - Random noise attenuation using local similarity

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimidenoise < in.rsf > out.rsf similarity=simi.rsf thr=

PARAMETERS
       file   similarity =      auxiliary input file name
       float  thr =      thresholding level
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msimidenoise.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfsimidenoise(1)

Madagascar.sfsimidenoise1 — Method
sfsimidenoise1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimidenoise1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimidenoise1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimidenoise1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimidenoise1(1)

NAME
       sfsimidenoise1  - Random noise attenuation using local similarity (dif‐
       ferent weighting approach)

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimidenoise1 < in.rsf > out.rsf similarity=simi.rsf s1= s2=

COMMENTS
       The weighting function is defined as W(s) =  1                 if  s>s2
             = (s-s1)/(s2-s1)  if s1<=s<=s2       = 0                if s<s1

PARAMETERS
       float  s1 =      thresholding level 1
       float  s2 =      thresholding level 2
       file   similarity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msimidenoise1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfsimidenoise1(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsimilarity — Method
sfsimilarity(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimilarity on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimilarity. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimilarity(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimilarity(1)

NAME
       sfsimilarity - Local similarity measure between two datasets.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimilarity   <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  other=other.rsf  verb=y  niter=20
       eps=0.0f rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       September        2015        program        of        the        month:
       http://ahay.org/blog/2015/09/14/program-of-the-month-sfsimilarity/

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.0f      regularization
       int    niter =20      maximum number of iterations
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Msimilarity.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfsimivscan — Method
sfsimivscan(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimivscan on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimivscan. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimivscan(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimivscan(1)

NAME
       sfsimivscan - Velocity analysis using similarity-weighted semblance.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimivscan   <   cmp.rsf   >  scan.rsf  ref=ref.rsf  offset=offset.rsf
       mask=msk.rsf grad=grd.rsf  semblance=n  diffsemblance=n  avosemblance=n
       nb=2  weight=y  half=y  smax=2.0 ns=1 slowness=n squared=n v1= extend=4
       mute=12 str=0.5 thr=0.3 eps=0.01 niter=10 v0= dv= nv= v1= type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   avosemblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute AVO-friendly semblance
       bool   diffsemblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute differential semblance
       float  dv =      step in velocity
       float  eps =0.01 ®
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       string grad =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   half =y [y/n]     if y, the second axis is  half-offset  instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      optional mask file (auxiliary input file name)
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       int    nb =2      semblance averaging
       int    niter =10 ®
       int    ns =1      number of heterogeneity scans
       int    nv =      number of scanned velocities
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   semblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute semblance; if n, stack
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       float  smax =2.0      maximum heterogeneity
       bool   squared =n [y/n]     if y, the slowness or velocity is squared
       float  str =0.5      maximum stretch allowed
       float  thr =0.3 ®
       string type =      type of semblance (avo,diff,sembl,power,weighted)
       float  v0 =      first scanned velocity
       float  v1 =      reference velocity
       bool   weight =y [y/n]     if y, apply pseudo-unitary weighting
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msimivscan.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsimivscan(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsimpostkirch — Method
sfsimpostkirch(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsimpostkirch on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsimpostkirch. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsimpostkirch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsimpostkirch(1)

NAME
       sfsimpostkirch  -  2-D simplest-form post-stack Kirchhoff time modeling
       and migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsimpostkirch < in.rsf > out.rsf vel=vel.rsf adj=y aa=n sw=0 v0=

COMMENTS
       Suppose the input_image & output_data or input_data & output_image have
       the same dimensions, samplings.  The dottest has been past.

PARAMETERS
       bool   aa =n [y/n]     yes: apply reciprocal antialiaising operator
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     yes: migration, no: modeling
       int    sw =0      if > 0, select a branch of the antialiasing operation
       float  v0 =      constant velocity (if no velocity=)
       string vel =      velocity file (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msimpostkirch.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfsimpostkirch(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsin — Method
sfsin(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsin on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsin. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsin(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsin(1)

NAME
       sfsin - Simple operations with complex sinusoids

SYNOPSIS
       sfsin  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  root=root.rsf  mask=mask.rsf adj=n verb=n
       niter=0 rect=1 perc=50. fact=0.5 eps=1./n1 oper= type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  eps =1./n1      scaling for shaping inversion
       float  fact =0.5      factor for thresholding  (used  when  oper=t  and
              niter > 0)
       string mask  =       missing  data  interpolation (auxiliary input file
              name)
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       string oper =      operation to perform
       float  perc =50.       percentage for thresholding  (used  when  oper=t
              and niter > 0)
       int    rect =1      smoothing radius (for oper=s)
       file   root =      auxiliary input file name
       string type =      [haar,linear,biortho] type of the seislet transform
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msin.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                          sfsin(1)
source

       ns=1 eps=0.01

       float  eps =0.01      regularization

Madagascar.sfsizes — Method
sfsizes(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsizes on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsizes. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsizes(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsizes(1)

NAME
       sfsizes - Display the size of RSF files.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsizes files=y human=n su=n file1.rsf file2.rsf ...

COMMENTS
       Prints  the element size, number of elements, and number of bytes for a
       list of RSF files.  Non-RSF files are ignored.

PARAMETERS
       bool   files =y [y/n]     If y, print size of each file.  If  n,  print
              only total.
       bool   human  =n  [y/n]     If y, print human-readable file size. If n,
              print byte count.
       bool   su =n [y/n]     Same for Seismic Unix
SOURCE
       user/jennings/Msizes.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfsizes
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfsizes(1)
source

sfslant(1) Madagascar Manuals sfslant(1)

NAME
       sfslant - Time-space-domain Radon transform (slant stack)

SYNOPSIS
       sfslant  <  in.rsf > out.rsf verb=n adj=n rho=y anti=1. np= dp= p0= x0=
       dx= nx= p1=0.

COMMENTS
       April 2015 program of the  month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2015/04/21/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfslant/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  anti =1.       antialiasing
       float  dp =      p sampling (if adj=y)
       float  dx =      offset sampling
       int    np =      number of p values (if adj=y)
       int    nx =      number of offsets
       float  p0 =      p origin (if adj=y)
       float  p1 =0.       reference slope
       bool   rho =y [y/n]     rho filtering
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  x0 =      offset origin
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/icomp
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf2
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mslant.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfslschain2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfslschain2d(1)

NAME
       sfslschain2d  -  Separable  LS  -  Find a symmetric chain of 2D-Fourier
       weighting and scaling

SYNOPSIS
       sfslschain2d  <  src.rsf   >   wht.rsf   target=tgt.rsf   init_w=w0.rsf
       init_wf=wf0.rsf fweight=fwht.rsf match=mch.rsf niter=0 liter=50 rect1=1
       rect2=1 frect1=1 frect2=1

PARAMETERS
       int    frect1 =1      smoothing in frequency dim1
       int    frect2 =1      smoothing in frequency dim2
       file   fweight =      auxiliary output file name
       file   init_w =      auxiliary input file name
       file   init_wf =      auxiliary input file name
       int    liter =50      number of linear iterations
       file   match =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =1      smoothing in time dim1
       int    rect2 =1      smoothing in time dim2
       file   target =      auxiliary input file name

       user/fomels/Mslschain2d.c

sfsmooth(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsmooth(1)

NAME
       sfsmooth - Multi-dimensional triangle smoothing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsmooth   <   in.rsf   >   out.rsf   repeat=1   adj=n  rect#=(1,1,...)
       diff#=(n,n,...)

COMMENTS
       January 2012 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/01/01/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfsmooth/

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     run in the adjoint mode
       bool   diff# =(n,n,...)  [y/n]     differentiation on #-th axis
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/matt
       bei/dpmv/yalei
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/dwnc/vofz
       bei/fdm/kjartjac
       bei/fld/synmarine
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/ft1/plane4
       bei/krch/sep73
       bei/sg/denmark
       cup/rna3d/real
       cup/rna3d/sin
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sact1
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2

       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009VTIModeSeparation/separate3
       3 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sfs‐
       mooth.html

Madagascar.sfsmoothcur — Method
sfsmoothcur(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsmoothcur. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsmoothcur(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsmoothcur(1)

NAME
       sfsmoothcur - Convert input slope and time derivative

SYNOPSIS
       sfsmoothcur  <  DATA.rsf dipt=DIPT.rsf > MODEL.rsf dataout=DATA_OUT.rsf
       eps=1.0 niter=100 rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       * to its curvature field using LS and shaping regularization *  applied
       to causint_lop d = L m

       Takes: rect1= rect2= ...

       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       string dataout =      optionally, output predicted data (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       file   dipt =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =1.0      dumping factor
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Msmoothcur.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdix.c 5595 2010-03-21 16:54:14Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsmoothcur(1)
source

COMMENTS

RSF Documentation

sfsmoothder1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsmoothder1(1)

NAME
       sfsmoothder1  -  Convert  input  to its derivative using LS and shaping
       regularization

SYNOPSIS
       sfsmoothder1 <  DATA.rsf  >  MODEL.rsf  dataout=DATA_OUT.rsf  niter=100
       rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       * applied to causint_lop d = L m

       Takes: rect1= rect2= ...

       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       string dataout =      optionally, output predicted data (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Msmoothder1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mdix.c 5595 2010-03-21 16:54:14Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfsmoothder1(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsmoothder2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

NAME
       sfsmoothder2  -  Convert  input  to its derivative using LS and shaping
       regularization

SYNOPSIS
       sfsmoothder2  <  DATA.rsf  >  MODEL.rsf  dataout=DATA_OUT.rsf   eps=1.0
       niter=100 rect#=(1,1,...)

COMMENTS
       * applied to causint_lop d = L m

       Takes: rect1= rect2= ...

       rectN defines the size of the smoothing stencil in N-th dimension.

PARAMETERS
       string dataout =      optionally, output predicted data (auxiliary out‐
              put file name)
       float  eps =1.0      dumping factor
       int    niter =100      maximum number of iterations
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Msmoothder2.c

sfsmoothn(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsmoothn(1)

NAME
       sfsmoothn - N-D non-stationary smoothing (fixed version of sfnsmooth.)

SYNOPSIS
       sfsmoothn < in.rsf > out.rsf repeat=1 rect#= shift#=

COMMENTS
       Note Fomel's Mnsmooth.c may contain bugs in user/fomel/ntriangle.c t[i]
       -> t[o+i*d]; s[i]->s[o+i*d] in triple Example: chenyk/ortho_non/nsmooth

PARAMETERS
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       int    repeat =1      repeat filtering several times
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msmoothn.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfsmoothn(1)

Madagascar.sfsoftclip — Method
sfsoftclip(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsoftclip on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsoftclip. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsoftclip(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsoftclip(1)

NAME
       sfsoftclip - Soft clip the data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsoftclip  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf upper= lower= sharp=1.0/fmax(upper*up‐
       per,lower*lower)

COMMENTS
       Uses softplus function Performs lower clipping then upper  clipping  if
       both specified

       lower  clipping:  y  = output, x = input, k = sharpness, c = lower clip
       value y = ln(1+exp(k*(x-c)))/k + c

       upper clipping: y = output, x = input, k = sharpness, c  =  upper  clip
       value y = -ln(1+exp(k*(c-x)))/k + c

PARAMETERS
       float  lower = ®
       float  sharp =1.0/fmax(upper*upper,lower*lower) ®
       float  upper = ®
SOURCE
       user/luke/Msoftclip.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfsoftclip(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsort — Method
sfsort(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfsort(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsort(1)

NAME
       sfsort - Sort a float/complex vector by absolute values.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsort < in.rsf > out.rsf memsize=sf_memsize() ascmode=n dim=dim

COMMENTS
       Written by: Gilles Hennenfent & Henryk Modzelewski, UBC Created: Febru‐
       ary 2006

       January 2016 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2016/01/16/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfsort/

PARAMETERS
       bool   ascmode =n [y/n]     y=ascending; n=descending
       int    dim =dim      maximum dimension
       int    memsize =sf_memsize()      Max amount of RAM (in Mb) to be used
SOURCE
       user/slim/Msort.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfsort(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfsp(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsp(1)

NAME
       sfsp - 2-D Pseudo-spectral wave extrapolation

SYNOPSIS
       sfsp  >  out.rsf vel=vel.rsf < source.rsf opt=y dt= nt= isx= isz= nb=30
       c=0.01 ax=5.0 az=5.0 factor=5.0/6.0

PARAMETERS
       float  ax =5.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  az =5.0      suppress HF parameter
       float  c =0.01      decaying parameter
       float  dt = ®
       float  factor =5.0/6.0      suppress HF parameter
       int    isx = ®
       int    isz = ®
       int    nb =30 ®
       int    nt = ®
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/songxl/Msp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                           sfsp(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsparsify — Method
sfsparsify(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsparsify on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsparsify. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsparsify(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsparsify(1)

NAME
       sfsparsify - Transforms regular 2-D array to sparse array

SYNOPSIS
       sfsparsify < in.rsf > out.rsf nonzero=n1*n2

COMMENTS
       Input is int or float array Output is a float nonzero-by-3 array, where
       nonzero=`<input.rsf sfattr want=nonzero | awk -F '= ' '{ print $2  }';`
       column  0 holds the data values (converted from int to float, if neces‐
       sary), column 1 holds coordinate values (i.e. o+i*d, not indices i) for
       dimension  1 of input, and column 2 the coordinate values for dimension
       2 of input

PARAMETERS
       int    nonzero =n1*n2      Number of nonzero elements in input
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Msparsify.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfsparsify(1)
source

       Helix Transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspecfac < in.rsf > out.rsf acfile=acfile.rsf

COMMENTS
       (Maximum dimension is 3) $  Copyright (C) 2009 Stanford University $  $
       This  program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify $
       it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by  $
       the  Free  Software  Foundation;  either version 2 of the License, or $
       (at your option) any later version.  $ $  This program  is  distributed
       in  the hope that it will be useful, $  but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; with‐
       out even the implied warranty of $  MERCHANTABILITY or  FITNESS  FOR  A
       PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the $  GNU General Public License for more de‐
       tails.  $ $  You should have received a copy of the GNU General  Public
       License  $  along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
       $  Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307
       USA

PARAMETERS
       file   acfile =      auxiliary output file name

       user/ridder/Mspecfac.f90
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfspectra(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspectra(1)

NAME
       sfspectra - Frequency spectra.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspectra < in.rsf > out.rsf all=n opt=y

       March  2012  program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2012/03/18/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfspectra/

PARAMETERS
       bool   all =n [y/n]     if y, compute average spectrum for all traces
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
USED IN
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/krch/sep73
       cup/rna2d/real

       system/generic/Mspectra.c

       4.2-git

source
Madagascar.sfspectra2 — Method
sfspectra2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspectra2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspectra2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

NAME
       sfspectra2 - Frequency spectra in 2-D.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspectra2 < in.rsf > out.rsf all=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   all =n [y/n]     if y, compute average spectrum for all traces

       system/generic/Mspectra2.c

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspefcstep. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspefcstep(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspefcstep(1)

NAME
       sfspefcstep - Streaming prediction-error filter with constant step.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspefcstep  <  inp.rsf  >  out.rsf  infil=infil.rsf  verb=n  na= ngp=0
       lambda1= lambda2=0.0f

PARAMETERS
       string infil =      initial filter (auxiliary input file name)
       float  lambda1 =      constant scale parameter in time axis
       float  lambda2 =0.0f      constant scale parameter in space axis
       int    na =      filter size
       int    ngp =0      constant step
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mspefcstep.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfspefcstep(1)
source

sfspefvstep(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspefvstep(1)

NAME
       sfspefvstep - Streaming prediction-error filter with variable step.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspefvstep  < inp.rsf > out.rsf infil=infil.rsf lag=lag.rsf verb=n na=
       lambda1= lambda2=0.0f

PARAMETERS
       string infil =      initial filter (auxiliary input file name)
       string lag =      variable step (auxiliary input file name)
       float  lambda1 =      constant scale parameter in time axis
       float  lambda2 =0.0f      constant scale parameter in space axis
       int    na =      filter size
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mspefvstep.c

RSF Documentation

sfsphase(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsphase(1)

NAME
       sfsphase - Smooth estimate of instantaneous phase.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsphase < in.rsf > out.rsf niter=100 order=10 ref=1. rect#=(1,1,...)

PARAMETERS
       int    niter =100      number of iterations
       int    order =10      Hilbert transformer order
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Msphase.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfspike — Method
sfspike(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspike on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspike. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspike(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspike(1)

NAME
       sfspike - Generate simple data: spikes, boxes, planes, constants.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspike  <  in.rsf  >  spike.rsf  mag=  nsp=1 k#=[0,...] l#=[k1,k2,...]
       p#=[0,...] n#=  o#=[0,0,...]  d#=[0.004,0.1,0.1,...]  label#=[Time,Dis‐
       tance,Distance,...] unit#=[s,km,km,...] title=

COMMENTS
       Spike positioning is given in samples and starts with 1.

PARAMETERS
       float  d# =[0.004,0.1,0.1,...]       sampling on #-th axis
       ints   k# =[0,...]       spike starting position [nsp]
       ints   l# =[k1,k2,...]       spike ending position [nsp]
       string label# =[Time,Distance,Distance,...]       label on #-th axis
       floats mag =      spike magnitudes [nsp]
       int    n# =      size of #-th axis
       int    nsp =1      Number of spikes
       float  o# =[0,0,...]       origin on #-th axis
       floats p# =[0,...]       spike inclination (in samples) [nsp]
       string title =      title for plots
       string unit# =[s,km,km,...]       unit on #-th axis
USED IN
       bei/conj/causint
       bei/dpmv/matt
       bei/dpmv/yalei
       bei/dwnc/phasemod
       bei/dwnc/vofz
       bei/fdm/kjartjac
       bei/fdm/movies
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/ft1/hankel
       bei/trimo/all
       bei/trimo/mig
       bei/trimo/mod
       bei/trimo/veltran
       bei/vela/stack
       bei/vela/strat
       bei/vela/vscan
       carrot/test/modeling
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cup/rna3d/sin
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/icomp
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       26 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sf‐
       spike.html
SOURCE
       system/main/spike.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfspike
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfspike(1)

Madagascar.sfspiral — Method
sfspiral(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspiral on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspiral. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspiral(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspiral(1)

NAME
       sfspiral - Spiral function

SYNOPSIS
       sfspiral  >  spiral.rsf  nx=500 ny=200 xmax=20. ymax=3. xmin=0. ymin=0.
       dx=(xmax-xmin)/(nx-1)  dy=(ymax-ymin)/(ny-1)  xc=10.  yc=5.  eps=1.0e-6
       v0=2.0 v1=2.0 r0=1.0 r1=0.4 b=0.1 fac=0.2 sp_r=1. sp_t=0.05

PARAMETERS
       float  b =0.1      exponential decay factor
       float  dx =(xmax-xmin)/(nx-1) ®
       float  dy =(ymax-ymin)/(ny-1) ®
       float  eps =1.0e-6 ®
       float  fac =0.2 ®
       int    nx =500 ®
       int    ny =200 ®
       float  r0 =1.0 ®
       float  r1 =0.4      paramters of original shape
       float  sp_r =1.       speed in radius
       float  sp_t =0.05      speed in angle
       float  v0 =2.0 ®
       float  v1 =2.0 ®
       float  xc =10.  ®
       float  xmax =20.  ®
       float  xmin =0.  ®
       float  yc =5.  ®
       float  ymax =3.  ®
       float  ymin =0.  ®
SOURCE
       user/kourkina/Mspiral.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfspiral(1)
source
Madagascar.sfspiralsort — Method
sfspiralsort(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspiralsort on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspiralsort. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspiralsort(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspiralsort(1)

NAME
       sfspiralsort  - Sort microseismic surface array recording traces with a
       given epicenter along a spiral shape R = r0 + d(a-a0).

SYNOPSIS
       sfspiralsort   <   in.rsf   x=x_file.rsf   y=y_file.rsf    >    out.rsf
       dist=dist_file.rsf  theta=theta_file.rsf  epi_x= epi_y= radius0=1.0 an‐
       gle0=0.0 dr=

PARAMETERS
       float  angle0 =0.0      Starting angle of spiral.
       file   dist =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dr =      Spiral interval parameter.
       float  epi_x =      referenced epicenter coordinate x.
       float  epi_y =      referenced epicenter coordinate y.
       float  radius0 =1.0      Starting radius of spiral.
       file   theta =      auxiliary output file name
       file   x =      auxiliary input file name
       file   y =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/yunzhi/Mspiralsort.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfspiralsort(1)
source

sfspitz(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspitz on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspitz. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspitz(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspitz(1)

NAME
       sfspitz  - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using F-X Prediction Error
       Filters

SYNOPSIS
       sfspitz < in.rsf > out.rsf order=3 ntraces=1 verb=n norm=y

COMMENTS
       based on Seismic trace interpolation in the  F-X  domain  S.Spitz  Geo‐
       physics 56, 785(1991).

PARAMETERS
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     normalization flag
       int    ntraces =1      number of traces to be interpolated
       int    order =3      linear PEF order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Mspitz.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfspitz(1)
source
Madagascar.sfspitzbl — Method
sfspitzbl(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspitzbl on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspitzbl. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspitzbl(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspitzbl(1)

NAME
       sfspitzbl  - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using F-X Prediction Er‐
       ror Filters

SYNOPSIS
       sfspitzbl < in.rsf > out.rsf order=3  ntraces=1  f1=0.0  f2=1.0  verb=n
       norm=y

COMMENTS
       based  on  Seismic  trace  interpolation in the F-X domain S.Spitz Geo‐
       physics 56, 785(1991).  This implementation is for bandlimited [f1  f2]
       signals

PARAMETERS
       float  f1 =0.0      lower frequency in band limited signal >= 0.0
       float  f2  =1.0       higher  frequency  in  band limited signal <= 1.0
              (normalized nyquist)
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     normalization flag
       int    ntraces =1      number of traces to be interpolated
       int    order =3      linear PEF order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Mspitzbl.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfspitzbl(1)
source
Madagascar.sfspitzblns — Method
sfspitzblns(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspitzblns on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspitzblns. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspitzblns(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspitzblns(1)

NAME
       sfspitzblns  -  Missing  data interpolation in 2-D using F-X Prediction
       Error Filters

SYNOPSIS
       sfspitzblns < in.rsf > out.rsf w1=n1 w2=n2 k1=1 k2=1 order=3  ntraces=1
       f1=0.0 f2=1.0 verb=n norm=y

COMMENTS
       based  on  Seismic  trace  interpolation in the F-X domain S.Spitz Geo‐
       physics 56, 785(1991).

       Uses 2D Patching.

PARAMETERS
       float  f1 =0.0      lower frequency in band limited signal >= 0.0
       float  f2 =1.0      higher frequency in  band  limited  signal  <=  1.0
              (normalized nyquist)
       int    k1 =1      number of patches along the first dimension
       int    k2 =1      number of patches along the second dimension
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     output normalization flag
       int    ntraces =1      number of traces to be interpolated
       int    order =3      linear PEF order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    w1 =n1      lenght of patch along the first dimension
       int    w2 =n2      lenght of patch along the second dimension
SOURCE
       user/lcasasan/Mspitzblns.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfspitzblns(1)
source
