sfspitzns(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspitzns(1)

NAME
       sfspitzns  - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using F-X Prediction Er‐
       ror Filters

SYNOPSIS
       sfspitzns < in.rsf > out.rsf w1=n1 w2=n2 k1=1  k2=1  order=3  ntraces=1
       verb=n norm=y

COMMENTS
       based  on  Seismic  trace  interpolation in the F-X domain S.Spitz Geo‐
       physics 56, 785(1991).

       Uses 2D Patching.

PARAMETERS
       int    k1 =1      number of patches along the first dimension
       int    k2 =1      number of patches along the second dimension
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     output normalization flag
       int    ntraces =1      number of traces to be interpolated
       int    order =3      linear PEF order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    w1 =n1      lenght of patch along the first dimension
       int    w2 =n2      lenght of patch along the second dimension

sfspline(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspline(1)

NAME
       sfspline - 1-D cubic spline interpolation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspline < in.rsf > out.rsf pattern=pattern.rsf fp= sort=n

COMMENTS
       Specify either n1= o1= d1= or pattern=

PARAMETERS
       floats fp =      end-point derivatives [2]
       string pattern =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   sort =n [y/n]     if y, the coordinates need sorting
USED IN
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold

       system/generic/Mspline.c

       4.2-git

NAME
       sfsplinebank - Prepare a filter bank for B-spline plane wave filters

SYNOPSIS
       sfsplinebank  >  out.rsf nt=40 np= pmax=2. niter=20 eps=FLT_EPSILON nh=
       lag=

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =FLT_EPSILON      tolerance
       string lag = ®
       string nh = ®
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       int    np =      number of dips
       int    nt =40      length of the fast axis
       float  pmax =2.       maximum dip
SOURCE

RSF Documentation

sfsplit(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsplit(1)

NAME
       sfsplit - Splits file into slices along the last dimension

SYNOPSIS
       sfsplit verb=n inp= outdir=(out_basenm+ivlad.ext nthick=1

COMMENTS
       Usage:

       sfsplit inp=file.rsf outdir=[file_split.rsf] nthick=[1]

       Parameter nthick gives the maximum thickness of a slice. The last slice
       may be thinner.

PARAMETERS
       string inp =      ifile.rsf
       int    nthick =1      slice thickness
       string outdir =(out_basenm+ivlad.ext ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Msplit.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfsplit(1)

Madagascar.sfspray — Method
sfspray(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfspray on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfspray. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfspray(1) Madagascar Manuals sfspray(1)

NAME
       sfspray  - Extend a dataset by duplicating in the specified axis dimen‐
       sion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfspray < in.rsf > out.rsf axis=2 n= d= o= label= unit=

COMMENTS
       This operation is adjoint to sfstack.

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =2      which axis to spray
       float  d =      Sampling of the newly created dimension
       string label =      Label of the newly created dimension
       int    n =      Size of the newly created dimension
       float  o =      Origin of the newly created dimension
       string unit =      Units of the newly created dimension
USED IN
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/trimo/mod
       bei/vela/strat
       cup/rna3d/shot
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/zicig
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/fold
       cwp/geo2009TTIModeSeparation/marmousi2
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf1
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf2
       cwp/pept2011MicroearthquakeMonitoring/saf3
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/main/spray.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfspray
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfspray(1)

Madagascar.sfsqsanaly — Method
sfsqsanaly(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsqsanaly on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsqsanaly. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsqsanaly(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsqsanaly(1)

NAME
       sfsqsanaly - Analytic escape solutions in phase space for constant gra‐
       dient of slowness squared

SYNOPSIS
       sfsqsanaly < in.rsf > out.rsf iq= gx= gz= sc= xc= zc=

PARAMETERS
       float  gx =      x-gradient of slowness^2
       float  gz =      z-gradient of slowness^2
       int    iq =      switch for escape variable 0=x, 1=a, 2=t, 3=z
       float  sc =      slowness constant
       float  xc =      x reference
       float  zc =      z reference
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Msqsanaly.c

       d2= on1= oo1= od1= on2= oo2= od2=

       float  d2 = ®
       file   key =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n1 = ®
       int    n2 = ®

       float  o2 = ®
       float  od1 = ®
       float  od2 = ®
       int    on1 = ®
       int    on2 = ®
       float  oo1 = ®
       float  oo2 = ®

Madagascar.sfsrmig3 — Method
sfsrmig3(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsrmig3 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsrmig3. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsrmig3(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsrmig3(1)

NAME
       sfsrmig3 - 3-D S/R migration with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfsrmig3  slo=Fs_s.rsf  sls=Fs_r.rsf  <  Fw_s.rsf rwf=Fw_r.rsf > Fi.rsf
       cig=Fc.rsf ompchunk=1 ompnth=0 verb=y  eps=0.01  twoway=n  nrmax=1  dt‐
       max=0.004  pmx=0  pmy=0  tmx=0 tmy=0 vpvs=1. hsym=n nht=1 oht=0 dht=0.1
       nht=1 oht=0 dht=0.1 hsym=n nhh=1 ohh=0 dhh=0.1  nha=180  oha=0  dha=2.0
       nhb=180 ohb=0 dhb=2.0 itype=

PARAMETERS
       file   cig =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dha =2.0 ®
       float  dhb =2.0 ®
       float  dhh =0.1 ®
       float  dht =0.1 ®
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   hsym =n [y/n]
       string itype =      imaging condition type
                     o = zero lag (default)
                     e = extended
                     x = space-lags
                     h = space-lags magnitude
                     t = time-lag
       int    nha =180 ®
       int    nhb =180 ®
       int    nhh =1 ®
       int    nht =1 ®
       int    nrmax =1      max number of refs
       float  oha =0 ®
       float  ohb =0 ®
       float  ohh =0 ®
       float  oht =0 ®
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       int    ompnth =0      OpenMP available threads
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   rwf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       string sls =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   twoway =n [y/n]     two-way traveltime
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  vpvs =1.       Vp/Vs ratio
USED IN
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/flatWEMVA
       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA
SOURCE
       user/psava/Msrmig3.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfsrmig3
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfsrmig3(1)
source

NAME
       sfsrmod3 - 3-D S/R modeling with extended split-step

SYNOPSIS
       sfsrmod3 slo=Fs_s.rsf sls=Fs_r.rsf < Fw_s.rsf > Fw_r.rsf ref=Fr.rsf om‐
       pchunk=1 ompnth=0 verb=y eps=0.01 nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0
       tmy=0 twoway=n

PARAMETERS
       float  dtmax =0.004      time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       int    nrmax =1      maximum number of refs
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       int    ompnth =0      OpenMP available threads
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       string sls =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   twoway =n [y/n]     two-way traveltime
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag

       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2

NAME
       sfsrmva - 3-D S/R WEMVA with extended split-step

SYNOPSIS
       sfsrmva  slo=Bs.rsf  swf=Bw_s.rsf rwf=Bw_r.rsf < Pi.rsf > Ps.rsf verb=y
       eps=0.01 adj=n twoway=y nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0 tmy=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     y=ADJ scat; n=FWD scat
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       int    nrmax =1      max number of refs
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   rwf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swf =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   twoway =y [y/n]     two-way traveltime
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag

       cwp/geo2008NumericWEMVAoperators/saltWEMVA

       system/seismic/Msrmva.c

Madagascar.sfsstep2 — Method
sfsstep2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsstep2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsstep2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsstep2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsstep2(1)

NAME
       sfsstep2 - 3-D post-stack modeling/migration with extended split step.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsstep2 < in.rsf > out.rsf slowness=vel.rsf inv=n verb=n eps=0.01 nt=1
       nr=1 padx=0 pady=0 dt=0.004 nw= dw= w0=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.004      time error
       float  dw =      Frequency sampling (for modeling)
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     If y, modeling; if n, migration
       int    nr =1      maximum number of references
       int    nt =1      taper size
       int    nw =      Length of frequency axis (for modeling)
       int    padx =0      cross-line padding
       int    pady =0      in-line padding
       file   slowness =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  w0 =0.       Frequency origin (for modeling)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Msstep2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfsstep2(1)

Madagascar.sfstack — Method
sfstack(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstack on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstack. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstack(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstack(1)

NAME
       sfstack - Stack a dataset over one of the dimensions.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstack  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  scale=  axis=2 rms=n norm=y min=n max=n
       prod=n

COMMENTS
       This operation is adjoint to sfspray.

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =2      which axis to stack. If axis=0, stack over all  di‐
              mensions
       bool   max  =n  [y/n]     If  y, find maximum instead of stack. Ignores
              rms and norm.
       bool   min =n [y/n]     If y, find minimum instead  of  stack.  Ignores
              rms and norm.
       bool   norm =y [y/n]     If y, normalize by fold.
       bool   prod  =n  [y/n]     If y, find product instead of stack. Ignores
              rms and norm.
       bool   rms =n [y/n]     If y, compute the root-mean-square  instead  of
              stack.
       floats scale =       [nAXIS]
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/trimo/all
       bei/trimo/subsamp
       bei/vela/strat
       bei/vela/vscan
       cwp/geo2006TimeShiftImagingCondition/flat
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/flat4
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/gaus1
       cwp/geo2007StereographicImagingCondition/sigsbee2
       cwp/geo2008InterferometricImagingCondition/sigs2
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2oneA
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/flatEICangle
       cwp/geo2011WideAzimuthAngleDecomposition/seam357
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/main/stack.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfstack
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfstack(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS
       sfstackn < in.rsf > out.rsf min=minin.rsf max=maxin.rsf mean=y thres=0.

PARAMETERS
       string max  =       file determining up to which value to stack (auxil‐
              iary input file name)
       bool   mean =y [y/n]     if n, sum; if y, average
       string min =      file determining from which value to stack (auxiliary
              input file name)
       float  thres =0.       threshold (percentage of maxabs)

Madagascar.sfstacks — Method
sfstacks(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstacks on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstacks. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstacks(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstacks(1)

NAME
       sfstacks - Constant-velocity stacks.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstacks  <  cmp.rsf  >  stk.rsf  offset=offset.rsf mask=msk.rsf half=y
       str=0.5 mute=12 nv= v0= dv= CDPtype=  slowness=n  squared=n  h0=0.  ex‐
       tend=4

PARAMETERS
       int    CDPtype = ®
       float  dv =      step in velocity
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       float  h0 =0.       reference offset
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       int    nv =      number of velocities
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       bool   squared =n [y/n]     if y, the slowness or velocity is squared
       float  str =0.5      maximum stretch allowed
       float  v0 =      first velocity
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mstacks.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfstacks(1)
source

Madagascar.sfstaticcorr — Method
sfstaticcorr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstaticcorr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstaticcorr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstaticcorr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstaticcorr(1)

NAME
       sfstaticcorr -

SYNOPSIS
       sfstaticcorr < Fin.rsf > Fou.rsf verb=n

COMMENTS
       Static Corrections for Redatuming SHARAD data to MOLA surface Input: 2D
       correlation between SHARAD data and clutter simulation Output: Smoothed
       maximum  correlation  picks representing residual ionosphere time delay
       Created on: Mar 9, 2021

PARAMETERS
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cwp/Mstaticcorr.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfstaticcorr(1)
source

NAME
       sfstcontrib - Contribution weighting using streaming attributes.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstcontrib   <  gath.rsf  stack=stck.rsf  weight=wght.rsf  >  outp.rsf
       eps=1.0f w0=0.0f

PARAMETERS

       file   stack =      auxiliary input file name
       float  w0 =0.0f      initial weight
       file   weight =      auxiliary output file name

Madagascar.sfstfchain — Method
sfstfchain(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstfchain on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstfchain. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstfchain(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstfchain(1)

NAME
       sfstfchain - Find a symmetric chain of Fourier weighting and scaling

SYNOPSIS
       sfstfchain   <   src.rsf   >  wht.rsf  target=tgt.rsf  fweight=fwht.rsf
       match=mch.rsf rect=1 frect=1 niter=0 liter=50

PARAMETERS
       int    frect =1      smoothing in frequency
       file   fweight =      auxiliary output file name
       int    liter =50      number of linear iterations
       file   match =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       int    rect =1      smoothing in time
       file   target =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mstfchain.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfstfchain(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfstfchain2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstfchain2(1)

NAME
       sfstfchain2 - Find a symmetric chain of 1-D Fourier weighting and scal‐
       ing with movies

SYNOPSIS
       sfstfchain2  <   src.rsf   >   wht.rsf   target=tgt.rsf   init_w=w0.rsf
       init_wf=wf0.rsf  fweight=fwht.rsf  match=mch.rsf  wsnap=snap_w.rsf wfs‐
       nap=snap_wf.rsf  lsmigsnap=snap_lsmig.rsf  rect1=1   rect2=1   frect1=1
       frect2=1 niter=0 liter=50 snap=0

PARAMETERS
       int    frect1 =1 ®
       int    frect2 =1      smoothing in frequency
       file   fweight =      auxiliary output file name
       file   init_w =      auxiliary input file name
       file   init_wf =      auxiliary input file name
       int    liter =50      number of linear iterations
       file   lsmigsnap =      auxiliary output file name
       file   match =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =0      number of iterations
       int    rect1 =1 ®
       int    rect2 =1      smoothing in time
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   target =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wfsnap =      auxiliary output file name
       file   wsnap =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mstfchain2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfstfchain2(1)

Madagascar.sfstft — Method
sfstft(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstft on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstft. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstft(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstft(1)

NAME
       sfstft - Short-time Fourier transform (STFT).

SYNOPSIS
       sfstft < in.rsf > out.rsf inv=n window=n sym=n opt=y ntw=7

PARAMETERS
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, perform inverse transform
       int    ntw =7      time-window length
       bool   opt =y [y/n]     if y, determine optimal size for efficiency
       bool   sym  =n  [y/n]     if y, apply symmetric scaling to make the FFT
              operator Hermitian
       bool   window =n [y/n]     if y, add Hanning window
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mstft.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfstft(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfstltft(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstltft(1)

NAME
       sfstltft - Streaming time-frequency transform (LTFT).

SYNOPSIS
       sfstltft    <    in.rsf   >   out.rsf   basis=basis.rsf   mask=mask.rsf
       weight=weight.rsf inv=n verb=n nw= dw= w0=0. lambda=1.0f

PARAMETERS
       string basis =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dw =      frequency step
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse transform
       float  lambda =1.0f      smoothing parameter
       string mask =      data weight (auxiliary input file name)
       int    nw =      number of frequencies
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       float  w0 =0.       first frequency
       string weight =      model weight (auxiliary input file name)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mstltft.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfstltft(1)
source
Madagascar.sfstolt — Method
sfstolt(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstolt on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstolt. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstolt(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstolt(1)

NAME
       sfstolt - Post-stack Stolt modeling/migration.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstolt  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  vel= pad=nt extend=4 mute=12 minstr=0.0
       stretch=1

COMMENTS
       Requires the input to be cosine-transformed over the lateral axes.

       August 2014 program of the month:  http://ahay.org/blog/2014/08/03/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfstolt/

PARAMETERS
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       float  minstr =0.0      minimum stretch allowed
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       int    pad =nt      padding on the time axis
       float  stretch =1      Stolt stretch parameter
       float  vel  =       Constant velocity (use negative velocity for model‐
              ing)
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mstolt.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfstolt(1)
source

SYNOPSIS
       sfstolt2 < in.rsf > out.rsf vel= pad=nt nf=2

COMMENTS
       Requires the input to be cosine-transformed over the lateral axes.

PARAMETERS
       int    nf =2      Interpolation accuracy
       int    pad =nt      padding on the time axis
       float  vel  =       Constant velocity (use negative velocity for model‐
              ing)

NAME
       sfstoltstretch - Stolt stretch.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstoltstretch  <  in.rsf  >  st.rsf  velocity=vel.rsf inv=n nstretch=1
       pad=nt eps=0.01 vel=

PARAMETERS
       float  eps =0.01      stretch regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, inverse stretch
       int    nstretch =1      number of steps
       int    pad =nt      time axis padding
       float  vel =      reference velocity
       file   velocity =      auxiliary input file name

RSF Documentation

sfstphase(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstphase(1)

NAME
       sfstphase - Streaming estimate of instantaneous frequency.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstphase < in.rsf > out.rsf lambda= window_size=1 verb=n complex=n or‐
       der=100 ref=1. hertz=n band=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   band =n [y/n]     if y, compute instantaneous bandwidth
       bool   complex =n [y/n]     if y, use complex-valued computations
       bool   hertz =n [y/n]     if y, convert output to Hertz
       float  lambda = ®
       int    order =100      Hilbert transformer order
       float  ref =1.       Hilbert transformer reference (0.5 < ref <= 1)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       int    window_size =1      window_size
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mstphase.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfstphase(1)

Madagascar.sfstream — Method
sfstream(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstream on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstream. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstream(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstream(1)

NAME
       sfstream - Streaming PEF

SYNOPSIS
       sfstream    <    inp.rsf    >   out.rsf   pattern=pat.rsf   pef=pef.rsf
       known=known.rsf inv=n adj=n na= eps=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag (for linear operator)
       float  eps =      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       string known =      known data locations  (optional)  (auxiliary  input
              file name)
       int    na =      PEF filter size (not including leading one)
       string pattern =      pattern data (for linear operator) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
       string pef =      output PEF (optional) (auxiliary output file name)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mstream.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfstream(1)
source
Madagascar.sfstreamh — Method
sfstreamh(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstreamh on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstreamh. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstreamh(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstreamh(1)

NAME
       sfstreamh - Streaming PEF on a helix

SYNOPSIS
       sfstreamh  <  inp.rsf > out.rsf lag=lag.rsf pattern=pat.rsf a= n= inv=n
       adj=n jump=1 na=0 eps=

PARAMETERS
       ints   a =      filter shape [dim]
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag (for linear operator)
       float  eps =      regularization
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inversion flag
       int    jump =1      jump > 1 is used for trace interpolation
       string lag =      auxiliary input file name
       ints   n =       [dim]
       int    na =0      PEF filter size (not including leading one)
       string pattern =      pattern data (for linear operator) (auxiliary in‐
              put file name)
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mstreamh.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfstreamh(1)
source

sfstreamissh(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfstreamissh(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstreamissh(1)

NAME
       sfstreamissh  - Missing data interpolating using streaming PEF on a he‐
       lix

SYNOPSIS
       sfstreamissh < inp.rsf > out.rsf lag=lag.rsf known=known.rsf a= n= na=0
       eps= var=0.0f seed=time(NULL)

PARAMETERS
       ints   a =      filter shape [dim]
       float  eps =      regularization
       file   known =      auxiliary input file name
       string lag =      auxiliary input file name
       ints   n =       [dim]
       int    na =0      PEF filter size (not including leading one)
       int    seed =time(NULL)      random seed
       float  var =0.0f      noise variance
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mstreamissh.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfstreamissh(1)
source
Madagascar.sfstretch — Method
sfstretch(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstretch on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstretch. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstretch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstretch(1)

NAME
       sfstretch - Stretch of the time axis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstretch  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  datum=dat.rsf inv=n dens=1 verb=y v0=
       half=y CDPtype= delay= tdelay=  hdelay=  scale=  nout=dens*n1  extend=4
       mute=0 maxstr=0 rule=

PARAMETERS
       int    CDPtype = ®
       file   datum =      auxiliary input file name
       float  delay =      time delay for rule=lmo
       int    dens =1      axis stretching factor
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       float  hdelay =      offset delay for rule=rad
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, do inverse stretching
       float  maxstr =0      maximum stretch
       int    mute =0      tapering size
       int    nout =dens*n1      output axis length (if inv=n)
       string rule =      Stretch rule:         n -  constant-velocity  normal
              moveout   (nmostretch),  default           l  -  linear  moveout
              (lmostretch)         L - logarithmic stretch (logstretch)
              2  -  t^2  stretch (t2stretch)         c - t^2 chebyshev stretch
              (t2chebstretch)         r - radial  moveout  (radstretch)
              d  -  datuming  (datstretch)           s  -  s*t scaling stretch
              (scalestretch)
       float  scale =      scaling factor for rule=scale
       float  tdelay =      time delay for rule=rad
       float  v0 =      moveout velocity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/sg/toldi
       bei/trimo/all
       bei/vela/stretch
       bei/wvs/head
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/sin
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mstretch.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfstretch
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfstretch(1)
source
Madagascar.sfstripes — Method
sfstripes(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfstripes on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfstripes. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfstripes(1) Madagascar Manuals sfstripes(1)

NAME
       sfstripes  -  Model  the  positions  and  dips  of the constant offset,
       source, midpoint, and receiver strikes in a source vs. offset space.

SYNOPSIS
       sfstripes < inp.rsf > out.rsf mo= ms= my= mr=

PARAMETERS
       int    mo =      offset parameter, a constant offset line  will  appear
              in the output every o offset
       int    mr  =      receiver parameter, a constant receiver line will ap‐
              pear in the output every r receiver
       int    ms =      source parameter, a constant source line  will  appear
              in the output every s source
       int    my  =      midpoint parameter, a constant midpoint line will ap‐
              pear in the output every y midpoint
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mstripes.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfstripes(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfsttimefreq(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsttimefreq(1)

NAME
       sfsttimefreq - Time-frequency analysis using streaming attributes.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsttimefreq  <  time.rsf  >  timefreq.rsf  mask=mask.rsf nw= dw= w0=0.
       lambda=1.0f window_size=50 phase=n

PARAMETERS
       float  dw =      f    requency step
       float  lambda =1.0f      smoothing parameter
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nw =      number of frequencies
       bool   phase =n [y/n]     output phase instead of amplitude
       float  w0 =0.       first frequency
       int    window_size =50      window_size
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Msttimefreq.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfsuplane — Method
sfsuplane(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsuplane on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsuplane. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsuplane(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsuplane(1)

NAME
       sfsuplane - Create common offset data file with up to 3 planes

SYNOPSIS
       sfsuplane  >  out.rsf  nt=NT  ntr=NTR  dt=DT offset=OFF npl=NPL taper=0
       dip1=0  len1=3*ntr/4   ct1=nt/2-1   cx1=ntr/2-1   dip2=4   len2=3*ntr/4
       ct2=nt/2-1   cx2=ntr/2-1  dip3=8  len3=3*ntr/4  ct3=nt/2-1  cx3=ntr/2-1
       liner=0

COMMENTS
       Command line should be: sfsuplane in=NULL >file.rsf (There should be at
       least one parameter in command line because of sf_init(argc,argv))

PARAMETERS
       int    ct1 =nt/2-1 ®
       int    ct2 =nt/2-1 ®
       int    ct3 =nt/2-1 ®
       int    cx1 =ntr/2-1      set defaults and/or get parameters for plane 2
       int    cx2 =ntr/2-1      set defaults and/or get parameters for plane 3
       int    cx3  =ntr/2-1      check if user wants the special output speci‐
              fied
       float  dip1 =0 ®
       float  dip2 =4 ®
       float  dip3 =8 ®
       float  dt =DT ®
       int    len1 =3*ntr/4 ®
       int    len2 =3*ntr/4 ®
       int    len3 =3*ntr/4 ®
       int    liner =0 ®
       int    npl =NPL ®
       int    nt =NT ®
       int    ntr =NTR ®
       float  offset =OFF ®
       int    taper =0      set defaults and/or get parameters for plane 1
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msuplane.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfsuplane(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfsv2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsv2d(1)

NAME
       sfsv2d - Velocity and heterogeneity parameter convert to dip.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsv2d  <  in.rsf  > out.rsf anisotropy=anisotropy.rsf n=32 d=12.5 o=0.
       mute=n half=n tp=0.150 t0=0. v0=10000 x0=0. abs=y inner=n hyper=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   abs =y [y/n]     if y, use absolute value |x-x0| (available when
              mute=y)
       file   anisotropy =      auxiliary input file name
       float  d =12.5      offset interval
       bool   half =n [y/n]     if y, half-offset instead of full offset
       bool   hyper  =n  [y/n]     if  y,  do  hyperbolic mute (available when
              mute=y)
       bool   inner =n [y/n]     if y, do inner muter (available when mute=y)
       bool   mute =n [y/n]     if y, use mutter
       int    n =32      offset number
       float  o =0.       offset origin
       float  t0 =0.       starting time (available when mute=y)
       float  tp =0.150      end time (available when mute=y)
       float  v0 =10000      velocity (available when mute=y)
       float  x0 =0.       starting space (available when mute=y)
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Msv2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfsv2d(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS
       sfsvd < in.rsf > out.rsf left=outu.rsf right=outv.rsf

COMMENTS
       Compute [U,O,V]=SVD(A), A=UOV, a little bit different from A=UoV'

PARAMETERS
       string left =      auxiliary output file name
       string right =      auxiliary output file name

       user/yliu/Msvd.c

Madagascar.sfsvmf — Method
sfsvmf(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsvmf on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsvmf. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsvmf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsvmf(1)

NAME
       sfsvmf - Space varying median filtering.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsvmf  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf similarity=similarity.rsf L=lengthout.rsf
       boundary=n  ns=0  ne=n2-1  nfw=  l1=4  l2=2  l3=2   l4=4   lambda1=0.15
       lambda2=0.25 lambda3=0.75 lambda4=0.85

COMMENTS
       Using local similarity as a reference.

PARAMETERS
       string L =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   boundary =n [y/n]     if y, boundary is data, whereas zero
       int    l1 =4      space-varying window parameter l1 (default=4)
       int    l2 =2      space-varying window parameter l2 (default=2)
       int    l3 =2      space-varying window parameter l3 (default=2)
       int    l4 =4      space-varying window parameter l4 (default=4)
       float  lambda1  =0.15       space-varying window parameter lambda1 (de‐
              fault=0.15)
       float  lambda2 =0.25      space-varying window parameter  lambda2  (de‐
              fault=0.25)
       float  lambda3  =0.75       space-varying window parameter lambda3 (de‐
              fault=0.75)
       float  lambda4 =0.85      space-varying window parameter  lambda4  (de‐
              fault=0.85)
       int    ne  =n2-1       processing window ending point, corresponding to
              the temporal axis, n2 means transposed first-axis dimension.
       int    nfw =      reference filter-window length (>l4, positive and odd
              integer)
       int    ns  =0       processing  window starting point, corresponding to
              the temporal axis
       file   similarity =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msvmf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfsvmf(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfswell(1) Madagascar Manuals sfswell(1)

NAME
       sfswell - Add swell noise to the data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfswell   <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  den=10.  inten=0.1  slope=0.1  width=4
       length=30 num=5 rep=n noise=n

PARAMETERS
       float  den  =10.        noise  density  (percent,  default=10,   Min=0,
              Max=100)
       float  inten  =0.1       noise  intensity (multiple peak value of data,
              default=0.1)
       int    length =30      max noise length (default=30)
       bool   noise =n [y/n]     if y, output noise only
       int    num =5      noise number (default=5)
       bool   rep =n [y/n]     if y, replace data with noise
       float  slope =0.1      noise slope (default=0.1)
       int    width =4      max noise width (default=4)
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mswell.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfswell(1)

PARAMETERS

       float  perc =5      threshold percentage of the maximum value
       int    size =0      sliding window radius
       bool   sw =n [y/n]     sliding window
       float  var_thres =0.       variance threshold (normalized)

       user/jsun/Mswnorm.c

       n1=nz0-fz n2=nx0-fx

       int    f2 =0      sliding window radius
       int    n1 =nz0-fz      sliding window radius
       int    n2 =nx0-fx      sliding window radius
       int    size =0      sliding window radius
       bool   sw =n [y/n]     sliding window
       float  term =100.       variance threshold (normalized)
       float  thres =0.       variance threshold (normalized)

Madagascar.sfsymposolver — Method
sfsymposolver(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsymposolver. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfsymposolver(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsymposolver(1)

NAME
       sfsymposolver  - Symmetric positive definite matrix equation solver us‐
       ing square root method (cholesky decomposition method)

SYNOPSIS
       sfsymposolver < in.rsf rhs=rhs.rsf > out.rsf verb=n n=

COMMENTS
       Ax=d-> LL'x=d -> Ly=d -> L'x=y -> x Input is the down triangle of A.

PARAMETERS
       int    n = ®
       file   rhs =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Msymposolver.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfsymposolver(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfsynmarine(1) Madagascar Manuals sfsynmarine(1)

NAME
       sfsynmarine - Simple synthetic marine data example.

SYNOPSIS
       sfsynmarine > out.rsf nt=250 nh=48 ny=10 nz=25

PARAMETERS
       int    nh =48      offset samples
       int    nt =250      time samples
       int    ny =10      midpoint samples
       int    nz =25      depth samples
USED IN
       bei/fld/synmarine
SOURCE
       user/gee/Msynmarine.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfsynmarine(1)
source
Madagascar.sfsyntop — Method
sfsyntop(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfsyntop on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfsyntop. See ?Madagascar for examples.

       sfsyntop - Make synthetic topography map.

SYNOPSIS

       file   mod =      auxiliary output file name

       int    n2 =100      data dimensions

sft2diter(1) Madagascar Manuals sft2diter(1)

NAME
       sft2diter - Time-to-depth conversion (linear operator)

SYNOPSIS
       sft2diter   <   in.rsf   >  out.rsf  s0=is0.rsf  t0=it0.rsf  x0=ix0.rsf
       f0=if0.rsf mask=mask.rsf  prec=prec.rsf  dix=dix.rsf  velocity=y  adj=n
       shape=n eps=0.1 verb=n tol=1.e-6 cgiter=200 rect#=(1,1,...) what=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       int    cgiter =200      number of CG iterations
       string dix =      auxiliary input file name
       float  eps =0.1      regularization parameter
       string f0 =      auxiliary input file name
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       string prec =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect# =(1,1,...)       smoothing radius on #-th axis
       string s0 =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   shape =n [y/n]     regularization (default Tikhnov)
       string t0 =      auxiliary input file name
       float  tol =1.e-6      tolerance for shaping regularization
       bool   velocity  =y  [y/n]     y,  inputs  are  velocity / n, slowness-
              squared
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string what =      what to compute (default inversion)
       string x0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/llisiw/Mt2diter.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sftah5dinterp — Method
sftah5dinterp(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sftah5dinterp on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sftah5dinterp. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sftah5dinterp(1) Madagascar Manuals sftah5dinterp(1)

NAME
       sftah5dinterp - Trace And Header GET Header Word prints trace headers.

SYNOPSIS
       sftah5dinterp < in.rsf > out.rsf key= verbose=1

COMMENTS
       tah  is the abbreviation of Trace And Header.  Madagascar programs that
       begin with sftah are a designed to: 1- read trace and headers from sep‐
       arate  rsf  files  and  write them to standard output (ie sftahread) 2-
       filter programs that read and write standard input/output  and  process
       the  tah  data (eg sftahnmo, sftahstack) 3- read tah data from standard
       input and write separate rsf files for the trace and headers  data  (ie
       sftahwrite)

       These  programs  allow Seismic Unix (su) like processing in Madagascar.
       Some programs have su like names.

       Some programs in this suite are sftahread, sftahgethw, ftahhdrmath, and
       sftahwrite.

       The  sftahgethw  program  prints headers.  List the headers you want to
       print in the key parameter.  EXAMPLE:

       sftahread  verbose=1  input=npr3_gathers.rsf  |  sftahgethw   verbose=0
       key=sx,sy,gx,gy,offset  >/dev/null

       The headers are in the file npr3_gathers_hdr.rsf, the headers parameter
       default.  The headers are merged with the trace amplitudes and the  tah
       data  sent  down the pipe for sftahgethw.  The source and group coordi‐
       nates and offset (sx,sy,gx,gy,offset) are printed  to  STDERR.   Traces
       are sent to STDOUT, which is directed to /dev/null (the bit bucket).

       PARAMETERS strings key= no default

       list  of  header keys print.  Look at the sfsegyread for a list      of
       header names.

PARAMETERS
       strings
              key =       [numkeys]
       int    verbose =1

                   flag to control amount of print
                   0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
SOURCE
       user/karl/Mtah5dinterp.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sftah5dinterp(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sftahagc. See ?Madagascar for examples.

PARAMETERS

       floats tstart =       [numtstart]
       int    verbose =1

                     flag to control amount of print
                     0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
       float  wagc = ®
       floats xstart =       [numxstart]

Madagascar.sftahfilter — Method
sftahfilter(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sftahfilter on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sftahfilter. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sftahfilter(1) Madagascar Manuals sftahfilter(1)

NAME
       sftahfilter  - Read Trace And Header (tah) from standard input and FIL‐
       TER

SYNOPSIS
       sftahfilter < in.rsf > out.rsf filter_file=filter_file.rsf filter= ver‐
       bose=1 filt_indx_t0=0

COMMENTS
       tah  is the abbreviation of Trace And Header.  Madagascar programs that
       begin with sftah are a designed to: 1- read trace and headers from sep‐
       arate  rsf  files  and  write them to standard output (ie sftahread) 2-
       filter programs that read and write standard input/output  and  process
       the  tah  data (eg sftahnmo, sftahstack) 3- read tah data from standard
       input and write separate rsf files for the trace and headers  data  (ie
       sftahwrite)

       These  programs  allow Seismic Unix (su) like processing in Madagascar.
       Some programs have su like names.

       Some programs in this suite are sftahread, sftahgethw, ftahhdrmath, and
       sftahwrite.

       The sftahfilter program is designed to apply a filter. Trace and header
       data (tah) are read from from standard input (usually a pipe).  A  fil‐
       ter  is  read  from  the command line or from a file.  If the filter is
       read from a file, it can be a single filter, or  one  filter  for  each
       trace.   Future  enhancements would be to use trace headers to define a
       location in the filter file and read that filter or even interpolate  a
       filter.   That would support shot or receiver dependent filter for sur‐
       face consistant decon.  Another enhancement would be to  add  frequency
       domain bandpass filters.

       EXAMPLE:

       sftahsort                       input=shots-receivers-23900_headfix.rsf
       sort="xline:600,601 offset"                              |  sftahfilter
       filterfile=dephase.rsf                             |      sftahmakeskey
       pkey=xline      skey=cdpt                             |      sftahwrite
       verbose=1                                                   label2=cdpt
       o2=1 n2=100 d2=1                             label3=xline  o3=600  n3=1
       d3=1                                             output=dephasecmps.rsf
       >/dev/null

       sfgrey <mutecmps.rsf | sfpen

       In this example a deterministic dephase filter is applied to a prestack
       datafile.

       The shot organized prestack data, shots-receivers-23900_headfix.rsf are
       read in xline offset order by sftahsort program.  The  headers  are  in
       the  file  shots-receivers-23900_headfix_hdr.rsf, the headers parameter
       default.  The headers are merged with the trace amplitudes and the  tah
       data sent down the pipe to apply a filter.

       The  sftahfilter  program applies a filter contained in the dephase.rsf
       file.

       The program sftahmakeskey is used to create a secondary key used in the
       following  sftahwrite  to  define the location to wrte the trace in the
       output file. Sftahmakeskey makes a secondary key (skey=cdpt) the  count
       the  traces starting in the a primary key gather (pkey=xline).  The in‐
       put traces gathered by xline by sftahsort. Sftahmakeskey sets cdpt to 1
       when the trace has a new xline.  If the trace has the same xline as the
       previous trace cdpt is incremented

       sftahwrite writes the trace data to dephasecmp.rsf and the headers  are
       written  to  the file dephasecmp_hdr.rsf.  The order of the data in the
       file is defined by the cdpt and xline trace headers, so the  data order
       is  (time,cmpt,xline).   Finally,  the output volume is displayed using
       sfgrey.

PARAMETERS
       int    filt_indx_t0 =0

                   indx to time 0 in the filter.  Must be in the range [0,num‐
              filter)
       floats filter =

                    A list of floats that is the filter to convolve on the in‐
              put
                    traces.
                   [numfilter]
       string filter_file =

                   name of the rsf file containing the filter(s)
                (auxiliary input file name)
       int    verbose =1

                   flag to control amount of print
                   0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
SOURCE
       user/karl/Mtahfilter.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sftahfilter(1)
source
Madagascar.sftahgain — Method
sftahgain(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sftahgain on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sftahgain. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sftahgain(1) Madagascar Manuals sftahgain(1)

NAME
       sftahgain  -  Read Trace And Header (tah) from standard input and apply
       GAIN

SYNOPSIS
       sftahgain <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  xstart=  tstart=  verbose=1  scale=1.0
       tpow=0.0 epow=0.0 agc=0.0

COMMENTS
       tah  is the abbreviation of Trace And Header.  Madagascar programs that
       begin with sftah are a designed to: 1- read trace and headers from sep‐
       arate  rsf  files  and  write them to standard output (ie sftahread) 2-
       filter programs that read and write standard input/output  and  process
       the  tahxstart  data  (eg  sftahnmo,  sftahstack) 3- read tah data from
       standard input and write separate rsf files for the trace  and  headers
       data (ie sftahwrite)

       These  programs  allow Seismic Unix (su) like processing in Madagascar.
       Some programs have su like names.

       Some programs in this suite are sftahread, sftahgethw, ftahhdrmath, and
       sftahwrite.

       The sftahgain program is designed to apply various amplitude gain func‐
       tions.  These gain functions include multiply by a constant, trace bal‐
       ance,  clipping,  AGC,  t**pow,  exp(epow*t) and AGC.  Trace and header
       data (tah) are read from standard input  (usually  a  pipe).   Data  is
       scaled:  out(t)  = scale * BAL{CLIP[AGC{[t^tpow * exp(epow * t)}]} Then
       trace and header data is written to standard output.

       EXAMPLE:

       sftahsort                       input=shots-receivers-23900_headfix.rsf
       sort="xline:600,601   offset"                              |  sftahgain
       agc=.5                                             |      sftahmakeskey
       pkey=xline       skey=cdpt                            |      sftahwrite
       verbose=1                                                   label2=cdpt
       o2=1  n2=100  d2=1                             label3=xline o3=600 n3=1
       d3=1                                                 output=agccmps.rsf
       >/dev/null

       sfgrey <agccmps.rsf | sfpen

       In  this example the shot organized prestack data in the file shots-re‐
       ceivers-23900_headfix.rsf are read in xline offset order  by  sftahsort
       program.   The  headers  are  in  the  file shots-receivers-23900_head‐
       fix_hdr.rsf, the headers parameter default.   The  headers  are  merged
       with the trace amplitudes and the tah data sent down the pipe for scal‐
       ing (agc).

       sftahagc applies a .5 second automatic gain control (agc)

       The program sftahmakeskey is used to create a secondary key used in the
       following  sftahwrite  to  define the location to wrte the trace in the
       output file. Sftahmakeskey makes a secondary key (skey=cdpt) the  count
       the  traces starting in the a primary key gather (pkey=xline).  The in‐
       put traces gathered by xline by sftahsort. Sftahmakeskey sets cdpt to 1
       when the trace has a new xline.  If the trace has the same xline as the
       previous trace cdpt is incremented

       Sftahwrite writes the the trace data to agccmp.rsf and the headers  are
       written  to the file agccmp_hdr.rsf.  The order of the data in the out‐
       put file is defined by the cdpt and xline trace headers, so  the   data
       order  is  (time,cmpt,xline).   Finally, the output volume is displayed
       using sfgrey.

       Operation order:

       out(t) = scale * BAL{CLIP[AGC{[t^tpow * exp(epow * t)}]}

PARAMETERS
       float  agc =0.0      Length of agc window in seconds. 0.0 means no agc
       float  epow =0.0      multiply data by exp(epow*t)
       float  scale =1.0      multiply data by this float
       float  tpow =0.0      multiply data by t^tpow
       floats tstart =      list of times that correspont to xstart and define
              the  offset           dependent  start  time for the agc scaling
              [numtstart]
       int    verbose =1

                     flag to control amount of print
                     0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
       floats xstart =      list of offsets that correspond to tstart and  de‐
              fine the offset
                         dependent start time for the agc scaling  [numxstart]
USED IN
       data/bpstatics94/firstlook
       data/bptti2007/firstlook
       data/bpvelanal2004/firstlook
SOURCE
       user/karl/Mtahgain.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sftahgain(1)
source
Madagascar.sftahgethw — Method
sftahgethw(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sftahgethw on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sftahgethw. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sftahgethw(1) Madagascar Manuals sftahgethw(1)

NAME
       sftahgethw - Trace And Header GET Header Word prints trace headers.

SYNOPSIS
       sftahgethw < in.rsf > out.rsf key= verbose=1

COMMENTS
       tah  is the abbreviation of Trace And Header.  Madagascar programs that
       begin with sftah are a designed to: 1- read trace and headers from sep‐
       arate  rsf  files  and  write them to standard output (ie sftahread) 2-
       filter programs that read and write standard input/output  and  process
       the  tah  data (eg sftahnmo, sftahstack) 3- read tah data from standard
       input and write separate rsf files for the trace and headers  data  (ie
       sftahwrite)

       These  programs  allow Seismic Unix (su) like processing in Madagascar.
       Some programs have su like names.

       Some programs in this suite are sftahread, sftahgethw, ftahhdrmath, and
       sftahwrite.

       The  sftahgethw  program  prints headers.  List the headers you want to
       print in the key parameter.  EXAMPLE:

       sftahread  verbose=1  input=npr3_gathers.rsf  |  sftahgethw   verbose=0
       key=sx,sy,gx,gy,offset  >/dev/null

       The headers are in the file npr3_gathers_hdr.rsf, the headers parameter
       default.  The headers are merged with the trace amplitudes and the  tah
       data  sent  down the pipe for sftahgethw.  The source and group coordi‐
       nates and offset (sx,sy,gx,gy,offset) are printed  to  STDERR.   Traces
       are sent to STDOUT, which is directed to /dev/null (the bit bucket).

       PARAMETERS string key= no default

       list  of  header keys print.  Look at the sfsegyread for a list      of
       header names.

PARAMETERS
       strings
              key =       [numkeys]
       int    verbose =1

                   flag to control amount of print
                   0 terse, 1 informative, 2 chatty, 3 debug
SOURCE
       user/karl/Mtahgethw.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sftahgethw(1)
