sfvelcon(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelcon(1)

NAME
       sfvelcon  - Post-stack velocity continuation by implicit finite differ‐
       ences

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelcon < in.rsf > out.rsf vel=0.75 v0=0. nv=n1 adj=n add=n inv=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   add =n [y/n]     addition flag
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     adjoint flag
       int    inv =0      amplitude type
       int    nv =n1      number of steps
       float  v0 =0.       starting velocity
       float  vel =0.75      final velocity
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mvelcon.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfvelinv — Method
sfvelinv(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvelinv on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvelinv. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvelinv(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelinv(1)

NAME
       sfvelinv  -  Velocity transform for generating velocity spectra and its
       corresponding hyperbolic modeling.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelinv < cmp.rsf > vtr.rsf adj=n niter=0 ns=nx ds=0.001 os=0.00000001
       nx=ns dx=10. ox=0. robust=n perc=90. fact=1.5 nliter=10 eps=1. type=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj  =n  [y/n]     adj  =  0:  from velocity-domain(t,s) to cmp-
              gather(t,x)
                     adj = 1: from cmp-gather(t,x) to velocity-domain(t,s)
       float  ds =0.001      slowness sampling
       float  dx =10.       offset sampling
       float  eps =1.       regularization parameter for robust inversion
       float  fact =1.5      threshold factor for robust inversion
       int    niter =0      number of iterations (invoked if adj=y)
       int    nliter =10      number of POCS iterations for robust inversion
       int    ns =nx      number of slowness values
       int    nx =ns      number of offset values
       float  os =0.00000001      slowness origin
       float  ox =0.       offset origin
       float  perc =90.       threshold percentage for robust inversion
       bool   robust =n [y/n]     robust inversion
       string type =      thresholding type
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mvelinv.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfvelinv(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvelinvnew — Method
sfvelinvnew(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvelinvnew on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvelinvnew. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvelinvnew(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelinvnew(1)

NAME
       sfvelinvnew - None

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelinvnew < infile.rsf res=fres.rsf vel0=fm.rsf mres=fmres.rsf > out‐
       file.rsf velout=vtr.rsf nv=nhx dv=0.01 ov=1.5 niter=20 savevel=0 flag=0
       mflag=0  huber=0  irls=0  nstep=1  rwt=0.  mwt=0.  srate=0.01  eps=0.01
       lamda=1000. delta=0.0001 step=0.000005 alpha=790.635 alpha= lip= reset=

PARAMETERS
       alpha  =      smoothing parameter, typical value: 1 to 10  times  esti‐
              mated norm(x,inf)
       delta  =0.0001       delta  controls  update step and convergent, small
              delta ensure convergence but with small decrease in data fit er‐
              ror
       dv     =0.01 ®
       eps    =0.01 ®
       flag   =0 ®
       huber  =0 ®
       irls   =0 ®
       lamda  =1000.        lamda  controls sparsity, bigger lamda, more spar‐
              sity
       lip    =      the estimated Lipschitz constrant of the dual  objective,
              default: alpha*normest(A*A',1e-2)
       mflag  =0 ®
       file   mres =      auxiliary output file name
       mwt    =0.  ®
       niter  =20 ®
       nstep  =1 ®
       nv     =nhx ®
       ov     =1.5 ®
       file   res =      auxiliary output file name
       reset  =       Nesterov's acceleration restart (theta is reset) or skip
              (theta is not reset)
       rwt    =0.  ®
       savevel
              =0      Flag to choose the algorithm
       srate  =0.01 ®
       step   =0.000005      step is very important in convergence  and  spar‐
              sity
       file   vel0 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   velout =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/seisinv/Mvelinvnew.f90
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfvelinvnew(1)
source

       sfvelinvww - None

       os=0.00000001 huber=0 irls=0 nstep=1 niter=20 rwt=0. mwt=0.  srate=0.01
       epw=0.01 savevel=0

PARAMETERS
       ds     =0.001 ®
       epw    =0.01 ®
       huber  =0 ®
       irls   =0 ®
       mwt    =0.  ®
       niter  =20 ®
       ns     =nh ®
       nstep  =1 ®
       os     =0.00000001 ®
       rwt    =0.  ®
       savevel
              =0 ®
       srate  =0.01 ®

sfvelmap(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelmap(1)

NAME
       sfvelmap  - 2-D mapping from moving-object velocity to plane-wave slow‐
       ness

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelmap < in.rsf > out.rsf  osx=-0.5/dvx  osy=-0.5/dvy  nt=360  dt=0.5
       ot=0.

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =0.5      line parameter increment
       int    nt  =360       number  of  line  parameter  for  integration  in
              [0,180].
       float  osx =-0.5/dvx ®
       float  osy =-0.5/dvy ®
       float  ot =0.       line parameter origin
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Mvelmap.c

       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfvelmod(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelmod(1)

NAME
       sfvelmod - Velocity transform.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelmod < scan.rsf > cmp.rsf half=y extend=4 slowness=n

COMMENTS
       Inverse of sfvscan.

PARAMETERS
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
USED IN
       bei/vela/vscan
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mvelmod.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfvelmod(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfvelsteer(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvelsteer(1)

NAME
       sfvelsteer - Velocity steering for 2D receivers array.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvelsteer  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  nvx= dvx= ovx= nvy= dvy= ovy= iypi=0
       iyps=ny-1 xp=

PARAMETERS
       float  dvx =      vx sampling
       float  dvy =      vy sampling
       int    iypi =0      first depth position  where  velocity  steering  is
              computed
       int    iyps  =ny-1       last depth position where velocity steering is
              computed
       int    nvx =      number of vx values
       int    nvy =      number of vy values
       float  ovx =      vx origin
       float  ovy =      vy origin
       float  xp =      lateral position where velocity steering is computed
SOURCE
       user/browaeys/Mvelsteer.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfvelsteer(1)

       bool   pull =y [y/n]     pull or push operator
       float  s02 =0.       reference slowness squared (for antialiasing)

Madagascar.sfversion — Method
sfversion(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfversion on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfversion. See ?Madagascar for examples.

source
Madagascar.sfvfsacrsnh — Method
sfvfsacrsnh(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvfsacrsnh on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvfsacrsnh. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvfsacrsnh(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvfsacrsnh(1)

NAME
       sfvfsacrsnh  -  Version 2.0 - Zero offset CRS parameters inversion (RN,
       RNIP, BETA) with Very Fast Simulated Aneeling (VFSA)  Global  Optimiza‐
       tion

SYNOPSIS
       sfvfsacrsnh  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf om0=0.0 dm0=0.1 nm0=1 v0=1.5 ot0=0.0
       dt0=0.1 nt0=1 c0=0.5 temp0=10 repeat=1 verb=0

COMMENTS
       This program uses the Non-Hyperbolic CRS approximation to fit data cube
       and get the zero-offset CRS parameters (Fomel, 2013).

       Programmer: Rodolfo A. C. Neves (Dirack) 13/08/2021

       Email:  rodolfo_profissional@hotmail.com

       License: GPL-3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt>.

PARAMETERS
       float  c0 =0.5      damping factor of VFSA
       float  dm0 =0.1      central CMP's sampling (Km)
       float  dt0 =0.1      t0's sampling (s)
       int    nm0 =1      central CMP's number of samples (Km)
       int    nt0 =1      Number of t0's sampling (s)
       float  om0 =0.0      central CMP's origin (Km)
       float  ot0 =0.0      t0's origin (s)
       int    repeat  =1       How many times to perform VFSA global optimiza‐
              tion
       float  temp0 =10      initial VFSA temperature
       float  v0 =1.5      Near surface velocity (Km/s)
       bool   verb =0 [y/n]     1: active mode; 0: quiet mode
SOURCE
       user/dirack/Mvfsacrsnh.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfvfsacrsnh(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfvirtualdata(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvirtualdata(1)

NAME
       sfvirtualdata - Construction of virtual seismic data.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvirtualdata  <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  dif=dif.rsf verb=n stack=n both=n
       jumpo=1 jumps=1

PARAMETERS
       bool   both =n [y/n]     receiver flag, if y, receiver with both sides
       string dif =      auxiliary input file name
       int    jumpo =1      jump in offset dimension, only for stack=n
       int    jumps =1      jump in shot dimension, only for stack=n
       bool   stack =n [y/n]     stack flag, if y, no common multiple gather
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mvirtualdata.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfvirtualdata(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfviscoa2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfviscoa2d(1)

NAME
       sfviscoa2d  -  2D visco-acoustic modeling with 8th order staggered-grid
       FD

SYNOPSIS
       sfviscoa2d < Fv.rsf rho=Frho.rsf tau=Ftau.rsf tauo=Ftauo.rsf  >  Fw.rsf
       pz=Fpz.rsf px=Fpx.rsf nb=30 nt= dt= fm=20.0 ft=0 jt=1 verb=n kt=

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20.0      dominant freq of Ricker wavelet
       int    ft =0      first recorded time
       int    jt =1      time interval
       int    kt =      output px and pz component at kt
       int    nb =30      thickness of PML ABC
       int    nt =      number of time steps
       file   px =      auxiliary output file name
       file   pz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       file   tau =      auxiliary input file name
       file   tauo =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity, if y, output px and pz
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mviscoa2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfviscoa2d(1)
source

sfviscoe2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfviscoe2d(1)

NAME
       sfviscoe2d  - 2D 4-th order visco-elastic wave propagation using sponge
       ABC

SYNOPSIS
       sfviscoe2d   <   Fvp.rsf   vs=Fvs.rsf    rho=Frho.rsf    taup=Ftaup.rsf
       taus=Ftaus.rsf  tauo=Ftauo.rsf  > Fwavz.rsf wavx=Fwavx.rsf verb=n nb=30
       nt= kt= dt= fm=20.0 ft=0 jt=1

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      time sampling interval
       float  fm =20.0      dominant freq of Ricker wavelet
       int    ft =0      first recorded time
       int    jt =1      time interval
       int    kt =      record wavefield at time kt
       int    nb =30      thickness of sponge ABC
       int    nt =      number of time steps
       file   rho =      auxiliary input file name
       file   tauo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   taup =      auxiliary input file name
       file   taus =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       file   vs =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wavx =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/pyang/Mviscoe2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfviscoe2d(1)

sfvofz(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfvofz(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvofz(1)

NAME
       sfvofz - Analytical traveltime in a linear V(z) model.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvofz  >  out.rsf  n1=  n=  n2=  n=  g=1.  v0=0.5  s=0.5 d1=0.5/(n1-1)
       d2=1./(n2-1) o1=0. o2=0. intime=n

PARAMETERS
       float  d1 =0.5/(n1-1)      vertical sampling
       float  d2 =1./(n2-1)      horizontal sampling
       float  g =1.       velocity gradient
       bool   intime =n [y/n]     if in vertical time coordinates
       int    n =      number of samples
       int    n1 =      vertical samples
       int    n2 =      horizontal samples
       float  o1 =0.       vertical origin
       float  o2 =0.       horizontal origin
       float  s =0.5      shot location at the surface
       float  v0 =0.5      initial velocity
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mvofz.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfvofz(1)
source

sfvofzperm(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvofzperm(1)

NAME
       sfvofzperm - V(z) prestack exploditing reflector.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvofzperm  <  data.rsf  >  image.rsf  size=size.rsf left=left.rsf mid‐
       dle=middle.rsf right=right.rsf mig=n nz= dz= nt= dt= nh= dh=

PARAMETERS
       float  dh =      offset sampling (if modeling)
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      time sampling (if migration)
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       file   middle =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       int    nh =      offset samples (if modeling)
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      time samples (if migration)
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       file   size =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mvofzperm.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfvscan — Method
sfvscan(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvscan on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvscan. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvscan(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvscan(1)

NAME
       sfvscan - Velocity analysis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvscan   <   cmp.rsf   >   scan.rsf   offset=offset.rsf   mask=msk.rsf
       grad=grd.rsf semblance=n diffsemblance=n avosemblance=n  nb=2  weight=y
       half=y  smax=2.0 ns=1 slowness=n squared=n v1= extend=4 mute=12 str=0.5
       v0= dv= nv= v1= type=

COMMENTS
       Inverse of sfvelmod.

       May 2013 program of the month: http://www.ahay.org/blog/2013/05/04/pro‐
       gram-of-the-month-sfvscan/

PARAMETERS
       bool   avosemblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute AVO-friendly semblance
       bool   diffsemblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute differential semblance
       float  dv =      step in velocity
       int    extend =4      trace extension
       string grad =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   half  =y  [y/n]     if y, the second axis is half-offset instead
              of full offset
       string mask =      optional mask file (auxiliary input file name)
       int    mute =12      mute zone
       int    nb =2      semblance averaging
       int    ns =1      number of heterogeneity scans
       int    nv =      number of scanned velocities
       string offset =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   semblance =n [y/n]     if y, compute semblance; if n, stack
       bool   slowness =n [y/n]     if y, use slowness instead of velocity
       float  smax =2.0      maximum heterogeneity
       bool   squared =n [y/n]     if y, the slowness or velocity is squared
       float  str =0.5      maximum stretch allowed
       string type =      type of semblance (avo,diff,sembl,power,weighted)
       float  v0 =      first scanned velocity
       float  v1 =      reference velocity
       bool   weight =y [y/n]     if y, apply pseudo-unitary weighting
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/vela/vscan
       bei/wvs/vscan
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mvscan.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfvscan(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvsptmigda — Method
sfvsptmigda(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvsptmigda on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvsptmigda. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvsptmigda(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvsptmigda(1)

NAME
       sfvsptmigda - 3D time scattering-angle Kirchhoff migration for VSP data

SYNOPSIS
       sfvsptmigda  <  dataFile.rsf vel=velFile.rsf > imageFile.rsf semb=semb‐
       File.rsf dag=dagFile.rsf cig=cigFile.rsf is3d=n axis2label=0 isAA=y is‐
       DipAz=y hmign=dp.hNum sembWindow=11 itn=dp.zNum ixn=dp.xNum iyn=rp.is3D
       ? vp.yNum : 1 ito=dp.zStart  ixo=dp.xStart  iyo=dp.yStart  itd=dp.zStep
       ixd=dp.xStep  iyd=dp.yStep dipn=1 dipo=0.f dipd=1.f iscatn=1 iscato=0.f
       iscatd=2 * gp.dipStep

PARAMETERS
       int    axis2label =0      0 - shot; 1 - cmp; 2 - receiver
       string cig =      output file containing CIGs in the surface-offset do‐
              main (auxiliary output file name)
       string dag  =       output file containing CIGs in the dip-angle domain
              (auxiliary output file name)
       float  dipd =1.f      step in dip-angle
       int    dipn =1      number of dip-angles
       float  dipo =0.f      first dip-angle
       int    hmign =dp.hNum      number of migrated offsets
       bool   is3d =n [y/n]     if y, apply 3D migration
       bool   isAA =y [y/n]     if y, apply anti-aliasing
       bool   isDipAz =y [y/n]     if y, apply dip/azimuth mode; if  n,  apply
              inline/crossline angle mode
       float  iscatd  =2  * gp.dipStep      scattering-angle increment (in de‐
              gree)
       int    iscatn =1      number of scattering-angles
       float  iscato =0.f      first scattering-angle (in degree)
       float  itd =dp.zStep      step in imaged times (in ms)
       int    itn =dp.zNum      number of imaged times
       float  ito =dp.zStart      first imaged time (in ms)
       float  ixd =dp.xStep      step in imaged inlines
       int    ixn =dp.xNum      number of imaged inlines
       float  ixo =dp.xStart      first imaged inline
       float  iyd =dp.yStep      step in imaged crosslines
       int    iyn =rp.is3D ? vp.yNum : 1      number of imaged crosslines
       float  iyo =dp.yStart      first imaged crossline
       string semb =      output file containing  semblance  measure  of  CIGs
              stacking (auxiliary output file name)
       int    sembWindow  =11       vertical  window for semblance calculation
              (in samples)
       string vel =      velocity model file (velocity in m/s) (auxiliary  in‐
              put file name)
SOURCE
       user/aklokov/Mvsptmigda.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfvsptmigda(1)
source

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvti2desep. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvti2desep(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti2desep(1)

NAME
       sfvti2desep  -  2-D  two-components  wavefield  modeling using original
       elastic displacement wave equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti2desep  <  Fvp0.rsf  vs0=Fvs0.rsf  epsi=Feps.rsf  del=Fdel.rsf   >
       Fo1.rsf    Elasticz=Fo2.rsf    apx=Fo3.rsf   apz=Fo4.rsf   apxs=Fo5.rsf
       apzs=Fo6.rsf  apxx=Fo7.rsf  apzz=Fo8.rsf  apxxs=Fo9.rsf  apzzs=Fo10.rsf
       ElasticSepP=Fo11.rsf   ElasticSepSV=Fo12.rsf   ns=301  dt=0.001  isep=0
       ihomo=0 nstep=1 tapertype=

COMMENTS
       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China Authors:  Jiubing
       Cheng and Tengfei Wang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   ElasticSepP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   ElasticSepSV =      auxiliary output file name
       file   Elasticz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apxs =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apxxs =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apzs =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apzzs =      auxiliary output file name
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ihomo =0      if ihomo=1, homogeneous medium
       int    isep =0      if isep=1, separate wave-modes
       int    ns =301 ®
       int    nstep =1      grid step to calculate operators: 1<=nstep<=5
       string tapertype =      taper type
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti2desep.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfvti2desep(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvti2dpseudop — Method
sfvti2dpseudop(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvti2dpseudop. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvti2dpseudop(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti2dpseudop(1)

NAME
       sfvti2dpseudop  -  2-D  two-components wavefield modeling using pseudo-
       pure mode P-wave equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti2dpseudop < Fvp0.rsf  vs0=Fvs0.rsf  epsi=Feps.rsf  del=Fdel.rsf  >
       Fo1.rsf     PseudoPurePz=Fo2.rsf    PseudoPureP=Fo3.rsf    apvx=Fo4.rsf
       apvz=Fo5.rsf apvxx=Fo6.rsf apvzz=Fo7.rsf PseudoPureSepP=Fo8.rsf  ns=301
       dt=0.001 isep=0 ihomo=0 itaper=0 nstep=1 tapertype=

COMMENTS
       Copyright  (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China Authors: Jiubing
       Cheng and Wei Kang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under  the  terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the
       Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at  your
       option) any later version.

       This  program  is  distributed  in the hope that it will be useful, but
       WITHOUT ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of  MER‐
       CHANTABILITY  or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   PseudoPureP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPurePz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPureSepP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ihomo =0      if ihomo=1, homogeneous medium
       int    isep =0      if isep=1, separate wave-modes
       int    itaper =0      if itaper=1, taper the operator
       int    ns =301 ®
       int    nstep =1      grid step to calculate operators: 1<=nstep<=5
       string tapertype =      taper type
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti2dpseudop.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfvti2dpseudop(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvti2dpseudop1 — Method
sfvti2dpseudop1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvti2dpseudop1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvti2dpseudop1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvti2dpseudop1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti2dpseudop1(1)

NAME
       sfvti2dpseudop1  -  2-D two-components wavefield modeling using pseudo-
       pure mode P-wave equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti2dpseudop1 < Fvp0.rsf vs0=Fvs0.rsf  epsi=Feps.rsf  del=Fdel.rsf  >
       Fo1.rsf     PseudoPurePz=Fo2.rsf     PseudoPureP=Fo3.rsf    adx=Fo4.rsf
       adz=Fo5.rsf   apx=Fo6.rsf   apz=Fo7.rsf    apvx=Fo8.rsf    apvz=Fo9.rsf
       adxx=Fo10.rsf  adzz=Fo11.rsf apxx=Fo12.rsf apzz=Fo13.rsf apvxx=Fo14.rsf
       apvzz=Fo15.rsf PseudoPureSepP=Fo16.rsf ns=301 dt=0.001  isep=0  ihomo=0
       itaper=0 nstep=2 tapertype=

COMMENTS
       Copyright  (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China Authors: Jiubing
       Cheng, Wei Kang and Tengfei Wang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under  the  terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the
       Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at  your
       option) any later version.

       This  program  is  distributed  in the hope that it will be useful, but
       WITHOUT ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of  MER‐
       CHANTABILITY  or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   PseudoPureP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPurePz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPureSepP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   adx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   adxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   adz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   adzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ihomo =0      if ihomo=1, homogeneous medium
       int    isep =0      if isep=1, separate wave-modes
       int    itaper =0      if itaper=1, taper the wavenumber domain p=opera‐
              tors
       int    ns =301 ®
       int    nstep =2 ®
       string tapertype =      taper type
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti2dpseudop1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfvti2dpseudopfvs0(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti2dpseudopfvs0(1)

NAME
       sfvti2dpseudopfvs0   -  2-D  two-components  wavefield  modeling  using
       pseudo-pure mode P-wave equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti2dpseudopfvs0 <  Fvp0.rsf  epsi=Feps.rsf  del=Fdel.rsf  >  Fo1.rsf
       PseudoPurePz=Fo2.rsf   PseudoPureP=Fo3.rsf   Fvs0=Fo4.rsf  apvx=Fo5.rsf
       apvz=Fo6.rsf apvxx=Fo7.rsf apvzz=Fo8.rsf PseudoPureSepP=Fo9.rsf  ns=301
       dt=0.001 isep=0 ihomo=0 itaper=0 nstep=1 tapertype=

COMMENTS
       with finite nonzero vs0

       Copyright  (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China Authors: Jiubing
       Cheng and Wei Kang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under  the  terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the
       Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at  your
       option) any later version.

       This  program  is  distributed  in the hope that it will be useful, but
       WITHOUT ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of  MER‐
       CHANTABILITY  or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   Fvs0 =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPureP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPurePz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPureSepP =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   apvzz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ihomo =0      if ihomo=1, homogeneous medium
       int    isep =0      if isep=1, separate wave-modes
       int    itaper =0      if itaper=1, taper the operator
       int    ns =301 ®
       int    nstep =1      grid step to calculate operators: 1<=nstep<=5
       string tapertype =      taper type
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti2dpseudopfvs0.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023             sfvti2dpseudopfvs0(1)

NAME
       sfvti2dpseudosv  -  2-D two-components wavefield modeling using pseudo-
       pure mode qSV-wave equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti2dpseudosv < Fvp0.rsf vs0=Fvs0.rsf  epsi=Feps.rsf  del=Fdel.rsf  >
       Fo1.rsf    PseudoPureSVz=Fo2.rsf    PseudoPureSV=Fo3.rsf    acx=Fo4.rsf
       acz=Fo5.rsf   asx=Fo6.rsf   asz=Fo7.rsf    asvx=Fo8.rsf    asvz=Fo9.rsf
       acxx=Fo10.rsf  aczz=Fo11.rsf asxx=Fo12.rsf aszz=Fo13.rsf asvxx=Fo14.rsf
       asvzz=Fo15.rsf PseudoPureSepSV=Fo16.rsf ns=301 dt=0.001 isep=0  ihomo=0
       itaper=0 nstep=2 tapertype=

       Public License for more details.

       file   acxx =      auxiliary output file name
       file   acz =      auxiliary output file name
       file   aczz =      auxiliary output file name

sfvti3de(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti3de(1)

NAME
       sfvti3de  -  3-D  three-components wavefield modeling using elasic wave
       equation in VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti3de < Fvp0.rsf vs0=Fvs0.rsf epsi=Fep.rsf del=Fde.rsf gam=Fga.rsf >
       Fo1.rsf Elasticy=Fo2.rsf Elasticz=Fo3.rsf ns=301 dt=0.001 bd=20

COMMENTS
       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng, Tengfei Wang and Wei Kang

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   Elasticy =      auxiliary output file name
       file   Elasticz =      auxiliary output file name
       int    bd =20 ®
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       file   gam =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ns =301 ®
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti3de.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfvti3dpseudosh(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti3dpseudosh(1)

NAME
       sfvti3dpseudosh  -  3-D  three-components wavefield modeling using pure
       mode SH-wave equation in 3D VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti3dpseudosh  <  Fvp0.rsf  vs0=Fvs0.rsf   epsi=Fep.rsf   del=Fde.rsf
       gam=Fga.rsf > Fo1.rsf SHy=Fo2.rsf SH=Fo3.rsf ns=301 dt=0.001 bd=20

COMMENTS
       * Note: The z-components of pure-mode qSV-wave are zero.

       Refernces:  Cheng  et  al.  (15th  IWSA, 2012); Cheng and Kang (SEG Ab‐
       stract, 2012); Kang and Cheng (SEG Abstract, 2012) Wang et al.(SEG  Ab‐
       stract, 2012)

       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng, Tengfei Wang and Wei Kang

       This  code  is  first written by Tengfei Wang at Tongji University, and
       then optimzied by Jiubing Cheng for Madagascar version at BEG,  Univer‐
       sity of Texas at Austin.

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   SH =      auxiliary output file name
       file   SHy =      auxiliary output file name
       int    bd =20 ®
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       file   gam =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ns =301 ®
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti3dpseudosh.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                sfvti3dpseudosh(1)
source

sfvti3dpseudosv(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvti3dpseudosv on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

RSF Documentation

sfvti3dpseudosv(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvti3dpseudosv(1)

NAME
       sfvti3dpseudosv - 3-D three-components wavefield modeling using pseudo-
       pure mode SV-wave equation in 3D VTI media.

SYNOPSIS
       sfvti3dpseudosv <  Fvp0.rsf  vs0=Fvs0.rsf  epsi=Fep.rsf  del=Fde.rsf  >
       Fo1.rsf   PseudoPureSVz=Fo2.rsf  PseudoPureSV=Fo3.rsf  ns=301  dt=0.001
       bd=20

COMMENTS
       * Note: The x- and y-components of pseudo-pure-mode qSV-wave are summed
       thus the * 2nd-order system only consist of two equations.

       Refernces:  Cheng  et  al.  (15th  IWSA, 2012); Cheng and Kang (SEG Ab‐
       stract, 2012); Kang and Cheng (SEG Abstract, 2012) Wang et al.(SEG  Ab‐
       stract, 2012)

       Copyright (C) 2012 Tongji University, Shanghai, China

       Authors: Jiubing Cheng, Tengfei Wang and Wei Kang

       This  code  is  first written by Tengfei Wang at Tongji University, and
       then optimzied by Jiubing Cheng for Madagascar version at BEG,  Univer‐
       sity of Texas at Austin.

       This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it
       under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published  by  the
       Free  Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your
       option) any later version.

       This program is distributed in the hope that it  will  be  useful,  but
       WITHOUT  ANY  WARRANTY;  without  even  the  implied  warranty  of MER‐
       CHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU  General
       Public License for more details.

       You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along
       with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
       59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

PARAMETERS
       file   PseudoPureSV =      auxiliary output file name
       file   PseudoPureSVz =      auxiliary output file name
       int    bd =20 ®
       file   del =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dt =0.001 ®
       file   epsi =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ns =301 ®
       file   vs0 =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chengjb/Mvti3dpseudosv.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                sfvti3dpseudosv(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvtihti2ort — Method
sfvtihti2ort(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvtihti2ort on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvtihti2ort. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvtihti2ort(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvtihti2ort(1)

NAME
       sfvtihti2ort - Combining VTI and HTI parameters to orthorhombic accord‐
       ing to Schoenberg & Sayer (1995)

SYNOPSIS
       sfvtihti2ort  >  c11o.rsf  c22o=c22o.rsf  c33o=c33o.rsf   c44o=c44o.rsf
       c55o=c55o.rsf c66o=c66o.rsf c12o=c12o.rsf c13o=c13o.rsf c23o=c23o.rsf <
       c33.rsf   c55=c55.rsf   c11v=c11v.rsf    c66v=c66v.rsf    c12v=c12v.rsf
       c13v=c13v.rsf  c11h=c11h.rsf  c55h=c55h.rsf c12h=c12h.rsf c13h=c13h.rsf
       phi=phi.rsf c16o=c16o.rsf c26o=c26o.rsf c36o=c36o.rsf c45o=c45o.rsf ro‐
       tate=n

COMMENTS
       NOTE:  HTI  is  defined  in  VTI  grid  with  respect  to  the vertical
       (Ruger(1997)) Refer to SEAM 2 notes for detailed description

PARAMETERS
       file   c11h =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c11v =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c12h =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c12o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c12v =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c13h =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c13o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c13v =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c16o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c22o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c23o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c26o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c33o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c36o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c44o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c45o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c55 =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c55h =      auxiliary input file name
       file   c55o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c66o =      auxiliary output file name
       file   c66v =      auxiliary input file name
       file   phi =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   rotate =n [y/n]     Doing azimuthal rotation (y-> mono, n->  or‐
              tho)
SOURCE
       user/zone/Mvtihti2ort.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                   sfvtihti2ort(1)
source
Madagascar.sfvweks3d — Method
sfvweks3d(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfvweks3d on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfvweks3d. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfvweks3d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfvweks3d(1)

NAME
       sfvweks3d - 3D visco-elastic time-domain pseudo-spectral (k-space) mod‐
       eling using shared-memory parallel FFT

SYNOPSIS
       sfvweks3d   <   Fwav.rsf   ccc=Fccc.rsf    den=Fden.rsf    sou=Fsou.rsf
       rec=Frec.rsf  wfl=Fwfl.rsf > Fdat.rsf qqq=Fqqq.rsf verb=n snap=n free=n
       ssou=0 dabc=n opot=n back=n kspace=n qmod=0  nbell=5  jdata=1  jsnap=nt
       rfreq=1000  fcut=500  pcut=0.2  nqz=sf_n(az)  nqx=sf_n(ax) nqy=sf_n(ay)
       oqz=sf_o(az) oqx=sf_o(ax) oqy=sf_o(ay)

COMMENTS
       sou wavelet  (nx,ny,nc,nt)  rec  data      (nx,ny,nc,nt)  sou  geometry
       (nc,nx,ny) rec geometry (nc,nx,ny)

PARAMETERS
       bool   back =n [y/n]     backward extrapolation flag (for rtm)
       file   ccc =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   dabc =n [y/n]     absorbing BC
       file   den =      auxiliary input file name
       float  fcut =500      cutoff frequency for Q-compensation
       bool   free =n [y/n]     free surface flag
       int    jdata =1 ®
       int    jsnap =nt ®
       bool   kspace =n [y/n]     k-space method (ps) flag
       int    nbell =5      bell size
       int    nqx =sf_n(ax) ®
       int    nqy =sf_n(ay) ®
       int    nqz =sf_n(az) ®
       bool   opot =n [y/n]     output potentials -> 1*scalar, 3*vector poten‐
              tials
       float  oqx =sf_o(ax) ®
       float  oqy =sf_o(ay) ®
       float  oqz =sf_o(az) ®
       float  pcut =0.2      pcut/2 is tapered portion w.r.t. 1
       int    qmod =0      q modeling switch
       file   qqq =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rec =      auxiliary input file name
       float  rfreq =1000      reference frequency for constant-Q
       bool   snap =n [y/n]     wavefield snapshots flag
       file   sou =      auxiliary input file name
       int    ssou =0      0 -> acceleration source; 1 -> stress source; 2  ->
              displacement source
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   wfl =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mvweks3d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfvweks3d(1)
source
Madagascar.sfwarp1 — Method
sfwarp1(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwarp1 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwarp1. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwarp1(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwarp1(1)

NAME
       sfwarp1 - Multicomponent data registration by 1-D warping.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwarp1  <  in.rsf > warped.rsf other=other.rsf warpout=warpout.rsf am‐
       plout=amplout.rsf warpin=warpin.rsf verb=n noamp=n accuracy=  nliter=10
       niter=100

PARAMETERS
       int    accuracy = [1-4]     interpolation accuracy
       file   amplout =      auxiliary output file name
       int    niter =100      maximum number of linear iterations
       int    nliter =10      number of non-linear iterations
       bool   noamp =n [y/n]     if y, don't correct amplitudes
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string warpin  =       optional initial warp file (auxiliary input file
              name)
       file   warpout =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mwarp1.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfwarp1(1)
source

Madagascar.sfwarpscan — Method
sfwarpscan(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwarpscan on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwarpscan. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwarpscan(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwarpscan(1)

NAME
       sfwarpscan - Multicomponent data registration analysis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwarpscan  <  in.rsf > warped.rsf other=other.rsf verb=y cheb=n sign=n
       ng=1 g0= dg=g0 rect1=1 rect2=1 rect3=1 rect4=1 niter=10  shift=n  accu‐
       racy=

PARAMETERS
       int    accuracy = [1-4]     interpolation accuracy
       bool   cheb =n [y/n]     use Chebyshev scan
       float  dg =g0      gamma sampling
       float  g0 =      gamma origin
       int    ng =1      number of gamma values
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect1 =1      vertical smoothing
       int    rect2 =1      gamma smoothing
       int    rect3 =1      in-line smoothing
       int    rect4 =1      cross-line smoothing
       bool   shift =n [y/n]     use shift instead of stretch
       bool   sign =n [y/n]     use signed similarity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mwarpscan.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mwarpscan.c 744 2004-08-17 18:46:07Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfwarpscan(1)
source
Madagascar.sfwarpscann — Method
sfwarpscann(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwarpscann on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwarpscann. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwarpscann(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwarpscann(1)

NAME
       sfwarpscann  -  Multicomponent data registration analysis with non-sta‐
       tionary model smoothing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwarpscann < in.rsf > warped.rsf other=other.rsf verb=y ng=1 g0= dg=g0
       mode=0  rect1=1  rect2=1  rect3=1  rect4=1  niter=10  shift=n accuracy=
       rect#= shift#=

PARAMETERS
       int    accuracy = [1-4]     interpolation accuracy
       float  dg =g0      gamma sampling
       float  g0 =      gamma origin
       int    mode =0      mode=0: traditional; mode=1: high-resolution
       int    ng =1      number of gamma values
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       string rect# =      size of the smoothing  stencil  in  #-th  dimension
              /auxiliary input file/
       int    rect1 =1      vertical smoothing
       int    rect2 =1      gamma smoothing
       int    rect3 =1      in-line smoothing
       int    rect4 =1      cross-line smoothing
       bool   shift =n [y/n]     use shift instead of stretch
       string shift#  =       shifting of the smoothing stencil in #-th dimen‐
              sion /auxiliary input file/
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mwarpscann.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfwarpscann(1)
source
Madagascar.sfwarpscanw — Method
sfwarpscanw(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwarpscanw on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwarpscanw. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwarpscanw(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwarpscanw(1)

NAME
       sfwarpscanw - Multicomponent data registration analysis.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwarpscanw  <  in.rsf > warped.rsf other=other.rsf renergy=renergy.rsf
       denergy=denergy.rsf verb=y cheb=n sign=n ren=n  den=n  ng=1  g0=  dg=g0
       rect1=1 rect2=1 rect3=1 rect4=1 niter=10 shift=n accuracy=

PARAMETERS
       int    accuracy = [1-4]     interpolation accuracy
       bool   cheb =n [y/n]     use Chebyshev scan
       bool   den =n [y/n]     use data energy
       file   denergy =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dg =g0      gamma sampling
       float  g0 =      gamma origin
       int    ng =1      number of gamma values
       int    niter =10      number of iterations
       file   other =      auxiliary input file name
       int    rect1 =1      vertical smoothing
       int    rect2 =1      gamma smoothing
       int    rect3 =1      in-line smoothing
       int    rect4 =1      cross-line smoothing
       bool   ren =n [y/n]     use reference energy
       file   renergy =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   shift =n [y/n]     use shift instead of stretch
       bool   sign =n [y/n]     use signed similarity
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/sbader/Mwarpscanw.c
VERSION
       4.2-git Mwarpscan.c 744 2004-08-17 18:46:07Z fomels

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfwarpscanw(1)

       grad2=grad2.rsf sl=nx/2 what=2 nb1=20 nb2=20

PARAMETERS

       file   grad2 =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nb1 =20      x boundary nodes
       int    nb2 =20      z boundary nodes
       int    sl =nx/2      source location
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       int    what =2      2nd or 4th order for FD

Madagascar.sfwavemis2 — Method
sfwavemis2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwavemis2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwavemis2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwavemis2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwavemis2(1)

NAME
       sfwavemis2  - Missing data interpolation in 2-D using wavelet transform
       and compressive sensing.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwavemis2 < in.rsf > out.rsf mask=mask.rsf  niter=20  perc=99.  verb=n
       ordert=1. ordert=1. nbreg=1 oper= type=

PARAMETERS
       string mask =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nbreg =1      number of iterations for Bregman iteration
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       string oper  =      [shaping,pocs,bregman] method, the default is shap‐
              ing
       float  ordert =1.       Curve order for thresholding parameter, default
              is linear
       float  perc =99.       percentage for soft-thresholding
       string type =      [haar,linear,biorthogonal] wavelet type, the default
              is linear
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mwavemis2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfwavemis2(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfwavemixop(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwavemixop(1)

NAME
       sfwavemixop - Complex 2-D wave propagation (with kiss-fft)

SYNOPSIS
       sfwavemixop  <  Fw.rsf  >  Fo.rsf ref=Fr.rsf snaps=Fs.rsf left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf alpha=Fa.rsf beta=Fb.rsf verb=n snap=0 correct=n type=0
       pad1=1 mode=

PARAMETERS
       file   alpha =      auxiliary input file name
       file   beta =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   correct =n [y/n]     jingwei's correction
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       string mode =      default mode is pspi
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   ref =      auxiliary input file name
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       int    type =0      type of propagation; 0 means no correction applied,
              and mode takes effect, 9 enables jjsf
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mwavemixop.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfwavemixop(1)

sfwavemovie(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwavemovie(1)

NAME
       sfwavemovie - Helmholtz factorization

SYNOPSIS
       sfwavemovie  >  out.rsf  imp=imp.rsf nz=96 nx=48 nt=12 nw=2 init=1 v=1.
       dz=1. dx=2. lambda=nz*dz/4. sixth=0.0833 gamma=0.667 epsdamp=0.01  pad‐
       factor=1024 nfilt=nx+2 impresp=n

PARAMETERS
       float  dx =2.  ®
       float  dz =1.  ®
       float  epsdamp =0.01 ®
       float  gamma =0.667 ®
       file   imp =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   impresp =n [y/n]
       int    init =1 ®
       float  lambda =nz*dz/4.  ®
       int    nfilt =nx+2 ®
       int    nt =12 ®
       int    nw =2 ®
       int    nx =48 ®
       int    nz =96 ®
       int    padfactor =1024 ®
       float  sixth =0.0833 ®
       float  v =1.  ®

       user/gee/Mwavemovie.c

NAME
       sfwavmod - 1-2-3D finite difference modeling

SYNOPSIS
       sfwavmod < in.rsf vel=vel.rsf sgrid=sgrid.rsf ggrid=ggrid.rsf > dat.rsf
       wfl=wfl.rsf jt=1 jtm=100 ot=0.0 verb=n

PARAMETERS
       file   ggrid =      auxiliary input file name
       int    jt =1      time interval in observation system
       int    jtm =100      time interval of wave movie
       float  ot =0.0      time delay
       file   sgrid =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       string wfl =      wavefield movie file (auxiliary output file name)

       chen/test/wavmod

sfwcfftexp2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwcfftexp2(1)

NAME
       sfwcfftexp2  -  2-D  FFT-based  zero-offset  exploding reflector model‐
       ing/migration

SYNOPSIS
       sfwcfftexp2 < data.rsf > image.rsf left=left.rsf right=right.rsf  mig=n
       timer=n pad1=1 nz= dz= nt= dt=

PARAMETERS
       float  dt =      time sampling (if modeling)
       float  dz =      depth sampling (if migration)
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   mig =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       int    nt =      time samples (if modeling)
       int    nz =      depth samples (if migration)
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   timer =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mwcfftexp2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfwcfftexp2adj — Method
sfwcfftexp2adj(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwcfftexp2adj on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwcfftexp2adj. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwcfftexp2adj(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwcfftexp2adj(1)

NAME
       sfwcfftexp2adj  -  2-D FFT-based zero-offset exploding reflector model‐
       ing/migration

SYNOPSIS
       sfwcfftexp2adj < data.rsf  >  image.rsf  snaps=snaps.rsf  left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf adj=n timer=n snap=0 pad1=1 n0=0 nz= dz= nt= dt=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       float  dt =      time sampling
       float  dz =      depth sampling
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    n0 =0      geophone surface
       int    nt =      time samples
       int    nz =      depth samples
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       bool   timer =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mwcfftexp2adj.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                 sfwcfftexp2adj(1)
source

       int    w =50      size of window

sfwem2dgpu(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwem2dgpu(1)

NAME
       sfwem2d_gpu - 2D ISOTROPIC wave-equation finite-difference migration on
       GPU

SYNOPSIS
       sfwem2d_gpu vel=Fvel.rsf < Fxig.rsf  swf=Fswf.rsf  rwf=Frwf.rsf  >  Fx‐
       igo.rsf   swfout=Fswfo.rsf   rwfout=Frwfo.rsf  sillum=Fsillum.rsf  ril‐
       lum=Frillum.rsf gpu=0 nxtap=40 verbose=n wantwf=n wantillum=n nh=0

PARAMETERS
       int    gpu =0      ID of the GPU to be used
       int    nh =0 ®
       int    nxtap =40      TAPER size
       file   rillum =      auxiliary output file name
       file   rwf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rwfout =      auxiliary output file name
       file   sillum =      auxiliary output file name
       file   swf =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swfout =      auxiliary output file name
       file   vel =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verbose =n [y/n]     VERBOSITY flag
       bool   wantillum =n [y/n]     Want output wavefields
       bool   wantwf =n [y/n]     Want output wavefields
SOURCE
       user/rweiss/Mwem2d_gpu.cu
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfwem2d_gpu(1)
source

sfweximg(1) Madagascar Manuals sfweximg(1)

NAME
       sfweximg - 3-D modeling/migration with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfweximg   slo=Fs.rsf   swfl=Fws.rsf   <   Fm.rsf  cc=Fc.rsf  >  Fd.rsf
       rwfl=Fwr.rsf adj= save=0 feic=0  verb=n  eps=0.01  nrmax=1  dtmax=0.004
       pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0 tmy=0 nhx=0 nhy=0 nhz=0 nht=0 dht=

PARAMETERS
       int    adj =      y=ADJ migration; n=FWD modeling
       file   cc =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dht = ®
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       int    feic =0      extended I.C. flag
       int    nht =0      number of lags on the t axis
       int    nhx =0      number of lags on the x axis
       int    nhy =0      number of lags on the y axis
       int    nhz =0      number of lags on the z axis
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       string rwfl =      auxiliary output file name
       int    save =0      save wfld flag
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swfl =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cwp/Mweximg.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfweximg(1)
source

sfwexmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwexmig(1)

NAME
       sfwexmig - 3-D modeling/migration with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfwexmig slo=Fs.rsf swfl=Fws.rsf < Fd.rsf > Fm.rsf cc=Fc.rsf cip=Fe.rsf
       feic=n fdrv=n fnew=n verb=n eps=0.01 nrmax=1  dtmax=0.004  pmx=0  pmy=0
       tmx=0 tmy=0 nhx=0 nhy=0 nhz=0 nht=0 dht=

PARAMETERS
       file   cc =      auxiliary input file name
       file   cip =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dht = ®
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   fdrv =n [y/n]     image derivative flag
       bool   feic =n [y/n]     extended I.C. flag
       bool   fnew =n [y/n]     phase-shift flag
       int    nht =0      number of lags on the t axis
       int    nhx =0      number of lags on the x axis
       int    nhy =0      number of lags on the y axis
       int    nhz =0      number of lags on the z axis
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swfl =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cwp/Mwexmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfwexmig(1)

SYNOPSIS
       sfwexmva   slo=Bs.rsf  <  Pi.rsf  <  Ps.rsf  swfl=Bws.rsf  rwfl=Bwr.rsf
       cc=Fc.rsf verb=y adj= feic= eps=0.01 nrmax=1  dtmax=0.004  pmx=0  pmy=0
       tmx=0 tmy=0 nhx=0 nhy=0 nhz=0 nht=0 dht=

PARAMETERS
       int    adj =      y=ADJ Back-projection; n=FWD Forward Scattering
       file   cc =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dht = ®
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       int    feic =      extended I.C. flag
       int    nht =0      number of lags on the t axis
       int    nhx =0      number of lags on the x axis
       int    nhy =0      number of lags on the y axis
       int    nhz =0      number of lags on the z axis
       int    nrmax =1      max number of refs
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   rwfl =      auxiliary input file name
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swfl =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag

       user/cwp/Mwexmva.c

sfwexnmig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwexnmig(1)

NAME
       sfwexnmig - 3-D modeling/migration with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfwexnmig  slo=Fs.rsf swfl=Fws.rsf dipx=Fdx.rsf dipy=Fdy.rsf < Fd.rsf >
       Fm.rsf cc=Fc.rsf cip=Fe.rsf feic=n verb=n eps=0.01 nrmax=1  dtmax=0.004
       pmx=0  pmy=0  tmx=0 tmy=0 nhx=0 nhy=0 nhz=0 nht=0 dht= dhx=cub->amx.d*2
       dhy=cub->amy.d*2 dhz=cub->az.d*2

PARAMETERS
       file   cc =      auxiliary input file name
       file   cip =      auxiliary output file name
       float  dht = ®
       float  dhx =cub->amx.d*2 ®
       float  dhy =cub->amy.d*2 ®
       float  dhz =cub->az.d*2 ®
       file   dipx =      auxiliary input file name
       file   dipy =      auxiliary input file name
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   feic =n [y/n]     extended I.C. flag
       int    nht =0      number of lags on the t axis
       int    nhx =0      number of lags on the x axis
       int    nhy =0      number of lags on the y axis
       int    nhz =0      number of lags on the z axis
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   swfl =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cwp/Mwexnmig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                      sfwexnmig(1)

Madagascar.sfwexwfl — Method
sfwexwfl(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwexwfl on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwexwfl. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwexwfl(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwexwfl(1)

NAME
       sfwexwfl - 3-D wavefield extrapolation with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfwexwfl  slo=Fs.rsf  <  Fd.rsf  > Fw.rsf verb=n eps=0.01 datum=0 inv=1
       causal=n nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0 tmy=0

PARAMETERS
       bool   causal =n [y/n]     causality flag
       int    datum =0      datuming flag
       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       int    inv =1      down/upward flag
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/cwp/Mwexwfl.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfwexwfl(1)
source

NAME

SYNOPSIS

       eps=0.01 nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0 tmy=0 nw= dw= ow=0.

       float  dtmax =0.004      max time error

       int    nw = ®

       int    pmy =0      padding on y

Madagascar.sfwiggle — Method
sfwiggle(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwiggle on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

RSF Documentation

sfwiggle(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwiggle(1)

NAME
       sfwiggle - Plot data with wiggly traces.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwiggle  <  in.rsf  xpos=xpos.rsf  xmax= xmin= poly=n polyneg=n fatp=1
       xmask=1 ymask=1 pclip=98. zplot=0.75 clip=0. seemean=n verb=n  transp=n
       yreverse=n xreverse=n > plot.vpl

COMMENTS
       Run "sfdoc stdplot" for more parameters.

       June         2013         program         of         the         month:
       http://www.ahay.org/blog/2013/06/12/program-of-the-month-sfwiggle/

PARAMETERS
       float  clip =0.       data clip (estimated from pclip by default
       int    fatp =1      polygon border fatness
       float  pclip =98.       clip percentile
       bool   poly =n [y/n]     if draw polygons
       bool   polyneg =n [y/n]     if polygons for negative values
       bool   seemean =n [y/n]     if y, plot mean lines of traces
       bool   transp =n [y/n]     if y, transpose the axes
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       int    xmask =1      polygon filling
       float  xmax =      maximum trace position (if using xpos)
       float  xmin =      minimum trace position (if using xpos)
       string xpos =      optional header file with trace positions (auxiliary
              input file name)
       bool   xreverse =n [y/n]     if y, reverse the horizontal axis
       int    ymask =1      polygon filling
       bool   yreverse =n [y/n]     if y, reverse the vertical axis
       float  zplot =0.75      vertical separation
USED IN
       bei/ft1/matrix
       bei/sg/toldi
       bei/wvs/head
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       data/alaska/line31-81-m8r
SOURCE
       plot/main/wiggle.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfwiggle(1)
source

RSF Documentation

sfwiki2static(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwiki2static(1)

NAME
       sfwiki2static - Downloads the Madagascar wiki as static html

SYNOPSIS
       sfwiki2static verb=n outdir=.

COMMENTS
       Wiki  pages are downloaded every time. Main_Page is moved to index.html
       Html files in local dir are deleted if not present on the wiki, in  or‐
       der  to  avoid  accumulation of dead wiki pages. To save bandwidth cost
       and download time, images and linked documents are downloaded only if a
       local copy is not present.

PARAMETERS
       string outdir =.  ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mwiki2static.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                  sfwiki2static(1)
source
Madagascar.sfwile — Method
sfwile(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwile on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwile. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwile(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwile(1)

NAME
       sfwile - Process data with GIMP 2.0.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwile < in.rsf > out.rsf command=

COMMENTS
       Input  samples  must be in byte (unsigned char) format. Preprocess data
       with sfbyte first, if they have float or other samples. Only  first  2D
       section  (n1  x n2) is taken from input data, the rest is ignored.  Use
       sfwindow and/or sftransp to generate input in adequate order.  o1,  o2,
       d1, and d2 are ignored; data are treated by GIMP as equally spaced.

       Be  advised,  that  a  greyscale  image file is created; not every GIMP
       plugin is capable of working with greyscale input.

       Examples:

       sfwile < in.rsf command="gimp-equalize TRUE" > out.rsf sfwile <  in.rsf
       command="plug-in-spread  5  5" > out.rsf sfwile < in.rsf command="plug-
       in-gauss-rle 4.0 TRUE TRUE" > out.rsf sfwile < in.rsf command="plug-in-
       sobel  TRUE  TRUE TRUE" > out.rsf sfwile < in.rsf command="plug-in-neon
       5.0 0.0" > out.rsf sfwile < in.rsf command="plug-in-emboss 315.0 45.0 7
       TRUE" > out.rsf sfwile < in.rsf command="plug-in-ripple 27 2 1 0 0 TRUE
       TRUE" > out.rsf sfwile <  in.rsf  command="plug-in-whirl-pinch  45  0.0
       1.0" > out.rsf

       Documentation   for   basic   GIMP   plugins   can   be   found   here:
       http://docs.gimp.org/en/filters.html Information about additional plug‐
       ins is collected here: http://registry.gimp.org/

PARAMETERS
       string command =      Command to be executed by GIMP
SOURCE
       user/bash/Mwile.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfwile(1)
source

sfwilson(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwilson(1)

NAME
       sfwilson - Wilson-Burg spectral factorization.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwilson   <  in.rsf  >  out.rsf  lag=lag0.rsf  lagout=lag.rsf  maxlag=
       niter=20 eps=1.e-6 n1=maxlag a0=1. verb=y stable=n lagin= filtin=

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =1.  ®
       float  eps =1.e-6      truncation tolerance
       string filtin = ®
       string lag =      optional input file with filter lags (auxiliary input
              file name)
       string lagin =      optional input file with output filter lags
       string lagout =      auxiliary output file name
       int    maxlag =      maximum lag
       int    n1 =maxlag      output filter length
       int    niter =20      number of iterations
       bool   stable =n [y/n]     stability flag
       bool   verb =y [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mwilson.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfwindow(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwindow(1)

NAME
       sfwindow - Window a portion of a dataset.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwindow  < in.rsf > out.rsf verb=n squeeze=y j#=(1,...) d#=(d1,d2,...)
       f#=(0,...)                 min#=(o1,o2,,...)                 n#=(0,...)
       max#=(o1+(n1-1)*d1,o2+(n1-1)*d2,,...)

COMMENTS
       Other  parameters from the command line are passed to the output (simi‐
       lar to sfput).

PARAMETERS
       float  d# =(d1,d2,...)       sampling in #-th dimension
       largeint
              f# =(0,...)       window start in #-th dimension
       int    j# =(1,...)       jump in #-th dimension
       float  max# =(o1+(n1-1)*d1,o2+(n1-1)*d2,,...)       maximum in #-th di‐
              mension
       float  min# =(o1,o2,,...)       minimum in #-th dimension
       largeint
              n# =(0,...)       window size in #-th dimension
       bool   squeeze  =y [y/n]     if y, squeeze dimensions equal to 1 to the
              end
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     Verbosity flag
USED IN
       bei/dpmv/krchdmo
       bei/dpmv/matt
       bei/dwnc/sigmoid
       bei/fdm/kjartjac
       bei/fld/cube
       bei/fld/shotmovie
       bei/fld/synmarine
       bei/fld/yc
       bei/ft1/autocor
       bei/ft1/brad
       bei/ft1/ft2d
       bei/krch/sep73
       bei/sg/denmark
       bei/sg/toldi
       bei/trimo/mod
       bei/trimo/subsamp
       bei/vela/stretch
       bei/vela/vscan
       bei/wvs/head
       bei/wvs/vscan
       cup/rna2d/real
       cup/rna2d/shot
       cup/rna2d/simple
       cup/rna3d/real
       cup/rna3d/shot
       39 more examples listed in:
       /home/mlouboutin3/Research/madagascar//share/doc/madagascar/html/sfwin‐
       dow.html
SOURCE
       system/main/window.c
DOCUMENTATION
       http://ahay.org/wiki/Guide_to_madagascar_programs#sfwindow
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfwindow(1)

sfwkbjTI(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwkbjTI(1)

NAME
       sfwkbjTI - VTI eikonal solver (3-D).

SYNOPSIS
       sfwkbjTI  <  bv.rsf  > time.rsf shotfile=shots.rsf br1=d1 br2=d2 br3=d3
       plane1=n  plane2=n  plane3=n  b1=plane[2]?   n1:   (int)   (br1/d1+0.5)
       b2=plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) b3=plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)
       zshot=0. yshot=o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 xshot=o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 vv= eta=

PARAMETERS
       int    b1 =plane[2]? n1: (int) (br1/d1+0.5) ®
       int    b2 =plane[1]? n2: (int) (br2/d2+0.5) ®
       int    b3 =plane[0]? n3: (int) (br3/d3+0.5)      Constant-velocity  box
              around the source (in samples)
       float  br1 =d1 ®
       float  br2 =d2 ®
       float  br3  =d3      Constant-velocity box around the source (in physi‐
              cal dimensions)
       string eta = ®
       bool   plane1 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane2 =n [y/n]
       bool   plane3 =n [y/n]     plane-wave source
       string shotfile =      File with shot locations  (n2=number  of  shots,
              n1=3) (auxiliary input file name)
       string vv = ®
       float  xshot =o3 + 0.5*(n3-1)*d3 ®
       float  yshot =o2 + 0.5*(n2-1)*d2 ®
       float  zshot =0.       Shot location (used if no shotfile)
SOURCE
       user/tariq/MwkbjTI.c
VERSION
       4.2-git MwkbjTI.c 4136 2009-02-07 17:20:32Z sfomel

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfwkbjTI(1)

       wfun=Mwfun.rsf Mapp=Mappfile.rsf  tp=Mtpfile.rsf  seed=time(NULL  f0=15

sfwmf(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwmf(1)

NAME
       sfwmf - 1D weighted median filtering.

SYNOPSIS
       sfwmf < in.rsf > out.rsf weights=weights.rsf verb=n nfw= boundary=n

PARAMETERS
       bool   boundary =n [y/n]     if y, boundary is data, whereas zero
       int    nfw =      filter-window length (positive and odd integer)
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       string weights =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/yliu/Mwmf.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfwuab — Method
sfwuab(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfwuab on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfwuab. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfwuab(1) Madagascar Manuals sfwuab(1)

NAME
       sfwuab - Wrapper for Utilities Acting on Binaries

SYNOPSIS
       sfwuab prog= inp= tpar= ipar= verb=n

PARAMETERS
       string inp =      Input file
       string ipar =      Independent params, i.e. perc=100 cmap=rgb
       string prog =      Non-madagascar utility
       string tpar =      Translated params, i.e.: ni1=n1 ni2=n2
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mwuab.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                         sfwuab(1)
source

NAME
       sfxcor2 - OpenMP time- or freq-domain cross-correlation on axes 1,2,3

SYNOPSIS
       sfxcor2 < Fs.rsf uu=Fr.rsf > Fi.rsf verb=n axis=2 nbuf=1

PARAMETERS
       int    axis =2      stack axis
       int    nbuf =1      buffer size
       file   uu =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mxcor2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

Madagascar.sfxcorr — Method
sfxcorr(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfxcorr on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfxcorr. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfxcorr(1) Madagascar Manuals sfxcorr(1)

NAME
       sfxcorr - Cross-correlation function

SYNOPSIS
       sfxcorr < in.rsf match=match.rsf > out.rsf lagfile=lagfile.rsf l=n1y-1

COMMENTS
       C=XCORR(X,Y,L), computes the (auto/cross) correlation over the range of
       lags: -L to L, i.e., 2*L+1 lags. If L is left out, default  is  L=n1-1,
       where n1 is the length of Y.

PARAMETERS
       int    l =n1y-1      maxlag of auto/cross correlation function
       string lagfile =      auxiliary output file name
       file   match =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mxcorr.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfxcorr(1)
source
Madagascar.sfximage — Method
sfximage(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfximage on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfximage. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfximage(1) Madagascar Manuals sfximage(1)

NAME
       sfximage - Displays a 2-D RSF file with Seismic Unix's ximage

SYNOPSIS
       sfximage inp= par= verb=n

COMMENTS
       Test with: sfspike n1=5 n2=3 nsp=3 k1=1,3,4 k2=1,2,3 > junk.rsf; sfxim‐
       age inp=junk.rsf par="perc=100 cmap=rgb1 legend=1"; You  should  see  a
       picture with blue background and red blobs.  See also sfimage.

PARAMETERS
       string inp =      Input file
       string par =      ximage params that can't be found in RSF headr
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/ivlad/Mximage.py
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfximage(1)
source
