sfxlagtoang2d(1) Madagascar Manuals sfxlagtoang2d(1)

NAME
       sfxlagtoang2d - SS(x-lag) to angle transformation (PP or PS waves)

SYNOPSIS
       sfxlagtoang2d  <  Fstk.rsf > Fang.rsf vpvs=Fgam.rsf dip=Fdip.rsf verb=n
       inv=n na=sf_n(axs) da=1./(sf_n(axs)-1) oa=0. extend=4

PARAMETERS
       float  da =1./(sf_n(axs)-1) ®
       file   dip =      auxiliary input file name
       int    extend =4      tmp extension
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     inverse transformation flag
       int    na =sf_n(axs) ®
       float  oa =0.  ®
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
       file   vpvs =      auxiliary input file name
USED IN
       cwp/geo2008IsotropicAngleDomainElasticRTM/marm2allA
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mxlagtoang2d.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

RSF Documentation

sfxtomo(1) Madagascar Manuals sfxtomo(1)

NAME
       sfxtomo - Kjartansson-style tomography

SYNOPSIS
       sfxtomo  <  inp.rsf > out.rsf adj=y nz=nh oz=oh dz=dh nx=ny ox=oy dx=dy
       nh=nz oh=oz dh=dz ny=nx oy=ox dy=dx niter=-1

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =y [y/n]     adjoint flag
       float  dh =dz ®
       float  dx =dy ®
       float  dy =dx ®
       float  dz =dh ®
       int    nh =nz ®
       int    niter =-1      number of iterations
       int    nx =ny ®
       int    ny =nx ®
       int    nz =nh ®
       float  oh =oz ®
       float  ox =oy ®
       float  oy =ox ®
       float  oz =oh ®
SOURCE
       user/gee/Mxtomo.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfxtomo(1)

NAME
       sfycvelinvww - Inverse velocity spectrum with interpolation by modeling
       from inversion result (C version)

SYNOPSIS
       sfycvelinvww < in.rsf > out.rsf velout=vout.rsf ns=nh ds=  os=  huber=0
       irls=0 nstep=1 niter=20 savevel=0 rwt=0.0 mwt=0.0 epw=0.01 srate=0.01

PARAMETERS
       float  ds = ®
       float  epw =0.01 ®
       int    huber =0 ®
       int    irls =0 ®
       float  mwt =0.0 ®
       int    niter =20 ®
       int    ns =nh ®
       int    nstep =1 ®
       float  os = ®
       float  rwt =0.0 ®
       int    savevel =0 ®
       float  srate =0.01 ®
       file   velout =      auxiliary output file name

Madagascar.sfzanisolr2 — Method
sfzanisolr2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfzanisolr2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfzanisolr2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfzanisolr2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzanisolr2(1)

NAME
       sfzanisolr2  -  Lowrank decomposition for 2-D anisotropic wave propaga‐
       tion (Complex).

SYNOPSIS
       sfzanisolr2  <  velz.rsf  vels=vels.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf   >
       right.rsf  mode=0 seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt= os=true sub=false
       sub=true abc=0 nbt=0 nbb=0 nbl=0 nbr=0 ct=0.0 cb=0.0 cl=0.0 cr=0.0  ta‐
       per=1.0 approx=2 relation=3

PARAMETERS
       abc    =0       absorbing boundary condition (0=no abc, 1=direction de‐
              pendent, 2=direction independent)
       approx =2      Type of approximation (0=exact 1=zone 2=acoustic)
       cb     =0.0 ®
       cl     =0.0 ®
       cr     =0.0 ®
       ct     =0.0 ®
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0      wave mode (0=p wave, 1=Sv wave)
       nbb    =0 ®
       nbl    =0 ®
       nbr    =0 ®
       nbt    =0 ®
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       os     =true ®
       relation
              =3      Type of q relationship  (0=shale,  1=sand,  2=carbonate,
              default being smallest error)
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       sub    =true      for twostep, default true
       taper  =1.0      wavenumber tapering flag
       file   vels =      auxiliary input file name
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mzanisolr2.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfzanisolr2(1)
source
Madagascar.sfzanisolr2abc — Method
sfzanisolr2abc(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfzanisolr2abc on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

sfzanisolr2abc(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzanisolr2abc(1)

NAME
       sfzanisolr2abc  - Lowrank decomposition for 2-D anisotropic wave propa‐
       gation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfzanisolr2abc  <  velz.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf   >   right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4  npk=20  dt=  nbt=0  nbb=0 nbl=0 nbr=0 ct=0.0
       cb=0.0 cl=0.0 cr=0.0

PARAMETERS
       cb     =0.0 ®
       cl     =0.0 ®
       cr     =0.0 ®
       ct     =0.0 ®
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       nbb    =0 ®
       nbl    =0 ®
       nbr    =0 ®
       nbt    =0 ®
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mzanisolr2abc.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfzero(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzero(1)

NAME

Madagascar.sfzerocross — Method
sfzerocross(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfzerocross on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfzerocross. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfzerocross(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzerocross(1)

NAME
       sfzerocross - Zero crossings.

SYNOPSIS
       sfzerocross < in.rsf > out.rsf levels=3

PARAMETERS
       int    levels =3      levels of quantization [2,3,5].
                    levels=2 1: zero crossing or zero; 0: otherwise
                    levels=3 1:  positive to negative zc; -1 negative to posi‐
              tive zc; 0: otherwise
                    levels=5 +/-2: positive/negative values; +/-1: as in  lev‐
              els=3; 0: zero.
SOURCE
       user/saragiotis/Mzerocross.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                    sfzerocross(1)
source
Madagascar.sfzerotrace — Method
sfzerotrace(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

sfzerotrace(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzerotrace(1)

NAME
       sfzerotrace - Zero part of traces in order to make aliasing

SYNOPSIS
       sfzerotrace < in.rsf > out.rsf beg=o2 j=2 l=1

PARAMETERS
       float  beg =o2      zero part beginning point
       int    j =2      jump step between two consecutive zero parts
       int    l =1      length of each zero part
SOURCE
       user/chenyk/Mzerotrace.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar.sfzfraclr2 — Method
sfzfraclr2(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

Runs RSF program sfzfraclr2 on the data provided by input. This may be an Madagascar.RSFFile or an array (and optionally, positional and keyword arguments n, d, o, l, u). If the program requires no input, it may be absent.

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfzfraclr2. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfzfraclr2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzfraclr2(1)

NAME
       sfzfraclr2  -  Complex lowrank decomposition for 2-D viscoacoustic iso‐
       tropic wave propagation.

SYNOPSIS
       sfzfraclr2   <   vel.rsf   fft=fft.rsf   left=left.rsf   >    right.rsf
       seed=time(NULL  eps=1.e-4  npk=20 dt= w0= rev=false mode=0 compen=false
       taper=0.2 cutoff=250. vmax=6000. sign=0 avg=false  gamma=  abc=0  nbt=0
       nbb=0 nbl=0 nbr=0 ct=0.0 cb=0.0 cl=0.0 cr=0.0

PARAMETERS
       abc    =0 ®
       avg    =false      whether use average value of gamma
       cb     =0.0 ®
       cl     =0.0 ®
       compen =false      compensate attenuation, only works if mode=0,1 (vis‐
              coacoustic)
       cr     =0.0 ®
       ct     =0.0 ®
       cutoff =250.       cutoff frequency
       dt     =      time step
       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       gamma  = ®
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0      mode of propagation: 0 is viscoacoustic (default); 1  is
              loss-dominated; 2 is dispersion dominated; 3 is acoustic
       nbb    =0 ®
       nbl    =0 ®
       nbr    =0 ®
       nbt    =0 ®
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       rev    =false      reverse propagation
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       sign   =0      sign of solution: 0 is positive, 1 is negative
       taper  =0.2      taper ratio for tukey window
       vmax   =6000.       maximum velocity
       w0     =      reference frequency
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mzfraclr2.cc
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                     sfzfraclr2(1)
source

sfzmarch(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzmarch(1)

NAME
       sfzmarch - Phase-space traveltime (marching in z)

SYNOPSIS
       sfzmarch < vel.rsf > out.rsf na= da= a0= order=3 scheme=2 verb=n what=

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =      starting velocity
       float  da =      angle sampling
       int    na =      angle samples
       int    order =3      interpolation order
       int    scheme =2      finite-difference order
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       string what =      what to compute (t,x,z,a)
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mzmarch.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfzoeppritz(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzoeppritz(1)

NAME
       sfzoeppritz - Testing Zoeppritz equation

SYNOPSIS
       sfzoeppritz > out.rsf na=90 a0=0. da=90./na icoef=4 vp1= vp2= vs1= vs2=
       rho1=1. rho2=1. incp=y outp=y refl=y

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =0.       first angle
       float  da =90./na      angle increment
       int    icoef =4 [1,2,3,4] particle  displacement,  displacement  poten‐
              tial, energy, real part
       bool   incp =y [y/n]     incident P (or S)
       int    na =90      number of angles
       bool   outp =y [y/n]     rellected/transmitted P (or S)
       bool   refl =y [y/n]     reflection or transmission
       float  rho1 =1.  ®
       float  rho2 =1.  ®
       float  vp1 = ®
       float  vp2 = ®
       float  vs1 = ®
       float  vs2 = ®
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mzoeppritz.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfzolsrtm2(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzolsrtm2(1)

NAME
       sfzolsrtm2 - 2-D FFT-based zero-offset exploding reflector modeling/mi‐
       gration linear operator

SYNOPSIS
       sfzolsrtm2  <  data.rsf  >  image.rsf   snaps=snaps.rsf   left=left.rsf
       right=right.rsf  adj=n  timer=n  verb=n  snap=0  pad1=1  gpz=0  taper=0
       thresh=0.92 oz=0. nz= dz= nt= dt=

PARAMETERS
       bool   adj =n [y/n]     if n, modeling; if y, migration
       float  dt =      time sampling
       float  dz =      depth sampling
       int    gpz =0      geophone surface
       file   left =      auxiliary input file name
       int    nt =      time samples
       int    nz =      depth samples
       float  oz =0.  ®
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   right =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name
       int    taper =0      tapering in the frequency domain
       float  thresh =0.92      tapering threshold
       bool   timer =n [y/n]
       bool   verb =n [y/n]
SOURCE
       user/jsun/Mzolsrtm2.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

sfzomig(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzomig(1)

NAME
       sfzomig - 3-D zero-offset modeling/migration with extended split-step

SYNOPSIS
       sfzomig  slo=Fs.rsf < Fd.rsf > Fw.rsf < Fi.rsf verb=n incore=y eps=0.01
       inv=n causal=n twoway=y nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0 tmx=0 tmy=0 nw=
       dw= ow=0. mode=

COMMENTS
       To be deprecated in favor of zomig3

PARAMETERS
       bool   causal =n [y/n]     y=causal; n=anti-causal
       float  dtmax =0.004      time error
       float  dw = ®
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   incore =y [y/n]     in core execution
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     y=modeling; n=migration
       string mode = ®
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    nw = ®
       float  ow =0.  ®
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   twoway =y [y/n]     two-way traveltime
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag
USED IN
       cwp/jse2006RWEImagingOverturningReflections/sigsbee
SOURCE
       system/seismic/Mzomig.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                        sfzomig(1)

NAME
       sfzomig3 - 3-D zero-offset modeling/migration with extended SSF

SYNOPSIS
       sfzomig3  slo=Fs.rsf  <  Fd.rsf  >  Fw.rsf < Fi.rsf ompchunk=1 ompnth=0
       verb=n eps=0.01 inv=n causal=n twoway=y nrmax=1 dtmax=0.004 pmx=0 pmy=0
       tmx=0 tmy=0 nw= dw= ow=0. mode=

COMMENTS
       May 2019 program of the month: http://ahay.org/blog/2019/05/06/program-
       of-the-month-sfzomig3/

PARAMETERS
       bool   causal =n [y/n]     y=causal; n=anti-causal
       float  dtmax =0.004      time error
       float  dw = ®
       float  eps =0.01      stability parameter
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     y=modeling; n=migration
       string mode = ®
       int    nrmax =1      maximum references
       int    nw = ®
       int    ompchunk =1      OpenMP data chunk size
       int    ompnth =0      OpenMP available threads
       float  ow =0.  ®
       int    pmx =0      padding on x
       int    pmy =0      padding on y
       file   slo =      auxiliary input file name
       int    tmx =0      taper on x
       int    tmy =0      taper on y
       bool   twoway =y [y/n]     two-way traveltime
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity flag

Madagascar.sfzomiso — Method
sfzomiso(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

It is also possible to pass keyword arguments to the sfzomiso. See ?Madagascar for examples.

RSF Documentation

sfzomiso(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzomiso(1)

NAME
       sfzomiso - zero-offset isotropic reverse-time migration

SYNOPSIS
       sfzomiso   velo=Fvelo.rsf   cr=Fcr.rsf  wave=Fwave.rsf  <  Fimag.rsf  >
       Fdata.rsf vmap=Fvmap.rsf sigm=Fsigm.rsf inv=n tau=n verb=n  opt=n  nt=1
       dt=1. bzl=0 bzh=0 bxl=0 bxh=0 czl=1. czh=1. cxl=1. cxh=1. n3=nt eps=1

COMMENTS
       * exploding reflector modeling : < imag.rsf sfzomiso inv=y > data.rsf *
       zero-offset migration        : < data.rsf sfzomiso inv=n >  imag.rsf  *
       forward  modeling              :  <  data.rsf sfzomiso inv=n > imag.rsf
       Need (1) velo *= 2 (2) nr=1 (3) imag.rsf is useless

PARAMETERS
       int    bxh =0 ®
       int    bxl =0 ®
       int    bzh =0 ®
       int    bzl =0 ®
       file   cr =      auxiliary input file name
       float  cxh =1.  ®
       float  cxl =1.  ®
       float  czh =1.  ®
       float  czl =1.  ®
       float  dt =1.       time d (if inv=y)
       float  eps =1      regularize sigma
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, modeling; if n, migration
       int    n3 =nt      wave time n
       int    nt =1      time n (if inv=y)
       bool   opt =n [y/n]     optimze fft size
       file   sigm =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   tau =n [y/n]     if y, tau domain; if n, cartesian
       file   velo =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       file   vmap =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/xuxin/Mzomiso.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfzomiso(1)
source

sfzomvti(1) Madagascar Manuals sfzomvti(1)

NAME
       sfzomvti - acoustic VTI wavefield

SYNOPSIS
       sfzomvti    vnmo=Fvnmo.rsf    vz=Fvver.rsf   eta=Fheta.rsf   cr=Fcr.rsf
       wave=Fwave.rsf < Fimag.rsf >  Fdata.rsf  vmap=Fvmap.rsf  sigm=Fsigm.rsf
       inv=n  tau=n  verb=n  opt=n  nt=1  dt=1. bzl=0 bzh=0 bxl=0 bxh=0 czl=1.
       czh=1. cxl=1. cxh=1. n3=nt eps=1

COMMENTS
       * exploding reflector modeling : < imag.rsf sfzomvti inv=y > data.rsf *
       zero-offset  migration         : < data.rsf sfzomvti inv=n > imag.rsf *
       prestack forward modeling    : < data.rsf  sfzomvti  inv=n  >  imag.rsf
       Need (1) vnmo *= 2, vver *= 2 (2) nr=1

PARAMETERS
       int    bxh =0 ®
       int    bxl =0 ®
       int    bzh =0 ®
       int    bzl =0 ®
       file   cr =      auxiliary input file name
       float  cxh =1.  ®
       float  cxl =1.  ®
       float  czh =1.  ®
       float  czl =1.  ®
       float  dt =1.       time d (if inv=y)
       float  eps =1      regularize sigma
       file   eta =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   inv =n [y/n]     if y, modeling; if n, migration
       int    n3 =nt      wave time n
       int    nt =1      time n (if inv=y)
       bool   opt =n [y/n]     optimze fft size
       file   sigm =      auxiliary input file name
       bool   tau =n [y/n]     if y, tau domain; if n, cartesian
       bool   verb =n [y/n]     verbosity
       file   vmap =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vnmo =      auxiliary input file name
       file   vz =      auxiliary input file name
       file   wave =      auxiliary output file name
SOURCE
       user/xuxin/Mzomvti.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

NAME

       tion.

SYNOPSIS
       sfzortholr3  <  c11.rsf  seta1=seta1.rsf  fft=fft.rsf  left=left.rsf  >
       right.rsf seed=time(NULL eps=1.e-4 npk=20 dt= mode=0 tilt=false

       eps    =1.e-4      tolerance
       file   fft =      auxiliary input file name
       file   left =      auxiliary output file name
       mode   =0      '0' means quasi-P (default),'1' means quasi-S, '2' means
              quasi-S2
       npk    =20      maximum rank
       seed   =time(NULL ®
       file   seta1 =      auxiliary input file name
       tilt   =false ®

       ing/migration linear operator

       rightf=rightf.rsf  leftb=leftb.rsf  rightb=rightb.rsf  gmres=n niter=10
       mem=20 timer=n verb=n snap=0 pad1=1 gpz=0 nz= dz= nt= dt= nt= dt=

       file   leftf =      auxiliary input file name

       int    niter =10 ®
       int    nt =      time samples
       int    nz =      depth samples
       int    pad1 =1      padding factor on the first axis
       file   rightb =      auxiliary input file name
       file   rightf =      auxiliary input file name
       int    snap =0      interval for snapshots
       file   snaps =      auxiliary output file name

       bool   verb =n [y/n]

Madagascar.sfztrace — Method
sfztrace(input; kwargs...) -> Madagascar.RSFFile

RSF Documentation

sfztrace(1) Madagascar Manuals sfztrace(1)

NAME
       sfztrace - Multiple arrivals by depth marching.

SYNOPSIS
       sfztrace < in.rsf nt=nx*nz na=362 da=0.5 a0=-90. vel=y order=3 iorder=4

PARAMETERS
       float  a0 =-90.       starting angle (in degrees)
       float  da =0.5      angle increment (in degrees)
       int    iorder =4      interpolation accuracy for grid
       int    na =362      number of angles
       int    nt =nx*nz      ray length bound
       int    order =3      interpolation accuracy for velocity
       bool   vel =y [y/n]     y, input is velocity; n, slowness
SOURCE
       user/fomels/Mztrace.c
VERSION
       4.2-git

Madagascar                        APRIL 2023                       sfztrace(1)
source
